No comment
Delicious and halal!!! You can't get peri peri chicken that is halal in the city in many places! Loved all the flavors I tried there!

This place was very disappointing - I tried to pick up some chicken and fries for my kids after school (this place is half a block from 3 schools) and asked for it plain. I was told they don't do plain and I had to have a sauce. My 4 and 6 year old were not psyched about the garlicky sauce, and the chicken and fries underneath seemed potentially good but slathered in an overpowering sauce.

Really good peri peri! I was impressed by the flavors and how the chicken was cooked. The food came at really fast and it was a nice ambiance in a small neighborhood: the meat is halal too! I really liked the sauces. Tastes just like nandos with its own little kick!
No comment

Nestled in New York city's avenue city you will find a Porto-esque chicken spot sealing your favorite spicy sauces. The extra hot is not spicy as they even stated that it's not hotter than sriracha. The Lamb was overdone and tough to chew and all the sauces taste very similar. All the sauces are actually on the table so if you order garlic you can try mango or lemon that's accessible. The local sodas was a nice touch. I would stick to chicken here and order the orange soda. Enjoy
Great peri peri chicken, and helpful customer service. Best halal nando's equivalent in NYC!

Best place. The food is excellent and the place is so cozy. You cannot get such great amount of food with decent taste at such low price!!. The Staff is so friendly and treat us like family. I hope I could visit it often but surely if I came back to East Village I would go again.

The food was so good, I've ordered takeout and had food there and definitely recommend eating there! Love that it's a halal spot in east village and It was delicious, they have plenty of sauce at the table for you to dip in and the chicken was marinated so well! They're better than Nandos, we will be going back for sure! - @the_halally
Was very excited about a Peri peri establishment in the village but chicken had a weird bleach-ish taste and sauces were well below par. Jalapeño cheese bites also left a lot to be desired.

Having moved from Sydney where Portuguese chicken was as accessible as drinking water it was definitely missed living in the city.. until now! First bite of mango/lime half chicken had me drooling! Yes the spicy fries, the coleslaw, garlic bread and jalapeño poppers are ALL phenomenal with flavors well balanced. Without a single glimpse of doubt I will be back here very very soon. Oh and the Latin music being played was right up my alley so the whole experience was perfection!!
This spot serves some of the best peri peri wings in the area. I highly recommend anyone to add this to their list of food to eat in the east village. I absolutely fell in love with their wings!
No comment
No comment
This restaurant is on Uber eats. God is packed well. The fries came crispy. AMAZINGGGG lamb chops wow I am so happy I found this gem.

I've been to a lot of great spots in the city, and spent a lot of money at very fancy names in the city, but this is truly one of the best bang for your buck spots for a chill weeknight dinner. Some of the most flavorful, fun chicken flavors that you'll get and great service to boot. I'll definitely be coming back soon. It was so good I had to write a review
No comment
I got the 2 chicken sides with spicy fries and garlic bread. Super filling and delicious! The sauce on the chicken was unique and insanely flavorful.

Really love this place. The chicken sandwich, half mild and garlic herb, with fries is my go to. All of the sauces come on a rack at table side so you can try them all if you want a little more of one or the other or add some extra heat the with hotter ones. The combo of the soft bun, cheese, sauce makes to be probably my favorite sandwich in the city. Plenty of seating in a cool part of Alphabet City. The owner is such a sweetheart too. Must stop by!
No comment

Doesnt look like much but this spot has turned into my go to. The chicken bites over rice with salad is fantastic. So is the cauliflower seared with garlic and herbs sauce. Dont forget to ask for a mango strawberry juice. Cheers
It was a nice delicious chicken wings and very tender lamp chops, all in all Great meal

A very average meal, if that. Way over priced for what it is. Not worth it at all. If you're looking for a Nando's substitute, it could vaguely meet the craving. The lady serving there was very nice...
I came here with my girlfriend recently and the chicken is out of this world. But what makes it so good are the variety of sauces they provide which really adds a great flavor boost.

I love Peri Peri chicken so when I saw this new spot on Yelp, I was super intrigued, as I haven't seen many restaurants in the US selling this (maybe it's just the areas I've been around!) I ordered delivery from here at night and it was one of the best decisions I've made. I ordered the jalapeño poppers, fries, and tenders - all which were incredibly delicious. A side of jalapeño poppers includes 3 pieces - which is perfect if you're by yourself but feels a bit small if you're sharing. They are so delicious that they leave you wanting more. The peri peri seasoning is so fresh and flavorful, but not overbearing. The chicken was perfectly juicy and not dry. Next time, I want peri peri chicken I'm going to the restaurant!
No comment

first time trying Frangos so we only ordered two 1/4 portions-- one mild and one mango.  Both were delicious and juicy. The mild one had the perfect amount of kick while the mango had a balanced flavor of sweetness and acidity, both with some char which I love. Looking fwd to trying other flavors.
These wings are incredible and very much like the wings I ate in South Africa. I love the hot wings and the corn!

Peri peri is a fairly new concept to NY, this place is doing it right. You have 6 sauces to choose from ranging from garlic and herb to mango lime and x-tra spicy. You also have the option of mixing sauces which is nice but you totally don't have to as every table comes with its own little jars of sauce. The burgers are actually chicken sandwiches but tasty non the less. Def a must try if you're craving super flavorful grilled chicken, not the run of the mill rotisserie. They have multiple locations as well!
This place is amazing! The owner is the nicest person and the food is super affordable. Love supporting this business.

The owner and staff are so kind, welcoming and funny and make the experience amazing. In addition the food is amazing, especially the whole chicken and chicken kabob- haven't had one so good in years. Would definitely recommend this place, it's one of my favorites for a quick bite in the East Village
No comment
No comment
Very good peri peri chicken! We got the boneless platter. It was great for the two of us. All the sauces are delicious!

SO GOOD! The rack of lamb is just chef's kiss, perfection. The sauces are amazing. Fries are great. The service is great. They've got nice outdoor seating. I don't understand how this place isn't more popular.

The wings here are some of my favorite I've ever had. Sauces are on point, service is great, and everything is cooked well. These sauces are truly magically you could put them on just about anything and I would eat it. I find myself craving these wings quite often.
Sooo good! New York was truly missing a Peri Peri restaurant and now we have Frangos! Can't wait to come back.
Absolutely love this place, the Peri for 2 is such a great value for 2 people. Cannot said to come in person after COVID
With the new ownership change. Check this place out. Kinda people always a pleasure eating here. The food is amazing!

I don't get all the 5 star reviews. Been twice, first time the chicken tenders were decent, nothing amazing or special, served at room temp. Sides were underwhelming. Went a second time to give it a 2nd chance... below average sandwich with poor tasting sides. Maybe I keep missing out and getting unlucky but we'll see as time goes on.
The grilled chicken and wings in hot sauce are just to die for!! Hot spicy and flavorful. I have personally ordered it online multiple times and they never disappoint. Great food and great service.
Truly delicious and unique. I did wings with the hot mixed with garlic and herb...HIGHLY recommend. Check this place out. It'll be a new go-to.
Really great food! The chicken is amazing and the sides are great, too. I'm so glad they're in the neighborhood.

We went on a rainy weekday. They have two cute tents set up for outdoor dining. We got a table and were treated to one of the kindest and most attentive server. She attended to all three tables without a hitch. The food was delicious too. The sauces were well described for the heat. The mild sauce was slightly too spicy for my child: the server noticed, without us asking and brought us complimentary milder chicken which my kid then enjoyed. The sides were good too as was the piña colada mocktail. We had a good tasting raspberry gelato as well. I would include pictures, but one minute after finishing, 5 gallons of rain water spilled onto my family and I from a collapsed tent roof. The server was so kind. She helped us rush all of our belongings indoors, went out into the rain and retrieved my wife's glasses from a puddle, and helped us dry off and offered us new masks. I was not even upset bc of the delicious food and her hospitality. I cannot wait to come back on a sunny day.

Place is cute.. Food is ok... chicken had too much lemon flavor and rice was too salty and mushy... other sides were good like garlic bread and corn... found hair in food as well.. waitor did not do much about it other than apologize

The food was amazing. The lamb chops were some of the best I've had. We also ordered the whole chicken - Love that you can order multiple flavors and dont have to stick with 1 sauce for each chicken. The spicy fries and cauliflower were also great.

While we didn't eat in Frangos, we took out. The lamb chops were good, and covered with an extraordinary sauce, but I kept on wondering what they tasted like without. They seemed to have been cooked well. Not raw, but delightfully rare. Wings, on the other hand were incredible. Well cooked, and not "hard" which I find in most places serving them, probably because they were grilled, and taken off before becoming overdone. We ordered enough (8 chops, 15 wings) and paid enough to get two sides with each. Spicy fries were good, crispy, etc. Cauliflower was excellent, but such a tiny portion, not worth the plastic container they were in, same with the coleslaw. Sheesh... you'd think cabbage was gold, never mind the platinum carrots. While the flavors on both items were sensational, and we really did enjoy them, we would've expect the sides to be at least, double in size. They are extra$, and we were 3 people (2 men), and we were all pretty angry at the scarcity of the "sides". By the way, save yourself over $12 and pick it up yourself. Don't call Seamless because they charge a ton. I am going to the supermarket today and buying jerk seasoning and a huge pile of wings. Going to crisp them up in the oven with the seasoning, doused with olive oil. I can make coleslaw for next to nothing and be satiated, instead of spending $65! buyer beware.

The food and service and both really great. I'm vegetarian and had the vegan burger which was really delicious and satisfying - spicy fries as a side for the win! The owner noted I was vegetarian and not vegan and gave me cheese with my burger which I thought was a really nice and personal touch. Would definitely recommend and I will certainly be back :)

AMAZING!! Not gonna lie if you want to have a real mouth experience get the roulette chicken wings, fun and delicious. The chicken is mouthwateringly tender with addictive sauces provided for additional kick and with a side of spicy fries and jalapeño poppers you will literally have never eaten a better meal in your life no joke. Frangos Peri Peri is a spectacular food experience.

This place is amazing - if you're considering it absolutely stop by. The chicken was delicious and so many great sauce options. Food came out quickly without skipping out on quality. But the service really stood out! Kind and considerate staff made a great experience. Chicken and lamb chop peri peri, corn, and fries were all excellent options
Finally there is a great peri peri chicken place in New York! Delicious Nandos-style food with some of their own creations. Perfect place on the city for some southern African Portuguese food.
i've been missing Nandos so much since my trip to London, and this did the job ! super tasty and FRESH i'm so happy i found this gem and can't wait to visit as soon as I can !

The worst! Waited a decade for host to come and get me seated. Shashlik wasn't properly cooked, meze plates wasn't tasty at all, waiters were inattentive.

No comment

Another outstanding meal. The meat is absolutely delicious. The sides are to die for and the drinks have a kick! Come here if you want to enjoy a delicious, unique, fun experience for your mouth. You can savor every bite.
Great restaurant in the mall. Each kabob comes with 8-10 sides including an excellent babaganoush. The whole grilled fish takes top honors.

Naked Tomato is the more formal restaurant of the Miznon chain. While the food is very good, the service is actually more in line with a fast casual chain restaurant than the formal restaurant it is supposed to be. The cocktails are good, but the wine list is very limited. The meal starts with a selection of mezze (hummus is extra) and then you order skewers. The mezze are good, not great but the skewers are excellent.
Delicious food but very slow, not so friendly service. A great option if you're already at Hudson Yards but I wouldn't travel specifically for the restaurant.

Awesome choice for a quick workday lunch in Hudson Yards. Great deal on endless mezze and skewers (if you don't order an entree per person, there will be a $25 charge for the mezze). So delicious and the pita is amazingly fluffy.
No comment
No comment
Great ambience.  Food was good.  Just got the pita.  Was not a fan of how they drenched it in sauce and food sliding all over the place.  Would comeback though.
No comment
No comment

I love the concept - like many restaurants in Israel, the meal at Naked tomato starts with a ton of small dishes - like different kinds of eggplant, peppers, labne, beets, cabbage, etc. these come with THE most delicious, warm pita.  You can get all of these small dishes refilled.  The small dishes come with any choice of main dish.  I tried the lamb kabob, which is usually the most delicious dish at eyal Shani restaurants, but here the lamb was really undercooked.  Husband got entrecôte and also didn't love it.  We agreed that the small dishes are the show here.  Great service.  Anyway, we would definitely come back! Didn't give five starts only because my husband and I both had issues with the meat preparation.
No comment

Food was very tasty and interesting different concept. A bit pricey as others reference. Servers are very friendly and bubbly but what I found a bit frustrating, it was not uncommon that they were out if things or no longer making them. Either that night or its been removed. Or maybe I just asked for the wrong things? So they will ask you which sides you would like refilled, and then too often the response is, "We don't have any more of that. Is there anything else you would like refilled? Sorry we are out of that one. Is there anything else...". How abt start out saying what you are out of? This happened with my cocktail choice. And also the request for the shrimp. And many of the sides. When you hit on something they had it was like a buzzer went off. So unlimited refills sounds great but....

One of the best meals I had in NYC!!! Besides the abundant number of small dishes/mezze provided (all free and refillable with skewer orders, mostly veggie based), the skewers was delicious and had a good portion. The service was amazing as well - our hostess led me and my partner to see the skewers in a display case before ordering to get a sense of what they are. I order the Abu Jasmine cocktail - definitely on the sweeter side (orange juice) and had a lot of alcohol content. Would 100% go back and recommend!

You order two meat skewers at this place and with them come like 20 side dishes. We thought they were going to be small dishes but they were all fairly large considering how many there were. Everything was tasty but we felt like the amount of side dishes was overkill (at least for two people). I feel like they should warn parties of less than 4 that it's a literal ton of food. Otherwise great meal. Felt bad a lot went to waste though.

The naked tomato is built for groups and sharing.  The waitstaff is energic and extremely enthusiastic about the joys of the naked tomato! The menu is simply (and is actually called "Simple Menus").  You order a main dish and they take care of the apps.  I was with a party of five (Baily, Claudia, Charlie. . . (any 90's pop culture peeps out there?) ).  We ordered 5 kebobs, all of which were delicious -- with the duck being extra special.  The real prize, however, comes before the main dish, when warm pitas arrive accompanied by countless small plates of delicious goodies, all designed to help you make the perfect pita.
No comment

Insane. I can't even describe the food... the tahini... the hummus and THAT PITA! Service was meh but the location decor atmosphere and food made up for it! Check this place out for sure, the menu changes Eve try day!

Absolutely delicious seafood, beef, or chicken skewers. And with the price of a skewer they give you all the veggies you can eat and the veggies are incredible and make the meal. Don't order extras because they bring you as much veggies as you can eat and there's so many kinds it's delicious. Beads, potato salad, spicy cucumbers, spicy carrots, hummus, everything is delicious. Two thumbs up!
No comment

We visited on a quiet night, only two other groups in the restaurant. The staff member who seated us and explained the menu and then took our order, etc, was a very pleasant young man.  After that the service went down hill as the young woman assigned to service our table was virtually absent and we had to seek her out to get our small plates replaced. We waited  more than 10 minutes for Pita (surprising in an empty-ish restaurant). We felt like she was doing us a favor, a 180 from the 1st employee we dealt with. Food was good, particularly the mezzes but only 5 pieces of grilled octopus on a skewer for $39 was a surprise.   Please note that when we were about to pay the check the 1st employee asked how our meal was and when we discussed our disappointment with service he offered to bring us a glass of wine but we were already about to leave.  Would we go back, let you know after we try Laser Wolf in a few weeks.

Came to this establishment yesterday with my family.  We have since been extremely sick due to food poisoning (symptoms includes shivers, fever, "the runs", loss of appetite).  While I've been a fan in the past, this experience makes me question the cleanliness and preparation of their food (specifically the small plate salads).

Great spot to stop while shopping in Hudson Yard as there is both a cafe and sit down restaurant. Great service here and the food is incredible. With one entree, dishes of appetizers decided by the chef is included in your meal with fresh, warm pita bread. However, each member in your party must order at least one entree as the amount of apps given per party is extensive. Definitely would recommend the lamb main entree :)
Great Israeli food. Brazilian was amazing. Great salad. Grest service and presentation. Good drinks but very very weak on red wines.

Outstanding food & it would be darn near impossible to leave hungry! Unique setup of many tasty appetizers brought out at the beginning of the dining experience and then followed by excellent shaslik (chicken or lamb skewers). Service was very good and the location in the Hudson Yards complex is wonderful! Enjoy!

I'm in nyc with a customer and we had a great time. Service was great and attentive. Menu selections are  diverse - ordering small plates to share and then kababs with a selection of meats. Awesome quality of food!

We were accidentally running into this restaurant while looking for a place for lunch after visiting Vessel.  This was our first time to have Israeli food. Everything was so good, it took us by completely surprise. Besides the unbelieved amount of small dishes they offered, we ordered octopus shishlik and duck breast. Octopus was excellent but duck was a little bit over cooked. This place is built for sharing so next time I will definitely bring a big party to here.

This place was very disappointing. Their system is ass backwards, as well as their service. Solid advice - please examine your itemized bill.  They implement false charges and the little saving grace was, they were able to rectify that potent problem without having to escalate the erroneous issue further - in my situation fortunately. The quality of the food was okay ; Definitely not delectably out of this world and not the polar opposite, feces on a platter.  The ambient concept was suppose to be a "hip and classy" vibe but the place provided "empty energy" and was a bit vacant and desolate. We couldn't wait to leave - it was just repelling, unwelcoming, unwanted energy. As I finish this review, I also was not encouraged to generously tip as well as I normally do (22-25% in most cases) based on my experience.  Lastly, Naked Tomato is a fucking stupid name for an Israeli/Mediterranean restaurant/eating establishment.  (Due diligence was done, and we did not blindly dine at this spot expecting Italian food).
No comment
No comment

Condescending rude manager. I'd say stay away from this restaurant, especially if you're local New Yorkers. There are so many Mediterranean restaurants in the city that can serve as great tasting food as this one. However, this is the one that ruins your experience with their operations, services, and to top it off, with the manager. After our meal, we went through 40 minutes of 5 iterations of bills as they could not figure out the exact charge for our table. And when the manager finally came out, she was extremely arrogant and her first question (not an apology!) was, "there is only $1 overcharge we did on your check, what is the problem here?" although this was after their 3rd bill that overcharged 4 more drinks!! So it really did it for us. When she added further to say "we have 2 servers covering all tables so there can be confusions but this is how all restaurants are nowadays" we were thrown off at how arrogant and unprofessional she is as a manager. And she asked us to take out our own calculators, yes!! she did!, to confirm her last bill was correct, we were very very upset. This is not what you want your customers to experience at your restaurant. I do not recommend this experience.

No seasoning on the skewers and just bland. One skewer is $40 or more with like 3 unseasoned pieces (I ordered the octopus, which were 3 small pieces), and the rest on the skewer are just onions and jalapeno. My friend and I were the only customers, but waitress lacked any service and was drinking on the job, not even trying to hide it. Had to remind her about our drinks several times. Did not mention that the skewer stick was super hot. So I burnt my finger. Would never come back.
Delicious food and I love the concept of having a variety of dishes. We will definitely be back and bring friends

On our way to the Naked Tomato, we read the 5 reviews that added up to 2.8 stars, and decided that it's probably out of jealousy. We came in, wanting to give the place the best reviews possible. Unfortunately, the food was really not tasty, the mezzes were unsalted, lacking flavors and really disappointing. Service was one of the worst ever!! Definitely not in Eyal Shani's league!! The pita bread was wonderful, I'll give it that, but I'm NEVER repeating the experience..!!!
Delicious food, there are heaters for the outside seating area so you stay warm, service was good, small wait time, which was appropriate considering it was a sit down place, certainly worth it!

Arguably the best udon bowl in NYC, but not the best I've had. We got the niku and ebiten udon. Personally, the niku udon did not live up to its hype. There was barely any pieces of meat in there and the broth was extremely oily, defeating the purpose of getting udon. It almost tasted like a taiwanese spicy beef noodle soup and for $20+ it was definitely not worth. The ebiten udon on the other hand was amazing. The texture of the udon noodle was so satisfying and the broth was so basic yet flavorful. I would definitely return for the ebiten but at this current price point, I'd chose marugame over raku.
No comment

Note - this place is cash only. A lot of friends highly recommended this spot, and it was indeed a tasty choice. Came here for dinner with a friend on Saturday evening and put ourselves on the waitlist about 40 minutes in advance. There's indoor and covered outdoor seating available. We shared a chicken Karaage (you have the choice of 6 or 10 pieces) and I opted for the Chikara udon, which came with chicken, 2 big pieces of mochi, and udon in soup. The bowl was quite filling, even though it didn't look like much when it first came to the table.

I don't think booking is allow for this place so it is a bit hard to come here and eat. The thick bacon was the most delicious.

Omg I love this spot! I am not kidding when I say that everything that I tried here will forever be engraved in my mind. I loved the eggplant dish. The egg plant was so flavorful. It was cooked so nicely. It was tender and soft. It was so soft that you could eat the skin of the eggplant. I loved the egg in the eggplant because it added a creminess to the dish. I really liked the fried chicken. It was so crispy and crunchy on the outside but tender and soft on the inside. Also, I really liked the spicy mayo sauce that went with it. It had the perfect amount of spice and it had a nice tang to it. My favorite that I ate here was the udon! It was so good! The noodles were so thick and the soup was really flavorful. We drank every bite of the udon! I want to go back soon and I want to ask my mom.

This place is AMAZING AND CASH ONLY!!! Didn't realize it was cash only until we had to pay so thought I'd share the PSA. Now that that's out of the way, the food was absolutely incredible, probably some of the best udon I've ever had. Noodles were perfectly chewy and broth was rich and flavorful. Got some apps to start - fried chicken, an eggplant dish, and thick cut bacon. Thought the chicken was good, very crispy and the inside was buttery. The eggplant dish had a nice smoky flavor and was very unique! I'd skip the bacon. It was decent and honestly just a fatty pork belly, but nothing to write home about. The star of the show was of course the udon! Got the tantan. It was spicy and rich, but the broth wasn't too heavy. The noodles were super chewy which I loved! The peanuts made the broth nutty and umami. It was just so unique!! Definitely check this place out!!

Got on the Yelp waitlist an hour before arriving to the restaurant and was able to get seated right when we got there. The inside is small but there's outdoor seating as well. The udon texture was SO good, better than marugame. I got the tofu skin one with a poached egg, my boyfriend got the tan tan and the broth was so delicious and rich. My friend got the chicken one and it was yummy but on the lighter side. There was also mochi inside which was soft and great texture. We also got the karaage which was a bit spicy, so juicy and crispy. The prices are also great!
No comment
Niku was delicious!!! It really hit the spot today after a long red eye flight. The broth was complex and beefy. Loved the tender tripe. The udon was also perfectly al dente even to the last bite.
Very good Udon! Got the gyunan udon and the noodles were very chewy and satisfying and the broth and beef was very tasty!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Their food is a 4/5 but the services was close to none. Had to wait a very long time for water, and it looked like no tables got attention either. It's a relatively small restaurant, so you would expect waiters to be attentive but that wasn't the case.

The curry udon was very flavorful and true to its name. However, I don't think I could eat a whole bowl of it (I snagged a taste from the hubby). The ebi ten was great. I like that the put the shrimp tempura on the side so it did not get soggy in the soup. The noodles were so soft and tasted homemade. I would definitely come back if I were in the mood for noodles. However, I think would need an appetizer for next time.

Cash only with an ATM inside! I ordered the chicken tatsuta-age and niku udon. Food came out pretty quickly. Chicken tatsuta-age was pretty good and came with a creamy dipping sauce. The udon definitely was one of the most unique chewiness I've experienced, so that was a highlight. Unfortunately the beef short ribs in the niku udon didn't impress me much. They were pretty tough to chew and I was expecting a tender meat. Service was super good though! Would probably try the curry udon if I come back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
First time visit and it's good. The service and food is good. Just remember to bring cash, no credit card. I will return again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

There are few places that are acceptable for cash only, this is 1 of them because everything tastes like it was made in house daily. That includes the noodles, broths and in the case of what I ordered the beef stew. The udon is perfectly chewy. You can order it spicy or non-spicy, beef is super tender and falls apart. I also ordered the fried chicken which I forgot to take a photo of because I was too hungry from the wait. Would highly recommend checking this place out, expect at least a 20-40 minute wait though depending on the night regardless of your party size.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The restaurant can be a little hard to find because of darkness and signage - look for a person in an apron lol. We arrived at 5pm on Saturday and was served pretty quickly. Tried the niku udon, karaage, and curry udon. The niku udon soup was a bit salty for me but I enjoyed the flavor seeped into the noodle and meat. I loved that there was a painting of white paint on the white wall and a painting of black paint on the black wall.
No comment

No comment
No comment

My friend has been telling me to try out raku and I finally got around to try it. Be sure to do Yelp waitlist in advance since this place gets busy. The inside is very small so they don't have alotta tables, I was thinking of ordering their niku udon but they already ran out for the day. So I ordered the gyumen udon and added Mochi since my friend said it's a must get. The bowls they serve are huge and the udon portion is pretty good. I do agree that udon here is more chewy but I think the noddles are more flat than what I'm used to. I think I personally prefer the round noodles more since this one sorta reminds me of biang biang noodles, I'd maybe I am biased and one of my fav handmade udon spots is in downtown Los Angeles. I this off good to try one time but I heard there is also another udon spot in nyc that is pretty good.

No comment

No comment

This place came highly recommended by many friends and I was finally able to try it. The noodles were chewy and had a bounce to them. The broth could have been richer in my opinion but I appreciated its simplicity so I could enjoy the noodles more. The serving size is on the smaller side but i would say it was perfect for me. Also order the chicken karaage for the table to share which was enjoyable but not a must get

Had a wait time of about 30 minutes and then we were seated inside a booth. The udon that I got was delicious, noodles were good and the broth was refreshing especially for the cold, weather that day. The karaage we got as appetizers were crispy on the outside and juicy and moist on the inside. Overall great experience.

MY HAPPY PLACE If I just eat here every day I would be content with my life. I adore this spot literally everything about it. Most beautiful udon and most beautiful eggplant. You know that feeling when everything is soo good but your stomach is not limitless so you have to make sacrifices? Yes that is me when I go here. But cannot skip the eggplant and the udon ever!! Raku deserves everything!

CASH ONLY. Raku is best udon in New York City. I High recommend their Raku and Gyunan. Their broth is very rich and full of umami, but u will be pretty thirsty after dinning here. I recommend coming here before 5:30 on a weekday because it usually gets very busy after that time. Raku is pretty small about 18-20 seats inside but they recently expanded more outdoor seating which are equipped with heaters and doors though.
No comment

No comment
No comment
Sleek, authentic and unassuming. Great food and ambience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cute minimalist designed ramen shop. No sign outdoors. The ramen and the udon is fantastic! Staff is prompt and nice. Cash-only. I recommend.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Hands down best Udon I have ever had in my life. This tiny little spot in the east village is a must try if you live in the area. This place is always crowded so be prepared to wait for a table. Also they are cash only ;)

Came here beacuse my neighbor loves this place. The place location is almost hidden, kinda of a hole in a wall. Very small location and packed. Ordered the chikara udon. This was my first time trying udon noodles and they were not my favorite beause of the texture. I have to say the soup part was very tasty. My whole party enjoyed the food and drinks.

If you ever wander in East Village and crave udon, this is the spot to be at! Get to their store before it opens because a line already formed when I got there. The interior is small so there's limited seating. The day I came with my friend was a particularly cold day so eating udon was fulfilling and warmed us up to continue our exploration of East Village. The broth in their soup tasted so clean and not oily; full of flavor. Check it out because you will not regret it.

Eating at Raku was life changing. I ordered the ja ja cold noodles and these might have been the best noodles I've ever eaten. The texture of the udon noodles has you wanting more because of how chewy and bouncy they were. The ja ja noodles are a great choice if you're looking for a refreshing yet full of unami flavor dish.  The flavors were unlike any I've ever tasted and the warm and cozy yet buzzling energy of the place makes you want to come back for a second round in the future. As a plus, they give the table some frozen grapes as a treat at the end of your meal. The place is cash only but there is an ATM in the restaurant that you can use.

I'm very picky when it comes to noodles, especially ramen or udon, but this place delivered. Very delicious food and attentive service. My friend and I got the cold dishes, which were perfect and refreshing for a hot day. I would go again with others to show them how good noodles actually are.
Best udon place I've ever had!! I had the niku udon and even on a hot NY day, it was so good

This small shop serves chewy udon noodles with tasty broth and deliciously prepped meat. In addition to the classic niku, their Mentaiko and curry udon are also good options. Best udon in Lower Manhattan!
No comment

Very small restaurant and wasn't too crowded when we got there. We got seated immediately on arrival. I got the curry udon which was really good and the portions are huge! Although a little pricey, the broth was excellent and the noodle quality was of higher quality. The worker got me a bib to prevent staining my clothes which I am grateful for because I definitely had some on the bib by the time I finished my meal! I would definitely come here again when i'm craving some higher quality udon!
No comment
Soso, the service is fine because there is not enough people. The food is expected but the frozen grape as final snack is the great point.
No comment
Ginger Yuzu Tea with udon noodles. Quiwt table in the corner with quick and friendly service. Just what I needed!
Food came out quick. Service was attentive. Ramen was decent. I sat outside so can't say much about restaurant ambiance. Loved the frozen grapes they served along with the check
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
We had gotten the karage and two udon dishes. Overall love the texture and cook of the noodles. Very cute decor but wasn't earth shattering. Would recommend if you like noodles!

Loved how tasty everything was! I shared the  agedashi tofu with my father and we both enjoyed the taste! I got myself a bowl of katsudon and I was not disappointed! The waitress that served us was just adorable. Only con would be the size capacity. This location is quite small so expect a bit of wait time. Other than that, I recommend!
No comment
No comment

Ya know what.... I'm gonna say it. Raku is overrated. We went on a rainy Sunday afternoon and placed our name on the list via Yelp and the table was ready when we arrived. We were seated outside and it was super cramped and when we asked about inside seating we were scolded and told there was nothing inside and to sit. That's fine.. service alright. We ordered the spicy niku and the gyunan. The spicy niku had two pieces of tripe and some short rib for $26. The tripe was delish and I wish there were more. The flavor did not transcend beyond any dimension to me but I did like the chewiness of the noodles. The spicy oil stuck to my throat and I feel didn't balance the way I wanted to and I love spicy soups!! The gyunan was homey and comforting but both udons felt like they were missing something. For the price point I feel like I wouldn't go again.
No comment

No comment
Always spot on. Ended up having the snow crab and egg flower on the last visit. Noodles are always silky. Definitely a must try when in NYC.
No comment

No comment

Rake has plenty of promising reviews, but the food was overall too salty. The udon hit the spot with the softness, chewiness, and soup felt plenty flavorful. Vegetable gyoza was great with a thin chewy skin. Service here was friendly and attentive and I appreciate the water refill as my food left me very parched.
One of the best spots in NYC for udon. The broths are flavorful and the noodles are bouncy and chewy!
No comment

No comment

The noodles were good- the texture of the udon noodles were unlike what I had tried before but the actual broth wasn't that great. It honestly just tasted like the instant udon soup you can get from the asian market. The servers were not that great as they were kind of slow and kind of cold and the price was high for the quality and taste. Will probably not be coming back
No comment
No comment
No comment
the best udon i've ever had to date. period!! so freaking good, i would eat this meal multiple times in a week. try the Niku udon spicy (great for non spicy eaters too!
No comment

I kid you not, I thought udon was a mediocre noodle until I had Raku's udon. WOW, the noodles were AMAZING. This location is SUPER small, like can only fit 10-15 people kinda small. And yes I did shamelessly wait an hour during an Oct cold night so you know the udon hit the spot once I got to eat it. You can't make reservations at this location but you can at the other. I highly recommend a must go for locals and visitors alike!
Quick service and amazing quality food as always!  Love both locations but would prefer mocdougal bc it's bigger
Absolutely delicious. Try to sit inside simply to smell how good the food is about to be. I got the spicy niku udon + tatsuta-age. Will not disappoint.
No comment
Amazing handmade noodles with broth that wasn't overwhelmingly salty.

This was an excellent udon place to go to. The atmosphere was intimate and creative. The food was so good. I tried cold udon for the first time and it was delicious. The udon noodles were chewy and the broth was delicious. Would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The udon is very good. I ordered chicken karaage  and ebiten udon. The chicken karaage is ok, the sauce is too sour for me and I feel like it would taste better with spicy mayo. The udon is really good, the soup is clear and palatable, the noodle itself is thick and chewy, will come again for the udon!
No comment
No comment

I came to this spot because of the high reviews. I arrived at 530 pm on a Thursday night. Pretty crowded but there were plenty of tables av. The hostess attempted to seat me at the bar stool facing the wall. Wow. Waitress was not friendly at all even though my better half speaks Japanese. I don't know if it was because We aren't Japanese but whatever it is we won't be back. Food was okay but nothing to write home about.

soooo good! i've been to the soho location once, where I ordered the dan dan udon and this was my first time at the east village location. I got the ankake udon, which is like an egg drop broth. I was surprised that the soup was so viscous (beware: because of this it stays extremely hot) but it was packed with flavor and very filling but tasted very light at the same time. Raku's udon noodles are truly a leg above other udon places, the noodles have an extremely bouncy texture. If you find that noodle dishes can feel a bit too heavy sometimes, definitely get the ankake!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The interior is a little cramped due to the covid set up, so groups of 4 people max could fit, although a table for two would be ideal. The agedashi tofu was delicious. I would definitely recommend it as an appetizer. As for the toriten udon, it was a little disappointing as the chicken was soggy from being submerged in the broth. The flavor was pretty good, just sad that there was no crisp or crunch. Next time, I would get the chicken tatsuta-age as an appetizer and try a different udon. The noodles were pretty "Q." They seemed to be made in house as the ends were tapered. Service was amazing, friendly and efficient. Remember that they're cash only when you go! And enjoy your single frozen grape that comes with the check.

Good food , but very bad service. We arrived at around 3 pm and was told "host will see you outside" when we were about to go in. Then after 7-8 minutes a lady came to seat us. But our server, a female in white sweatshirt, brought us water without saying anything or even a simple smile. We were not told where the menu is and had to look around to discover the menu is by QR code. After we scanned, we had to look around to signal the lady who seated us we want to order. The lady in white sweatshirt never showed up. Lmao I've been seen something like this. After we are done though, she quickly took the cash (360 degree contrast from her service before). Then when we were leaving, not a single person said anything like thank you. Lol never coming back. There's plenty of good udon restaurants in New York, so a word of advice: to prosper in the long run, please manage your employees well and teach them appropriate professional manner.
No comment

Ive been trying to fit Raku into my itinerary for 3 days. Now that I've had it, I prefer marugame udon over raku. I got the niku udon. It's rly just preference rather than what was "wrong" with it. The broth here was definitely more complex and they did not skimp on meat. The noodles were also very fresh and bouncy. But I thought this niku was on the salty side. I'm used to marugame's sweet niku broth with smaller pieces of sliced meat rather than chunks of meat. Honestly this reminded me more of Chinese braised noodles. The udon here was also skinnier/flatter. Marugame has the rounder thicker noodles that are smooth and buttery which I prefer. But Raku is not bad! Just not my preference
No comment

Amazing, fresh udon!! Went on a Saturday night, indoors was crowded but we were seated outside within a few minutes. Our udon was fantastic and came out within 20 min and was piping hot. Very impressed with this place and can't wait to come back. Cash only but ATM inside.
This place was the best spot we ate at in NYC. Their clam udon was heavenly, light and packed with delicious flavor from the clam juice while the clams themselves were gigantic and fresh. S tier
No comment

Best udon I've ever had!! Both broths from the niku and the gyunan udon bowls tasted extremely flavorful, savory, and comforting; noodles were also really fresh and elastic. Portions were pretty large and they were relatively generous with the meat portions. I also tried the chicken tatsuta-age, and I liked how light the batter was and how clean it tasted, despite being fried. The lemon and dipping sauce (some sort of miso/mayo mix?) accompanied the chicken well! As for service, my subway was delayed a bit, but the waitress was nice and friendly about holding my reservation until I arrived. Overall, it's a nice, hearty dinner option for cold NYC winters!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Absolutely no complaints! Food was amazing and service was great. I would definitely recommend trying this spot out if you are in the neighborhood.

The food was decently portioned and very tasty. It was very packed when I went, they have both indoor and outdoor seating. I loved the yuzu ginger tea, so refreshing and really helped cool me down during the summer heat. Highly recommend if you're in SoHo!

No comment

Quite busy and sometimes it's hard to get a table for a large party. The udon noodles and broth here are really good and the tempura was super crispy and not oily. Highly recommend tho be warned it is cash only.
Went for lunch during a weekday so didn't have to wait. One of the best udons I have tasted. Small space though.
No comment
Super cute hole in the wall! This place is CASH ONLY! But there is an ATM inside incase you forget lol. Very delicious, we ordered the Katsu Don and Kitsune Udon!

Roku, you walk in and are immediately transported to Japan. The decor, minimalism and service - amazing. Cash only, they have an ATM in the back that blends into the cabinets. Best Gyoza and Udon I've had in NYC. The gyoza is scrumptious, astonishing flavor in each bite and perfectly cooked. The Udon noodles are to die for - makes any day better. The broth and meat make this Udon unbeatable. My go to, thank you for bringing so much joy through your food.
No comment

Raku has the best udon. I ordered the chikara which has mochi, chicken, and Japanese leeks also known as negi. The udon has the most perfect texture and it taste heavenly. The broth is clear and flavorful and the mochi is soft and chewy. It's amazing. I really enjoyed my meal here. The ambience is dim lighting but very cramped. It is hard to move around as it feels cramp and go there when they first open, guarantee seating. Cash only.
Always THE PLACE for udon. Consistently good, although the greeting at entry could sometimes be a little brusque, but given the tiny space and so many people angling for a table, it's to be expected.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best udon place in NYC!! Hands down will be satisfied. The spicy Niku udon is just the right amount of spicy. Super delicious meat. Definitely was not able to finished the whole bowel. The green iced tea is okay. The bottled cane soda is definitely a better pairing with the soup.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a great restaurant for udon! They have a good selection of cold and hot udon. I got the Niku udon (super delicious!) and a few appetizers. I strongly recommend the Niku! The fried oyster and salad appetizers were also good!
The udon noodles were amazing! The noodles themselves had great texture that I've never experienced at any other udon place. It had a very good chew to it and the broth was fantastic.

Curry udon is always delicious here, as is there regular clear broth beef udon. For the vegetarians out there, from a meat eater their veggie udon is soothing and something I would get on any regular day at Raku. Definitely not "just a veggie option" to appease the non-meat eaters! Service is always impeccable here and your water will never be left unfilled. Always a delight to dine here.

Solid higher-end udon.  While not the best udon I've had around this area, the udon was good and filled the craving.  I got their Niku Udon which came with some meat and tripe.  The cuts of meat were great and the noodles as well.  However, the broth was a bit on the basic side, leaving something to be desired.  I would recommend getting the sabazushi if you're a fan of mackerel, it had a slight char to it that was very satisfying.  Overall, cool spot and they do have an online waitlist but keep in mind that this place is pretty small and cramp.
No comment
Awesome!! Super good. Cute and cozy, also got Gyoza. Will be back for sure! Definitely priced very fair.
No comment

BE AWARE THAT THEY ONLY TAKE CASH (but there's an ATM in the back). We went to the location in Soho at 6pm on a Saturday and the wait was 1 hour for a party of 2. Then we walked to this East Village location and there was no wait (you can "get in line" using the Yelp app). The food was pretty tasty, but not the greatest value, although I was definitely full. We spent $90 for two udon noodles and two appetizers.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: I love Raku so much, but the East Village location was just not it for me. It was so small and cramped and our server was rude. You could tell she was flustered and there just wasn't enough staff on hand for a Friday night, which backfired on customers. The food was good, but the experience will keep me from returning back here.
No comment
No comment

I got dragged here by my SO who wanted to eat at Raku so badly. I wasn't entirely excited to go because I thought to myself - udon anywhere else aside from back home (Japan) is not that great. Wow, was I wrong. I took a sip of the broth and was surprised at the depth of flavor. It wasn't overly salty and I could taste the incredible dashi. The noodles were chewy and everything I could want in a bowl of hot soup. This review is solely for the food itself. If I had to comment on the service and place itself, I would have to say it's about 3/5 stars. If you get sat inside, be aware that you will sit really close to the other customers. We were sat outside, which we had no problems since we were trying to be cautious of our surroundings but we felt that the server(s) pretty much forgot about us. No checkbacks, but we were so content with our food that it didn't matter. We will be back!

Never disappoints, best udon in New York City! Udon is always silky smooth, and though a bit pricier than some other udon spots, it's a big portion. Personal favorite is the vegetable tempura udon. The tempura is lightly fried and pairs great with the salty udon soup. Usually a bit of a wait but have a drink at one of the many bars nearby while you wait!
I have yet to try something here that I did not absolutely enjoy. Their Niku Udon alone instantly made this ramen house one of my top 3 spots in NY.
No comment

We were fortunate enough to have our friends take us to Raku during our visit to NYC and Raku was a satisfying dinner after a long day. Delicious udon broth and the noodles were perfectly al dente. We also ordered the (vegetarian) Ankake udon for those with seafood allergies - both were great.

Delicious, soul filling udon noodles!! Best udon soup noodles period. For appetizers I've tried their kaarage, agedashi tofu, and sabazushi. They were all excellent and I can't wait to get again. The sabazushi which is pressed mackerel rice was soo good. Try to order it asap because they only make so many a day. I've tried the curry beef udon, gyunan udon, and niku udon so far. My favorite is the gyunan udon because of the thin slices of beef with such a flavorful broth along with thick udon noodles. Mouth watering udon that just hits the spot every time i go. I've had it for takeout as well and the quality is still the same! Can't wait until I come back, which is soon!!
No comment

Raku is one of my favorite udon places. There are two locations, and I think both are relatively similar in terms of wait time. Definitely try to either make a reservation (I think they started taking them during COVID, but I'm not sure if they're getting rid of them) or show up around 15-20 minutes earlier to put your name down during the dinner rush. I always get the Wakame udon, which I love since it's light yet refreshing. The broth base is so good and the udon noodles are made to a perfectly tender but chewy texture.

Ordered kitune, gyunan, and chikara udons and they were all magnificent.  The kitune had lots of seaweed, and it was smooth and soft. The broth was also very flavorful, and has a similar flavor to common udon. If you're interested in a "plain" udon, I recommend kitune. Also ordered Chikara. The Mochi comes with it- I LOVE this. So soft and chewy... like a party in my mouth with the chicken. Could use more protein (not too much chicken) but I highly recommend.   All three of them had its own unique flavor.  I can't say one is better than the other.  They were all great and I recommend Raku for Udon.
No comment
No comment

Friendly service. Waiter was knowledgeable on explaining the popular menu items in detail, helped us easily make a decision. I ordered the Ebiten udon with a side of poached egg and shiitake mushroom. Despite the small portion, both sides were amazing. The broth was so flavorful and noodles were perfectly Q!  Would def recommend and come back here. This place is packed so get there early if possible!
No comment

Wow these were the best noodles Ive ever had in my life. It was perfectly chewy and maintained its texture throughout the whole meal. I got the spicy niku udon and my friend got the chikara udon. The spicy niku udon had a good amount of spice, tender and lots of beef short ribs. It also had honeycomb tripe which werent overly chewy. The soup had a very clean after taste and it didnt feel greasy at all. The chikara udon was also very clean and had a nice chicken broth that was light. Really liked the addition of mochi pieces because it was very unique. Both came with lots of noodles and broth to enjoy. It is one of those places where you'll feel super satisfied and have a food coma but without feeling gross. As mentioned, it is cash only and they were very careful with covid!

Raku offers multiple branches. This branch is cash only and very small. They actually took over the out door seating area to the restaurant adjacent to it as they closed down too and Raku is that busy that people will come. We all got udon noodles with different meats and it was delicious.

The best udon in America, and I've been to the masters spots in Tokyo Japan. The hand pulled noodles are so firm w an amazing mouth feel. The spicy niku w honeycomb tripe and beef rib is amazing, but the simpler curry beef w wagyu meats is just as good w real curry flavor. I'll be back. They have 2 locations w Yelp waitlists for a reason.

After calling and listening to their voicemail telling us to put our name down on the Yelp waitlist we were told to arrive at 7:49. We checked in at 7:48 and they told us our table was ready 25 minutes ago and they had texted us so there was nothing they could do to seat us. The host told us we could put our name back on the waitlist and wait again but the waitlist was closed. When we showed this to the host he shrugged and told us there was nothing he could do. Not worth the trouble!
No comment

Best udon ever!! It tastes so fresh and the broth is light, so you don't feel terrible drinking the soup. I got the Niku and fiancé got the other beef soup- that was sliced. Both were delicious!! It's a small cozy place so id recommend putting your name down on the Yelp waitlist and then coming back when it's your turn. Id definitely be back to try some of the other udons.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The Chikara mochi udon was tasty and well portioned. Not to rave about, but solid. The wider than average front door is left open and the room is quite shallow, maybe 4x5 small tables. The farthest you can get from the entrance is about 10 feet. Dress as if you were eating outside.

The noodles here go craaazy. I've had udon noodles plenty of times but the ones at Raku are somehow very bouncy?? Not sure what the correct adjective is but definitely worth a visit. I got the curry udon which was really yummy, except the broth felt a bit gelatinous(?) and thick for my taste. But it was still good. The shrimp tempura was worth. Be sure to stop by Raku if you're in the area!
No comment

Walked in on a Sunday wait time was about 10-15 minutes so not too bad. The udon noodles were amaZing!! Chewy and fresh. The gyoza had a thin skin and a huge amount of filling! Overall great place to get your udon fix

My bf and I came arrived here late at night and they were pretty busy. We waited around 20 minutes to get seated and it was definitely worth the wait. Our server was super friendly and patient when answering our questions. I got the shrimp tempura udon with mochi and pickled plums on the side. I highly recommend adding the mochi to your udon noodle soup! The dumplings were alright because the fillings were a little bit dry. Overall, we enjoyed it a lot and we will definitely be back when we visit NYC again!

Did it! Ventured to Raku. Sat outside and it was cool enough to the point that when we bit into the chicken and sipped the broth for the first time, the warmth was pronounced. Spicy Niku is not too spicy and even those with low spice tolerance would be able to enjoy. Stir the broth around to disperse the chili oil evenly. Noodles were soft. Honeycomb tripe was chewy. Portion was generous and matched the price. Cash only!

This place definitely deserves its hype and everything was really good. I got the duck udon with fried chicken and wow, everything had a clean after taste. You can really taste the quality of ingredients, but I will say it is quite expensive so you should be prepared to drop at least $30-40. Keep in mind that they are cash only!!
No comment
No comment

Food was delicious! Ordered the niku udon, oyster udon and karaage. The soup of niku udon was good, loved how slippery and chewy the udon was! There was plenty of oysters in the oyster udon. The karaage was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The store started filling up with people quite fast though we got there 15min after they opened. The staff and service was good too. Would come back. Heads up for people- bring cash.
No comment

Service Amazing. Food quality terrific. Ambience was stellar. I could go on an write a long paragraph explaining ever sensation I felt when I ate my udon but I want you to see for yourself. Will be coming here again
No comment

Worth the hype. I've been wanting to try Raku for years and I'm so glad I was able to eat here during my most recent trip to New York! Portions are huge, and staff is very friendly. Loved the crispy fried chicken and the udon noodles were out of this world. I've never had udon like that before, although I've been to Japan a handful of times. The noodles are so chewy and delicious! I got the crab udon and my boyfriend got the beef. Both broths were so flavorful and tasty. I recommend trying to join the waitlist on yelp as the wait can be long (we waited a little over an hour).  Definitely a must try when you're in New York!
During the cold winter of 2020 amid the pandemic, Raku when I wanted some solid, soupy Japanese food. The udon is solid and chicken karaage fried to perfection
No comment
No comment

LOVE RAKU. The udon noodles are nice and chewy, and broth pairs perfectly. I'm also a big fan of the shrimp tempura, so I often get the Ebiten. The Gyunan and Curry are really good as well - ask for beef on the side. For appetizers, the Ankimo is the favorite - comes in a delicious ponzu sauce. The one thing I've had here that I wouldn't order again is the Kani Salad - lots of greens, very little Kani.
Delicious udon that's chewy! They have delicious broth and the interior is also super cute (: they have a long wait during weekends so try to go early if you want to give it a try
No comment
Got the Niku Udon and the beef was so tender and soft! The udon noodles are also very thick so be careful when eating! Make sure to chew them completely before swallowing

I'm not the biggest udon fan. I'm weird and prefer soba noodles and I always compare any Japanese noodles that aren't ramen to my favorite Japantown restaurant in San Francisco (Mifune). That said, this place exceeded my expectations. My friend highly recommended this place and we were craving something warm after a chilly fall day. When we arrived, we were told it would be a 45 minute wait. It ended up being an hour and a half wait, which was not ideal but the food did arrive quickly once we were seated. I ordered something new for me, the kamaage, which is noodles with a dipping sauce. The sauce was delicious and the noodles were great - chewy but not overcooked. I also got a side of shrimp tempura which was cooked perfectly. My friends got the sansai and the niku, and both were very pleased with their orders. Also - please note that this place is cash only, but they have an ATM in the back if you need.

Raku is everything I want an udon place to be. I would take udon over ramen any day, and Raku has impressed me every single visit. The Niku is definitely my favorite here. The noodles are so chewy and bouncy, beef so tender and flavorful, broth so light and delicious. I think Raku has my fave udon noodles that I've ever had. Even in 100 degree weather, I've slurped down these noodles happily with sweat beads rolling down my forehead, so you know how much I love this place.
Decent Udon and great interior. Noodles tasted fresh and then broth had decent flavor, would have loved a little bit of a richer broth, but overall not too bad.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

So delicious! Got Raku for takeout and it was so perfect! The flavor of the soup was unique and rich. The egg, noodles, veggies, and ground meat were just on point. Fabulous amount of soup as well for take out. Was super filling and extremely hearty. My friends also really enjoyed their meals - would absolutely recommend taking out from here and would love to visit in person sometime soon. I know there's two locations so I would like to try the other one as well.
No comment

Went with my friend looking for a quick, refreshing, and light meal. Delicious food (we had the cold udons) - perfect for this hot weather we've been experiencing! Ambience is nice and minimalist inside.
BEST UDON. Now I crave Raku every once in a while. The broth is always so flavorful and perfect for dipping tempura. Karaage is amazing to start. Raku is now a staple for me.

Amazing broth they make for their signature udons! Downside is that it's pretty hard to get a table and only accepts cash payments.
No comment

No comment
I ate here about six months ago and I still have dreams about their udon soup. It's literally the best thing I have ever put in my mouth!!!
The noodles are super QQ as they say! Usually not a big fan of udon, but the chewiness of the noodles, tenderness of meat, and flavorfulnpess of broth = chef's kiss! Also, portions are huge!
My first time at Raku and will be back soon.  The soba noodles are made fresh and to order.  I had asked for a little spice and was given some sesame oil with crushed chilli....WOW so good.
No comment

Homey Japanese shop with small but excellent selection of food. The yaki nasu - eggplant with minced pork and raw egg yolk is delicious! Smokey flavor and tender texture - its my favorite appetizer! Both mains are great as well - strongly recommend the nabe, which is one of their signatures as well. Get the green tea tiramisu! The green tea is authentic, and the layers melt right away in your mouth.
No comment
Came for outdoor dining a few weeks ago. Noodles are still as chewy as ever. Be prepared though, they are cash only!

SO impressed! This restaurant had the best precautions for COVID of any place I've been. There were temperature checks, contact tracing forms, social distancing enforced, masks worn by all and hand sanitizer on each table. I felt extremely safe here and the food was also delicious. Can't wait to return soon and in the future!
The curry udon was AMAZING! The noodles are so chewy and the perfect level of thickness, and with the richness of the curry broth with chicken...truly to die for. Go try it out!

while waiting in line for raku, two guests walked out and thanked the host for 2 straight minutes. that sums up our experience- the udon was perfectly chewy. the mackerel sushi (sabazushi- hidden under the section called "sides") had a tasty char. the yaki nasu was savory and peppery. we got the chikara, yasai kakiage, and nishin udon. never before have i been so sad to be too full to eat more.

Nice place, not very big. Came here in a party of 7, seated outside. Service was very quick (almost too quick), waiter kept coming over asking if we were ready to order, if wanted drinks/apps. Their edamame is portioned very nicely; their gyoza are not for the price. I got the pork katsu bowl. The pork was delicious, but the bowl was mostly rice. Drink selection is limited but prices are pretty typical/slightly lower than average for NYC restaurants. One downside is they're cash only, which we only found out once we were seated - I had to go to the ATM inside the place and withdraw $240 to cover the meal.

Best food I had on my week long NYC trip. Got cold udon for lunch and it was not only delicious but also refreshing during the hot day. Fried tofu was also delicious. One downside was that the Mackerel sushi was not available during lunchtime, which we did not know at the time. Will definitely come back on my next trip to try the mackerel!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The noodles are handmade and so chewy!! I can tell they are fresh and they go so well with the soup. I also recommend the rectangular sushi and the karage.

I'm obsessed with this place - from the time it opened in 2015, to throughout the pandemic (I ordered delivery). The Niku and Guynan are my go tos. Even though I live in LA now I think about it often. Please open LA location next!
No comment
No comment

My sister lives right across the street so this has been a staple for us during COVID outdoor dining. On this particular chilly day, I decided to have the shrimp tempura udon and my sister chose the oyako don. The tempura batter was so light and crispy, I immediately wanted more... my sisters dish was just as tasty and the flavor was so good. Will come back soon to try more of the menu.

Stopped here for lunch and wow what a spot. Asked for the one each of the most popular cold noodle and hot noodle. The waitress recommended me Niku udon and Jana. The Jana was sooo unique and would def come back to have it again. Udon noodle was thick and absorbed the broth well. Also ordered the tatsuta chicken. This is no ordinary chicken. Go try it. Almost every table had it for a reason. Will def come back again.
No comment

From the amazing food to the intimate dining experience... I highly recommend this place. You walk in through a small unmarked doorway. This restaurant seats about 15, but I they have had extra outdoor seating. The waitresses are very kind. The noodles are handmade and sooooo chewy and the broth is a masterpiece. Honestly, I recommend any of the hot noodles - you can't go wrong. At the end of the meal, they give you 1 frozen grape. It's oddly a perfect way to end your meal. Oh! CASH ONLY!!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Some of the best udon I had in the city! The texture was soft but not soggy and you can just taste the quality of the items here. It gets a little busy so the staff get pretty overwhelmed at times (giving us the wrong order) but it all worked out in the end!

Enjoyed the chewy flavorful niku udon. During covid, a shield separates the tables. Coming from out of town, these are the best udon I've had in recent memory. I havent left a restaurant feeling fuller and satisfied in a long time, so it's worth checking out!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The fried eggplant was delicious! The curry noodles: the noodles were great the broth was so so and not really curry or at least not what I was expecting when ordering that dish.
Raku has the best udon in nyc! It's my go to restaurant when I'm not sure what to eat. Amazing udon on the thinner side with a very tasty broth. Only downsides are cash only and the wait can be long!

We were waiting to get seated for a Tuesday lunch when there's a four-person table left in this quite small establishment. We asked the waitress if we could have that table instead of sitting at the stool facing wall, she declined with something unintelligible in a very rude manner. She didn't say anything when we showed her our vaccinations either, like silence. This place is cash only also which I find rare in EV. We were turned off and left.
No comment
No comment
What a cute little gem! Amazing service amazing food! Fried chicken was so juicy; noodles was al dante, oyako don was mouth watering and the eggplant... OMGGGG
No comment

I've never had cold udon before and was skeptical about it at first, but this place changed my mind! I ordered the yamakake udon, and it was the perfect dish to cool down on a hot summer day. I especially loved the flavors and texture of the noodles - chewy yet firm. I came with a friend on a Sunday evening and there was no wait. Service was very attentive and kind, and I loved the frozen grape that came at the end with the check - definitely something I've never been offered before at a restaurant. Would definitely recommend raku!
No comment
No comment

The food is good. The noodles are super chewy and the broth tastes fantastic. The vegetable tempura was good but a little bland and one of two of the vegetables were so hard to chew and break down. Otherwise the meal was great. My only gripe is how tight the restaurant is. The seats are so close to one another to the point where your sitting 1 feet away from random people. Also it was super hot in the restaurant to the point of sweating. I highly recommend the spot for the food but not for the dining experience. Also they only accept cash which can be problematic if you go there and forget to get cash. Also the entrance isn't marked that clearly so finding the restaurant was a bit harder than others.
No comment
No comment

Loved that the noodles are chewy homemade. My niku udon was heartwarming and packed a sweet savory punch from the meat. The meat was soooo tender and soft - absolutely delicious! Honeycomb tripe was very fresh and tasty! The curry udon was a bit of a let down. The flavors were one note and didn't have the depth we were looking for. Another downside is that it's cash only (they have an ATM machine inside).

column3: I-435 West KC-KS, Kansas City, KS
column6: Gross food.  Dirty silverware. Was eating here and a roach crawled across my table.  Disgusting:
No comment
No comment

horrible customer service, literally had been making us uncomfortable from the moment we walked in. when seated we were not greeted nor did they ask if we wanted any drinks, nothing. we ordered our food with little help from the waitress despite my confusion. before we had even got our food the waiters, two specifically, had been closely eyeing our table as if we had stolen something. there was no need for this especially because the place is so small that they can see us from standing at the counter!! waitresses seemed to speak amongst themselves while looking at our table, and it become insufferable to the point of not being able to finish our food. which speaking of, the food to me was great. as someone who ALWAYS tips I knew it was bad when i was not compelled to tip the 20% because of how extremely rude they were. then while we waited for our friend to use the bathroom. he came over and tried to grab our change ?? we were still deciding what to tip and the TYPICAL thing to do is to leave the tip on the table. he then pressured my friends to tip and when they explained that we had felt unwelcome the whole time and they had not shown the slightest bit of kindness he responds "and". it truly was the worst customer service i've experienced, kindness goes a long way.

I got curry udon here! First of all the portions are MASSIVE. Like this bowl was actually larger than my head and was filled with a heaping portion udon and curry! So worth your money and can last at least a couple of meals. The curry udon was super yummy and sooo warm. We got it on this super rainy, cold day and eating the dish made me all warm inside. My only note is that we paid extra for the chili oil and I genuinely did not taste it at all -- so avoid ordering that and save yourself the charge if you want spicy! Instead would recommend getting the (free) little spice packets. Those are also not that spicy but at least it's free! The service was also amazing, our waitress was the absolute sweetest.

The niku udon is amazing - it has a clearer soup and slightly chewy noodles, both with amazing flavor, and the beef and tripe were a welcome addition. The kani ankake (crab in egg soup) was also really nice, the soup is a bit thicker and lighter in flavor. The agedashi tofu is also very well done - very fluffy without an overly fried taste. They do not serve the mackerel pressed sushi for lunch which is unfortunate.
No comment
No comment
No comment

A simple pleasure. It is the second time we came. Make sure you don't miss the unremarkable small entrance. The udon is absolutely divine, chewy and lively. Made with love. The broth is awesome. We had the crab with egg broth that is rich with the taste of the sea. Fried oyster was fresh. Monkfish liver is like foie gras. The servers are so friendly and efficient. Highly recommend this beautiful place.
No comment

I ordered the seaweed udon and the noodles were fresh and chewy and the soup base was perfectly seasoned. A tad salty but I would definitely visit again. I also got a side of the mackerelzushi and it was amazing.
No comment
No comment

The quality was good overall, the noodles were handmade and tasted great compared to store bought ones. The only complaint I have is the lack of space in the restaurant, we ended up having to sit outside in the blazing heat and it wasn't very pleasant

Got the curry beef udon - super yum and large portions.  Some of the other selections seem a bit not as worth because there aren't many additional ingredients (especially veggies). My friend asked to charge his phone and left it with the workers inside but when he got it back it was not charged at all :/ Workers were really nice though

The udon here is very yummy and the noodle is the right amount of soft , chewy and sturdy. The tofu here is also very yummy.

We really liked this spot. Had the Oyakodon and the mushroom ramen. Spicy cucumber salad was a bit overpriced and edamame was just okay. But overall nice! Japanese owned which feels nice because it's authentic. Tasted authentic too. good choice!
Raku is one of the best Japanese undon restaurant, it's truly authentic. It holds high quality and fair price. I would like to come here every week.

Yummy! I got the fried chicken appetizer and then the spicy pork noodles. So good. Definitely be sure to join the waitlist on Yelp or you'll have to wait awhile -- place is small and very busy.

Love the large wooden spoons & honeycomb tripe. Outdoor dining is nice w dividers in between each table. They'll only seat & let you order when your entire party is there. This place is also cash only.
Unfortunately I got severe food poisoning from this restaurant :( that being said, while I was there, the food was amazing & the service wasn't bad!

column3: Irvine Business Complex, Santa Ana, CA
column6: Raku serves the best udon in town. If you are going here for the first time, I highly recommend trying their signature menu called Kani Ankake udon. You will be able to experience super flavorful soup blended with delicately seasoned crab meat. It's a must try menu. They dont accept credit card payment, so just remember to bring cash.

I ordered the chikara which has chicken and blocks of mochi on the bottom that you're supposed to break into cubes. I'm not sure if the mochi really fits with the dish, but it was interesting to try. I think there was too much of it though because it definitely fills you up. I'm used to lighter udon broths so this one was kinda salty to me, but the actual udon noodles were really good. Just the right amount of chewy! Although the wait was long to get a table and to get our food, service was great in terms of never having an empty glass of water. We came with a party of 9 and were eventually able to sit altogether. I definitely want to come back to try their other udons and their katsu don!
No comment
No comment
No comment

A quaint location that's hard to spot from the street. There is a very low amount of seating (a handful of tables, seating along the wall for around 10 people), but my party beat the rush by going between 5-6pm. The food was tasty; I had the curry udon and the fried chicken. Be sure to bring cash because they don't accept card!
No comment

A literal definition of a hidden gem. You won't be able to see it unless you really look for. We had went Pre-COVID and the seating inside was super limited. But it was a real nice experience. Their udon noodle was super flavorful. I am not sure what it is about the broth but it had complimented the udon very well. I am a texture type of gal and I loved how chewy the udon was. Every bite was mesmerizing and you can bet that I had dipped every drop of that broth. They had different varieties of items on their menu and I just felt like nothing can go wrong here except maybe how small the seatings are inside and how exceptionally crowded it could get at times.
No comment
No comment
This is my no.1 go to place in new york soho. Their noodles are chewy and well made. I will revisit this place for sure.
No comment
