Both are very delicious and fresh made! I would go again and try out different meal on the menu. This place is cash only. Remember to bring enough cash! :)
Great udon spot. Not many seating so it could get packed quickly. The soup base is very tasty. Karaage was good too. We will be back for more!
No comment

This place is so cute and authentic! The entrance is a sublet wooden door with no sign that says "raku" so make sure to watch out for it. We went at 6:30 pm on a Tuesday and there was no long but by 8 pm there was a line. The service was great and fast and friendly. The shrimp tempura and eggplant udon was delicious! Tasty and flavorful soup with long chewy udon noddles. The shrimp and eggplant was perfectly fried. It was a great experience! Great atmosphere.
The best udon I've had (including a previous trip to Japan).  I had the vegetable tempura udon and my partner had the curry udon. Both had amazing flavor and the texture of the noodles was perfect.
Ja Ja cold udon. Done. It has a hint of slickness but it's so well marinated and is so refreshing during the hot summer months.
Excellent sushi dinner with very attentive service and a sake lesson. Delicious tuna and sea urchin. Hope to return soon!
This place is such a vibe! The food is delicious and the people are super friendly and welcoming!

The first time I got the Ankake udon and I absolutely loved it. The broth is slightly thick, but it's very comforting especially on a cold day. The second time I went, I got the curry udon. I liked the Ankake udon more than the Curry udon, but it was still delicious. The only reason that keeps me from coming back to this place is their wait time. Literally I had to wait hours to be seated.

Arguably the best Udon noodles in America... just the perfect texture and it travelled well for delivery! Had the curry udon - would recommend extra noodles if your hungry. The curry had a nice balance of onions and meat (dark).

Great place to go if you're looking for a good bowl of udon in NYC! I had the gyunan udon and loved it - the udon was soft and chewy, and the broth was clean and refreshing. We came on a Saturday evening around dinnertime and there was a 45 minute wait, so definitely come early if you can to beat the dinnertime crowd, especially since the restaurant is rather small with limited seating. It can get quite loud in the restaurant because of the small seating area, but the food makes up for it. This place can be easy to miss since there isn't a sign, but be on the lookout for a wooden door covered by white and blue curtains. Highly recommend this restaurant if you're in east village!
No comment
No comment
No comment

When I came here it wasn't very crowded. I ordered a nameko udon and shared a thick cut bacon appetizer. The bacon was pretty good but it's so flavorful and fatty that I don't think I could finish it myself. The nameko udon had Waianae seaweed and mushrooms in it. The broth was good and the noodles were really nice and chewy. The service was nice too.

I just love love love the udon here, the noodle is so soft and chewy at the same time. I'm not that impressed with the appetizers though. But remember to bring cash since it's cash only, and there's always a line at night on weekends.
I think this is the best Udon in town! Had Niku udon, ankimo, fried chicken today, love every dishes! The noodles itself is good enough!!

So overrated. The soup base was literally soy sauce, salt and water plus whatever the topping u got. The portion of the udon was big for a Japanese restaurant but the ankimo appetizer had only 1 piece where all other restaurants I've been to at least give 3 pieces for cheaper price.  Will not come back and not recommend to any one I know.
Best udon in Manhattan(not as good as in Japan) and shouldn't miss the thick cut bacon too.
Very original taste of food materials. Noodle udon is very chewy. Broth is properly thick.  Bill gift was two frozen red grape - sweet surprise!
No comment

It was a happy accident that we ended up finding this gem in a city ripe with excellent cuisine. There is only seating for about 20 people, at best, but this place is absolutely worth the wait. We sampled almost everything on he menu. Too difficult to choose a favorite. Just go. You will not be disappointed.
No comment
No comment

Fantastic authentic Japanese food here. We ate here twice and both times were delicious!! Small room with Japanese decor and great dinnerware saves you a trip to Japan!! I suggest the crab ramen , duck ramen and the wagu beef.
Great environment and very good noodles. Big bowl and hearty. This is a cash only establishment but there's an ATM.

A small udon place near 1st avenue. I especially like their decoration from the moment I saw their door. Most of the udons are vegetable based. Absolutely love the fried tofu and fried eggplant appetizer. For entree, we tried the beef tripe one and the rice cake udon. I think I'd prefer the beef one though it tasted a bit like the Cantonese style beef noodle. But my friend thought it's a bit strong in the "beefy" flavor. I don't like the rice cake one so much because it is a bit plain. But all in all it's a good hang out place!
Really yummy comfort food. Makes me feel warm and fuzzy. Udon is hand made. Line may be long but very worth it! They told us the line was an hour long but it ended up being around 40 minutes.
Raku udon noodle will be the udon noodle that I'll miss the best in NYC. The soup, the meat, the noodle-all of these elements are amazing
No comment

The Kamaage Udon was great even though it's simple. It comes in plain hot water with separate dipping sauce. The sauce is a bit sweet and extremely flavorful. The noodle itself is a bit thicker than usual and is extremely filling. Everything is reasonably priced and even though the restaurant is on the smaller side the service is quick.

Been to this place once and ordered on Postmates many times in the past year. I love noodle, soup and this place. The broth is amazing with nice protein toppings. The waitress that helped us were nice and welcoming. I also really liked the sparkling sake they had. Will be back!

Hands down my favorite place to get udon! We did have to wait a bit after putting our names down in this small restaurant - you also will lose your table if your entire party is not there within minutes of them calling your name. This place was perfect for a cold day in NY. I had the ankake udon - kind of like egg drop soup. The noodles were soo good and fresh, definitely the highlight of this place. I had a side of shrimp tempura which was light and not greasy. My friend had the niku udon (shortrib and honeycomb tripe) which was very tasty and flavorful. I was able to order this to-go so I could have it later. Cash only.
Amazing place. A little hard to find but it is certainly worth it. Smaller place and cash only. The hand pulled udon is outstanding. I can't praise this place enough. Just go there and eat.
No comment

We went there Saturday night and waited about 30 minutes. I really loved the fried oysters, fried tofu and mackerel sushi. Oysters tasted very fresh. The udon bowl was so big as you can see in the picture comparing to my hand lol. Service was good. We also ordered eel and egg rice to go, it was still really good the next day! I would definitely recommend to my friends!! I also post the pictures on my ins: shangyiliuuu

I came right before the crowd and got seated right away and I ordered the beef ribs with beef tripes. The broth was so flavorful and tasty. The noodles are so chewy, and I think it tastes like hand made udon. It is as good as what I had in Japan! Although it's a little pricy, it's ok to have it once a while :)

I love their niku Udon and it is also the only one I've tried. It's delicious and definitely quite the bowl to warm you right up in the cold winter. I only go for this dish because it has the most amount of meat.  It is on the pricier end.

It's a great feeling when you walk out of a restaurant feeling good about yourself -- that it you're full but don't feel like you overate, that you're healthy? Raku's food felt healthy and light. The wait can be pretty long, but the staff was very friendly and accommodating.
It's a good noodle place don't get me wrong, they just don't kick people out who have already finished eating and make you wait forever.

I am shocked that the ramen market in the city still have space for new places like this. Yet I am very glad that they open up. Specializing in udon, the homemade noodle beats everybody else in the neighborhood. Definitely will go back.

This is the best beef udon I ever had in Manhattan! The restaurant is very initiated and cozy and yet very clean and neat. The beef stripe in the noodle give extra texture to the soup base. The soup has very rich beef flavor and the meat in the udon is soft, well cooked but not over cooked. On thing on spot is the udon noodle is hand pulled freshly made everyday. You could see it was clipped in the end. The udon is strong but not chewy, very soft to bite. Chicken karage is very crispy and tasty. Overall great experience!! Five star recommended for small group. It maybe a waiting time for an hour for any group lager than 4 people at regular dining time.

Had the ja ja cold udon. It was amazing. Spicy pork with thin slices of cucumber. Noodle texture was great. Not too tough not too soft. Great flavors. Place was a bit hot indoors because it's summer time. Great for a quick bite.
Really good vegetarian udon! I've eaten a lot of noodles, and Raku stands out to me as one of my favorites. Had to wait but it was worth it.
Very impressive udon. Perfect for a cold day. Attentive and detail-oriented staff. Will go back and try different dishes.

The food was delish!! Absolutely amazing. I had the opportunity to dine here when my family went on a vacation to New York. If I were to visit again, I would definitely dine here again. The cold udon was my favorite.
No comment

The udon here is delicious and the portion size of the noodles is pretty generous. But be aware that some of the extra topping orders can be pretty small. If you add shiitake mushroom to your order, you're actually adding 1 mushroom for $2. The seating is super limited and tightly packed too.
This is the best udon place in the city!!!  I love this place so much that I want to move next to here and come here everyday. The appetizers are delicious!  Udon selections are omg!!!!

Amazing restaurant that serves one of the best udon bowls in New York. Cute ambiance and great service! I would recommend the Niku Udon, Karaage, Agedashi Tofu, Sansai Udon, Nameko Udon and Oroshi Udon.

Would not come again. The place is so small and cramped and one of the servers is unreasonable especially for a customer who was being polite and waited outside of the shop to save them room when everyone else wasn't. Terrible hostess. The first lady was nice and accommodating though. The food is okay you can get  the same elsewhere; nothing special.

OMG!!! This is one of the best udon noodles I have ever had!!! The texture was so chewy and perfect. The broth super delicious and tasty. I'm so glad I came here today with the weather gloomy and rainy outside. Its the perfect place to end my day. Thanks Raku!!! Please come here and try this place cause you won't regret it.
Great Udo and the weird ancient Japanese BMG... Btw, the hidden ATM blew my mind. LOL

If you like udon, definatly a good place for it. Unfortunately I'm not a big fan but I still found alot to like about the place. It's a small spot so expects waits for seating, but there is alot of variety on the menu and the appetizers are pretty tasty. Pricing is pretty reasonable as well + good service!

This is by far the best udon place I've been to outside of Japan. Not only that but, the service was amazing. The food is fresh and packed with flavor. Yes it is a small restaurant but don't let that fool you. Each bite is perfect no matter what you have. Therefore I suggest this to anyone seeking great food packed with flavor.
No comment

The staff here are exceptionally nice and the food is really good! Go with the braised tuna for an appetizer and make room for their top notch udon noodles. They have a perfect consistency and the broth is surprisingly flavorful. Cold or hot I don't think you can go wrong with the udon quality at this place. Definitely want to come back.
Small place tucked away on a busy street. Very understated, if you're not paying attention you could totally miss it. Absolutely delicious!

Honestly, doesn't matter how good the food is, nobody should be waiting for a table for two hours because they don't know how to assign tables. It's super frustrating and deeply disheartening. I'm  very easy going but this is so not okay

Omg i love this place! I came here ard 5:30pm so the wait time wasn't that bad. I ordered chicken appetizer and curry udon, it's the BEST udon I've ever had in my life!!! Will definitely come back again, I love it love it, and I'm craving their udon right now at 1am, yea, that's why im writing this review :D
Delicious, homey, comfort food. The vibe of this place is so relaxing and the service makes me feel very welcomed. The udon noodle has such a great texture, best I have ever had!
Niku Udon tastes amazing, strongly recommend it. If the restaurant could cards it would be better.
No comment

Sooooo yummy! I got the Niku Udon. Portions are big, I couldn't finish my bowl even though I wanted to. The place is super cute and tiny - we went in on a Tuesday night and we grabbed the last two seats by the wall without having to wait. Oh and it's cash only!

This is probably my fav noodle spot in the city. I originally wanted ramen nearby but ended up coming to try their udon. I was really impressed with the texture of the hand pulled udon noodles as well as the broth itself. I'm usually one to go for the fancier dishes but I went with a simpler udon (forgot the name but it was with mountain veggies and mushroom tempura) and it was amazing. Just everything about it was really good. Even from the vibe the outside and inside, to the attentive service and clean bathroom, everything exceeded my expectations of a nyc resto.
No comment
Nice semi-discrete shop. Great service. I got the Raku udon, which had an amazing broth but just slightly too salty for my taste.

This is the best udon place, hands down. Try any. The chicken karaage appetizer is worth a mention. If you want to avoid the 1+ hour wait, try coming right when they open or later around 9:30pm for a late dinner.
The food was great, and so was the service. The waitresses were very informative about the menu. This place can be a bit hard to find if you don't keep a close eye out for it.
So far i love the beef udon soup. The bowl is impressive. It is huge. Wish they could put more udon in because I can eat more. Nothing negative so i give it 4 stars

This place simply has some of the best noodles in Manhattan. The broth is insanely good too. If you're not sure what to add to your soup, you can ask the servers and they'll give you some suggestions. I had the duck and a runny egg. It was fantastic. Top 5 bowl of soup in my entire life
No comment
Great place for food in a chilly weather. The portion is large. We were so full finishing everything. We loved the appetizers - deep fried chicken and tofu as well.
Really tasty Japanese food in a very clean minimal space.  Delicious soups and great for winter.  Lines can be long.
Every time I come here it's amazing. Love their Honeycomb tripe and short rib Noodles!!!
Bawitdabadabangadamgdiggydiggydiggysaid the boogie said up jump the whoogie. I was surprised by the adequate proportions and the soup was just right ordered the short rib soup. Happy wid my choice
No comment
I got the Niku Udon and wow the broth (flavorful and not too salty), the noodles, the tripe and ribs were all on point! My new favorite udon place in NYC...!!!

Deliciously chewy, with the right amount of bounce and snap. Yes, I'm describing the udon noodles of my dreams that come along the most delicious udon broth I've ever had. Broth had depth and pieces of honeycomb tripe and short ribs and was so good that I took the leftover broth home and ate it with some rice the next day. Don't judge. We also started with ankimo which is always delicious. The place is pretty small and there was a slight wait.

I really love Japanese food and i can say - this place is awesome. The Udon noodles so delicious! I mean it's totally different from other places. Soups are also amazing, friendly and price is good. Highly recommend it.

Best udon in NYC in my opinion. I tried the wagyu beef udon, the chicken with mochi udon, the beef tribe udon and they were all really good. The noodle  is definitely the star of the meal, it's so chewy and tasty even without the broth.
No comment

I was happy with the beef stew undo I have. The soup is delicious, the noodle is very chewy. Great atmosphere. Had fun with friends there. Would love to visit again and try all the eel and egg on rice.
BEST handmade udon ever! (PS. it's cash only)
No comment
The udon is amazing. They use thicker udon with soup and thinner udon for dipping. Delicious fried chicken. Cash ONLY but they have an ATM on site. Very clean restroom.

Was not impress. Had the mild curry chicken and there were only three tiny pieces of chicken in that large bowl of broth. Also had vegetable dumplings and there was barely any vegetables in it. They were stuffed with some creamy stuff and tasteless.

The place is nice but it's a bit dark and rlly small and tight space. When I first went in one of the waiters was a bit rude then after I got 2 diff ones and they were a lot nicer. The food there is good but over priced. I would recommend but I wouldn't go back too often cause it's so pricey.

Cute Japanese place. The pricing is reasonable and the interior is minimalistic in an interesting way. Not too much space tho! It could be a nice cozy Sunday night place to have Japanese soups. The portions are quite bigger than normal... Our soups were thick and spicy.
No comment
Horrible service! Servers will rush you to order and take plates off the table before you even finish eating. Will not return, absolutely disgusting mannerism!
One of the hidden jewels in East Village. It's comfortable, and a quiet respite from the tireless city. Their udons are reasonably priced and some of the tastiest in the city. Highly recommended!
Hands down the best udon place in the city and my must go to place on a rainy day Everything on the menu is worth ordering
I don't usually like udon and the udon here blows me away. It's silky smooth and not too hard and not too soft. The niku don is HUGE and has tripe and tender pieces of beef. Worth the $16.

Udon lovers rejoice! This place is like udon west but way nicer and cuter for around the same price. The servings here are huuuuge. You could wear the bowls they use as a big hat. The ankake udon is kind of like udon in thick egg drop soup. It's yummy and filling. The curry udon is also a good option. The curry is flavorful and not too spicy. Come here for one bowl of noodles and it can last you thru brunch and dinnertime. And the bowls of noodles and the interior and the little ombre drape entrance is all insta-worthy.
No comment
It's small place but they decorate as minimalism. Beautiful decor, friendly staff, great Udon menu (large servings).
No comment

Quite good. The noodles are imported from Japan and have a great mouth feel. The broth is tasty. I ate everything in my bowl. The service was friendly and really accommodating when I wanted to take photos of my food. Yeah, I should probably share them on this review.
I love the curry udon and thick cut bacon here. The wait could be long though. I always try to go after 130pm for lunch so we don't have to wait for too long.
No comment

Our go-to spot for udon -  the noodles are springy and chewy but not heavy and the selection of different broths and toppings is great. Curry udon one of my favorites, though we've had a few different ones across visits and they've all been delicious. The braised tuna appetizer is also delicious.

This place was great.  Was very impressed by the quality of the Udon.  I deserves the tremendously good reviews posted.  Quick note - the area inside is not very large.  So if your party members are not already there when you arrive, it would probably make sense to wait outside.  Though I would say that this restaurant is well worth the wait.

I ordered the Niku Udon which has beef short ribs & honeycomb tripe but was sad to see my bowl had no tripe at all :( There was a TON of beef though. My friend had ordered the same thing so I tried a piece of her tripe and it was sooo good.

No one greeted us at the door. We stood there for a good amount of time, they were just chatting amongst themselves until we approached them. Customer service was "nice" but we felt super rushed within 2 minutes of sitting down, didn't even get to see the menu and we were asked 3x "are we ready"? When the bill came the money barely touched the table, the waiter tried to grab it I did not even get the chance to recount the money. Food was good. First and last time there, will not be going back due to the service.
Best udon I've ever had. After looking at its reviews, I decided to try it myself. So nice the udon noodles are. I would put it No.1 udon restaurants in NYC.

This place was amazing. The food is absolutely delicious. You can tell that the noodles are homemade and they have the perfect amount of elasticity and chew to them. The broth was also great. I can't wait to go back and try all the different types of udon noodles they have. They also have donburi but I didn't see anyone eating that (the place was packed) probably because the udon was so delectable

The consistency of the noodles are absolutely perfect. It is the right amount of chewy and for some reason stays that way no matter how long you leave them in the broth (they don't get soft or start disintegrating). Highly recommend the agedashi tofu and niku udon
ordered mushroom and veggie udon, soup was flavorful, this place is rather small but simple and decent inside.
Wait to get in was a little long, but totally worth it. Great ambiance and the food was delicious.
I feel like they've managed to differentiate themselves with more authentic Japanese ramen. This will satisfy food snobs

Came here on my birthday as a second option based on the glowing 5 star reviews everybody here gave on Yelp.  Super overrated to the point i can say i can make udon better than this at home.  Nothing to work home about.  I wanted to ask for my money back.

While the udon noodle bowl were pretty decent (the broth was pretty rich -- my girlfriend and I ordered the shrimp tempura udon bowl), menu itself was sparse (consisting mostly of udon) and  the appetizer we ordered wasn't very appetizing at all (it was braised tuna which tasted like flavorless overcooked tuna and cost us $8 for a small portion of fish). Furthermore, our plans went a bit awry as they ONLY ACCEPT CASH and don't accept other forms of payment. I would recommend other restaurants for new visitors in NYC.

This little restaurant in East Village is really a gem. The udon noodles are amazing! There are a variety of broths, both light and heavy and the noodles are very fresh and has a similar bouncy texture as mochi. Highly recommend! Look out for their sister restaurant to open on the west side.
Best udon noodles ever. The yam & seaweed appetizer was amazing in a hot summer!   Def. will bring friends and families there. Seats always limited though.

If you're the kind of person who goes to restaurants for the experience than you will probably be fine here, since it's an interesting intimate space and everyone is very nice. It reminds me of tiny mom and pop shops I've been to in Japan, but they tried to upscale it and attract a young crowd. They succeeded with the young crowd, which is why I think the reviews are so good. BEWARE, the food is bad and overpriced. My curry udon tasted like curry powder jello. There was no heartiness in it that you would expect from authentic Japanese cooking. Other dishes were similar. Go there to check out the hype, but set your expectations low to have a good time and be ready for the pricey bill.
I really enjoyed this noodle-centric Japanese restaurant.  I did feel that it could have been more flavorful, but it wasn't overly expensive and it was just what I was looking for.  Recommended.
No comment

Fantastic udon. The noodles hand-made and flown from Japan and you can really taste the difference from the usual store-bought kind. They are chewy and flavorful and soak up all the tasty broth. Ingredients are impeccable, the space is minimalist and comfortable. Perfect for lunch (but gets very full)

Be patient you can't reserve and there are only 20 seats but it is worth the wait, very lovely service waitresses, excellent price quality ratio. It was very good. I had the katsu don. The decoration is very minimal, so the space, but for the ones we want to be transported back to a Tokyo restaurant atmosphere, this is it. Can only recommended it.
No comment

Go for the udon. It's smooth and chewy. I don't doubt they make it themselves. I got the short rib udon and it was more than enough to fill me up (compared to when I got the large udon from Tsutonron). The short rib was cooked perfectly. However, I didn't enjoy the soup as much and it could be hotter. Will come back to try another udon next time!

Yummy homemade Japanese udon chewy and filling. Soup is always delightful with enough favors not salty and greesy. Fried chicken and dumpling are good appetizers. Be aware of party of more 3 might be long wait since limited big tables inside.

I haven't been in NY for a few years and so I revisited Raku.  I heard they opened the new location in China Town, and I felt the quality changed a little.  Agedashi Tofu was very firm, and Kara age was very brown. It must be very hard to keep the quality since the waiting time is 20 min to 45 min.  I missed the original tastes Raku used to have.  If they started to serve ordinary stuff, it won't worth waiting in line.
Hole in the wall place with friendly service and a variety of udon choices. Definitely recommend getting a spicier broth. Portions are large and very filling- worth the price!

I came here for lunch one day. Not too busy during lunch since I went closer to opening, and they sat me at a two-person table instead of having to sit at the bar stools and face the wall (yay). The waitress came out with hot tea and water for me, and I ordered the curry udon. I must admit, I'm not an udon expert, and particularly, I wished there were more people inside so I could copy how to use that humongous wooden spoon paddle to eat my udon. Haha. The curry udon was good. It came out in this huge heaping big bowl. The broth itself was interesting.. I can't quite pinpoint it. It almost tasted watered down, but still had a runny thickness to it? Not sure how to describe. It was good though.

Great spot for udon! Really yummy broth and noodles have a well rounded texture. I like them a little more firm though. The appetizer portions are pretty small if you're trying to share. But overall one of my faves in this area. Small space. If you use the wait list feature on Yelp it's not too accurate. I waited 45 minutes on the list and when I got there, was told it would be another 20 minutes. That dampened the whole experience. But food was a 5 so I'd come back again at a less busy time.

SO amazingly good! Straight out of Japan, authentic udon. I just ordered the plain Kitsune udon and even that just blew me away - I highly recommend if you don't want something too heavy. But I did try my sister's curry udon and that was amazing as well! Just a lot if you're not super hungry. And lastly, the fried chicken is TO DIE FOR! That is a must. Okini!
My favorite place for udon and fried chicken. There might be several minutes of waiting for dinner, but Definitely worth waiting. The Unagi Don is also amazing.
No comment
No comment

I was feeling sick and decided to stop by for a hot bowl of udon to feel better. i got the niku udon. the tripe was very similar to the tripe you can get at dim sum places (like with the turnip and whatnot, in the clear glass bowls). the broth was a bit salty but overall it hit the spot. it's a tad pricey (like $17-18 average for a bowl of udon) but it's a very hearty portion and you get a decent amount of tripe & meat.

Raku was delicious however it did not blow me away. The menu was simple and I tried the popular items, fried chicken and Niku udon. The fried chicken was the star of the meal, it was succulent and paired well with a spicy masago aioli. The noodles were unlike any other udon noodles I've ever had. I loved the texture/shape it was quite different not quite uniformly round. The niku broth was good however it just reminded me of a lighter version of Taiwanese beef noodle soup. Wish there was more options.

This place was awesome! Actually I was looking for Ramen place via yelp, and it shows me 'wrong' result. So, I was kinda upset because they only have Udon. But, all foods were great and We will definitely go there again!!
No comment
No comment

Discreet exterior but definitely a lucky find. I've been searching for ramen in the city with the authentic umami flavor and this is by far the most exceptional! It's a small place but the wait won't be long and the service is fast. Definitely worth a try! I'll be back again!

Husband and I both got really sick after eating here. :( I don't know how or why but shortly after eating here we both felt a prickly feeling in our throats. Within a day I had a full blown worst flu of my life. Persistent 103 degree fever that keeps coming back, sore throat from hell, nausea for days, constant headache, chills, body ache... It's been a week and I'm still not better. I don't know what I got infected with but I'm never coming back here, that's for sure.

I love the texture of the noodles and how you can tell it's homemade. One bowl is super filling. My favorite is the Niku udon! The thick cut bacon appetizer wasn't bad, but I probably wouldn't get it again. It's not expensive at all considering it's in Manhattan and it's such a filling/authentic meal. The restaurant size is small, but I like that it's not too loud.
No comment
It's a cute small place selling different kind of udon noodles. Yummy but beware of a line.
Excellent small intimate dining experience!  Attention to detail not only in the food but also the surroundings.  Gyoza and udons were fantastic!
Tiny little cute shop. The signature beef noodle soup is amazing! Really loved the texture of the noodle and the fact that it doesn't get mushy in the soup is just wonderful!!!!!
No comment
Simple classic udon noodles in fresh broth, genuine  Japanese atmosphere, quick and quality service
No comment

I've had a lot of udon, but this is the best udon i've ever had in my life. I had the Yasai Kakiage Udon. The noodles are made in-house, and they are the perfect amount of chewiness. The broth is clean and well seasoned.The vegetable tempura was perfectly crisp and piping hot. Cash only. Must try.

I never knew udon can be this good. This is opened by the owner of my all time fav sushi restaurant kura. Looking at the pictures I wasn't tempted to go, then ine day I ordered delivery. And now I'm addicted.

The place was pretty small, simple designs. Order the Niku Udon, Agedashi Tofu, and some wine. The beef from the Niku Udon was flavorful, and the udon was chewy. (Although not made in-house, it was handmade and shipped from Japan.) The tofu was light in saltiness, but soggy (would have preferred the shell to be crunchy). The wine brought out the taste of the beef (so I would recommend ordering some wine).
No comment
some of the best udon I've ever had, the noodles were super chewy and the beef broth was great

Excellent udon. I had the curry udon with beef and it was flavorful without being oily, with great texture to the noodles. The staff was friendly and attentive. Not a bad wait on a Tuesday night. Definitely coming back to try other things on the menu!

Had the Niku Udon and Miyasaka Yawaraka sake. The Niku Udon was decent, but the noodles were very, very delicious, slightly chewy and almost perfect. Although I wasn't a fan of the sweet broth I did enjoy the texture of the tripe and the way the brisket fell apart. The daikon had been soaking in the broth so made a nice burst of flavor that balanced out. Paired with the sake made a wonderful meal.
No comment
No comment

I went there based on the yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Ramen was good, but not exceptional therefore only 3 stars. Place itself is nice but very small, only a few tables, but when we got there there was plenty of free space and service was really fast.
BESTT udon!!! The noodles are so authentic and soft and chewy, and the broths are all so comforting on a cold day. I will def be back!!!
Amazing Udon noodles are so fresh.  They get it from Japan.  Great appetizers also.  It's worth the wait!

Great dinner yesterday at Raku.  Small menu of appetizers, udon, and donburi dishes.  The star is obviously the udon, which had the most perfect, silky smooth texture and just the right amount of chewiness.  I had the kamonan udon, cooked to perfection with a flavorful and light broth.  My friend had the niku udon, which was also delicious but with a heavier, heartier broth.  Agedashi tofu and chicken karaage were also stellar and worth a try. We left completely full and satisfied.  Having lived in Tokyo for several years, I have super high standards and this place impressed me!  Service was friendly, polite, and unobtrusive.  Space is small, and even though we didn't have to wait for a table for 3 at 7pm on a Wednesday night, I definitely see this place getting crowded!

Love their Udon dishes, the broth is so rich in flavor and the noodles had perfect texture. My favorite so far are the ebi tempura and the wagyu beef Udon. The curry Udon was less to my liking. I love the minimalist decor. Don't forget to join the wait list on yelp.
Udon like no other .. Tofu alone worth the trip, Tried the Niku and Herring. Brilliant

Neat place for the delicacy of the food. We ordered three different types of ramen and some appetizers. The appetizers were karage and monkfish liver, both were outstanding. The flavors of the udon broth were delicious. The texture of the noddles were chewy and flavorful.

Went here on August 13th on a day trip to NYC with my boyfriend. The interior was very well-designed and aesthetically pleasing, although a bit small (If you go, make sure to go early, around 6 or 6:30). We ordered the edamame, which was much more tender and fresh than what we usually get at our local sushi place, and the hijiki for appetizers. Both were absolutely delicious. For udon we ordered niku udon and gyunan udon. I had the niku udon, and I loved the fragrant broth, the soft honeycomb tripe, and the flavorful pieces of beef. It was very filling, soothing, and easy on the stomach. My boyfriend also really liked his gyunan udon. We went into Raku with very high expectations based on reviews we had read, and they were definitely met/exceeded. Definitely recommend!!!!!

The noodles' texture is not something that can be achieved from anything store bought. Whether cold or hot, amazingly chewy and springy, the best udon I've had in the city. Usually I prefer soba but this has converted me. The short rib and tripe was so tender and rich without being greasy or heavy (short rib carefully trimmed of fat), the broth was so good I finished it all. The staff are great and very accommodating. We have a 3 year old and they're kind enough to provide plastic utensils and cup with lid and straw. The sides are all good but the noodles are the star. They only accept cash, but they also have a really cool looking atm inside a cabinet if you forgot beforehand.
No comment
The best udon place in NYC.... The only thing that I don't like is no plastic is accepted.... cash only....
No comment
No comment
We ordered agedashi tofu, niku udon and pork cutlet rice. All of them were tasty. The thick cut beef in niku udon was so soft that just melt in your mouth. Really enjoyed the food there.

Wonderful little spot.  With great soups. Had the beef rib and tripe udon (must have been the Dominican in me calling out!). It was flavorful and had plenty of tripe and beef. limited menu. Not too many tables. But very cozy. Service was attentive. Will be back!
The best udon I've had. I evangelize about this place to anyone who asks me for a restaurant recommendation -- and they've gone on to spread the word themselves! Also super affordable.
Beautifully simple, small space. Feels like a place on the canal in Kyoto. Totally authentic. Friendly staff. Fair prices. Go.
Probably one of the best Japanese food around. Feeling very lucky to have found this place before it becomes popular (and no doubt that it will).
Their curry udon and tatsuta age are life-affirming. This bowl of noodles will change your life. Wow.

Best udon I ever had!!! Never knew that udon can be this delicious! The noodle here has wonderful texture. You'll definitely love it. I ordered curry udon and my husband ordered niku udon-- both are so good. Highly recommend!

Homey, comfortable, delicious.  Shrimp tempura udon was prepared perfectly - everything from the tempura batter to the udon texture to the soup broth.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is small and fills up quickly, so go early!

I have not had a lot of udon.  But it was the best udon I have ever had.  I had the tofu udon and the tofu was amazing and so were the noodles.  Super fresh with a great texture that I have not had before with udon noodles.  About $10 for the vegetarian bowl.  The vegetable gyoza were great.  Hard to find--wooden door with two black curtains covering it and the restaurant seats about 25-30 so you may have to wait.  People were waiting right inside the restaurant and we waited about 10 minutes for 3 people on a Monday night.  It's the best I've ever had so five stars.

Enjoyed the theme! (Yin and Yang) Place is a bit hidden but once you get in you'll feel comfortable. The chop sticks were official! I got the curry beef udon with fried chicken appetizer, absolutely delicious. Check this place out.

As an avid noodle lover, raku has the best noodle by far. Their noodle is unique and al dente, you get that bounce everytime unlike other places who serve soft noodles. Their broth are also very flavorful yet clear and light. The ambiance makes me feel like i'm in japan! Only downside is i wish they gave more meat but definitely worth it :)

This place is so amazing! The udon is cooked to the right consistency--not too chewy and not to hard. The broth is flavorful and will have you drinking all of it. My favorite is the kamonan udon! The duck does not feel dry and the soup is very clean. Get the duck!
The broth was so clear and refreshing. A lot of flavor. The noodles were chewy. I can't wait to go back.
had the tripe soup, kind of clean and minimal like the dining room, fat gelatinous noodles and a discreet broth. overall 3 and 1/2 stars
No comment
No comment
Exterior, interior, location, atmosphere, quality of food, portion is all good enough to bring a friend who's visiting nyc or loves asian food and culture. Absolutely love this place.

I got the mushroom udon and thought it was really good - the broth was flavorful, especially for something all vegetarian. The noodles were a great chewy consistency and silky texture. My friend got curry udon and couldn't stop talking about it. We were in a rush and she insisted on inhaling all of the rest of the noodles. Definitely recommend.
We had the curry udon and the chikara udon, both delicious. The place is cute and simple. Good service, zen atmosphere, large selection of udon noodle soups. We will come back.

This place is definitely a hidden gem. While  the restaurant is small and waiting for seating may seem like forever, this place is worth it. I gave it 5 stars for the food. I'm not someone who's crazy for udon, but this place has to be my favorite spot. There's something authentic about it. Anyway, if you like asian/oriental food and you're craving soup, I highly recommend giving this place a try!
This is the BEST UDON place in my life! The soup base is wonderful. Noodle is unique. It is adequately chewy. Service was good too. I waited thirty minutes to get food, but I don't regret it.

Had the niku udon, because it's the most recommended bowl according to the yelpers. And I love me some tripe. The tripe/meat was cooked to perfection. They are very generous with the amount of meat they put in it. However, its a bit pricey, BUT still worth it.
Walked in on a Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend and we were seated immediately. Loved the space. Amazing udon broth. This place is definitely a Yelp bookmark worthy spot.

The best udon I have ever had. Pretty sure they handroll their udon. The broth is tasty, not too salty and they are not skimpy on the meats and veggies unlike other udon/ramen places. I got the tripe/pork meat udon and it had like 3 large pieces or tripe and 3 large pieces of pork meat. It was delicious. Very cozy atmosphere. Can get a little crowded and is hard to find but overall great food and customer service.

Best udon spot in the city. Noodles are spongy and thick, broth is flavorful and rich but not too heavy. The chilled noodles are also worth it. For appetizers try the tofu or fried chicken. It's the best deal in the city (30$ pp for apps mains and sake) and the atmosphere and service is perfect for an intimate low key night. It is small though so best for small groups.

People have been telling me to come to this place for a while and now I know why! It was a little confusing to find because it's very unassuming outside but once you come in the door behind that little blue and white flag you are instantly charmed. I was instantly hit with the delicious aroma of their food and the beautiful and simple minimal aesthetic. The mild curry udon noodle with beef is DELICIOUS and just perfect for the chilly weather that day. The noodles were the perfect texture and intermingled with the curry broth beautifully. Best udon I have had in New York.
Clean, well presented Japanese dishes at reasonable prices! The egg drop soba was particularly interesting.
Best Udon. Hands down. You can't go wrong either eat-in or get delivery. Just note, it's a small space and there can be a long line depends on when you go.
No comment
This is our second time here. Just as good as first time. Udon is so delicious. Niku (beef ribs and honeycomb tribes) is most flavorful. Other udon soups are just as good.

My friend and I were looking for ramen around St.Marks and we found this place on yelp... not quite ramen but it is like a hole in the wall for udon! I got the short rib noodle and we ordered the fried chicken for appetizer. The chicken was so tender and juicy we wanted seconds! The short ribs noodle soup was so delicious. The broth is very refreshing and flavorful and the short ribs are so tender. The udon tasted so fresh. Definitely will come back again!

Ate here for lunch yesterday and had the Niku Udon (beef short ribs and honeycomb tripe). The udon was good and the broth was flavorful. The meat was tasty too. Overall it was a solid meal. I liked how it was a peaceful little spot with nice decor. Give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood!

Went there and tried the beef short rib with honeycomb tripe. The soup was amazing - the udon was less chewy than what I prefer. But overall it is definitely worth the wait. We went next door to the Peruvian restaurant for happy hour as we waited for a table.
Simplistic casual ambience, with high quality utensils. Great udon noodles, with a tasty rich broth (niku udon). Would be back!

This restaurant has all kinds of udon and some appetizers. Very different from the udon should might have in other Japanese restaurants. You can feel the handmade-ness with chewy texture and the soup base is good too. Service is very friendly.
Some of the best authentic Udon in the city! Service is great and prices are reasonable. Love the Mushroom and wakame udon and fried tofu appetizer. Definitely a place to check out.

Had lunch at Raku, new favourite noodle joint. Had the monkfish liver to start and beef shortribs udon. The udon noodles were a game changer - perfectly chewy. Definitely coming again the next time I'm in the area.

After once sushi lunch, eating a professional udon came in my mind. I can not say I am the expert of udon, but I do really know about the noodle, ramen etc. Raku's udon is the best one I have ever done. kk....  Help u guys will have same thing.  PS. Beef udon I chose.
The soup noodles are super tasty, so is the fried chicken appetizer, must have.   Staff is very friendly and considerate of the customers.

I came twice here because the store looks authentic, and the good reviews on yelp. But the food I got are just soso. I think the noodle itself was good, tempura was ok but not so good, chicken karage was ok but nothing special, I don't really like the taste of the soup. I expected better because of the good reviews but....
Great spot for lunch.  Go early, or prepare to wait a bit.  The curry udon.... sooooo good on a cold rainy day!  The fried chicken was great as well, but the udon is the highlight for sure.
I have went there for my birthday back in October 2015, I was treated by some co-worker, I love this place, the food was so delicious, I would recommend to anyone. Wonderful!!!!
Just moved upstairs and tried this little shop out for the first time. Everything was delicious: the noodles were fresh, the fried chicken hot and juicy and the service was very polite.

Food and service were awesome. I had the recommendation of udon, since I didn't want the honey comb, with the wagyu beef and the broth was flavorful yet clean. I went there for lunch, 10 minutes before it opened and it was almost basically full. The place is small, but cute.
Favorite udon spot in nyc so far! Noodles are consistently good and the broth is flavorful yet not overwhelming.

I used to go to Sake bar hagi and ippudo ramen for finger food and noodle but at the end of the day, it wasn't enough for me. However, Raku is the right place to eat japanese noodle and appetizer, since they have perfect menu. I tried curry udon and bacon for lunch. The Udon's texture is chewy and soft at the same time and amount of food is enough. The taste of food is excellent, but what this store actually does to you is to make you relaxed by food and gentle mood. Price is reasonable. Highly recommend this restaurent. I still can't believe that I can try these kind of food in NYC. I stay happy throughout the day! best!

This place is beautiful! I fell in love with the decoration in the outside and couldn't help myself but walk in. The inside also had very clean and unique design. As much as the exterior and interior design lured me in, the Udon also did not disappoint. I think the best one on the menu is the Curry Udon. Other than the curry I tried the mochi udon and although the broth and noodles were perfect, the mochi wasn't quite my cup of tea.
really nice setting and atmosphere. cozy and small. udon was good but could've done with a little bit more flavor
Good restaurant. I have to say that their udon portion is HUGE. And their appetizers are also very tasty.  But they are cash only.

Love this restaurant. The simple, elegant, clean atmosphere and the waitress at lunch was fantastic. Such a prime example of great service and fresh food. Everything was fantastic. It really tastes as if my mom had made it...and everyone knows homecooked meals are the best. I will tell everyone about this place. BRavo
100% love it! Best noodle ever! I have been there many times and every time they made me surprise. Super good udon and the fired chicken taste super good. I recommend niku udon!
Had half a bowl of cold udon without soy sauce.... it was completely untasteful. Then the clerk said they forgot to put soy sauce. Words failed me.
Best gyoza I've ever had. The udon was great -- I recommend the spicy chicken curry one. The vibe is a bit pretentious but it's worth it.
udon is the best..the construction outside a lot of noisy.... only cash....

The restaurant is a little out of the way and can be easy to miss if you're not looking for it. The inside is also small so it's not great for parties larger than 4. I came with a friend later in the afternoon so we were seated right away. We decided to share chicken tatsuka-age and a gyunan udon with a poached egg and extra udon noodles. The chicken was juicy and served with a spicy mayo sauce. I wish they had given us more mayo as it was gone after the first two pieces of chicken. The udon was very good. The noodles had a nice chew and you could definitely tell that they were freshly made. Also, the bowl of udon is huge. You can't tell through the pictures on Yelp, but it is big. While this place can run pretty steep for just a bowl of udon, a hack would be to share a bowl with a friend and order extra noodles or even toppings to stretch your dollar. I will definitely be frequenting this place in the winter or if I want a break from ramen.

I would not come here again.  First, they only accept cash, and that's a real pain.  The caraffe of hot sake was admittedly very good, but at $34 too expensive, and difficult to pour.  My main complaint was the shrimp and eggplant tempura udon.  I admit the noodles were delicious, and the broth excellent (not too salty), but they only gave you two shrimp and left the freakin tails on!  I hate that!  Remove the tails!  I don't want to be pulling a soupy tail off of my shrimp.  And only two, be more generous please.  And ONE, ONE piece of eggplant.  Skimpy.  And for $14.

Finally made my way here after a friend's recommendation. It's nice overall, but nothing too surprsing, and I am not a fan of Niku Udon (beef tripe). I could have given 4 stars if I had something else. Also, this place is cash only.

I have never been much of an udon fan but this place has me hooked. I have never been disappointed in anything I have ever ordered here. The staff and owners are extremely helpful and friendly. My go to dish here has been the Niku Udon. It is a nice sized bowl. Deep rich broth. Nice pieces of short rib and tripe. The noodles look hand pulled with a nice soft yet great chew in the texture. This is true comfort food at its finest. Keep up the good work and see you all soon.

My wife and I got there and they told us 10 min wait. We offered to wait outside in the drizzling rain so we aren't in the way. A couple came and went straight in and were seated. We had to ask and they told us that they had put their name on the list previously. Totally fine. Then, another couple came after us, deliberated whether they should eat here and then finally went in to wait. Then, a group of four came and one of them went in to ask the wait situation. They were given a table immediately bc a table of four just left. However, the tables are by couple so the restaurant could have totally split the tables and sat us and the couple after us. Instead, they chose to sit the four that came after all of us. A few more minutes later, they sit the couple that came after us. That was the last straw and we left. I had eye contact with the hostess a few times and she did not offer to explain the situation. We probably waited for 25 minutes. This is completely unacceptable and we will never be back.
Delicious food, but too sweet. We ordered both rice and udon. We got tired of the sweetness when we almost finished it.
Theres not much else to say other than thia place ia the best. The beef and curry udon is on point. The chicken is amaZing. Love love love
good foods but terrible service, honestly they're kinda racist, good service for white people but for others... won't go again.
Best udon in the City. It is Kura's sister restaurant and its does not disappoint. Best of all, the tastiness of the broth matches the quality of the noodles. An important combination.
very legit udon hidden in plain sight in east village. a new favorite for me. lots of great options that come in generous bowls. noodle is cooked well and the overall balance of flavors is great.

Amazing udon. We've been there twice so far, and we've tried the niku udon, curry udon, kitsune udon, and one of the cold udon. All were perfect. The udon was chewy, and the broth was light but flavorful. They use thicker udon for the hot served ones and thinner udon for the cold served dishes -- that's really thoughtful! They know what comes best with the soup or the sauce! As for the restaurant itself, the place is small. There might be a line on the weekends, but it's definitely worth the wait!
This is the best place to have udon in town. The noodle texture is really unique. The place is not easier to find though.
first time was great.  2nd and the 3rd time   soup taste like  instant  ramen

Small little joint with a cute minimalistic entrance. I ordered the niku udon which was minimalistic in its own way as well. Don't misunderstand me when I say that, as simple of a bowl it was, it was very delightful in flavor. I prefer ramen, and not sure how I ended here, but it left me satisfied (not my pockets of course). The space was cute, the staff were friendly. Would I come back? Maybe.

We got in early... First customers. The restaurant is small and cozy. The staff was quick to offer us hot tea on a freezing winter day... So A+ on service. The food was brought it quickly... Piping hot so we had to cautiously approach our food but nonetheless it was delicious. The beef tripe was amazing as well as the curry udon and the duck udon.
Such a nice and cozy place! The udon is very authentic and delicious too :)! Got the ebiten udon and I loved it. Definitely going to come back! Really is a hidden gem.

I had the Niku Udon and the taste wasn't to my liking, probably because the broth contained fish (I didn't know that when ordered) and I realized I am not a fan of tripe.  Also, I the large noodles were difficult to eat.  However, my boyfriend's Oyako Don was tasty.  The food is high quality and fresh, but the style was not for me.  The place was also very difficult to find without a name at the entrance.

Really cute place in the East Village. Very all space inside though so there's always a wait. I was seated at the bar tables right by the door and it was such a cold night whenever people walked in and out I felt the chills from my seat. We ordered the fried chicken which was not that great. It was too crunchy and tasted a bit weird. I ordered the beef udon which was delicious but a bit salty. The portion was really good and such a nice warm broth on a cold day. The ambiance gives it the stars but the food was aite. Service was amazing!

I had high hopes, quickly dashed.  The food was OK, not great.  I thought the Udon I had was kinda tasteless; the broth was good the noodles oddly lacking flavor.  Wassupp?   I was so surprised, and left 2/3rds of the noodles in the bowl barely touched.   So disappointing, as I LOVE udon.  Cute place, nice decor, beautiful serving dishes.... surface is fab, taste was a dud.
we ordered curry udon with Mochi...very delicious. I think I'll have been there many times
Amazing food in very simple and gorgeous presentation. The BBQ eel over rice was delicious.

Really fantastic! Came here on Tuesday and absolutely loved it. We shared some appetizers- vegetable gyoza, fried chicken both were delicious. Then I had the shrimp tempura ramen with a side of Mochi and thought it was excellent. Huge fan and can't wait to come back.

This is hands down the best udon restaurant I have been to in NYC. I had the bacon app and the Niku. The spiced bacon is a thick cut and just sublime. The hand pulled noodles are super fresh and light in the Niku. The homemade broth has nuanced flavors that bring out the best in the tender beef. Highly, highly, recommend.

I visited Raku since long time back but today I get a chance to share my experience over here, and I must say my experience was really amazing and I still remember the taste of fried chicken which I ordered was so juicy and I believe it is the best fried chicken in the city.

Like others here, I hesitate to let the world know about Raku because I want it all to myself! Walk along 6th Street between Second and Third Aves, a typical lower east side stretch of old buildings and old restaurants, and suddenly you come to this clean, very Zen-like facade, and you know you're there. Inside is a cozy, 26-seat restaurant that serves huge bowls of warming udon noodles and other classic Japanese fare. If you eat meat, order a side of bacon with whatever main dish you choose from the small but varied menu. If you don't eat meat, you will still be able to find something delicious on the menu. There are no bad choices.

I got the chance to try the food here last night when a dear friend of mine took me. I tried the ankimo (monk fish liver) and the niku udon (beef noodle soup) - both exceeded my expectations. The soup turned out to be a perfect blend of flavors that I've never encountered before. I've had it several times around the US and even in Japan, and I must say it's one of the best I've ever tried. It was easy to tell that the ankimo was prepped by a professional. The seasonings on it were just the right consistency, and the presentation was 5-star worthy. The only bad thing I noticed was the crowd - the tables here are very close to each other, and it got so crowded soon after we sat down to the point where we didn't really have any privacy. I could notice that the people on the table next to us could listen to our conversation without even trying, and we we're speaking in a pretty quiet tone. I would probably come back here, but not after 5pm because judging from my first visit, that's when guests start pouring in. I'm very glad that this spot is near my apartment though, it's definitely praise of worthy, the food is so good it'd be a sin to miss out on it.
No comment

No comment

No comment
No comment

Service and staff is a little disorganized but the food makes up for it.  We started our dinner with the Brussels sprouts salad which was excellent, then the Luca pizza and the burger. One of the best burgers in town, hands down! I will definitely go back to try the other pizzas on the menu. Ended the meal with banana pudding, so rich and a texture you can't find anywhere else.
No comment
No comment

Ehhh it was okay I guess, a little underwhelmed especially with all the hype I was hearing from their Emily Burger. The bun was nice and soft but when you get to the middle of the dough it becomes soggy. I had better elsewhere, guess I'm spoiled. My hubby got their mvp pizza I tried a slice too, the dough was soggy and dense in the middle as well, and seasoning was wayyy too salty. He did not finish his dinner we went to a different restaurant to satisfy his hunger.
No comment

Pizza always delivers when it comes to vegetarian food and Emily was no exception! From the cheesy garlic bread to their MVP, the sauces and crust were cooked to perfection. We're from California so we were really excited when Emmy Squared opened up in Santa Monica and they didn't disappoint! From East to West coast, their pizza is still the best :)

The burger was truly excellent, a savory delight. The Detroit style pizza was very good as well. Nothing to dislike about this place, worthy of the hype.

I don't like Detroit style pizza but omg Emily is such an exception. So fresh, not heavy at all, and leaves you wanting more! I've gotten take out a few times here and recently went in person. Never disappoints!

The waitstaff were friendly and did not skip a beat. They constantly checked in on us and helped me decide on what to order- there were so many great options! I ordered the MVP pizza and crispy chicken crunchers. I loved the thickness of the pizza dough along with the parsley pesto. The chicken crispers had a good taste to them however I found them to be slightly over cooked. I would definitely come back to try another pizza (the white sauce ones looked amazing!)

No comment

Review for burger only . Walked in for 2, was quoted an hour wait at 6 on Sunday. Actual time seated was like 20/25 minutes. No complaints there. Ordered the burger double stack. Not much customization there unless you want well done burger.  Looked like most tables were ordering pizza although we weren't the only burger orders.  The burger was pretty good, medium rare patty, with sweet pickles and plenty of cheese. Bun was a bit disappointing. Felt a bit deflated baked in house pretzel bun but the dough tasted gummy/undercooked.  Would have preferred a brioche or potato roll but that's a personal preference.  At almost $30 I was expecting a bit more perfection, just saying Lol waffle cut fries were fine but felt over cooked/ really crispy.  We both barely touched the fries.
No comment
Food: 5/5. Service:5/5. Simple Greens salad. Double Stack burger. Prosecco. Sauv blanc. Perfect lunch date on a Saturday!
No comment

My favorite pizza place in NYC! Go to order is Vodka pizza with caramelized onions and pickled peppers with a side of waffle fries. It's really hard to find vodka sauce pizzas so I truly cherish Emily's!
No comment

Definitely worth the splurge! I don't often order hamburgers but from previous reviews that I had seen, I knew I had to order it. It was SO delicious and so simple. Not too many toppings, but the ones that were there were perfect. Literally the best burger I have ever had, and the waffle fries were very tasty as well. I 100% recommend!

No comment

My husband and I visited on a Friday for Dinner and we had to make reservations online which said they only had availability outside at 4pm.  We arrived at 4 and it was pretty empty so luckily we were able to be seated indoors because it was cold and the outside area does have a Velcro plastic curtain but did not appear to be heated so be mindful of that if outdoor is the only option.  The restaurant is small and cozy and  my son recommended this spot to me claiming burger was great.  Unfortunately I was not a fan of the burger.  They do not allow you to substitute out any of the burgers ingredients.  So I'm assuming they want you to eat it as it was designed.  But I wasn't a fan of the burger.  In my opinion it was not A GREAT BURGER.  My husband and I still feel Dolphins burger in Yonkers has a GREAT burger...  this burger in our opinion was just ok.  We did order the COLONY PIZZA as well and it was divine.  Its pepperoni, pickled jalapeños and honey and it was delicious. I was still thinking about it two days later.  I would recommend this spot for the pizza not the burger and the drinks were weak in my opinion.  I get tipsy with a glass of wine or sangria and decided to have a "Patio Pounder" mixed drink since it was my husband birthday and I left without the slightest buzz.  My husband had "The Fenton New York Giants Punch" and also felt it was weak.

Came here for brunch with some friends who came late. Our server was so gracious and patient. Had the best burger. Super juicy. Make sure to make reservations. Great ambiance as well. Super casual but phenomenal service and food. Trust.

Emily was very good, but not the best burger in NYC.  We got the cheeseburger and fried chicken sandwich, both were great and packed with flavor.  The waffle fries that came on the side were excellent and some of the best I've had.  I would rank the burger as a few spots behind au cheval in terms of quality a very solid burger, but not as flavorful plain and simple.  Still a great place to check out, and the area in the west village is super nice to walk around.
All around great place, service and food were top notch. I will definitely be coming back to try the pizza, which is odd for me to say since I'm not much of a pizza person.
AMAZING food! Such a great Friday night spot. We got the Emily pie, the burger, and the cheesy breadsticks. Everything was hot, flavorful, and just fantastic. Would go back in a heartbeat

PHENOMENAL meal. This was an "if you only have time for one meal in NYC"-level splurge. We had a killer table in the basement cellar and ordered far too much food for the 3 of us, but it was worth getting to try everything. The chicken crunchers had great asian savory flavors, the pizza was a perfect Detroit style, and the Burger was as good as Armchair Expert promised.

We got lucky and stumbled into this place.  Quiet little side street spot. Pizza was good and their specialty burger did not disappoint.  The food timing needed some help but a Saturday afternoon staff  isn't easy.

Everyone's favorite pizza place which has a much raved about burger, the Emmy Double Stack Burger. Said burger contains two juicy dry-aged beef patties, the famed EMMY sauce, caramelized onion, & American cheese, all on a pretzel bun. The burger was truly immaculate. Upon first bite, the famed EMMY sauce just comes dripping out, interlacing with the juices of the medium rare beef, the cheese ooey gooey like molasses. Much thought was placed into all ingredients because even the pretzel bun, teasing with its sheen, did an excellent job in general upkeep of all contents. My slight gripe would be that our burger was more the size of a slider and came with waffle fries instead of curly fries. But, we had even ordered a Chicken Parm sandwich which contained the crunchiest breaded chicken imaginable. Both food items were sensational! It is a place that is much raved about for a reason. We took a chance with a walk-in on a weekday around 2:30pm and were seated immediately. Such sweet luck for one one sweet meal!

Not the best burger I've ever had. Fries were delicious. Emily pizza was good. Luca pizza was good. Definitely not the best pizza I've ever had, but a solid choice. I wouldn't wait to get in this restaurant or go out of my way to eat here.

Did I just pay $30 for a burger? I look into my empty wallet not able to feel anything but the nostalgia of eating another juicy Emily burger. As I lie in bed, all I can think about is when is the next time I can get a taste of that 8 inch double pounder.

On a quiet, tree-lined street in the West Village is one of the preeminent dining establishments in New York City--Emily! Upon approaching, the exterior of the restaurant is chic--beautiful greenery and magnificent lights--set the expectations for a memorable dining experience. Entering into the restaurant, the interior is contemporary with modern decor, inclusive of subway wall tiling and interior plants. If you are coming on a weekend, be sure to come early to ensure you can get a table and confirm item availability. As a very nice gesture, particularly in the time of Covid, all tables are set with individual hand sanitizer dispensers. Water crafts on the table also help to ensure efficient service. Now, on to the main event, the food. No hyperbole, this is some of the very best fare I've had at any restaurant in the United States! A staple of this restaurant is the Emily. This burger is served on a pretzel roll and includes a special sauce, sweet onion and pickle on the side. The combination of the special sauce and sweet onion flavor creates for an especially sensory experience that delights completely. The beef patty is extremely tender, seemingly to crumble into individual morsels of deliciousness with every bite. The amalgamation of flavors and textures makes this a burger worthy of a visit by itself, but then there's the pizza. Again, one of the very best pizzas I've had. The pizza here is Detroit style--rectangular in shape with carmelized crust. I ordered the MVP with olives. The crust has a hint of garlic and other seasonings and the carmelization really sets the foundation for an exceptional pizza. The sauce has a robust flavor and is in abundance on the pizza. In the case of the MVP, the pesto sauce is an exceptional counterpart to the tomato sauce and adds a brilliant infusion of flavor. Finally the cheese and toppings are fresh and delicious. Emily will surely be on our list of places to introduce any visitors to New York. Simply exceptional.

5/5 for the fantastic service. They had an issue in the kitchen the day I went so they were not able to serve warm appetizers but they gave all the guests an order of fries for the inconvenience (we weren't planning to get apps so this wasn't even an inconvenience for us). Definitely try the burger if you eat beef. The Emily pizza is delicious and unique. Pizzas were smaller than I expected but still a great experience.

There were about 20 minute gaps between pies coming out and the toppings were completely uneven. For $26 a pie, all pieces should be as even as possible. They were out of many things and one staff member had to get Diet Coke liters from a grocery store nearby but first She stopped to smoke right next to our table outside! She was also hanging out of her shirt and cursing like a sailor while on her phone, complaining, which seemed inappropriate. Service left a lot to be desired with many staff members being very snippy and making smart remarks in Spanish amongst themselves within earshot of patio patrons. I really though this was a more refined place.

Came here to try the infamous Emmy burger, and it was pretty good! I know this place is primarily a pizza restaurant for the Detroit style slices, but we'd heard so much about the burger that we had to each get our own! The burger is pretty sizable with 2 patties, and the pretzel bun is awesome with great flavor. It also holds up to what really is the star of the dish, that sauce! It's sweet with a little spicy kick. The caramelized onions are the perfect compliment as well. We each were sure we wouldn't have stomach space for the fries that normally come with the burger, so our waiter was nice enough to shave a couple bucks off the price so that we would get the burgers without fries. That being said, the burger is still pretty pricey, coming at $21 without fries. Is it the best burger I've ever had? No- but it is tasty and I can see why people love it.

We held my wife's 30th birthday at Emily and the staff were absolutely incredible taking care of us. They really went above and beyond and the food blew our minds. It was absolutely delicious and such a fun special meal to share! The appetizers, the burger, and the pizza were all so good!

The service here was absolutely atrocious. The host, Josh, was completely rude and denied us access to inside seating due to our service dog, which is illegal by New York State law. He then lied about this the next day when I called to speak to the manager regarding the issue.

Decided to try this cute pizza spot after some research. The reviews on the burger and pizza were good! And they didn't steer wrong.  Had the Emmy Burger which was mouth watering delicious. The sauce they use was fantastic. Nobody seemed to quite know what was in it but whatever the secret is they got it spot on. I would come back for that burger. Plus the curly fries were fried just right.  Also tried the Colony Pizza. I've never had Detroit pizza before and I could get used to it. Love the crispy edges of the dough, the bread is doughy for sure. So if you're a thin pizza kinda person this may not be for you. The pepperoni on the pizza stole the show for me, drizzled with a tiny bit of honey added a nice sweet flavor to the saltiness.  Service was prompt and staff were friendly. Got the food in no time.  Granted it was 4pm...

Loved the burger...it lives up to the hype. The patties are juicy and flavorful, the sauce is awesome, and the pretzel bun is probably the best I've had! I didn't get the fries (the burger was pretty filling) so I can't speak to them. The wait was about 30 minutes to sit at the bar.

Slightly biased since this restaurant shares my name and that adds an extra layer of cool...but hey, that just tells you to bring a friend/date named Emily here for extra brownie points with her!!! The Emmy burger is DIVINE; the bun is soft, the patty is juicy and cooked to perfection, the caramelized onions and the cheese add the most delectable mix of textures... even the fries that come with it are amazing. It's a bit pricey for a burger if you have it by yourself, but I shared it with a friend (they give you a big knife so it's easy to split) and we found that to be the perfect amount. Really enjoyed the elderflower cocktail as well. Great location, friendly service, clean bathrooms, fun ambience!

This spot is the perfect place if you are craving comfort food. The burger is indeed one of the best in the city. It's soft and just melts in your mouth. Their pizzas are equally indulgent. They mix solid cocktails, nothing special but definitely good accompaniments to brunch or dinner. I live in the neighborhood and have frequented a few times. Staff is always very kind and accommodating, I've never shown up with a reservation but am sat in a reasonable amount of time. Their outdoor setup is great; the location is cozy in and of itself. For a reasonable price, I always end up belly up and happy after dining.

This place is so freaking good! Basic dishes made with quality and love. Pizza, fries, burgers, sandwiches. The lemonade is where it's at! So order it lol. I decided to go with the spicy chicken sandwich, and boy oh boy was I happy with my selection. The zest in the sandwich, the spice, the way the chicken is cut (thin sliced), the bun! All to go crazy over! Round of applause for the great service too!

Wow! I saw this place on Bobby Flay's "the flay list" show and I've been meaning to try if it for some time now but never actually had the time to travel from Jersey to here. I was in the city one night and I really wanted pizza so I scrolled through my yelp bookmarks and came across this restaurant. I ordered take out since my husband wanted to try some and it was raining. I ordered the Colony and the Tina to go. It took about 15-20 minutes for them to make it. As soon as they handed me the box I could immediately smell the aroma, it smelled so good that as I was walking back to the train in the rain I had to stop and take a bite of one. And omg it tasted just as good as it smelled and I had two slices one hot and one cold and they both were tasty. Once I hit home an hour later they were cold but it only took about 10 minutes to heat it up in the oven and it tasted fresh again. I will certainly be coming back here but maybe eat in next time.

The eggplant parm was a bit too salty and saucy...it would've been better paired with some bread for texture. Things that are scary in life: working a block away from the WV location of Emily because you can easily go and pick up pizzas ft. a brussel sprout salad and then convince yourself that because you had the salad, you were healthy that day, so you can skip the gym and then this pattern continues on and on and then it's summertime and you're whole entire body is just like pizza: doughy.

I am a pizza lover and take my pizza very seriously. The ambiance of this location was great. I ordered the Mimi and the Colony. The Colony was a recommendation of the waiter, and it was great. I accompanied the pizza with a 2016 Malbec, La Posta. The service was good, I went on a Friday night, it was busy and I think the service could have been a bit faster on the response time. The food did come out in a timely fashion, being asked for our initial drinks did take about 8 to 10 minutes to happen. I wasn't too happy about that but it wasn't a deal breaker considering how busy It was, I think it was fair. I did chose to eat at the bar, this wasn't bad at all. Seating area at the bar wasn't a ton of room but it wasn't too tight either, I am 5'11 and 196lbs (200lbs after the meal :)) I chose to eat at the bar rather than wait 1+ hr for a table. Pricing was fair and justified the quality of the food and This was easily one of my top 5 pizza experiences. I would come back to this location, there is a Brooklyn location which I am planning on visiting next.

Great service and great food. Some of the pizzas are a bit pricey like the pig freaker, but it was super heavy and tasty so it's good for sharing. Warning: it is quite salty. The burger tasted great but patties are always cooked medium and it's two thin patties vs one thick patty which I prefer cooked pink in the middle. Their version of medium has no pink, but not surprised because the patties are thin. Tasted great but also really heavy. Curly fries were okay, was a bit on the salty side and even so, tasted a bit under seasoned. It needed something else, curly fries usually have a bit of seasoning other than just salt. Staff is super friendly. Other people's pizzas looked delicious and we didn't grab drinks this time so will def have to be back.

Terrible job with delivery, which in NYC is a deal breaker even when we aren't in the middle of a pandemic. Took over an hour for my food to arrive. Thankfully the delivery service refunded me but what a disappointment. I had been looking forward to trying this pizza for a while. Won't be bothering again.

Omg the food and service.... Can't beat it. We had the famous burger and it taste and looked so good. The service was also great. The servers were so attentive and friendly. I don't always leave reviews but I made sure I did for this restaurant. If you want good food and service, go here!

Excellent all around.  Vibe is lively yet chill.  I was solo and waited for the bar.  The wait ended up being longer than quoted and the kind bartender brought me a delicious IPA on the house for my patience.  Once seated I opted for shaved Brussels (one of the more unique and delicious Brussels salads I have had - miso and blue cheese really elevated) and that famous burger.   I was in search of NYCs best burger and decided on this spot.  I am glad I did.  Fantastic flavor and just the right amount of messy.  Short wine and beer list but good.  They cranked out many many cocktails which looked great.  The service was excellent - a clear mantra.  I will be back no doubt.
This place is awesome! Our server was amazing and so accommodating and took off items that our party either didn't like or want. Great atmosphere and great food. Highly recommend!
