I love finding the best burger I can in every city and I think Emily nailed it! We came in around 330 on a Saturday and had a 30 min wait which was fine since there were a couple good beer and cocktail spots within a block. My wife and I both ordered the burger since I would agree to split one (yes I expected it to be good and wanted all of it). We both loved the flavor in every bite. She only ate half of hers so I had to step up and finish that after my burger and fries. You know I liked it if I ate 1.5 burgers and all of my curly fries haha. I already have recommended several people to come here when they are in town

I found this place on Yelp, and was so happy that I did!! We had some fabulous Detroit style pizza. This was the first time I had it, and I really liked the crust. It was thick, but not too heavy, and buttery around the edges. We had the Colony, which was a red pizza with pepperoni, peppers, cheese, and a honey drizzle. It was fantastic - the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and spicy.  Emily is also known for their burgers, which looked delicious. I think the next time we go, we will split a burger and a pizza. The service was friendly as well. Can't wait to return!!

Loved the pizza here! It's my first time have Detroit style pizza and I would describe it as like a sicilian pan pizza, which makes for a delicious crust! We got the Arrestein and Emily, which were both great. I was a bit surprised by the honey on the pizza at first but the added sweetness actually makes it all the better. We also tried the burger. Also good but I would've preferred a little less sauce. Making reservations early is definitely a must! I made one 2 days before and they only had either really early or late slots left

I love this place! A small spot in the west village with one of my favorite burgers in NYC. Definitely one to split with a friend (if only so that you can also order a pizza!) but it is massive, and I could drink that emmy sauce by the cup. The service has been attentive during all my visits, and each of the pies I've tried have been interesting and delicious. I am a huge fan of the For The Nyugen, and the Emily, but they're all great, IMO. They have an excellent wine selection, and the banana pudding is a great way to end the meal!

No complaints here. Short-staffed, our waiter put in the extra effort to make sure we enjoyed our dining experience. My wife and I split the Chicken Parm-wich and the MVPizza. Talk about heartburn, but it was worth every bite.

I love the location of this restaurant! My friend and I are on a "mission" to try all the reputable burgers in the city, and came here on a Wednesday evening for dinner (with a 6:30pm reservation). They seated us right away, and we ordered the Emmy burger to share, along with the Arenstein pizza. The burger is legitimately delicious, but I fear I'm more of a tradition (savory) pizza fan, so I'd be tempted to try the other flavors in the future. Service is excellent here too! ...just know that it's a little on the loud side, but don't let that deter you from making a reservation here.

I have never received service like this anywhere else. Our waiter Cris was so amazing at his job. Always checking the table, giving great recommendations and bringing another bottle of water before the first was finished. He was already a hottie and to be that good at your job, EVEN HOTTER. Cris recommended two pizzas that were to die for! I've never had pistachios or honey on a pizza. Now! I can't imagine eating a slice without it! Don't let me forget to give my compliments to Chef Jazon n his crew for not only making incredible tasting food, but in a timely manner with a crowded restaurant at peak dinner time. Steamy hot and well seasoned curly fries hit the table barely 5 min after we ordered it. While the pizza flowed right in as the fries were devoured. Emily is definitely doing something right and everyone should go see what that something is! Thank you for an absolutely explosive first experience. I will be back!

Made a reservation for 6 pm and we were seated right away. The place was already busy by then so I recommend making reservations in advance since the place is quite small. Awesome. We started with the broccoli salad and it was insane. Miso dressing, get out of here. So good. For entrees I had the spicy chicken sandwich, and my husband had the cheese burger. Both were fabulous. I will definitely be back. The pizza looks bomb too.

This is the best burger I've ever had, definitely get the burger (warning it's very messy). The pizza is also delicious

Cute place tucked away in west village. Came here with a friend on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. Inside is laid back bright, love the atmosphere. There is a downstairs that is a little more remote and intimate. This could be a great date spot or place to catch up with a friend. The menu has a good variety that will appeal to most. The waitstaff is very friendly. The food is delicious! We split a beet salad and a buffalo mozzarella deep dish pizza. They were both so good. The salad was light and refreshing, it played with many flavor profiles that blended nicely with each other. The pizza was savory and cooked perfectly. I highly recommend to anyone in the west village area!

I don't know what your feelings are on American cheese but I'm okay with it on a $3 burger but a $26 burger better have the best damn cheese around! The meat was delicious but the American cheese ruined the experience. Go to a different location if you want the burger.

The menu is always in season. We shared a broccoli salad and split a pizza. In addition, I had the spicy chicken sandwich. Absolutely delicious.

I have now been to both locations and tried the pizza and the burger, and while the pizza is good, the burger is the real reason you need to come here. The dry aged beef they use is incredible, the signature Emmy sauce is delicious (not sure what all is in it, but boy is it good), the caramelized onions provide a subtle sweetness, the pickles bring the right amount of acid, the melted cheese binds it all together, and finally the pretzel bun holds all the elements of goodness together. This burger lives up to the hype people give to it and the price tag they sell it for ($26). However, as many have stated before me, they only sell a certain amount per day, and during my visit they sold out by just after 7:20pm, so I would suggest getting there as early as you can to snag one!

I came here to try the famous Emmy Burger. And it was delicious. The sweet pickles were great and added a nice crunch to the burger, the pretzel bun was toasted well and tasted good, and the caramelized onions were also tasty. I loved the Emmy sauce and the patties were cooked well. But with all of those components brought together on a single burger, I just found it a bit too sweet overall. But still, a great burger. The curly fries were probably the best I've ever had. Great crunch and seasoning was perfect. Definitely reccomend!

I visited this hidden gem in NYC because I heard their burger was one of the best. NYC restaurants generally disappoint me when my expectations are too high, so I tried to keep my expectations low when I ordered the Emily Burger. They also serve "Detroit style" pizza, and looking around the restaurant I saw what looked to be delicious pan pizzas similar to what you would find in Chicago. My friend ordered a pizza. As soon as the Emily burger arrived and I sliced it, I couldn't contain my excitement any longer. It was 2 juicy patties perfectly cooked with cheese in between and special sauce dripping down. I could see it would be a messy but delicious burger just from looking at it. Then when I bit into it I was in burger heaven. In the top 3 of burgers I've ever tasted, and I've had lots of burgers around the country. The pretzel bun was so much better than expected, as it sopped up whatever juices weren't running down my hand as I ate it. Best burger I've had in NYC for sure. Then I tried a slice of pizza. It was heavenly too! Much better than NY style pizza most of NYC loves so much. If that's Detroit style, now I know I have to get pizza if I ever find myself in Detroit. An added bonus was that they serve Coke in the bottle! Coke is always best in the bottle. A great burger, great pizza, Coke in the bottle, along with friendly service makes Emily a 5 star restaurant.

The pizza was really really good. Was really impressed. It's hard when you live in New York because there's good pizza everywhere, but this was different. The cocktails were very good. We also split the burger, which was top 3 best I've ever had.

Emily has been on my list of places to try for some time, and I'm so glad we had the opportunity to go, we were not disappointed! My friend from school suggested we eat here while hanging out in the city. I'm so glad he did! I had never heard of Emily's before and wasn't sure what to except, especially being very picky with my pizza. We went around lunchtime on a Saturday and it was very crowded when we walked in, but we were able to be seated relatively quickly. They had fun drinks on the menu and we both had a different one. We also ordered two different pizzas to try to give us a variety. We ordered a regular one and a fun one. They were both delicious. It was a crunchy crust, and a soft middle, but a great balance. Everything on both pizzas just worked together so well. Definitely a go-to place when in the area!

Had seen from a couple of sources that this was the best burger in NYC, so definitely wanted to give them a try. The wait for a table was too long when we were in the area (1.5 hours -  this is December during covid times and outdoor dining only) so we decided to get takeout and ordered the Emmy burger and the spicy chicken sandwich. When we got home, both sandwiches proved to be extremely messy to eat because of the sauces. Deconstruction aside, both were very tasty - but the sauces wayyy overpowered. Also, they did not ask how I wanted my burger when I placed the order and I was surprised to see that it was rather undercooked. Not sure if this is considered a modification?- which the menu notes they decline - if so they should note that the chef recommendation is rare to medium rare. I was also disappointed by the fries - I love curly fries, but got maybe 4 in my order, and the rest were bottom of the barrel, extra crispy end pieces. Pretty bummed after the high expectations I had going in.

Absolutely love Emily's! Such a cute little place in the West Village. The double stack burger is my favorite and the Emmy's sauce is to die for! The Arenstein pizza is also my favorite. The food is all around delicious. Only complaint is the last 2 times I have been in the wait staff has not been friendly, we were rushed when ordering, and take awhile to come check on you for refills (went an entire meal without water) and getting the check despite how small the place is.
The place is great and the burger is awesome as are the crowler fries!! My friend had the pizza and likewise  very much enjoyed it.

Another great meal in the city at Emily west! We love this place. Food is perfect, best servers (Brittany is phenomenal) and they always make you feel at home. Absolutely our favorite burger and pizza spot in all of manhattan! Thanks for being our favorite restaurant

This one was definitely worth the wait.  I've been dying to try Emily for months and they definitely lived up to every expectation.  The Emmy Burger was beyond incredible from the unique sauce to the side of curly fries, every bite was a moment to savor.  The pizza was just as good if not better than the burger and 100% falls in the best I've ever had category.  The crust is crispy and nothing like any Sicilian pizza I've ever had.  The vodka sauce added a special twist to an already amazing pie.  I would return in a heartbeat.  This is a hard reservation to get so pick a date weeks away and make your reservation on Resy ASAP.  Pizza definitely loves Emily.

The hype for this place is real. Burger is amazing, especially the perfectly toasted pretzel bun....I didn't know hamburger buns could be that good. My friends and I came here to try the burger but arenstein pizza pie was delicious too - crispy, cheesy, spicy and a little sweet. Extra props to our waiter who was super friendly and gave us great suggestions.

Dinner here tonight was fantastic. You can tell their pizza is made out of high-quality ingredients - we definitely got what we paid for ... and more. Our server, Heather, was very attentive despite it being a busy night. The manager, Alex, did his best to sit us as promptly as possible and made sure to check in on the guests whenever he had a chance. Looking forward to dining here again and bringing more friends to check out the pizza.

Came for dinner on a Thursday night and the place was packed but service was very friendly. We had the burger with curly fries, vodka pizza with pepperoni and buffalo mozzarella and tomato sauce pizza with peppers and buffalo mozzarella. The burger was juicy on a pretzel bun and curly fries super crispy 5/5. The vodka pizza was so delicious, thick crust with crispy cheese on the corner and creamy buffalo mozzarella. We love prince street pizza and Emily's is like a classier and less-greasy version. The buffalo mozzarella and bits of greens make the pizza feel lighter and healthy. Really delicious 5/5. The tomato pizza wasn't bad either but the flavors aren't as amazing as the vodka pizza 4/5. Definitely will come back here for a classier pizza night when we feel like getting out of sweats!

For Detroit style pizza in Detroit, one should seek out a Buddy's location, but when in NYC and craving that crunchy, cheesy bottom square slice, Emily's will scratch that itch.  The Colony is a spicy sweet sensation for pepperoni pizza lovers.  If you go off peak, it's lovely to sit in the pleasant space on the first floor looking out through the large front windows into the neighborhood.

Everything was SO good. Its a quaint little spot in the west village and is always crowded. We ordered the burger (had to) and WOW it was really good. The sauce and cheese mixture and the bun was so fresh. We also got the side of curly fries but dressed them for the extra $5 instead of ordering the full appetizer order. Then we ordered the luca pizza with the fresh ricotta cheese on top. I also had the quart of wine which was $18 which most NY places charge that for a glass so loved that. Would return and would recommend this place to anyone - resident or tourist!
Great hamburger. Great atmosphere and nice staff. We also ate the pizza which was very tasty.

A little background, I haven't been to Emily West Village, but I have checked out Emily Brooklyn. Not my favorite, but it is good. I noticed that the 2 Emily's have the same, but different menus. For example, At Emily BK, the Colony has pepperoni, jalapeños and honey on a thin crust pizza, but the Colony in WV is a Detroit style pizza. I prefer the Detroit style over the thin crust, but I know some are die hard thin crust fans. Detroit style is very similar to Sicilian pizza. We also had a chance to get the Emily burger which was so so good. The Detroit style pizza was pretty bomb. I can't say there were any part of that slice that I dislike. It had everything I loved on a pizza. Pepperoni for the salty meat I needed, honey for the touch of sweetness and the chili to give it a little kick. There's a possibility that it tasted extra good because we were pretty tipsy before we got there. Anyways, I give the Detroit style pizza an 8 out of 8 slices.

Best pizza I've ever had! I've been dreaming about it since my last trip. We ordered the Grammy and the one with pickled peppers, honey and pepperoni. The sweet vs. hot was TO DIE FOR! I can't wait to go back & order this pizza again!!

Came in on a Wednesday night and had to wait 1.5 hours. Be sure to reserve ahead and be on time. This time we ordered the Mimi pizza and the Crowlers. It was great as always! But also do order the Emilys burger its divine! plus their quantity is pretty good.

My personal opinion this place is over hyped. I heard about this place so many times "Best burgers in the city" or "Best pizza in the city", but everything literally is  average, literally just nothing special. I definetly tried burgers much better in the city. I can't even say that waiter was nice to me. And in the same time i can't say that something was bad. Not good not bad, just average - 3.

Let's not bury the lede here: the burger is the reason to come to Emily. Granted, it is a cute, cozy restaurant in a great location in the West Village that plays the right amount of Leon Bridges (which is a lot), but the burger is the reason you wait, and the reason it is so difficult to get a res here. Plan ahead, go to Blue Ribbon across the street to kill time, and don't worry that you're missing out on anything by not ordering the pizza. Order the burger and you will have no regrets.

I have visited 3 times now and love Emily. Everyone goes crazy about the burger, but the burger has just been so so for me the last 2 times. I think the pizza is worth the hype and wait to get in. Don't feel defeated if you don't have a reservation, bar seating is always open and I have never waited longer than 20 minutes for an open table or a cancelled res.

I absolutely loved this place. My friend and I tried the Detroit style vodka pizza. Excellent. Each slice had a crispy edge and the interior was nice and fluffy like focaccia. Great flavor. The burger is the best one of tried in NYC so far (and I've had a few). Served with curly fries which were fun, but nothing special. Would definitely want to come back!

YUM! So happy I came with friends that wanted to share all the things. We all split two pizzas and a burger. Still way too much for 4 people. The food was awesome but what really stood out what the great service. I asked for the manager at the end because our server was SPECTACULAR. Can't say enough good things about this place. If you're lucky enough to snag a rezzie, come with an empty stomach, a couple good friends, and high expectations - you won't be disappointed.

This was an amazing lunch spot and well worth the 45 minute wait! They'll text you when a table opens and the seemingly small menu is perfect! AMAZING BURGER & I got a mushroom basil pizza that was out of this world. The other amazing thing was a cocktail w rose & egg white. I was scared to try? But it was SO tangy and tasty. Foamy, refreshing, perfect. Thanks for an amazing meal!!

No hot beverages. Burgers are either well done or medium rare. Pizzas etc. Looks nice but that's about it.

Superb Detroit style pizza at Emily WV! We tried one deep dish/square and one flat/round and much preferred the square pizza. There was something addictive about the doughy insides, fresh toppings and crunch of the burnt sides. So amazingly good. Also fantastic was the burger, which everyone raves about. It lives up to the hype!!
Super creative and tasty pizzas! Their burger put them on the map, and for good reason, but if you're looking for a great date night and pizza is all that'll do this place never disappoints.

Burger is juicy and very delicious! With curly fries on the side is crispy as usual! Staff is very friendly, parking can be a little challenging but we were lucky, we tried the pizza too and it was one of those low key awesome pizza nothing spexial but just aimply good!

... vibey place, great music, service hit or miss. But, the pizza steals the show and saves the day. We had the 'Mimy'. Great flavors, perfect crust. I think splitting a round and a detroit-style is the way to go for 2 or 3. Thank You.

Quaint restaurant that fits right into the west village neighborhood.  Tried the Detroit style pizza - pepperoni, jalapeño and honey. Interesting and tasty combination. This is only the second time I've tried this style pizza. I liked it better than the cheaper, super heavy alternative at Lions Tigers and Squares - it also costs nearly 4x as much. Personal preference , I'll still stick with regular old thin crust pizza. But I might come back to give the burger a try here based on the good reviews. Service is friendly.

Returned to Emily last night for a second try, and am SO glad we did!!! Our server, Dominick, was attentive and friendly. We started with the shaved Brussels sprout salad and the crowlers, both of which were delicious. We tried the burger again, and were blown away by how delicious it was! Cooked perfectly, and bursting with flavor. We also had the Emily pizza (Detroit style) and the Arenstein. Everything was excellent! This confirmed our suspicion that we had happened to visit Emily on an off night the first time around. They definitely redeemed themselves on this second visit! (We devoured the pizza before we could get a picture :))
Wasn't too impressed by the burger, pizza was really good. Kinda reminds me of prince st pizza

Made a reservation and there was still a bit of a wait. The place is nice but not much seating. Restrooms are downstairs. Although they're known for their burgers, my friends and I weren't really feeling burgers and didn't have room for it so we opted for the pizza and some appetizers. The pizza was a square shape and pretty thick. It was much too greasy for me and I thought it was just alright, especially for New York City which is known for pizza. The service was average. Our food took a while to come out. I think I would have to try the original location in Brooklyn and go for their pizza next, but definitely heard you have to make a reservation ahead of time!

Amazing gourmet burger and pizza!! The burger was so good my 6 month old wanted some. It's a $26 burger but I think worth it. So juicy! I went with a large group (8) and we split 5 burgers and 4 pizzas.

Look, is the food delicious? Yes. Is it worth the hype, the crazy wait times, and the prices? No. My friend and I put our names down around 6:30 and was given a 1.5 hour wait time. If you come later in the night (like at 8pm), the estimated wait time is around 3 hours. It's a crowded restaurant with serious pizza and burgers. The Emily burger is simple-- two patties of meat, two slices of cheese, caramelized onions, and a pretzel bun with your regular, high school cafeteria style, from frozen curly fries for $26. We order the Colony pizza (pepperoni, chili, honey) for $21. Everything was tasty, and for two people it was definitely more than enough food. I might come back if I can get a reservation next time, but honestly I don't think this food is worth the high prices.

This is one of the most incredible burgers I've had in recent memory. Juicy medium rare Pat Lafrieda dry aged beef with semi-sharp white grafton cheddar & sautéed onions with a buffalo "Emmy" sauce held together by a tomcat pretzel bun. Upon first bite you are overcome with umami goodness. It's just something you need to try to appreciate. It's pretty messy looking but the bun actually holds it together perfectly. If a $26 burger is not something u crave, then turn to the awesome selection of Detroit style pan pies. Matt and Emily Hyland's creations are pairings of awesome obviously good pizza toppings, that work so well it surprises me that no other pizza places have done it. Also the downstairs area is super cool and somewhat romantic with dim lighting and candles at each table.

Awesome spot for phenomenal food, drinks and great service. The Emmy burger is to die for. Sat at the bar and had great service from our server Anthony. Highly recommend this restaurant, one of my favorite spots in the West Village.

i showed up with a couple absolute slags, ordered like 27 drinks, and our waiter tony had a smile on his face and a joke to go with each one of'em! great service. food was tasty, and it's a nice ambiance. i recommend this spot to anyone that finds themselves in the area.

Pizza loves Emily? Why doesn't pizza love Alexander W.? Here is another agonizing case of unrequited love. Five stars crossed lover right here. My heart will always pine for the Detroit-Grandma pies, especially the Arenstein and Colony. The Duck Pressed sandwich can't keep ducking my advances. The top part of the restaurant may seem small, but there is a whole cavernous world downstairs.

If you enjoy deep dish pizza for that packed bite, this is your place. Lots of variety but you cannot go wrong with the classic granny and if you like a bit of spice, add the pickled jalapeños and you're all set! Curly fries and cheesy bread are great additions but the pizza is the star of the show if you're vegetarian! Beware - tough to get a reservation and walk-ins are usually tough because this place is super popular and always packed. Suggest going when they open.

If you've earned a cheat day then Emily is a great choice. The burger and pizzas have alot of deserved hype. I thought the cheese on the burger was a bit much kind of over powered it and I prefer a classic bun over pretzel all day but definitely worth tryjng. The pizza if you like Detroit style is really good, a nice change from the classic NY style if you're looking to change it up.

Came here for lunch today and food was great. I wanted to try their burgers and pizza, but they didn't seem to have the lamb burger on the menu anymore. Four of us split a round Emily and a Detroit style For the Nguyen, as well as the burger. The Emily had a little too much honey for my personal taste, but the pizza itself was really good. I think I preferred the Detroit style though. That cheesy crispy crust is delish. The burger was a little too salty and the bun didn't hold up. I'd come back for the pizza for sure.

waited 2 years to try this hyped up, transcendent burger.  meh
Best burgers I've ever tried in NYC ever! Pizza is delicious there as well - must try here!! I loved the pretzel bun on a burger :)

I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning with friends visiting from California.  We ordered the Emmy burger and the Arenstein (vodka sauce pizza).  The Emmy burger is enormous - 2 Pat LaFreida dry aged beef patties, cheese, caramelized onions, and Emmy sauce (tastes like sweet russian dressing) on a Tom Cat pretzel bun.  It will taste pretty salty but the sweetness of the sauce helps.  It tastes amazing but yeah, you might want to pass out afterwards.  The pizza was delicious - Detroit style is the new kind of pizza for me.  The edges are crispy and there's a lot of sauce.  The Arenstein had jalapenos and pepperoni so it definitely had a kick to it.  I shared the pizza and burger with a friend and it was still way too much food for me.  I think I could've just eaten half the pizza or half the burger and it was enough for me.  The service was good - no complaints there.  I would come back if I had friends visiting from out of town.

I came across this place while browsing the ranking of the best burgers in nyc. I was skeptical since Emily's is a pizza place but I'll be damned if it wasn't a great burger. Is it $27 worth, I don't think so but it was a great burger. I also had one of the vodka sauce based Detroit pies and that was worth a trip to Emily's alone.

self-proclaimed pizza professional, so trust when i say this place has rad pizza. dont get the boring cheese kind. go out on a limb and try the street fair or arenstein. silent threat on the menu is the emmy burger. per usual, i was slightly lit while eating dinner, but i cannot stop thinking about the burgers bun. its a messy burger, so dont order on the first date. get it on your second when youre ready to let the crazy out! the waitress we had was soo nice, which is always a plus. rad private dining room in the basement if you fancy like dat.

I really believe you can't beat Emily when it comes to pizza and burgers. The best in the city. I took my very critical boyfriend here for his birthday and he LOVED every bit of it and ate until he was sick. It's one of our special treat meals. We will be back!

The burger: it might be good if not for the foul-smelling sauce. That ruined it for me. I'm not fond of pretzel buns either. Too many other wonderful cheeseburgers in town. It's one and done for Emily.

Ok, not to be dramatic but this burger is LITERALLY the best burger I have ever eaten in my life. The bomb combination of sweet caramelized onions, pickles, and some kind of crack sauce that I'm truly not worthy of, plus a fair amount of cheese and a perfect pretzel bun makes me want to eat this burger for every meal of the day. The fries were just your typical curly fries, nothing more nothing less. Can't wait to get back to NYC to go here again.

This was my second visit to Emily.  I have tried their pizza, which is excellent and very much worth the price points listed for each variety.  HOWEVER, the burger that I ordered on my second visit was over-hyped to say the least.  I will point out the creative aspect of the burger, but the flavors do not sit well together in my opinion.  The sauce overpowers the beef and the pretzel bun tends to overpower the rest of the burger.  This sandwich is not worth the price, and by the way it came out lukewarm.  I will commend the staff for their service, which was excellent.

Come here hungry! My friend and I split their burger and the Colony pizza and we struggled to finish. Came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed full. Definitely a very popular spot! After reading all the rave reviews of the burger, I finally had to break down and try it. We ended up ordering the Emily pizza and a burger. Going into this place, I was less excited about the pizza because I prefer thin crust over a thicker crust. I was pleasantly surprised by the pizza and really enjoyed it!! Would definitely come back here just for pizza. As for the burger, it was excellent as well and extremely flavorful. My only complaint is that it's a bit overpriced for what it is. You can't charge $26 for a burger that's served on a metal try with a sheet of paper. If you're going to charge so much, make the presentation a little but nicer. The burger also comes with curly fries and they taste similar to Arby's curly fries, which is never a bad thing! Another thing that kind of rubbed us the wrong way was the fact they bring out food "as it's made." They brought my boyfriends pizza out first. We waited for five minutes and then I made him go ahead and start eating because his pizza was going to get cold. My burger didn't come out until he was almost done with his pizza. So many restaurants figure out how to bring the whole tables food out at the same time so you aren't awkwardly waiting to eat. I don't understand why Emily can't do the same. Overall, will definitely come back despite the burger being a bit overpriced and the food not coming out at the same time.

5 stars for bougie pizza and burgers. Yes you can go get cheap pizza and burger at any corner in NYC, but sometimes you wonder if the grass is greener on the other side and yes, it IS greener. 2 stars for the unmatched price and product. I heard so many things about this restaurant. All great things, didn't live up to the hype at all. Not the best burger ever. So good!! This is a go to delivery spot for us and I've even ordered their frozen pizzas from Goldbelly (totally recommend that too).  All pizzas great plus the brussel sprouts salad is delicious.  Support your local restaurants, please!!

I want to say went you walk in was a nice cozy, clean and modern restaurant in a cool location as well!! We came in to sample ans try there famous burger, and man it so true ! Best burger I have ever had.  Great beer on tap, outstanding service, cozy atmosphere - everything you could ask for!

I FINALLY got to visit Emily on my most recent trip to New York, after following them on Instagram for years. The wait was loooong, but that's to be expected on a Saturday evening. They text you to let you know when your table is ready, which is nice since there's really no designated place to wait inside the restaurant, which isn't so nice. The restaurant appears to be small, but there's actually a whole bottom floor where the kitchen, restrooms, and group seating are all located. In true New York style, all the tables are absolutely on top of each other. The servers are nice but usually running up and down the stairs and therefore not that present. We ordered the colony pizza and the emily burger along with some drinks. The food was absolutely amazing and worth the price tag. The drinks not so much. I would love to return again.

Let me just say that I haven't stop thinking about this pizza since I had it, It's been a few weeks now. I'm on a diet now so unfortunately I won't be eating pizza no time soon but I'm saving all my cheat days for this pizza!!!! Me and my husband can't stop talking about it and to think we only tried one pizza I can imagine what the other ones must taste like. I'm looking through the menu trying to decide which pizza to try next time but the EMILY PIZZA IS A MUST only pizza lovers would understand. I will try the Williamsburg location next time being that's it's closer to me I'm counting down the days til we meet again.

Amazing food and vibe. Despite Covid they made it feel homey and amazing. Nico is the best waiter and provided thoughtful reccs that came through in terms of taste. Visiting from San Francisco and highly highly recommend :)

They have good pies! I do recommend the emily pizza and emmy burger. It's soooo gooood. Can't go wrong with those 2. The emily pizza is very unique because of the honey and pistachio ingredients on it. But, don't be scared to try it or you'll never know what you're missing. I was adamant at first but got addicted to it. The emmy burger has this yummy sauce on it that  sets it apart from a regular burger. The price is expensive ( since it is in nyc) and there could be a long wait. I suggest you make a reservation.

Had a great meal here with my son over the summer. He loved his burger and I had a specialty pizza. The waitstaff were very accommodating and attentive. Very cozy atmosphere and nice menu. This is one of the best burgers you'll ever eat. The cocktails are yummy, the salads are delish, I would highly recommend trying it. My tip is make a res for lunchtime cause it's hard to get in at dinnertime!

This restaurant blatantly lied to us tonight. We ordered delivery at 7:30pm. At 9:14pm we called the restaurant because our order was very late and they told us "it was just picked up by the delivery person." After the food didn't show up we called the delivery driver who didn't answer. At 9:45 we got a notification that our order was canceled because of "staff issues" at the resturant. Don't lie to us and tell us our food is on the way when it wasn't made and didn't leave the restaurant. With so many restaurants trying so hard to succeed in these tough times, skip this one because they are dishonest.
