Emily- West village is truly exceptional! We ate downstairs in the basement which is a delightful space, walls are made of brick and you can smell one of the oldest brick ovens in Manhattan cooking away for the always packed dining room full of hungry patrons. The food however defies description it could not possibly have been better, I got the Emily burger, my wife got the spicy chicken sandwich and we divided them between us. The chicken sandwich was hands-down the best I've ever had anywhere! It was hot and spicy the meet was juicy and covered in delicious sauce and it was served on a homemade pretzel bun. We had been told how amazing it was but it exceeded expectations. The burger was untraditional, a creation of their own making but as a visitor to New York I left thinking about when I could get back to Manhattan from Texas to have another one! Our waitress was rude and  unhelpful but they still get five stars because the food is that good!

It's very important to experience a good New York pizza, and I just might've found my favorite new pie! I ordered The Grammy, which is traditional tomato and mozzarella but I am so thankful that I added on the pepperoni topping, because it literally has to be the best pepperoni I've ever had. Also if you get the chance, please treat yourself and go back to try the Emmy burger! The sauce and beef on that burger is absolutely sensational, and served with crisp curly fries
No comment

Wow, Emily serves up a tasty burger and pizza!  If you're ordering the burger, come very hungry and ready to get your hands/face a mess.  It's massive and covered in all kinds of messy goodness.  It also comes with delicious curly fries.  My friends kindly let me try a bite of the three different pizzas they ordered - all of which were phenomenal. They got the Emily, the classic vodka, and the MiMi.  Yum, yum, and yum!
Dear god...do not eat here during covid. That's all I can say. The service was hands down the worst I have ever experienced at any restaurant in the world.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Arenstein pizza and Emmy Burger are probably the best things I've ever eaten in my life. No question.

The pizzas are really average- skip. All the hype about the burgers is deserved. It's relatively simple to get a weekday lunch reservation as well, thankfully. Service is on the brusque side but competent enough. Just go for the burger and you won't be disappointed!

Having just returned from a visit to Detroit, I was glad to have some delicious Detroit style pizza in NYC. This version is smaller and lighter then the pizza I got in Detroit (the incredible Buddy's), but it was still very very tasty and just as crispy. We also got the shaved brussels sprouts salad, which needed more robust flavor. The space is small, so the noise level is very high. Next time I think I'll sit at the quieter space near the bar.
Get the burger! Get the pizza! Get the wedge! Phenomenal food at a cute west village eatery!

Had one of the grandma pies and we should have probably tried the round pie as I'm more into thin crust pizzas. The toppings were fresh and yummy though. All the other tables were getting the burger and fries , something to possibly try next time I'm in the hood.
No comment

Cute little village restaurant. Their burger is a must try, although it's quite big in portion so you might wanna share. Friendly staff, I found the tables a bit too close to each other. Also, they have a nice local beer collection that you should try! Overall a pleasant experience, perhaps slightly overpriced but comparable with other locations in WV.
The Emily burger and pizzas are amazing. Fries are thin and super crispy which I love! It was randomly closed on Wednesday around the Jewish holiday last week so a bit disappointed I couldn't go.
Bad - overrated. Pizza was cold. Hostesses were rude. Burger was great for meat eaters but experience was bad enough that even they wouldn't go back

Perfect for lunch and dinner! Outdoor and indoor dining space. Food and drinks are amazing! Best burgers in the area for sure. Service is always great! Alex and whole team always go out of their way to make anything happen. Highly recommended! We love this place. Thank you guys
No comment

I've been to all the locations in NY and I would say by far that the food, service and vibe are the best yet. The manager Josh did an exceptional job with checking on our table and making sure we were happy and had everything we needed and our glasses were full. The food was delicious and I left feeling very full and beyond satisfied.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have been to the Brooklyn (Fulton St) location and the W Village spot a couple times. I can't decide what I love more, the pizza or the burger. But let me say this, they are both OUTSTANDING. I recently reserved the private room downstairs in W Village and entertained some clients. The experience was excellent. You sit literally right next to the wood burning stoves and the aroma makes you salivate. If you are a party of 6-8 people, I highly recommend this but make the reservation at least a month in advance. Massive props to these guys, they are crushing it. Make sure you get the Colony pizza and the shaved brussel sprout app is quality!
No comment

Let me start off with our server was great. I went with my 7 year old son on a Monday night and despite the hostess having a look of why would you come here with a kid look the server was very pleasant. We shared the meatballs to start. They were very good and flavorful. To the burger which many have raved as the best burger in nyc and beyond. This was by far the most overrated burger I've ever eaten. They only cook it in two temps, medium and well. Why would I ever want a dry aged meat medium or well? You couldn't even taste the meat. The sauce was good but very overpowering. The pretzel bun was different but didn't do much for me. This burger doesn't even come close to Minettas burger which is more expensive but worth it.
No comment

So worth all of the hype. The burger is probably the best I've had in the city - better than JG Melon, the Minetta Tavern black label burger, etc. It is definitely messy (don't go here on a first date - you need a friend for sure) but from the pretzel bun, to the caramelized onions, to the double soft pat lafrieda patties, I am still dreaming of this baby. Pizza wise, we had the Colony - pepperoni with a sweet kick to it. Definitely want to return to try the Mimi Cheng's pie!
No comment
The Pat Lafreida burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had. Highly recommend it.

Came here on a Sunday night and was seated immediately. After we were seated the service was extremely slow. It took almost an hour for our food to come. We ordered the Emily pizza and the Emily burger. We had to prompt the server to provide an update on when our food would come out. By the time the burger arrived it was lukewarm and looked like it had been sitting there for a long time. I'm sure it would have been great when hot but the way it was served to us I would not order it again. The Emily pizza also did not seem like it had just come out of the oven but it was much better than the burger. The truffle and honey was delicious and the pistachios provided a nice crunch. Overall experience was much worse than I had expected. I was really excited to finally try this place and I don't think I would come back
Legendary Detroit style pizza and double whammy of a burger burger with exceptional service and outstanding music on the speakers! Highly recommend and will be back but make a rezy or eat at the bar!

Awesome place with a really cool aesthetic. We showed up with no reservation and only had to wait an hour for a spot at the bar, not bad. Me and my cousin split an Emmy burger and pizza, the pizza was extremely solid, the pepperoni was crisped up perfectly and was an overall extremely good full bite to it. The Emmy burger on the other hand was truly phenomenal, each bite was just overwhelming with flavor, I had to take breaks to regain my composure and remind myself I was in a restaurant and shouldn't be having a romantic moment with this sandwich. The pretzel bun was toasted perfectly, the dry aged beef was juicey and melted in your mouth. I felt as if I was get lost in the sauce in only the best way. Truly my favorite burger, in my opinion it's well worth the 26$ price tag
Pizza is fine, nothing to rave about. But a whole pie is a tiny little thing for $18. $18?....SCREW YOU. One star you a-holes just for the price alone.

This fashionplate featuring a Tasch cropped hoodie for a brunch catch up with one of my og besties.  I decided to abstain from alcohol for this brunch.  It was pretty crowded on a Saturday afternoon but we got seated pretty quickly.  We decided to dig in and order 2 pizzas to split.  The grammy was a great riff on a grandma pie.  We also got the Arnstein which had a delish vodka sauce and pepperoni.  We couldn't finish everything and the leftovers were as great as the meal.

Pizza Hearts Emily and so do I. This place is great! This is another one of those places that if I have visitors, I plan on getting a reservation. I know my friends will be leaving saying "that was the best burger I've ever had", and lets be honest, nothing gives me more satisfaction than being told I'm the best or I've found the best. The pizza here is good too, you really cannot go wrong. Plan on getting a burger and maybe a pizza to split.

I'm never one to be on the lookout for pizza or burger places, but I have to say that Emily blew me away. We had reservations maybe a month in advance for a Friday night dinner, and they were definitely required as we heard others being turned away with 2+ hour waits. We ordered the classic combo that was recommended by friends and the waiter - an Emmy burger and a Grandma pizza. Our waiter said his personal favorite was one of the pinks (pizzas with vodka sauce), the Arenstein, so we dove straight in for that choice. The pepperoni, pickled chili and honey combination was the perfect medley with savory deliciousness accented by a hint of sweet. The burger's pretzel bun was divine, and the fact that it came with curly fries was just the cherry on top. Definitely come here ASAP, your taste buds deserve it.
I feel like it's cliche to say -  but - the food at Emily is consistently amazing. Know what you're here for, don't mess around, and you'll leave incredibly satisfied.

Located in a quieter part of the west village Emily's promised a great burger.   Given the colossal size of the burger I chose a chicken parm sandwich instead.  I would've tried the pizza but they don't have individual serving sizes.  The sandwich turned out to be massive and uneatable without chopping it up.  It was good however.  Nice environment but I won't return.  Too many other places to try.
The pizza was really good, didn't even expect it. I heard the burgers were  better so will be going back to try that next.
No comment

Came here without a reservation on 06/24/17 with a party of 3 at 8:40pm.  We were told the wait time without a reservation would be 45 min to 1 hour.  We were willing to wait, which ended up to be around 1 hour.  Once inside and seated, service was great.  Everyone was friendly and welcoming from the hostess and bartender to the waitress.  I had the burger at Emmy Squared at their Brooklyn location so we were tempted to try something else BUT ended up ordering 3 burgers, one for each.  Couldn't resist.  They are delicious, although $26, but worth it to me! and they come along with great curly fries.  Also ordered a cocktail, Manhattan, which was made perfectly.   Overall, a great experience and a welcomed addition to Manhattan :)

The hype is real.  I had the mimi pizza, and the burger.  The pizza was incredible.  Cooked perfectly.  Tasted great.  The burger is creative, and delicious.  I need to come back as much as possible to try other pizzas.

This restaurant just became one my favorites in NYC for pizza. It's not NYC style here that's killer good but the Detroit Style Grandma pizza. Thick crust, square pies with delicious and some unique toppings make Emily stand out from other pizza restaurants in NYC. Of course they are very famous for their burger. We thought about getting it for dessert. We will have to go back. Make a reservation or go very early and be prepared to wait.

Was very busy, hostess accommodated our walk in party after short wait by text. Well worth a reservation. Ordered  a self made pizza a la vodka, side of Sichuan sauce, anchovy pizza and burger. Top Gun
Awesome Pizza and Atmosphere!  Love the crust of Detroit style pizza .  Royce was great as our server.  I highly recommend!

I had heard of Emily from Instagram. And considering we share the same name and apparent passion for the same food knew we had to go here on our babymoon. Went ahead and made reservations ahead of a show we were seeing and glad we did. Even at 5pm the place started to get crowded! It's cozy and comforting inside, totally matching the vibe of the neighborhood. Our waitress was so friendly and just genuinely nice! My husband had a cocktail and they made me a yummy mocktail to enjoy as we waited for our pizza to cook. I'd say the way to go if you've never been is to share a pizza to start which was just delicious and then get the burger. You HAVE to get the burger. I can 100% say this was the best burger I've ever had. Normally not one for a pretzel bun but this one actually was soft and had flavor! The curly fries that come on the side are a perfect detail! I'd say it is a bit pricy however I'm not a formal person but like a good meal out, so this was worth it to me and would definitely go again. You are getting more than what you pay for here!

Best burger I have ever had!  I also am not a burger lover but I definitely loved this burger. The curly fries were meh and the cost is already high so you feel like the $32 (after tax & tip) is just for the burger. That's the only bummer. Even still, I would get it again. Maybe the Brooklyn location's side of fries is better.
the burger is so delicious and so yummy. You can't come here and not try it! Definitely get the Luca pizza !!
No comment

Possibly my favorite West Village spot. Never disappointed when I visit. I am a SLAVE to the Emmy Burger and I could eat the colony pizza everyday. Just writing this is making my mouth water. The servings are great for sharing.
Currently in my TOP 5 pizzas and burger. Don't leave the restaurant without trying the burger!!
No comment

I usually write 5star reviews but this place is for sure 1 star- they are extremely unaccommodating.  I spoke to the host he said wait will be approx 15-20 mins, then, they said 1 hour minimum. They sat about 4 parties without reservations right in front of me, we also came with 3 kids, it seems as if the fact that we came with kids seemed to be a problem. Finally we said we will wait 1 hour to sit and eat with our kids, it's been 2 hours now and our table still isn't ready. This place is a joke, horrible.
No comment
No comment

Great place. Went for a friend's birthday on a weeknight. Was pretty crowded and had to wait 1.5 hrs before being seated, but the staff were really friendly and kept us updated. The double burger was to die for! The meat in the burger was fresh and tender. Put me in a food coma.
Food was served cold. Both entrees, when asked for our food to be served hotter-- we were met with attitude and slower pace/service.
No comment

Good meal that left me full and content. Known for the burgers and pizza, we had one of each and a cocktail and beer. All in bit less than $80. No reservation but came and put number down and got a text about 40 minutes later for a 9:30pm dinner on a Thursday - yes it is that crazy even then. Had the pizza with pepperoni, jalapeño, and hot honey. Charred crust and a bit over cooked for my liking. But pepperoni were very good. Honey was unnoticed and cut into six pieces so perfect to share. Not as thick as I expected so reminded me of a Roman slice of traditional pizza but a bit more cooked. Burger was solid. No substitutions or changes so it comes as is - drenched in sauce and onions. Two patty and medium means medium rare here which in my mind is good, but beware. Burger patties really good and juicy, but the sauce and heaps of grilled onions really overpower the burger. Pretzel bun an interesting addition, but again not sure it really helps enhance the burger flavor and more. Lots of big flavors in the burger that might not work together in my opinion. Curly fries a cute side that isn't typical and gives the dish some more uniqueness. Beer list small at 4 and $10. Cocktails $15 and seemed to lean sweet. Enjoyed my meal here, but tough to get a spot. Interesting options to spice up a traditional burger or pizza like sichuan oil or Fried chicken on top of a pie. Recommended for date nights or even takeout in West Village.
No comment

Had a reservartion for 7:30, they even message me to confirm me coming, and i kindly replied yes, but when i got to the restaurant they said i had no reservation and made me wait more than an hour for a table. The food may be good but the customer service is awfull
No comment

Emily's pizza is amazing.... we added sausage. My husband's ale was yummy too.  It's a bustling place with a friendly wait staff.  The burger looked amazing, something we might try next time we're in town.

This burger is by far the biggest waste of money on Manhattan. Take my word for it, don't do it. I've been in New York 20 years and have had burgers everywhere from Peter Lugar's, to Hardings to the little prince to Minetta Tavern to Burger and barrel. Just have the pizza, the burger is simply not worth it. PS it's a sloppy mess. $28, go f yourself, Emily

The food was superb! However the hostess 'Genie' or as she says so (the girl with blonde hair), was full of attitude to the point that I thought she was actually a RACIST. I arrived at 12:10 with plenty of empty tables to fit a party of 5, she made it almost impossible to seat us all and said we would have to wait to 2pm. At around 12:40 (the tables still empty) she decided to seat us if we split ourselves in a party of 2. I don't know what changed in that half an hour, and magically we could be seated. Did she just want us to wait ? But why though ? Other people came and they were seated with a big smile on her face.

Excellent selection of unique pizzas with some toppings that you'll not likely find elsewhere. The Emily pizza with pistachio, honey and truffle Sottocenere is my personal fave. Solid wine list.  Great service - everyone that works here is extremely attentive and friendly.  Nice atmosphere as well - lots of candlelight gives it a cozy feeling. The only area this restaurant is lacking in is dessert.  There is only one option - a deconstructed S'more which is good, but not worth the price.
Great location, service was mediocre.  I've been here three times and have had good experiences.  You must order Detroit style pizza and the burger.

We got the crowlers and the vodka pie to share. The crowlers were really heavy and the portion size was a bit too large. The vodka classic was phenomenal. It was essentially vodka sauce on perfectly baked parmesan bread. Emily's is also a nice space with its large windows and lighting, although it could be a bit loud at times.

The burger lives up to the hype! The pizza is a must have though, so the move is splitting pizza and burger. The pizzas are semi Sicilian style but not really thick - crisp crust which was my fav part. Worth the visit.

Pro tip: go during the week right when they open for dinner at 5. Got a table immediately. Besides that, this place is sorta overhyped. Pizza was just ok and really overpriced for the size. We got the colony and I didn't taste any pickled chili or honey. The Emmy burger on the other hand was bomb. Maybe not worth $26 but still really really good. Super super messy because of the sauce though. They prob should give more than one napkin when ordering this burger. So if you don't mind dropping $26 on a really good burger then you should go check it out. Prob a one and done place for me though.

Friends recommended this spot for a dinner out as they already have tried it. I am not big fan of meat but decided to try, since the whole group was super excited about the burgers. I have to tell you, this place did not disappoint us. Whole experience from the moment we entered the space till the end was superb. We had a bottle of wine, and few appetizers to start (cheesy garlic sticks, curly fries with cheese and jalapenos and a pizza with two types of cheese, pistachios and honey) and we absolutely enjoyed every bite. After that burgers lived up to the hype too. And very important thing to add, service was amazing. Everyone that we interacted with (Rebecca, Dom & Carly) was absolutely there to add up to the experience, big thanks  for all of them. Will definitely go back again!

Wow! The only thing that could compete with how incredible the famous Emily Burger is was the amazing service we received. Rebecca, Dom, and Carly all went out of their way to ensure we had a fantastic dining experience and man did we! My girlfriend and I invited another couple to try this place out for the first time and everything was perfect. The food here is truly top notch, and again the service can not be beat! I would highly highly recommend this restaurant! And we will DEFINITELY be back!!
Whenever I go to Emily I don't know what to order - a burger or a pizza. They're both one of the best in town. Highly recommended!

I only ate the burger, so these 5 stars are for the burger and atmosphere alone, but damn, that's a good burger! The curly fries were normal, which means they were good but not special. The place is adorable and near tons of other restaurants bars for drinks pre or post burger eating. I've eaten a lot of things in NY and rarely like to go to the same place twice, but I would definitely come eat this burger again.
No comment

Perhaps, I just ordered the wrong items. This was mediocre pizza. I ordered the Mr. GREY to start. For the price charged, there was no wow factor and I wondered if there was any alcohol at all. I forget the name of the appetizer but it was shredded sprouts with miso dressing on the bottom. The server recommended this.....OK. Anyway, I imagined a cow grazing on grass. As for the pizza, we ordered the Luca and the grandma style Street Fair. The Luca... felt like an uncooked pie, the sauce was cold. I am not a fan of cold sauce pizza, overall the tomato sauce was rich but cold sauce is not cool in my pizza books. The Street Fair was much better, onions were cooked perfectly but the taste of sausage was very faint. Despite our messy plates from appetizer, server did not offer new plates for pizza. The service was mediocre... at best. Expensive for what it is and I left with regrets.

Came with a friend on a Wednesday night and the place was super busy! The hostess was really nice and we didn't have to wait long for our table to be ready (we had a reservation). I know they just got some fame recently for having an amazing burger (I think the Infatuation rated their burger as the best?) so I was really excited to try that. We ended up ordering the burger as well as the Mimi pizza to share. The service was a little slow at times and it seemed like our waitress was covering too many tables. Overall, I thought everything was really good though the burger was a little too salty for my taste. This is a solid restaurant to come for good food and a nice atmosphere.
No comment

I was shocked to hear upon calling on a Monday evening that the wait for Emily was an hour long, but they let me put my name in over the phone and texted me 30 minutes later that they had bar seats open! The system made it really easy to get seated, and made the wait feel much shorter. We loved sitting at the bar; the bartender gladly answered our numerous questions about cocktails and menu items. She directed us towards the brussel sprout salad and Luca pizza, and both were to die for (and I'm not usually a brussel sprout fanatic). They will tell you that the pizza serves 1-2 but it's pretty definitively a 2 person deal, so definitely bring a friend to share with.

I came here on a Bumble date for dinner and absolutely loved it! The place is such a cute date spot--the ambience is very nice and lively. My date and I shared the burger and a pizza and they were both amazing--discovered we are both foodies! I will definitely be coming back!
No comment
Amazing!!! Sat at the bar with my friend from out of town. The bartender was super friendly and helpful. She had the Emmy burger & I have the Arenstein pizza, both were amazing.

I honestly had one of the best burgers of my life here. The pretzel bun is a wonderful mix with the flavors and sauce. It comes with fries and was super filling and a bit pricey, but absolutely worth it.   Can't say anything about the pizza but if you had to choose, I would order the burger!

Had the Detroit style pizza and it was so soggy in the middle I couldn't even pick it up. Burnt on the sides not to the point of being inedible but pretty dark for baked cheese. The quality would have been okay if each slice was a dollar but a small pie is $20 and a bottle of jarritos is the outlandishly expensive $4 a bottle! Mexican soda for $4? Are you kidding me? And the wine list was dismal. I can tell that the people who order their wines have no idea about wine. The glass of wine is $14. That's ridiculous. I could give it more stars if it weren't so overpriced
Incredible burger, pink pizza with honey is the way to go and the loaded fries are also incredible. LOVE the miso sauce with the fries, quite possibly one of the best burgers I've had in NYC.
Food, drinks, and service all incredible. Sean and Andrea went above and beyond. 100% would recommend.

Superior pie! Niece and her hub took us to their favorite pizza place in Manhattan. It felt like a small-ish space, but it was very lively on Friday night. Our group of seven arrived right on time for our 7 pm reservation and were promptly seated at a large table in a brick alcove downstairs. The place was jammed and the waitstaff was buzzing about--attentive and totally pro at their jobs. We started with shared plates: a couple of Emily WV's amazing burgers, and a Brussel sprout salad--delish! Then we ordered four pies: 2 round, the Emily (truffle sottocenere, pistachios and honey) was super flavorful! and a Classic (red sauce and cheese), which was pretty close to a perfect pie; and 2 8x10s: a red, the Colony (pepperoni, pickled chili and honey) and a pink, the Vodka. The 8x10s were thick, pan pizzas highlighted by a tasty crust. Both were exceptional. The pies were plentiful and we had a few slices to take home. Emily WV had a nice selection of (mostly) local craft beer both on tap and in cans. I had a lovely Florette saison from the Long Island City brewery. The wine list looked pretty extensive, but we chose to bring our own bottle, for which they charged a corkage fee. As noted, the restaurant was packed, so reservations are useful, especially on the weekend.

I've been all over NYC hand down Emily West has the best burger  10 our of 10 the sauce is orgasmic !!!!!! Must come best service by Brittany she is amazing and is the best waitress  literally favorite spot in the city and can't get enough!

Mediocre burger, mediocre pizza, and mediocre service. I was excited to try this place, but it was a let down. The burger was super soggy and poorly proportioned-- too much meat and toppings for the bread to hold. The pizza was also incredible bland and a bit cold. Ironically, the only thing I enjoyed was their brussel sprout salad (which is why I am giving it 2 stars and not 1)--but it was not wow at all. Our server was also not helpful or knowledgeable when it came to the menu and providing suggestions. I definitely would not return to Emily again--it seems that the restaurant was either having a very bad day, or is it just extremely overhyped.
Hands down the best burger in the world. Doesn't matter how expensive it is because it really is worth it. Must try! Pizzas are also pretty good. Too bad it is hard to get a reservation there.

Service wasn't good at all. They got my order wrong. I'm a tourist and I have seen a lot of great places. This restaurant does not meet the standard of the great ones. Unfortunately, this restaurant needs to get their orders right and offer better service.
Overhyped. Bad service. Waited an hour for a table to only be told that we had to be done eating in an hour if we wanted to be seated. What a joke lol make your food worth that quality first.

Four of us stopped  in yesterday (Wednesday) around 2 pm for lunch and the restaurant was half full.  This could/should be a 5 Star spot!  Tucked inside of the very quaint, quiet and laid back community of Greenwich Village, Emily just seems to fit here perfectly.  So why the 4 stars?  .... Well.... I Contemplated 3 stars ....It's not the food or the setting - it was the lack of a warm reception as we entered and were seated by the hostess  which carried over into our server.  With such a great setting a server should do more than just take your order, deliver your food, clear away your plates and deliver your check.  How about a warm hello with a smile, some light conversation and advice about the menu, and thanks for coming and hope you enjoyed dining with us today?!  BTW the Emmy burger and curly fries were fantastic!!
No comment

Stopped in for lunch based on a yelp review. We had the Cesar salad, roasted cauliflower and meatballs. All delicious. Was a  wait for a regular table so sat at the bar. Service friendly. Would have loved to try the pizza...but with only 2 of us would have been too much. Overheard other guests rave about the burger. Hope to get back here again soon!
EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT. EXCELLENT comfortable setting, employees are outstanding, a homey environment just simply wonderful

I thought this was place was good for typical casual American fare but it's definitely not worth the hours long wait people report. I came very early on a Friday (around 5:15) and had no trouble getting a table. We got the pizza (with vodka sauce) and a burger - both were good but very heavy. Nothing I would run back for. I am taking a point off for the fact that they charged me $3 for a side of dressing to dip my fries into and didn't tell me there was a charge. I have never heard of a restaurant charging for extra dressing - and $3 for a tiny amount too.
Delicious pizza in the Greenwich Village area.  We really enjoyed having honey on our pizza and have since replicated that at home.  Very cozy dining room as well.

This is definitely a 4 star restaurant. I must admit I'm giving it 3 because it does not live up to the Emily name. The Lamb burger was good and definitely different, and the pizza's were solid (not nearly as good as Emily or Emmy Squared) but knowing that Emily and Emmy Squared are a lot better than both of these places disappointed me. Skip the West Village one and hit up the Brooklyn spots.

Good pizza. Overpriced. Delicious drinks. Small setting. A little bit overhyped and they like to avoid seating people and tell you it's a 2 hour wait. Don't know why they play this game, but I'm happy we got a table.

I went here for dinner tonight and was immediately impressed by the warm and inviting ambience in the restaurant and was surprised by the amount of space inside. I got here around 5 pm without a reservation and was seated right away, but It was already beginning to get more crowded as we arrived. I tried the Street Fair pizza and the shredded sprouts, both of which were delicious! The best part of the pizza was the crust and thickness of it. Next time, I think I would have preferred the plain grandma pie, but this one is really good if you like the combo of spicy peppers and sausage. I would definitely come again!
No comment

Loved this spot in the Village. It ended up snowing so all my meetings were cancelled so I hunkered down here with red wine and pizza. I ordered the classic - simple tomato base, herbs and fresh mozzarella. Perfection! Also, the service was quick, friendly and gave me space to read and enjoy my afternoon. Highly recommend.

First time at this location and the burger is just as good as the original BK location! They have great local NY beers on tap, the eggplant and burrata app is amazing and the pizza is some of the best you can find in nyc.

Their food is amazing! I ate here twice in 1 week! The place is tiny and cozy. Their burger is to die for. The price however is a tad too expensive for a burger. Their garlic bread sticks are amazing (Too garlicy tho).
No comment

Worth the hype!! Great meal, great vibe, WONDERFUL staff. I got there a little bit before the rest of my party and Jerusalem was so kind and helpful!! I had the Emily pizza per the recommendation of approximately 1000 yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. We also had a bottle of rosé and the On The Nguyen which was so unique too (although the blue cheese was a little strong for me). All around a great experience and I hope to be back soon!!

One of the best burgers in NYC.  Definitely add growler fries.  I think we didn't get the right pizza, it seems lack luster compared to the burger.  I would try the pig freaker next time.  The Dune Road didn't quite do it for us.
Burger is pretty good but expect extremely slow service. I waited over 20 minutes for the spicy chicken sandwich.

This is possibly the best meal I've had in NYC. The burger was cooked to perfection, the wine tasted great, the pizzas were delicious, and it was all shared amongst friends. We had to wait a while for the table, but we passed the time at Carmine's Tap Room around the corner.

Best burger ever accompanied by amazing pizza was the meal of the month. The burger was juicy, tender, huge with delicious sauce, melted cheese and lots of onions. The burger was decadent! We also tried the Detroit style classic pizza and a clam pizza. The clam pizza was super thin but full of flavor. The classic pizza was a square with a Sicilian like crust but it was cooked to perfection. Crispy bottom, springy middle, melted cheese. It was Great. The wine list was varied with lots of options. There were much fewer beer choices but what they had was quality. The service was as a little slow but pleasant. They allowed us to linger and eat to our fill. Make sure you have reservations. We showed up without one and the wait time was 2.5 hrs. It was strange because th place was half empty at 6pm and yet the long wait. Luckily they had some cancellations so they gave us a table in about 45 min.
No comment
No comment
This place is amazing.  I got the cheese sticks and a margarita pizza. The best ever. I'm still drooling thinking of all the good food I had.

It's got to be the best burger in New York. Funky and juicy and completely different. Unlike any I've had before it. The pizza is always fire. Can't say enough good things about this place. Service could use improvement but not enough to make me take off a star. The food here is simply fantastic. (pizza with tomatillo and bacon - get it)
No comment
This place lives up to the hype and is well worth the wait (I had to make a reservation 5 weeks out). Even though it's a pizza place the burger is to die for and should not be missed.

Burger was not worth the hype. At first it came out cold with only 1 pattie, on second try they'd clearly just refried the fries and while we had 2 patties bun was not toasted and felt cold/stale. Pizza was delish though!

The service is terrible, everyone apart from Dominic think they are the coolest thing since sliced bread. Booked a table for Father's Day and they put us down for 2 people when I called, when we got there they said they can't put a high chair next to us because we did not book for 3. Despite the table next to us being empty for last 40 min of our meal they still refused to give us a high chair. Manager Carla was not sympathetic and we had to pass the baby between us for the entire meal as one of us had to hold our 6 month old. They made the entire experience stressful and did not want to help us in any way. Terrible people, especially the hostess that looks at you as if she is doing you a favor for checking you in, I will not give them my business again. Staff has been consistently terrible last 5 times I've been there
No comment
No comment

Shared the pizza with pepperoni, vodka sauce, honey & peppers and the burger with a friend. I'll return for the pizza alone. It was better than I thought it would be and I had high expectations. I also had high expectations for the burger due to the hype & price tag but found it to be too rich for my taste. Too much sauce (which was very tasty) but it completely saturated the bottom bun. Too much cheese and meat as well too. super messy. All the flavors were great but it was a bit too much of all of it for my preference. I came at lunch on a Sunday and it was not crazy busy which was nice (made a reservation same day). I'll come back for the pizza!
First time here!  Great pizza!  The round table pizza was THE BEST!!!! Would definitely come back next time I'm in town!  Great atmosphere!  Great staff! Emily!  YOU ROCK!!!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: The pizzas are real good but the bad things about this place They dont care delivery ! one time my arrival time was like 5:50 i got my pizza 6:30 and I know it's not about delivery company!
No comment

Horrible service. My two guests and I came to the restaurant and another friend joined a bit later. As she sat down, the manager Tori came over and told us she couldn't accommodate another person at our table. We felt that she was very unhelpful and made us all feel unwelcome. We were able to squeeze her in for the remainder of our short and my friend got up to use the restroom and heard her speaking to another employee about our table and our order. I found this incredibly rude. My friend went over to her and told her that she heard her speaking about it, and told her how uncomfortable she had made us. She barely apologized and she felt even more disrespected. We came in hoping for a nice Sunday meal and we left with our view of the place completely tarnished. Hopefully Tori can understand that she made us feel incredibly disrespected.

The best pizza (square and round pies!) and hands down one of the best burgers that I've ever had. My boyfriend is OBSESSED with the burger and its pretzel bun. Also, their waffle fries are DEEEEEELICIOUS!!!! Seriously, I love Emily!
In love with the Pizza. The hamburger was good but in my view way overpriced.  Overall, a really good meal, however.
The burger is amazing, the pizza is delicious. If you're lucky enough to get in, do yourself a favor and get the Grandma Style pizza and the Burger.

Took my family here (visiting from CA) and my nana loved the vegetarian pizza options. We ordered three pizzas and a started and left with boxes. We all started with the miso fries and it was a group favorite. Additionally, the service was amazing!
No comment

My daughter did a search of NYC restaurants by asking where do the chefs of other restaurants go to eat during their down time and Emily was at the top of the list. Terrific pizza and the appetizers superb. The service was equally wonderful. This is a small local place that made us feel right at home. When they heard it was our very first meal in NYC, they sent over an appetizer for us to enjoy. Love this place.

This had been on my must go list forever and I finally got here! It is as amazing as everyone says. Made a reservation as far in advance as I could (I think 1 month out) and that was super easy. Our service was excellent, the food was amazing. Shared the Emmy Burger (only regret we should have gotten our own, it is so good your not going to want to share). Had the Grammy with pepperoni and the Quinn, both were soft (as I like it) but with crispy edges, perfection!

Amazing pizza, but must have a reservation. We rarely eat at the same place twice, but have been back three or four times bc we can't get enough. Pizza was a little different last time we came, hope it was a fluke. Also, would enjoy a better cocktail menu.

Solid spot for date night - the downstairs is really cozy and would be nice to go in the winter. Pizza is really good but the area is so full of good pizza that it's hard to justify spending this much when you can get a pie at Johns for half the price down the block.
No comment
No comment
Went back last night and the problem is fixed! Pizza was delicious as ever! yay! Also: pina colada is amazing.

I've been here once and had a pretty good experience so decided to go back and bring friends. The pizza is better than the burger and calamari appetizer which are both okay. The management here for dinner is completely rude to the point me and my friends walked out and will not be going back. At 5:30pm the hostess said they would be able to seat us as walk ins. Thirty minutes later they brought us downstairs to the basement which wreaked of mildew and actually had rain sleeping through the brick walls and a small fan on the floor to blow around the misty air!!! I saw two guests before us complain and get seated upstairs instead. But when we asked the hostess was polite and honestly was trying to help but the manager was rude and said we would not be able to sit at all no matter how long we waited unless we took the bar or sat in the mildewing basement (which should have honestly be been closed due to the leak and terrible smell) it was comical to expect anyone sit down there. The 5 seat bar was overcrowded with people with reservations that were made to wait even though the top floor was half empty ! After waiting an hour there, the manager was so rude and not even apologetic that we couldn't stay and give this establishment our money so we went to codino around the block for a polite and delicious authentic Italian meal :)

One word phenomenal. Hands down top 3 pizzas I've ever had. Went with some friends and ordered the mimi chengs with shishito peppers to start. Unbelievable flavor. The pizza had the crispiest yet gooiest crust In the best way. The sauce, ricotta mushrooms and basil all melted in my mouth. Service was excellent we were seated 25 minutes before our reservation. Would highly recommend.

Had dinner for 3 last night and everything was amazing. We had the crowlers (think nachos but with curly fries instead) along with the Emily pizza and the Mimi cheng pizza. Both pizzas were really innovative in terms of flavors, you definitely can't get anything like them anywhere else. Also, our server was a gem. She was very social and attentive, clearly focused on giving us the best experience we could have.

This restaurant is phenomenal!  The restaurant is quite cute, as it tucked away on a side street.  The menu itself is quite small, however everything on it is delicious!  The double stack burger is to die for, with the toppings and sauce.  If you are looking for sweet and savory, the Emily pizza is for you.  Highly recommend to anyone and everyone!

Call before you go**** and go early***! We waited 3 weeks for a reservation time that wasnt 5 pm or 10 pm (we settled on 9 pm) and came all the way here just for the burger. After we ordered drinks and an appetizer we placed our food order and they told us they were out of the burger. They were out of buns and wouldnt serve any sandwhiches. The table next to us left when they were told that and the other table next to us was pissed too. If thats what theyre known for they should tell people before they come/are seated that they dont have it. We settled on the pizza and when it came and we realized it was tiny we went to order another and another round of drinks and they told us last call happened 15 minutes ago and we were shit out of luck. (Another table across got upset about that too) No burger and no telling anyone about last call. Im so disappointed. I traveled an hour and a half round trip to eat pepperoni pizza

The mimi Cheng was my favorite of the pizzas (I personally like the vodka pizza at Rubirosa better). Our only regret is that we were too stuffed to try the Smores Calzone - but at least it's a good excuse to come back! Service was generally quick so overall very happy with this place.

Really nice space, polite and attentive waiters. The burger is one of the best I have ever had. The sauce, cheese and meat ratios are perfect. The pizza crust is the perfect balance crunchy and soft. Pizza is top 10 pizzas I have experienced. Will definitely be coming back here.

This place is phenomenal! The Emmy Burger is truly the best burger I have ever eaten in my life- it's a double burger with a sweet/salty sauce on a pretzel bun. I'm usually not a huge fan of pretzel buns because they can overpower the burger, but for some reason this one just works. Get. The. Burger. The thick crust pizza is also amazing. Crunchy outside and soft on the inside with very creative toppings and flavor combos. I stuffed myself silly. Great, upbeat atmosphere perfect for any event- date night, girls night, whatever. Highly recommend.

After going to the original Emily location in Brooklyn and Emmy Squared in Williamsburg, I wanted to give the newest location a try. Going in I had two main things on the menu: the pizzas and the burger. While there are many other delicious sounding options such as shishito peppers, however given that I was planning on getting the burger which comes with two patties I assumed that was plenty to eat which it was. I was very pleased with the burger now that I don't need to get to the Brooklyn location early to get one it was really good. The combination of the sauce and pretzel buns with the onions is amazing. It is definitely the best burger in NYC. We also tried the square pizza with vodka sauce. While I think it could have used a little more sauce, it was still really good albeit a little smaller than the pizza from Emmy Squared. I will definitely come back to try some of the appetizers and round pies.

I think this might just be the best pizza I've ever had. And I love pizza. The only reason I'm giving this 4/5 stars is because of this restaurant's accessibility. As I was leaving, a woman in a motorized wheelchair was trying to come in. Her loitering on the edge of the step into the restaurant was noticed by none of the staff. I took on the responsibility of asking if there were an accessible entrance, only to be told no. So, take that how you will. However, if you can get into this restaurant, you're going to have a great time. The service was excellent, with a very engaging staff spreading a great energy throughout the room. I ordered the Emily pizza, which looked very strange on paper--I was intrigued. When my order came out, the strangeness continued. Cold cheese, honey, pistachios, truffle...pizza? I bit in and, oh boy, it was incredible! Go to this restaurant!!! But also, @Emily make this handicap accessible!!!!!!
Pizza and service is amazing, and the Lammy Burger is out of this world. I highly recommend this spot to anyone visiting the city.

Don't even have a health rating. Not worth the hype. Say you can't make reservations but even when you put your name down they can only sit "reservations". Makes no sense. You're better off getting a $1 slice and dipping it in honey..

Had to wait for our table for ~30 minutes on a Friday night. As soon as we sat down the staff brought out complementary (and delicious) appetizers. Great food,  cute atmosphere. Will definitely return!

The food is great but the service is horrible. Also, they refuse to do pick-up and delivery during dinner time. I've tried to do pick-up/delivery multiple nights and they say "sorry, we are only placing orders for dine-in customers."

The burger was tasty - juicy, fragrant, and seasoned just right. It was a bit on the greasy side, so the bottom bun was soaked by the time it arrived. Would visit again, but only if in the area for a cheat meal.

Really quaint place on a quiet street. We had a show at the Minetta lane theater, 2 minute walk from there. Service was excellent, really nice greeter who found a table for us as we were an hour early for our reservation. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Emmy burger and the Mimi. The burger which is a Pat Lafrieda blended burger with sauteed onions , emmy sauce?, american cheese on a pretzel bun. It was a great tasting burger, Lafrieda blends usually are, but it was undercooked which is a big possibility with a double thick patty. They never asked how i wanted cooked. Good thing i like it this way. Likevi said , it was good, just not $26 good. You can get 5 pat lafrieda burgers at shake shack for that money. It did come with some fresh seasoned curly fries still not worth $26, I'd go $20 it is Manhattan. We never had Detroit style pizza before, so we ordered the Mimi. First off, it was freakin good pizza. Crunchy square crust doughy interior with nice sweet red sauce ,  and cheese. The mimi was supposed to have ricotta,  sauteed garlic , mushrooms and basil. I only saw and tasted the latter two. All in all i would recommend this place for the pizza, and the burger if money is not an option. They did not have the ipa i wanted, it was on the menu, but tap problems prevented that option, so i opted for the Barrier pilsner,  not as good, but i had to have a beer with my pizza.
The burger was really good.  I also really liked the playlist they had going in the background.  I never thought I would here matt Martians at a restaurant.

This is the most disappointing hyped restaurants I've been too. Medium rare burger was rare and cold. Pizza tasted worst the dominos. Crust not thin and not thick... tasted frozen. Server was super indifferent. We were there Monday morning at 12pm and they were out of coffee? Really? Don't go. Don't go. Or go and confirm my review guys!!!!
Love this place. "The Emily" is always the right pizza to choose. Pistachios on pizza... who knew?!?!

We were a group of 4 South asian men who were visiting NYC and decided to give Emily's a try for lunch (~1pm) after having heard so much about their burger. Upon entering, we noticed that the place was fairly empty; perhaps a couple of tables were occupied. Anyhow, upon requesting a table of 4, the servers exchanged a reluctant look as if they did not want us there. However, we did not think of it much then and waited for them to seat us. They then checked to ask if we had reservations, which was a little surprising since they weren't very busy. We told them, we did not and they exchanged another round of reluctant looks. After a few minutes, just as they are about to get us seated they inform us that they only serve the burgers for people who have reservations. Now, this totally blew my mind. Nowhere had they mentioned such a thing nor had I come across such a unique rule. I mean if they were busy, then I could have still understood they had a limited number of burgers they could serve in a day. But this was not only unacceptable but also felt racist. Trust me if you will, give this place a skip and go to an establishment that treats its customers right.
My man and I came here and split the burger and the mimi pizza and we both agreed that the burger was the best we've ever had. I will definitely be coming back for the food, service, ambience.
The burger was extremely oily. The pizza had minimal cheese. The quality of food is simply poor. I'm not going back.

I cannot tell you how good this place is. The Emily burger was honestly the best burger that I've had in Manhattan, which is really saying something. The pizzas are also fantastic (particularly the Colony pizza). Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Emily serves fantastic food in a friendly and casual environment. Will be back soon!

Emily is hands-down my favorite pizza in the city. This was my first time trying their Detroit style pies and this location and honestly, I was blown away by both the food and the service. The staff was really friendly and attentive. They brought us a free salad since our food was taking a little long. I already loved the Clinton Hill location, but this outpost is now also a new favorite.

I love both Emily's and Emmy's in Brooklyn, but the West Village location is my favorite by far-- it's more spacious than the Clinton Hill location and less pretentious than the Williamsburg one. We went for brunch on Saturday and were happy to find that it was less crowded and obnoxious as the other two locations can sometimes be.  The service was excellent-- our waitress was super friendly and chill -- and the pizza is the stuff that dreams are made of.  When we went they were only selling Detroit-style (maybe I read the menu wrong?), which I was a little bummed about as I was looking forward to being able to order both types of pie. But obviously, it only took a few seconds perusing the Detroit-style menu to get over any feelings of disappointment I may have had.  I We ordered the Grammy, the Mimi Cheng's and the Arenstein. They were all delicious, but the winner by far was the Mimi Cheng's-- ricotta, roasted garlic, mushrooms, thyme and chili. With some extra chili sauce drizzled over, it is insanely good.  The West Village location also has high chairs and booster seats for the kiddos, unlike the other two locations (Emily's in Clinton Hill has high chairs but only a few tables can accommodate one which means a long wait.)  I was a big fan of Blue Ribbon, but am so happy that Emily's has taken over the space!
I am Michael H.and my critical review was in the "not recommended" section and I do not know why.. Please  tell me the problem with it so that it will not happen again.

Will keep it short and simple without any repeats- burger and pizza were great.  Though, both were quite lukewarm when served to us.  The waiter tried to constantly rush us out of the restaurant during lunchtime service.  Would of understood if they were full or had a line of customers waiting. Food is 4 stars but I'd give an overall 3.5 stars if it were an option.

Act as if their a Michelin Star restaurant and essentially laugh off the idea that someone could ever possibly walk in off the street without a reservation. We were told they were booked through closing and we could wait the hour and a half until closing to see if something would open up, but they'd hate to see us wait and then have to end up closing before we got a table. There's a way to conduct yourself. And that's not it.

I went here with my brother and his best friend. The burger is a must and so is the wood fired pizza. Beware - the Quinn pizza does not have tomato sauce! We ordered another woodfired pizza, the standard one with tomato sauce and mozzarella and basil. This meal was to die for, I loved the ambiance, and most of all, I loved the company. Will definitely be back!
If you like Emmy Squared, you'll like it here. The pizza is basically exactly the same, so it's great.

My reservation for Saturday lunch was both confirmed and cancelled within an hour due to "facilities issues". I never received a phone call or an option for a later reservation. We went to the Grand street location in hopes of getting seated there. Needless to say, we were not given any priority or apology and were sent on our way. Pretty disappointing as this is one of my favorite pizza spots.

Yes, the Emmy Burger is the best burger I have ever had!  We made a reservation and we were taken right on time.  The four of us split two Emmy Burgers, one "Pink" pizza and one "Red" pizza.  It was plenty and it was delicious!  And the curly fries were great also.  Our server was fast and friendly and the restaurant was pretty cool with the big windows and brick walls.  I highly recommend you try the burger here.

Get the burger!!!! You're going to think you want the pizza (it is really good) but get the burger!!!! Better yet split the burger and pizza that is the move. Staff is very friendly. Tables are pretty close together but it is worth it for the food.

If you like Pizza Hut pizza, this will be your jam. While it's tasty, it's dripping in grease and falls far short of the plethora of pizza options in NYC. Otherwise a good vibe, worth checking out once (and maybe the burger options are more to write home about) but won't be a regular neighborhood spot for me.

Mediocre burger, mediocre pizza, and mediocre service. I was so excited to try this place, but it was a let down. The burger was super soggy and could not enjoy it and poorly proportioned-- too much meat and toppings for the bread to hold. The pizza was also incredible bland and very cold when it came to us. Ironically, the only thing I enjoyed was their brussel sprout salad (which is why I am giving it 2 stars and not 1)--but it was not wow at all. Our server was also not helpful or knowledgeable when it came to the menu and providing suggestions.

Emily doesn't need another 5-star review but I'm giving one anyway. The pizza is AMAZING. We got the Emily (thin crust, pistachio, honey and truffle) and the Colony (deep dish, pistachio, chili and honey) and both were to die for. The hubs declared it best pizza he's ever eaten. My only advice is make a reservation on their website far in advance - they book up and for good reason!

Joe, Emily's ever responsive and accommodating manager, reached out to discuss my experience and offer a return visit. I was wowed by the burger once again! Back to its former glory. The vodka grandma slices are also NOT to be missed. Will continue to sing its praises!

Wtf?! Why have I been hearing about this place for years?! This was essentially a Pizza Hut pizza laid out with some sort of Asian variant to make it more New York. Very upsetting and truly don't understand why people keep recommending this place.
No comment
Worst customer service ever. Completely ignored us and ruined my boyfriend's birthday dinner. Never coming back.

come here with my husband almost once a week. very creative and delicious salads, wonderful deep dish pizzas, extremely reasonable prices (well except maybe the burger but i'm vegetarian so that's not for me). also reasonable quartino wine prices and good beer selection. one of the best spots in the neighborhood.

We had a wonderful experience at Emily for a special occasion dinner with 12 girls. The service, food, and drink were all fantastic for our big group. We are locals and love having this location in the neighborhood. We got 6 pizzas and two burgers to share among us and had some leftovers that we ate the next day. Everything was delicious - the Colony, Emily and Luca pizzas were all big hits and of course the burger is not to be missed. We will be back again and again!
Very over rated. Had high expectations for the burger and was very disappointed. They try to hard, if you are looking for a good burger go around the corner to bar sardine
Omg the burger. All the pizzas are great too (esp the Emily!), and seems like this location is easier to get into than the original.

Pizza is good but not really anything special. The space is super tight and the whole place could use a stronger air conditioner. Drinks are pretty good tho! The Hurricane Hula is really yummy but basically as much as an entire pizza? Pro is that they have Detroit style deep dish and thin crust so it's good for different tastes. Curly fries are also so good! Overall, not sure a 26 dollar dollar burger, 14 dollar drink and tight table are entirely worth the hype. Might go back. ‍

Maybe 31/2 stars, just thought the burger was too wet/greasy, and Detroit pizza good but maybe little gimmicky. I prefer a proper Italian style pizza so maybe ordered wrong pie. Wine was good and enjoyed the casual but refined vibe.

Great pizza but unfortunately terribly rude host.  Plenty of open seats and wouldn't sit me and my elderly mother upstairs since all those tables were 'reserved' even though wide open.  Insisted we had to walk down the stairs which my mom can't do. No flexibility or willingness to work with customers.  Bad form.  We live in the neighbourhood and expect better especially for a weekday lunch.

Came here for Father's Day dinner.  So good.  The burger is amazing.  The pizzas fabulous.  The Brussels sprouts salad was fantastic.  The service was great as well.  Will absolutely be back (provided we can get a table!). Kids loved everything also!

What a terrible disappointment.  Emily advertises that they are open until 10 p.m. on Sundays. We hurried through 45 minutes of NYC Memorial Day weekend traffic in order to arrive at Emily - West Village before closing. We were relieved to be there at 9:48 with an active house and a number of available tables. We were shocked to be told that the kitchen closed at 9:45 and we would not be seated. The hostess claimed she was "sorry", however nothing about her demeanor was remotely sympathetic.  We were very hungry and asked for some accommodation, but she offered nothing.  If Emily's policy is to close at 9:45, then they should say so on their website and storefront. While it may have been inconvenient for Emily to serve a customer before their 10 p.m. closing, it is reasonable to expect that they would do so nonetheless.  We had so looked forward to their food, but will never set foot in this establishment again.  I urge everyone reading this review to refrain from dining at Emily.....there are many fine pizza and burger establishments in the area.  Please patronize those restaurants that keep their commitments and respect their customers.
I do not know what Emmy sauce is, but I would put it on everything if I could. The burger is absolutely everything it's cracked up to be, and the pizza is also outstanding.

Believe the hype - this burger is GOOOOOOD. Pizza was tasty too, but that burger is what I will remember. Kind of like in n out on crack. Plus, service was very friendly! Another plus - ranch dressing was very good, had an interesting almost pesto-y twist to it.
Pizza was absolutely amazing but staff was a little  on the slow side.  Overall I highly recommend.

Overall the food was great, the burger lived up to the hype best burger I had ever and the pizza was amazing with the slight sweetness to it.  The scenery was great too since I booked a reservation,definitely gonna go there again

Crazy Friday night and they were out of square pizza.... people kept complaining but the round pizzas were so delicious! The staff did an amazing job handling the chaos and made it a very pleasant experience.  The service and food are great!  Clearly there is a demand for the square but don't overlook the round!

First - the pizza is over the top delicious and the service is super friendly and great. Loved dining there. I like the classic red sauce best so far, but haven't had pink yet. Had both round and square pies. Second, I ordered takeout pizza. Though just as insanely delicious, I thought the order was wrong so called and told them. I didn't ask them to replace the pizza (though the guy on the phone offered). Minutes later, the manager, Asbury, called me and said he's bringing another pizza-he hand-delivered it within 10 minutes! As it turns out - I was wrong, the original order had been correct. In spite of that, Asbury graciously gave me the pizza and we happily agreed we'd see each other again soon. And often. 5 stars for customer service in addition to awesome food.

Amazing. Delicious. Do not miss out on the Detroit style pizza (Arenstein is amazing).  I love everything about this place. Service, atmosphere, burger, and maybe the best pizza in NYC. I want to try their round pizza as well...but can't NOT get the detroit!

We ordered four pizzas.  My wife's came first.  Then, the two pizzas for my kids.  Waited about 10 minutes, they said mine didn't come out right and that there were going to remake it and it would be out in 5 minutes.  About 15-20 minutes later I got mine as the rest of my family was done eating.  They apologized and didn't charge me for my pizza.  My wife and kids liked their pizzas; I thought mine was pretty good.  Unfortunately, horrible service ruined it for me.  Will never go back.

Horrible waiter experience. We left mid meal because the waiter was incredibly rude to our table. The woman serving the wine spilled the wine on the table. We never received an apology either. Would not recommend.
Great atmosphere. Good w kids (well behaved kids) and fabulous food. Had the Emmy burger and split it 3 ways. And a Grandmas pizza. ssoooo good!

Awful experience last night. Was told the wait for 6 would be 2 hours. Ended up being 3 and a half. The pizza was good but not worth the wait, or putting up with the rude staff and pretentious atmosphere.  It's a new restaurant and management clearly has no clue how to handle the demand they neither deserve nor will probably still have a year from now.

5 stars for food, 3 stars for service... but the food is really what matters. the burger is beyond amazing. definitely top 5 in the city. the pizza is outstanding. we had the Mimi Cheng, but i cant wait to go back for the colony. skip the dessert and get more pizza/ burger instead!
We absolutely loved the grandma style pizza! The Colony is a must-try. Great atmosphere for small group outing or date night.

Great pizza, burger and a chopped brussel sprout salad that had me wanting to go back again (24 hours later). Loved the comfortable vibe, the attentive hipster waiters and the overall feel. The Emily Pizza didn't sound like something we would enjoy (pistachio, honey, truffle cheese ?) ...  it was awesome !!!

I've been twice before. Pizza is good. However with no reservation, don't even bother with the 'wait list'. The 2 employees at the check in are clueless and have no idea how to accommodate customers. 7:10pm name placed on wait list, 9:59pm still not called. Momentarily is the answer when checking the status. Good food, not good people management.

The Double Stacked Burger was great...HOWEVER, the service was subpar.  First, their famous burger lives up to its fame. It's juicy and tangy and just delicious.  Though I thought the burger would be much bigger, but I was able to finish it all without leaving any behind. The curly fries it came with was okay, but not particularly memorable. I would have given this restaurant at least 4 stars if not 5 stars, if the wait staff would just smile and look like they want me as a patron. I went around noon on July 4th and said "Happy 4th" to the waiter at the door as I walked in and he looked at me like he could care less, I guess he doesn't celebrate Federal holidays, especially if he had to work on a holiday.  I sat at the end of the bar and ordered my food, not once during my time there did a wait staff walk over to say hi or how's the food or do you need extra napkins. This wait staff really was just going through the motions, no special effort to smile or even pretend they enjoy working there.  I was eating there, but I was essentially a non-person to them. Suffice it to say, the burger was amazing, but the service did not match up to the food reviews.

only bad thing I have to say is this place is a calorie killer.  All the food was pretty amazing including the drinks and pan pizzas (unlike any pizza I have ever had) get the burger while you still can one in are party said it was the best burger he had ever eaten.  the aesthetics are very cute and the service was perfect. The prices are also very reasonable here.

This place is incredible - totally lives up to the hype and for those saying that the Brooklyn location is better, I don't even know how that could be possible. This place is top notch- if you don't have a reservation, it's worth how ever long the wait is, just make sure you come starving.  You must share burgers and pizzas. I'd suggest a combination of rounds and squares, so that you can try the different crusts (the square is doughy, yet light).  The burger lives up to all the hype - cooked perfectly with great flavors and probably the best burger I've ever had in my life. Also, the Emily Pizza is absolutely amazing and apparently switching it to the round crust has made a huge difference. It's a must-order.  This place is a MUST!!!!!

Had the classic pie and the Grammy. Both were amazing. The Grammy has the the cheese baked crust. The tomato sauce had a lot of flavor. I also had the gem salad which was okay. Phoebe lemonade was an excellent drink choice. I will definitely come again.
Saltiest burger I have ever eaten. Pizza was good though. As was the service. Good spot for the weekend. A little overrated

We came to this location of Emily primarily because I was dying to try those Detroit square pies that were not available in the Brooklyn location. The way this restaurant is set up is interesting; you almost feel like you're dining in someone's wine cellar (if seated in the basement) and it doesn't seem particularly cramped even when full. We ordered the Colony, subbing in olives for pepperoni, and the cacio e pepe round pie. The Colony pie was BEAUTIFUL, with very robust sauce, the perfect amount of cheese that was deeply caramelized at the edges, and wonderfully paired toppings (jalapeno and honey is a winner, imo). The cacio e pepe is where things fell apart a little. It was actually a little revolting how much cheese was on it (and I say this as a cheese lover), and the crust was super thin, with no sauce to balance it out. Unfortunately, the cheese was leaking grease and had reached a rubbery consistency by the time it reached the table. I choked down a slice, but felt sick for the rest of the night because of it (and so did my dining buddy, somehow). I'd stick to the fresher square pies, y'all. Those are truly worth it.

My wife and I ate here a couple months back and it was amazing.  We had the Emmy burger and pizza and the food was absolutely superb, probably the best burger I have ever had.  So i decided after work to head down to their place and order some food to go and surprise my wife when I got home.  I ask when I get there if they do take out and the waitress assured me they did but when I asked for two Emmy burgers to go the individual behind the bar informs me that they dont allow the burger to be served for take out.  So, I ask him if they can just simply put the burgers in a bag for me and be on my way.  The guy immediately gets nasty and just repeats what he originally said, "we dont allow the burger to be served for take out".  Now im pissed.  I traveled 40 min out of my way to go to this place and for some stupid reason they wont allow a burger to be sold for take out on top if the nasty attitude I received for asking a logical question.  The staff's nasty attitude along with the establishments inability to simply adjust to the customer's needs (serving a friggin burger to go) guarantees that, not only will I never eat here again, I will make sure everyone I know, knows about this ridiculous interaction with those who run Emily.  Call me crazy but I find it ludicrous that a restaurant would turn down $60 because they dont want to serve a burger to go.  If anything they would increase their profit margins if they served the burger to go considering you wouldnt take up any of their restaurant space and the burger is one of the higher priced items on the menu.  But, hey, maybe they didnt want me reverse engineering their special sauce in my garage at home.  Who knows.  Anyway, I digress.  Thanks, Emily, for not making any sense

Wanted to see what all the fuss was about. Arrived at 6:50pm, waited almost 2 hrs for a table. (Walked around while waiting). It was Tuesday night, rush hour dinner, but two hours for a table??? While there were two, 4 seaters available, they were reserved. The food was good, Crowley fries are a must. We ordered two pizzas, they were good. However, I would not wait again two hours for that pizza. The ambiance, too loud, crowded, small, but I guess that's NY. I felt rushed all the time. Before we even finished our drinks  the check was "thrown" on our table. What if we wanted something else??? Apparently that is not the vibe there. Laid back is not their thing. Go in, eat, get out. I get it, it was peak rush our. That's probably very common in most trendy restaurants there but hey, I want to enjoy my food. Overall, if I don't have to wait an absurd amount of time, I'll eat there again. But there are so many places out there...without those crazy waiting times.

I decided to go to dinner at Pizza Loves Emily with my siblings and my girlfriend. On the phone, I was told the wait would be about 10-15 minutes. Once we get there, I was quoted 1 hour 30 minutes to 2 hours. Regardless, we decided to wait and put my name and number down. Since we were anticipating the wait, we began to walk around. 20 minutes later, we get a text saying our table was ready and we have only 10 minutes to get there. We were forced to take an Uber so we can get our table. Once we arrived and were seated, our waiter came over and told us that we can't get the Detroit Pizza (8x10) as they don't have the dough anymore for the night and that this has never happened before. We were disappointed but understood so we just ordered the normal 12" circle pizza. Once we got our drinks and curly fries, we noticed that people who came after us and ordered pizza began to get their orders and it happened to be the 8x10 Detroit Pizza. We assumed they may have ordered it ahead of time so we didn't make anything of it. Towards the end of our dinner, we noticed that more and more customers began to get the pizza that we were told is not available for the night. All of a sudden they had it available. Did they receive a "special delivery" at 9:00 pm on a Thursday night? I doubt it. The waiter didn't even bother to mention they had it available again. If they didn't want to serve us, they could have told us and we would have left. Thanks for nothing. Won't be going back.

I eat at Ichibantei so much, the least I can do is leave them with a 5-star review. I've tried a couple things on the menu such as the Katsu and Okayo Don, the Kaarage, and tuna steak (all super delicious!!!) but nothing compares to their niku udon bowl. The broth is perfect, they don't shy away from piling up the beef and everything meshes together so well. I've had the niku udon more times than I can count and I will continue to do so because Ichibantei is consistent with their delivery of home cooked goodness.

Super cute authentic Japanese restaurant that cooks Japanese comfort food. They have outdoor seatings, but in the warmer weather if you are magnet for bugs maybe avoid. Love the decor inside with the vinyl disc and the music and vibe of the place. The staff are friendly and great with recommendations. They have draft Sapporo beer!!! Enjoy the meals and app and felt like I went to a Japanese household and had a home cooked meal.

Went here to eat with a couple of friends and after we were seated, the same waiter who seated us was nowhere to be found. After 20mins of waiting, we just decided to go somewhere else to eat and that's when the waiter decided to show up to ask us "oh you're leaving?" with a slight smirk on his face. It was obvious that they just didn't want to serve us, which was a shame because we were excited to try this place. Don't give them business.
Good quick eat, sat outdoors, waiter was very nice, food was delicious, try their ramen , they are open late also

Great takeout, will definitely need to come for a late night snack. The Udon portion was big and the tempura rice was a nice crunchy addition. We also ordered gyoza, which were standard--hard to mess up. The pork tonkotsu was also delicious, although portion was smaller than some other places I've ordered from.

Super delicious food, very fast walking distance or I can ride my bike in lock it on a pole or something. The food is probably more like a 3.5 but in terms of service it's almost like they're trying to make it as hard as possible on you to order. So overall with other options in the neighborhood it's hard to justify coming here.

The tables and chairs are high and hard - fine for drinks but slightly uncomfortable for eating. The food is great though. I highly recommend the Cold Ramen Noodles + Chicken Nanban. I ordered katsu don takeout from this place as I was craving Japanese comfort food, but the other place I wanted food from does not do takeout, so I decided to try this place because it was close by. The restaurant has this cool hip hop vibe to it. They own the wall space next to the restaurant, and there's a huge mural with their name on it, so it's not that hard to spot the place. The restaurant has a couple of large wooden tables with stools that would be good for large groups or otherwise communal seating. The place struck me as authentically Japanese, and the employees were really nice, but the katsu don was just meh. I saw that the other fried chicken dishes were more popular, but I'd had enough fried chicken for one week, so I went with pork. Hopefully, the chicken is much better than the pork. I definitely want to come back to try the chicken when I have a craving for it.

Relatively inexpensive dinner. I liked the presentation and food. I ordered the garlic chicken but I'm looking forward to trying the fried chicken next time.
