I LOVE Japanese food, and frequently cook it at home so I was excited to try this place since it's so close. Usually when my boyfriend and I go to an expensive NY restaurant for the first time we share a plate since they range from $15-$25 per plate and the check can go up to the $60s for a lunch. When we stopped in here we were going to try the wagyu, and when were about to be seated in the empty booth section, the waiter told us we had to order an entree for each of us if we wanted to eat there. I understand covid precautions, but I have never been to a restaurant that forces you to individually buy plates unless it was a buffet (understandably). I'm disappointed that during a pandemic when everyone is low on cash, and restaurants are already struggling, this restaurant forces you to have your own $15-$25 plate of food just to eat there. I won't be going there anytime soon, but may one day I'll check back to see if they changed their policy.

The food here is good for sure! I would be hesitant to say that it was one of the best Japanese places in the city. I ordered their signature dish, and I found it to be a bit too fatty for my liking. However, they keep their prices low and are definitely good at capturing that signature Japanese izakaya vibe.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Got the Katsu Don delivery. Not bad. Eggs were a little off but the quality of the meat was very good. I may come here again but lots of other places I need to try for Katsu Don that are local. I do think that separating the rice and the dish as they do is far more practical than originally thought.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really delicious tonkotsu! Nice crisp outer layer with a delicious chewy texture to the black pork.  Very high quality meat, Wish there were more to it other than the bowl of white rice for $15 entree.  Some pickles on the side would be nice like in a bento would be ideal.  Got the tako wasabi and thought it was small for an appetizer but it's got a strong wasabi kick so actually that was the perfect amount.  Will definitely come back to try the other dishes!
No comment
No comment
Hamburger steak is very good. Ordered from here since 3 years ago and never failed. Also fried chicken is very good.

OK - I'm a next door neighbor, so I'll admit some bias - the owners are super friendly and eager to please.  This is a cozy location, with windows open to the street - walls covered with reggae albums, and excellent reggae playlists from the afficiando owners.  Ice cold pint mugs of Sapporo are always $5.  The food is excellent, with multiple small plates and premium entrees.  My faves are the burdock appetizer and the grilled tuna which is seared outside and pink inside with a delicious miso based dressing...
Living on 14th & B, this place is totally a gem for our apt. Just love this place. Cash only is annoying otherwise I would love to come here everyday

Honestly I don't know how this place has such high ratings, maybe they are paying Yelp to boost their ratings. This place serves disgusting food for expensive prices. Starting from their tempura, which is soggy and undercooked, to the Don bowls, which are way too watery, with rice that is obviously made and reheated. They even put soggy salad with leaves that are wilting on a plate. The hamburger steak smells sour, like meat that has been refrigerated for an obscene amount of time topped off with a even worse sweet and sour sauce that makes ketchup on steak look spectacular. Listen to me, if you have come here because of the 4 star average review, you will not be satisfied with the actual result of the restaurant.
Just wanted to grab a drink. We were 8 people, only 6 ordered a drink and we were asked to leave. Nobody was waiting outside and there was another free table. Definitely not coming back.

This is my goto when ordering comp'd dinner at work.  I get the chicken with the stuff on top.  It's good.  Real good.  Eat it.  I've never actually paid out of pocket for this place though.  I wonnder if I'd still like it as much?

Whenever I need to escape the horror of New York's humans, I visit Ichibantei. The cool reggae beats soothe my raging spirits, and the donburi fills me with happy, sleepy feelings. The staff are courteous to the extreme and the restaurant is warm and gentle. Ichibantei - I love you. New York gamma males, not so much.

I already knew this place had great comfort Japanese food. I ordered late night Chicken Nanban, which is amazing, but they forgot my order and made me wait an hour. I called, and when the order actually came they added some drinks and a Chicken Karagei. Forgiven. Great service and great food deserves 5 stars.

This is my third time ordering from the restaurant. If you order for delivery, be prepared for a long wait. The wait time is extremely inconsistent. My order usually arrives in 30 minutes. However recently it takes over an hour. But the quality of the food is great. Everything is well flavored and authentic. I would recommend the following dishes: Katsudon and Chicken Nanban.
No comment
Best Japanese restaurant in Manhattan. Had the chicken nanban and it was delicious. The service was really good too, definitely will be coming back here!!

Awesome Japanese comfort food and Karage style chicken. The tacowasu (Raw Octopus with wasabi) was a generous portion. The Nanban chicken was fantastic and the $5 ice cold Sapporo was a crowd favorite. Affordable late night food with Reggae spinning. It is like if you were in a Japanese surfer izakaya. Staff are cool and the food is great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I like this place!  Super chill spot tucked away with reasonable prices and qhat seems to be basic but good food. I only had a drink here but i will be back.  Cash only though!

We had the ramen and tako-wasa. The broth of ramen is spot on. It has pork flavor in it and taste awesome. We also had the mini sausage appertizer and tako-wasa. Tako-wasa is a wasabi flavor raw octopus appertizer. It is very fresh and chewy. A lot of people may not like this type of flavor, but I found it very authentic. The decor of Ichibantei is like all the other restaurants in East Village, and it is more like a bar. Overall great experience! :)
No comment
No comment
Good food but cash only which quickly becomes a minus when you are not always carrying cash around.
No comment
The delivery service is extremely slow. I live only a couple blocks away and both times I have ordered from them it took well over an hour.
They always serve beer in the frozen cold mug, just like a cozy Izakaya in Japan.
No comment

Not happy at all with Food. The Karage and teriyaki chicken looks the same, greasy fat deep fried with a lil sauce. The mixed vegetables that come with is a cup of lettuce with soy sauce. Don't waste your money on this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is simply a gem. I have been here dozens of time and food is always good, you can probably order closed eyes and you won't be disappointed. The place has charm and staff always nice. I definitely recommend if you are looking for a place to chill.

Solid food but the interior is a little low scale -- a pretty tight fit with large shared tables.  Not a place where you might bring a first or second date to, basically, but eat with friends or just hang.  The wait staff was really helpful and knowledgeable.
Chicken Nanban is my jam here. Just enough flavor not to over power the chicken! Eat some sausages as a good compliment and down that with a beer! Perfecto!!!
Everything was fresh and delightfully tasty. I've eaten  plenty of katsu. This is probably the best I've had. It's not too heavy and simply tasty.  Worth the look.
No comment
No comment
They forced us to pay 20% gratuity and on top of that harassed us for one person out of 12 not ordering something. Completely rude and disrespectful
Stoner owner bad attitude. Food Ma Ma. Waitress asked 5 times for something. Not stoned just bad. Stay away.

I went with a few friends on a Friday night, and to our surprise, the restaurant was completely empty. We followed the reviews and ordered tonkatsu, chicken nanban, and karaage. They were all juicy with the perfect amount of crispiness. My favorite was the chicken nanban. It is true that the service is a bit slow, but the staff is extremely friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Have been here a few times and have always had a great experience.  Food is very good and beer is cheap.   Sake selection is good too.  Note that it is cash only, though.

Fantastic food and atmosphere. Took my girlfriend here for our first anniversary dinner and we agreed it was the best non-home cooked meal of our lives. Got the teriyaki ramen with ichibantei steak and the gf got the fried pork. Comes with a bunch of rice and miso soup. Get the sapporo beer!
No comment

So I was super pumped to try this place since it was sold to me as Japanese Soul Food. But I'm guessing it wasn't the traditional soul food I was thinking of (i.e. fried chicken, ribs, mac n' cheese, etc.) and more so along the lines of Japanese comfort food. It's a small place and definitely reminded me of Japan but when I tasted the Kara-age...I just wasn't impressed. It was just OK. I was over at Jin Ramen earlier that day and tried the boneless fried chicken, which was super delicious. My other friends really liked their food so maybe I just didn't order the right thing. If there's a next time, I'll try the Chicken Nanban.

I have to downgrade the rating. I previously complained that the food was on the pricey side, and they've recently increased their prices again.  Although I like their food and the staff is so polite and friendly, I would love to support them but it's no longer an every day option for me.
No comment
No comment

There is a ridiculous rule about people not being able to share meals. We were harassed and guilted by one of the employees because a couple we were with decided to share a plate. Worst service I have received in a long time.
No comment

No credit cards. No alcohol served (though they did let us bring wine in). The menu is extremely limited. I was there with a group of about 10 people, and several had a lot of trouble finding something they wanted. I wanted a chicken dish or a vegetable dish: the latter was nonexistent, and the former only came deep-fried. If deep-fried chicken is your thing, then maybe you'd like this place. But even so: the deep-fried chicken teriyaki I got was full of gristle and tasted terrible. My boyfriend loves meat and tried to finish my dish (I just ate rice)...and even he admitted it was bad.

Small portion for the price. Mediocre food. If you are hungry and want some good food or drinks, go to Taisho, Rai Rai Kan, or any place in east village that opens late. Don't come here or you will be disappointed.

They have really great Japanese fried chicken and fantastic beer and sake prices! Sometimes the TVs can be a bit overwhelming and it's hit or miss with who else is eating here. The most fun I've had was when it was a sleepy rainy night and we were the only ones there. They played great reggae tunes. The staff is super sweet as well.
The nicest delivery man I have ever met, and the food is amazing as well. I cannot be more impressed!
No comment
No comment

Everyone says to get it, so honestly just follow the crowd. The chicken nanban is so tender and juicy. It strips away easily. The tartar sauce gives it a really great flavor, and it comes with salad, rice, and soup. The portions are generous so I'm always busting by the seams when I'm done eating, or I'll have a few pieces to take home as leftovers. Also, the service is good, and the waiters are friendly, smiley, and attentive. I've also gotten the katsu don before and it's also very tasty.
No comment

Yummm!  I had the japanese-style barbecued steak (don't remember the name) at the recommendation of the staff, and it was delish.  Will definitely be coming back for more. The place is also meticulously clean.  Good job.

Based purely on the delivery experience, the menu is pretty limited, but everything we ordered was good.  We ordered the katsu don, chicken nanban, and the kurobua tonkatsu.  All were good and roughly 12-14 dollar each.  All I would recommend to anyone.  They also offer sushi rolls.  But I would stay with the savory entrees.  Delivery was quick, food wasnt cold, everything turned out well.  Will definitely be on the list to try again.

Best chicken karaage ever. Juicy, flavorful, and tender. The rice is good too. I've never been to the place but I order the garlic chicken, teriyaki chicken, and chicken karaage pretty much every week. The delivery guy is really nice and polite. They are sometimes late but then they compensate by giving free drinks.

So I spoke to one of the workers there and they told me that they are waiting for their liquor license before they open for lunch... not sure what they two have to do with each other, but the food is still great.

We came here before a show. The theater was just 2 blocks away and we had about 50 mins, so we thought why not! The food was great with reasonable price. But it took too long for them to prepare. We ended up 15 mins late for the performance, and couldn't finish our meal. People said it wasn't usually like that, but if I am in a hurry and in the neighborhood again, I probably won't walk in there. Otherwise, they are pretty decent

Ichibantei is my favorite place to eat whenever I am in the city. The place has a unique atmosphere that really enhances your dining experience. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The food is amazing. The Kaarage chicken is to die for as is the Garlic chicken. Portion sizes are perfect. Most entrees come with a side of rice, miso soup, and a salad but they don't skimp on the main dish. You get a healthy serving of meat that makes the meal feel like a great value. I don't know of many places in the city where you can get a great meal for two for under $40. You can't go wrong with Ichibantei!
No comment
The only Japanese restaurant I know of in NYC, that serve real Chicken Nanban ($10 and comes with rice & shredded cabbage).  The staff is very friendly and even hooked me up with a free Taiyaki!!
No comment

This place has great food at good prices. For $8-12 you can walk out  full and the food is extremely interesting. The nanban and black pork are great and I can't way to try mire. The cute japanese girl who usually works at the counter is very nice and always willing to suggest her favorites. You gotta try this place they really deserve your business.
Food is amazing and delivery guy is super nice. Order fast though cuz it can take a while to arrive.
Nice frosted mug of beer, the cold and hot ramen are the best as well as the Karaage chicken and salad!

Rather decent tonkatsu here! Crispylicious and went well with a reasonable serving of rice. The menu isn't the cheapest you can find in the East Village, but still rather comparable for the food. Definitely worth checking out and comparing with the other places around here, although I don't know if I would come here consistently.

Stopped by here pretty soon after it opened and was met by a very welcoming staff. One of the owners and I explained the various dishes to my friends who aren't too familiar with Japanese food. Everything we ordered was delicious and my tonkatsu was the best I have had in a long time. Super nice inside and clean.

Usually pretty busy and this place is quite tiny. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're in an underground japanese bar. Food is flavorful but can be on the greasy/yummy side - especially any pork belly. Amazing food to pair with a frosted cold beer.
Great food, great attitude and definitely delivered within a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the recommended chicken nanban... Bomb!

My girlfriend and I go here at least 2 to 3 times per month. The simple recipe for a great restaurant is good food and friendly staff and Ichibantei has just that. My go-to dishes are the Chicken Nanban and Katsu Don.
No comment
The only place I know of that serves Japanese food with reggae music. It's more like a bar than a restaurant. Cool place to chill with buddies.

This place looks like a cheap chinese takeout from the outside, but don't be fooled - authentic japanese waiting to be served!  Food was quite delicious - well we only got the karaage but they were so nicely fried and juicy!

excellent low key spot. focus here is katsu, fried goods, sake and reggae. yup, the japanese are the biggest reggae heads on this planet outside jamaica. and whoever commented about "japanese soul food" sounding funny.. what's there not to understand? order something here and there's your answer.

No credit card, no alcohol served, no water (isn't there laws against this), ok food, saw many people walk in and walk right back out.  Prices changes depending on what they feel like charging you.  Compare the board vs. the menu.

Tizzzzyizzzzzyiiiiight. Loved it. A true muddafooking gem. Japones soul food with carribean decor and reggae music...am i pulling your chain? nah, mon, i no pull your chain. There's flag on the ceiling that says smthg about japanese soul food. I was delighted by this place well before dipping into the food. That being said, the food is quite satisfying. I had the tonkatsu (fried pork) and a fried chicken appetizer. It was taaasty, as was the sauce. Sizeable mugs of Sapporo for $5, glass for $3 and another, i believe japanese, beer on offer. They also have Japanese wines (say wha??)--red and white--and a good-sized sake list. This is definitely an eatery i wish to introduce many a friend to, but only those friends on the A list. Do yoself a service and get acquainted with the Ichibantei. You've earned it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small Spanish tapas bar in Greenpoint. We stopped by for Happy Hour, just ordering one drink, and ended up spending the evening there, getting several dishes in the menu. It's simply delightful. Everything was so delicious from the bread to the olives and pimentos. The standouts for me were the chorizos and the scallops. The cheesecake is a traditional basque one and a must try!
No comment

Let me tell you, it's the perfect bar. Don't bother coming here if you just want a drink, because this gem will be wasted on you. The staff are as knowledgeable as they are passionate abt food; and they really care that you enjoy what you're eating or drinking. I love this place so much I stopped taking dates here because why TF would I speculate with fire?
No comment

AMAZING cocktails, but definitely not somewhere I would get food. It's expensive and honestly just not good. My "cheese platter" was two chunks of bread, 3 slices of manchego, nuts. and a lil piece of jam. Absolutely not worth the price! For $4 a shrimp I shouldn't have to devein it myself. Bartenders were great and I'll be back for drinks but definitely stay away from the food
No comment

The service was a bit awkward and was bumbled a bit. I'm not sure the situation there, but it was offset by one of the best martini I've ever had and very good tapas food. I will also note that for happy hour oysters, they were delicious and quite big. The setting was quite moody and cozy as well, which lent to a nice experience even at the bar and by myself, but would likely serve as a very nice date evening without the full meal commitment.

Came here on a solo date for myself and had a lovely time. Came for their happy hour, had the oysters and a vodka martini. Sat outside and enjoyed the lovely weather and the views of the apartment buildings, quintessential Brooklyn. The service was great as the waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and had a good energy. Would love to come here with friends and enjoy the park next-door looking at the Manhattan skyline.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

El Pinguino in Greenpoint is a Spanish tapas and seafood bar serving up some of the freshest seafood towers in NYC. We ordered the seafood tower for dinner which included a dozen oysters, bass ceviche, scallop ceviche, and crab salad. The oysters were among the best we've had in NYC and the scallop ceviche and crab salad were particularly excellent as well. We paired the raw bar with a mineral-forward Txakoli wine from the Basque Country in Spain. Still feeling peckish, we ordered the chorizo and roasted red peppers. Each came with fresh sourdough bread from Shewolf Bakery to mop up the delicious juices. El Pinguino is a must-try for some of the best raw bar in NYC. Be sure to show up during happy hour for half off oysters
No comment
Finally a chance to try conservas! Guided by our waiter's suggestions, we greatly enjoyed our tinned fish and oysters.

This Spanish seafood bar has excellent drinks and I love the food options. From the extremely fresh oysters with perfect mignonette to a curated conservas list alongside She Wolf Bakery bread, I would highly recommend making the trip to this restaurant. I would be sure to get the cheesecake. Not to mention, it's got great decor including an AM radio in the bathroom!

What a business model - most of the food is tinned/canned so non-perishable and little-to-no preparation work. And delicious to boot. I love seafood in general, especially tapas from Spain. I had an incredible, dry Basque cider. Fun wine list. The waiter was super helpful and friendly. Cozy, low-key vibe, great for a date or a soft conversation with an old friend. The garlic aioli was a nice touch. The only dish that was underwhelming were the warm peppers - but such is life.
No comment
Can't think of a better way to spend a late afternoon than this happy hour.

What an absolute lovely addition to the neighborhood! In the past,  fancy seafood is typically served alongside some smug attitude- but not at El Pinguino! This quaint bar serves excellent seafood like their mango ceviche (insanely delicious) and oysters (the one's we had from Canada were incredible) alongside perfectly made martinis (don't sleep on that happy hour from 4-7!). The staff here is extremely helpful and friendly and we made fast friends with Euan and Michael, both of whom had excellent suggestions and made our experience even that much more enjoyable. Perfect for a date night or just a night out with a friend, El Pinguino is the best way to start out your night, end it or just stay way too long and get very drunk on the sheer bliss of this place. Either way, you'll enjoy every moment of this delightful little bar. Can't wait to come back!
No comment
Wonderful Spanish seafood tapa. Great bar and good food with friendly staff. Get there early for happy hour.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love the concept of the restaurant and I love that this style is becoming more popular. Unfortunately, the customer service was very poor aka very rude. She clearly hated her job and didn't want to be there resulting in a terrible experience. They also ran out of appetizer options late afternoon. The protein to entire entree ratio was very small. The flavors of both dishes were nonexistent. Maybe it was a one off since everyone else loved it. I sure do hope it was a one off..

I purchased the chicken bowl here with white rice, onions, lettuce, green sauce, hummus, tomatoes and pita bread. The people were very friendly and the food was good. It was more filling than I thought due to the quantity not being that much and the chicken tasted fresh and tasty.
No comment

Beef shawarma was delish. Grains salad is filling and  interesting. I love their pita- $1 for each extra one that goes w their babaganoush, hummus or yogurt. I get all the veggie toppings on mine but esp love the purple pickled radish.

Finally the place is open, took them long enough.  Food is always good.  Lots of people are working there, but the service is still very slow.  I guess it takes times for them to learn.  Other than slow, food is fresh and good.  My favor is the chicken shawarma rice bowl with everything.  Oh yeah pita bread too.  Their other location offer warm pita bread, this place offer room temperature.

column3: Town of Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY
column6: I've enjoyed eating at Downtown manhattan location but food at this location is not good. I had the chicken touk (cubes) with brown rice today. The 50% of chicken was undercooked so I ended up throwing it out. The rice were too dry and overall it was not a good meal. I think food at cava is better. I'll try something else next time and hope it was just one time thing.
No comment
No comment
No comment

GREAT drinks, nice menu selection, plenty of seating, good vibes, reasonable prices! Becoming one of my go to spots for a drink date or friend meetup. One of the best bars in the neighborhood for cocktails if not the best.

The place is really pretty. The bar and bathroom are beautiful. They had the heaters on too high when we were there so we were melting. I got an amaretto sour and it was fantastic. I didn't order any food but I would go back. The bartender was friendly.

What a pretty bar. Great drinks. Well decorated. Not overly crowded. Also a bar that's staffed well. Im used to seeing one bartender manning the entire bar so this was a pleasant surprise. Ken will make you an off menu cocktail if you ask nicely. We'll be back for sure!
Too loud average food.  Great. If you love packed places. I definitely didn't enjoy myself and will not be going back to many other great places in New York to enjoy.
No comment
Varied options of food and cocktails. Everything we ordered was great. Very good service. Nice atmosphere. Two thumbs up.
No comment
No comment
The staff was great and fun to talk to. The food, drinks, and ambiance were on point.

If only I could give 6 stars to this place because it has it all, great service, amazing food and the atmosphere is nice. Cocktails are lovely and the food is out of this world. Definitely recommend this place for its food variety, atmosphere and especially the bar. Great job and welcome to Tribeca.
One of the best spots in Tribeca. LOVE the drinks, LOVE the food, and LOVE the bartenders and service. Would reccomend
Great ambiance. The duck confit was really nice. Awesome cocktails, loved the Choco Old Fashioned.
No comment

Very average restaurant. It felt very old inside with the decor and by the way our service was on a Friday night for dinner, they seemed understaffed. I got the branzino and thought it was overpriced for what it was. The calamari in it was tough and not very tender, I barely ate it. My boyfriend got the veal and don't think it was his favorite dish. Unfortunately you have to go downstairs (2 flights of small stairs) to the basement to use the hotel bathroom. I won't be rushing back.

Did a date night at San Marino Ristorante. Our server was friendly but service was a bit slow at times. We enjoyed the bread and caesar salad to start. I got the veal which was underwhelming. My girlfriend got the branzino which was fine but also nothing crazy. We had a glass of wine and a cocktail which were a heavy pour and quite strong respectively. Also did coffee at dessert which was fine. They brought us an aperitiv which was a nice touch. Overall decent experience but not rushing back.
No comment

The ambience is lovely: white tablecloth, attentive waiters & my pasta funghi was incredible. Highly recommend. We were a group of 6 coming in late after a show nearby & we all enjoyed the experience. All voted 5 stars!
No comment

I made a reservation based on proximity to the Soho Playhouse, able to accommodate 10 ppl and the yelp reviews... When we arrived and I saw it was part of a meh hotel, my expectations plummeted. Then they presented awesome olive bread and tasty olives for the table...and then we tasted the amazing clams oreganata and realized the Yelp reviews were accurate. This place is a hidden gem. You expect a place like this, Old School Italian, on the UES. Everyone enjoyed their food. I had the whole branzino and broccoli rabe... and it was excellent. My only complaint is their wine list - it's pathetic...very little selection...though I didn't mind the Chianti we had.
Good food, great service. Decor a bit outdated, but food and service make this irrelevant.
No comment
I found this place just randomly looking for a place in Soho. I was pleasantly surprised/impressed by the service & food quality.

This is my first time dining here. Visited my friends in New Jersey for the PNA NY event this weekend. The place is clean and classy.. I ordered their Seafood pasta dish.. it was delicious... I literally ate it all. It was a very good dining experience.. would love to visit the place again someday..
Excellent food, drinks,  and atmosphere. It was very quiet when came on a weekday but service was still great. Will return for sure.
No comment
No comment
Nina ravioli very tasty. Veal ravioli with mushrooms. The bread is very good and artisan. They bring olives included. The glass of Malbec was very generous. Service very good too!
No comment

Beautiful dining room with glass ceiling. It's behind a hotel lobby which doesn't look great but keep walking. Service was top notch! My watermelon martini was so good I had two. I had lobster ravioli which was good but a small portion. I would go back when I'm in nyc again.
No comment
Service was great! But the appetizers were lack luster and the main courses were warm/borderline cold.. best part was the dessert, gelato with warm brownie.   Would not return for the price.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to this restaurant with friends. Service was great. Food was expensive but there was nothing really special about the food. Has a very aged and outdated feel to it, so if you're looking for a place to go and have fun with friends, definite not the place. But if you would like to treat your parents for their birthday, might be ok. Still wouldn't recommend.

One word: MEH.Came here on a Saturday evening, there were about 6 other people in the restaurant, and they told us that we have little over 1hr to eat bc there is an event after. However it took them 35min to put out 3 dishes, and the was mediocre at best (lamb chop sauce was too sweet); so I don't know why this restaurant deserves an average of 4.5 stars
Food and service was incredible!! Would definitely come back here next time I'm in NY 1000/10. Delicious, authentic food and the waiters were incredibly friendly!!
No comment

We came here late after the Halloween parade and they were kind enough to stay open for us to eat. The service was pleasant and prompt and the food was good. I enjoyed the table side pasta and the grappa. A fun and enjoyable experience.
No comment
Came here with 7 other friends and the waiters are super nice and the portions are HUGE! Absolutely amazing place

I ordered for delivery out and got the penne alla vodka. The portion size was very small and there was almost no sauce. Not worth $18 for the amount you get, at all. I recommend Protos pizza if you are ordering pasta in the area, unfortunately they were closed tonight which is why I had tried San Marino.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Slowest service. I got the rigatoni vodka, it was literally rigatoni noodles with tomato soup poured on top.

Fantastic.... We ordered the clams and octopus and it was excellent...then my wife ordered the lobster ravioli which had a heavenly sauce and I ordered the rib eye which was exquisite...excellent , fantastic food and service.. the drinks are plentiful and Danny our waiter was great... I strongly recommend this restaurant... great atmosphere great people and great food...we've been in New York for 4 days and this is the best restaurant we've been to....the chef is an artist!!!!
No comment

Went here for my daughter's birthday after looking for a place that does cheese wheel pasta.  The food, ambiance, and service was amazing.  I am so glad that we tried a new place which we know we will come back when we want Italian food.  Everything we tried had such nice flavor.  Definitely was a classy dinner at a great price.
No comment
We were staying in the hotel and decided to give this restaurant a try and so glad we did! It was delicious and our waiter, older Hispanic man was very attentive and polite.
We are still here and it is so good I just had to leave a review! Amazing service! Cute outdoor area! Such good food!

Angie, Danny and Gume are fantastic! I've been back   twice because of the service. The linguine and clam is delicious. The sauce is excellent! The drinks are excellent! I've been told many times that Italian food is top tier because Italians enjoy good food, drinks and fun company- San Marino definitely served all of it! Thanks for making my stay wonderful!
No comment
They cooka tha pizza with tha pasta and tha meatball mama Mia that's a spicya meatball
No comment

San Marino Ristorante is so fantastic, I wish I could hang here every single day. Great location, great ambiance. We had Chicken Parm. Absolutely magnificent. Team - one of nicest people I've seen who would always accommodate your needs. I certainly recommend that place and will be back.
Great quality Service and food , Atmosphere was welcoming and comfortable as well definitely comeing back !!
Great service.  Average food. But AMAZING bread.  There's a baker in that kitchen.  Olive bread and pizza crust outstanding.  Too bad other food doesn't measure up.

The first time we came here everything was wonderful so I made a reservation to go a second time. I confirmed with the restaurant we will be going a day prior to our reservation so everything seemed just fine and we were really looking forward to dining there again. Unfortunately on the day of our reservation the restaurant was closed at our reserved time, the front desk at the hotel (it is located inside a hotel) told us to wait so we waited for about an hour but no one seems to be there, and we tried calling but we can hear the phone ringing inside without anyone picking up. By this time the front desk did t want to bear any responsibility so they told us they never said the restaurant was going to open and they knew nothing about it. We had to go home hungry because all nearby restaurants were full and we didn't have any patience left after waiting an hour. Overall terrible experience I really hope the owner would notify us if they decide not to open. If you made a reservation there make sure to call before you actually are on your way so you know they are open
The cheese plate was definitely the stand out dish for me. Solid pasta and pizza in with a better price tag than you usually find in the city.
What a nice surprise this restaurant!  Great food. And Angie from Albania behind the bar is very sweet.

It's fabulous how this restaurant is attached to the Four Points Sheraton Hotel - totally unexpected. The staff here is awesome and the food is promising. I stayed here for 6-7 days at the hotel and went here every night. I would recommend people who live and work in the area to visit and eat here as well.

I had one of the BEST meals in NYC tonight. I had Spaghetti Carbonara with Arugula Con Formaggio salad. After dinner they brought me a small sifter of Homemade Sambuca!  Truly Amazing!  I will eat here every time in the Soho area of NYC!

Good to come in this restaurant . Good food and service and very good for our business . Private room you can have lunch and work with my team.

Enjoyed an amazing prefix and open bar with a large group of friends. Cheers to San Marino for really making the night.
Amazing. Please go here. The service was incredible from the moment we walked in and the food was delicious. From the bread and olives, the salad, up to the pasta arrabiata. Will definitely be back!
No comment

San Marino continues to be my "go to" place when inclement weather forces me to stay overnight at a SoHo hotel. The food is outstanding! My current favorites are the grilled salmon and the grilled calamari - perfect for a low carb diet. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is friendly. If you order carry out like I do, please make sure to tip the staff. They're working hard!

Simply one of the best. Went ages ago with out-of-towners and was doing a staycation in soho so stumbled upon and was so happy to find again. The wait staff is attentive, helpful, and kind. The food is traditional and authentic with generous portions. The waiter helped us select a wine and dessert to complement our meal. We had a blast, never feeling rushed and very fair prices. Don't miss out on this spot to WOW yourself or anyone you bring!
No comment

This place is a hidden gem. The food and customer service here is amazing. Riddi and Gumo are an amazing team. I'm in town on business and have had dinner here two days not because it was convenient to the hotel but because I wanted to eat here. I planned on having the same dish for dinner but tried something new and was pleasantly surprised.
One of my most favorite Italian places. The service is always nice and food is delicious. It is kid-friendly, our kids love their pizza. I recommend this place to many of my friends.
No comment

This is a fantastic restaurant that I happened on when visiting NYC. The service was amazing - my Mom can be a bit picky with wine and our server was extremely knowledgeable about which one she should order and even gave her two samples to try before she confirmed her order. Our water was always refilled and we were always asked if we wanted another round of drinks and whatnot. Our food was fantastic. Everyone (we had a party of seven) loved their meals and we all agreed that we would dine here again and recommend to friends. All of the workers were very friendly and welcoming. I would highly suggest going here!

No comment

This restaurant has decided not to follow COVID19 safety precautions. Our server was not wearing a mask and was repeatedly leaning over the table and breathing into our faces. Most of the staff, including someone who appeared to be the manager, were either not wearing masks at all, or were wearing their masks incorrectly. Additionally, big reusable menus were being passed from table to table without any sort of sanitation. As an FYI on ambiance - this restaurant is attached the Four Points Sheraton hotel and is partially located in the hotel lobby. I would advise folks to go across the street and visit one of the many great Soho restaurants for a better experience.

This place is absolutely wonderful. Our servers Arby and Dejan were great. They were extremely knowledgeable and attentive to every single thing. Service was extremely accurate and fast. Their recommendations were by far phenomenal. We were also seated right away.

I stayed here at the Four Point Hotel that's attached to this restaurant for three nights, and had breakfast and dinner here every day during my stay. The waitstaff is so on top of their game, very professional and friendly. They food itself was very delicious and fresh. I would highly recommend to any and everyone!

Solid Italian restaurant. For our appetizer we had the calamari which was very fresh and a nice tomato-based sauce and the baby arugula salad which was basic and nothing to call home about. The complimentary items (focaccia bread and fried zucchini slices) were unfortunately stale, but when we mentioned the issue with the bread, the waiter had the chef prepare a fresh batch of bread (which was not amazing but at least not stale).  For our main we had the squid ink frutti di mari pasta and the branzino, which were both excellent and were the stand-out items. We ended with an espresso and sambuca, both tasty. The service was pretty good until the end when it took quite a while to close out with the bill. I should mention that the tables were socially distanced and masks were worn - so covid precautions are being taken. Notably and this has nothing to do with the food or service, there were so many mosquitos in the area where we sat - I now have 6 bites on my feet and ankles...

Been here a couple of times, great place with delicious food, service and drink list. I had the Fettucinne with lamb Ragu and it was outstanding. Prices are very reasonable for the area ! Strongly recommend this place !
I had a beautiful time over here, food is delicious and the service is perfect, people are friendly as F

Fantastic place to enjoy a fabulous meal! Top notch food, drinks, & service! 5 star service to the group I was with by RB & Nina!! We always frequent this establishment when staying at the hotel. Love it here!
No comment
No comment

Ambiance was Great.  Staff was very ice and friendly.   We started with 3 amazing apps.  Fresh mozzarella. Stuffed eggplant and pasta made in a parm cheese wheel.  3 different chicken Dishes and a pasta for dinner then we had espresso cappuccino and dessert just amazing we will come back again

I got the ravioli, which was quite nice. There was complimentary bread, olive, and zucchini (liked this a lot) as well. The restaurant was mostly empty and I got a ton of mosquito bites while sitting outside, but the service was pleasant.
Their food is so delicious. Really recommend this place. Mario is so friendly and we had a great time.
I definitely love this restaurant. Great Italian food , excellent service and such a quite and beautiful place . Have been in many Italian restaurants but this is definitely my favorite one.
Incredible and fresh food. Good portion size and reasonably priced. Every dish was delicious. Excellent hospitality. Would definitely come back.

We stayed at a hotel above the restaurant and ordered Linguine alle Vongole and Tortellini soup for room service. It was a nice surprise. Food was delicious. Tortellini soup was just like what we had in Bologna.

No comment

Flavors of the old country! San Marino is very friendly and very good food! Service is just right. They checkin as needed and the food was piping hot! The tortellini in brodo had great flavor. My wife has the chicken scarpariella was a large portion. The food had plenty of garlic and veggies and chicken. The linguini with clam sauce had so many clams that the linguini was not visible. A must eat place!

What a lovely surprise this gem of a restaurant turned out to be! I had to work on Christmas night, so we were looking for someplace to eat nearby ... and one block away, we found San Marino. We were welcomed like old friends. The service was attentive without being intrusive, and extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of the food and drink. And the food, from the three delicious types of bread with beautifully grassy olive oil to the perfectly composed entrées to the delightful desserts, was spectacular. We look forward to returning soon.
This restaurant, hidden in Soho is one of my favorite italian restaurants Downtown. Great service and good for special occasions! Try the spaghetti here!

This was a great little stop for a Lobby restaurant. It has its separate entrance outside as well walking through a small open courtyard right next to the Four Points Lobby in SoHo on Charlton. You walk into a bar area that is very very tiny with about six seats at the bar. It is a very bright room with little if any character. I walked in & the bartender was not very friendly or attentive. She was a younger girl with three customers at her bar and seemed quite overwhelmed and completely not interested that a customer walked in the door. I walked past her and towards the back of the restaurant which is where the other two rooms are located. You walk into the next one which again is quite bright but darker appointments were in the room and where the service station is. I was greeted immediately by several male servers who were very very attentive and friendly. I decided to sit in the back room which is where all the character is. The tables in that room are linen-covered and candle-lit. the lighting was subdued and quite nice. The mudic playing was very indicative of the Sinatra era. The room was darker in styling and very italianate. It has a glass ceiling with a large Center chandelier so that was pretty interesting. When it came time to order, the food was VERY good. It came out in a reasonable amount of time. They definitely lean towards a little more fine dining but nothing over the top and I would describe the atmosphere as upscale casual. I had some tortellini in brodo and it was very well prepared and extremely tasty. Followed by a fish oriented dinner of red snapper & jumbo shrimp sauteed wonderfully in a lemon wine sauce with a small side of spaghetti. It was very flavorful and well presented. A variety of breads came out during the meal as well as separate complimentary dishes of assorted olives and sauteed zicchini to enjoy. There is a bar and open wine list which is also quite inexpensive and you can definitely find what you're looking for. Pricing was very reasonable and the atmosphere was okay so I'd say this is a great spot to just pop in if you're wandering around Soho and looking for something Italian. Mario was one of the attendees to my table & he was over and beyond attentive to all needs while i dined.
No comment
No comment
Just finished an amazing lunch! Service was exceptional. Server made great recommendations and everything came out well prepared and oh so tasty ! Definitely will return.
No comment

Was here today with my wife had such amazing experience!!! Mario was a great host he recommended me lamb shank witch was very tender and very well complimented with the risotto my wife had salmon witch was also very good..Thank you for the wonderful meal as well as that homemade sambuka ... Definitely well be back !!
Wonderful restaurant, didn't get to try the food though, I'm sure it would've been good. The water was DELICIOUS. Bathrooms are a little hard to find. Overall, 10/10.

Staying at the hotel and decided to have dinner at the restaurant, San Marino. What an excellent decision that was to be. We had the shrimp app with  cannelloni beans, one word - excellent. Mario, our head waiter /Sommelier was the best, he made great recommendations and made our dinning experience a memorable one. We hade the fruitti del mare with linguini (linguini was a sub for spag .) I highly recommend this Italian restaurant.

This is a great hidden gem. A friend and I were looking for somewhere nice and quick for lunch. We did not know what to expect since this was inside of a hotel but it was well worth it. The food was delicious, and the service was Outstanding. From the bread and olives at the start of the meal, to the waitstaff, quick service, and Chef Enzo coming by to make sure we enjoyed everything. I do not live in NYC, but I will definitely be back!!!
This restaurant has great food and great service! Would definately come again! Good italian food in NYC.

So, the fact that they are next to the hotel and will deliver to your room is amazing after a long ride into the city. The chicken parmigiana with spaghetti is great and can feed 3 people easily! Looking forward to trying more items on the menu very soon.

New York city's hidden jewel!! I really shouldn't leave a good review in fear of when I return I won't be able to get in! Great food....great service!! The definite jewel here though is the bartender, Jasmine.....THE BEST!!

I was here as a party of 12. Excellent atmosphere, food is spectacular, not pricey. Staff is very friendly and the owner was present in the dining area 100% of the time making sure the guest are taken care of. It was as good as it could get and I don't feel like I am exaggerating.

San Marino was an exciting experience! The staff was so nice and made sure all our needs were met. It was a birthday party and it couldn't have come out any better! I'm so happy with this place, will definitely come back either just for dinner or another party. The waiter, Mario was very knowledgeable and also very on point. Overall a great experience! Thanks San Marino!

What an excellent  Italian restaurant... I had dinner after my meeting and it surprised me !!!! Such delicious home made authentic food.. My waiter Mario was the best waiter out there !!! He described the specials to me with such knowledge and I ended up ordering the lamb chops with port wine sauce and they where cooked perfect and tasted great defiantly coming back !!!!

Olive bread, Linguini vongole in red sauce, tortellini soup and some chianti. All things are very good. This place is a hidden gem

Classy and friendly atmosphere, the staff was amazing the food was even better. I beliebe my servers name was Mario, let me tell you that he made my night very funny and class act guy. The food was on point and the drinks too. Definitely recommend this place for anyone to go to!

If you're staying in the area (or better yet, at the four points Sheraton that this restaurant is located in), this is a must visit. Nesteled in the rear of the lobby, the restaurant is both affordable and delicious. The entrees were rich and flavorful and  staff was extremely attentive and always kept our glasses full. We were blown away by our server, Mario - he displayed great knowledge of the menu and of the wine list. Bottom line - definitely stop in for some authentic Italian food and enjoy!
No comment

We had our rehearsal dinner at San Marino, as well as a breakfast after the wedding (we were married nearby and guests were staying at the hotel).  The private room in the back was perfect for our events and Sammy was very patient with me while we planned all the details.  The staff was wonderful and food was good.  We had a buffet for both events which allowed for our guests to mingle and get to know each other.  They set up a bar in the adjoining room and gave us the entire space for ourselves.  Thanks Sammy and staff!!!

Absolutely amazing second time at this place the food and service are outstanding the wait staff they will go out of there way jut to make sure that everyone is happy with there food and service not mention the after dinner drinks on the house the grappa was the key will definitely be back

What a find ! Was at the business meeting on Hudson street and ask for a suggestion to have Italian nearby.Would never have thought to walk into this place located at Four Points Soho Hotel! But it was awesome . Great feel ambiance, awesome service,fantastic food.Linguine with calamari was delicious,Tiramisu was fresh home made fantastic ! Would definitely recommend

No comment

Came here over the weekend to celebrate my father's birthday.  I had read all the positive reviews and was looking forward to trying this place out.  I was not disappointed.  The minute we walked in we were greeted with such warmth and hospitality.  The food was amazing!  It's been a long time since I've been to place that had such great dishes.  I will be telling all my friends to try this place out.  My family and I are planning to make this place our regular go to when we dine out.  Thank you San Marino!!
No comment

A hidden gem! From service to food, we were well taken care of by Tony and the rest of the San Marino team! It all started with the Wednesday happy hour at the attached Four Points Sheraton hotel. Tony was so engaging and knowledgeable and his invitation to dinner was something we couldn't pass up the following night of our stay. We barely chose our own dishes, as through sincere conversation, Tony took charge and made a variety of delicious recommendations that we couldn't help but devour. From the burrata and procuitto appetizer, penne and sausage first course, and veal with eggplant rolitini to the amazing Amorone wine and variety of after dinner specialty libations, Tony and even the owner Sammy certainly made us feel like royalty. Looking forward to our next dining experience at San Marino!

We had dinner here last night.  What a wonderful surprise. This was by far the best dinner in a long time.   The food was great and the staff made it even better.  Both my husband's dinner and mine was excellent from the salads the main course to desert.  You are missing out if you don't go here.

I am belatedly writing a post for a birthday dinner hosted at San Marino in December 2018. My friends and I had a wonderful experience at the restaurant. We were delighted by the beautiful room, table, delicious dinner and desserts. There is a private room which is great for conversations and celebrations. A big thank you to Arbi (manager) and the San Marino team for helping create a special and memorable evening!

Surpringly good for hotel restaurant. Sorry to say I was not expecting much at Sheraton hotel restaurant, but it was actually better than the Italian dinner I had in Soho the night before! I thoroughly enjoyed the penne  arrabiata. Quiet outdoor cafe atmosphere made for a great night! Guess this proves you can't judge a book by its cover!!

Went here on valentines day. The food was okay, the veal and steak were my favorite. The fingerling potatoes were totally not what I expected, very dry and plain. The service at the restaurant was good, the waiter was very pleasant. However, the bar attender at the bar was very strange. The drinks that she made were even worse. The drink prices very, $12 at the bar $14 at the table. I started off with bloody mary (I was a bit sick and its the best to drink for a cold) - at first I got a weird look , followed by a horrible bloody mary. I am nowhere near being a bar attender, but I can make a better tasting and looking one at home. While having dinner I had some martinis (which were a bit better but not worse the price whatsoever). Skip the drinks and the bar (drink wine if you want something alcoholic) and wait for a table in the hall way if you have to.

Excellent food at a modest price point. Great appetizers, entrees, dessert, wine, service. Attentive staff with on point recommendations. Will return!! Loved the pappardelle with mushroom. Loved the cheesecake.

Five star because for quality food and good service for NYC standard is way good . Fried zucchini  olives three different bread and complimentary Sambuca . Dinner for two in meatpacking cost us almost double two weeks ago.

The food was absolutely delicious and the service was amazing. Staff was always coming around to check on us, and the after dinner grappa was amazing. Felt like royalty . I m definitely going back with my family
No comment

Delicious delicious Italian food. As the other reviewers said , this place really does a great job on making you feel like at home.the waiters are so cordial to you and really go out of their way to make sure you have a good experience .
Mario is the best!!!  I stop by to dine here each time I visit NYC!  Thanks, Mario for delivering stellar service!

San Marino is an excellent Restaurant not only for dinner with friends but also for working lunches & private corporate events. The event planner, Alda, is amazing and always so helpful. She ensures that our needs are fully met! The service is always great! I highly recommend the Chicken Parm followed by the Tiramisu. They make it on premises and it's by far the best I've had! Also, don't forget to check out be outdoor space, it's great!
No comment

I saw great reviews on Yelp and other websites and was making a reservation for a Friday for 6 at 8 PM. I was happy to find that San Marino was available ---but upon going there there is a reason why. This restaurant is in the hotel lobby of a Sheraton Four Points. It's not one of those "gems" that happen to be attached to a hotel. It is truly just a bland hotel lobby restaurant. The atmosphere is horrible and it was basically empty on a Friday night. The food is fine -- nothing to write home about. And if you are eating with elderly, it might be the right place since it is basically empty and you can easily hear other people speak. But this is not a trendy NYC restaurant. It was embarrassing for us to have taken our out of town guests here!

I've only ordered online and had pizza delivered and it's the best pizza I've had in New York City. I can't wait to actually go to the restaurant but their delivery times are really quick and the pizza is really top notch.

We ate here recently.  They took our reservation for 14 people on a Sunday night at 9:00, which was surprising.  The wait staff was very attentive and professional, but the kitchen was quite slow.  The food was pretty good once we got it.  But the restaurant is in the back of a pretty shabby hotel.  It got 4.5 stars in open table, but I would say that was overrated.  The rest room was in the basement next to some equipment, and it looks very bare and unpleasant.  It was a little depressing, not the greatest decor.  They should tell you that it's in a shabby hotel....
No comment

Chose to dine at San Marino for my birthday this year and I was impressed. The food is exquisite and just plain delicious. The portion size was large enough that we had our leftovers for dinner the following evening. The ambience is intimate yet relaxing without being too bourgeois and the service is top notch. Mario was attentive and friendly as well as the other staff who made sure to cater to our needs, including requests for more sides. I definitely recommend San Marino.

Good enough food. I had a chicken dish in a white wine sauce with vegetables. The service was very nice. I was here on business and dining alone and was treated no different. As a former waitress I know it's not every servers favorite to have a party of one. I enjoyed my wine and my water was never empty. Overheard the next table talking about how much they enjoyed their dinners.

We enjoyed our experience so much!  The whole wait staff was so attentive, but more importantly the food was divine!  I had the pumpkin ravioli & it melted in my mouth.  My husband had the chicken parmesan & it was such a big portion, but he managed to eat the whole thing!  So perfectly prepared.  Can't wait to return for our next meal.
No comment
Everyone in my party loved their meals and the appetizers we shared were great as well. Our waiter Tony had us laughing and provided a great atmosphere. Highly recommended!
Food - VERY tasty.  Price - incredibly reasonable for a hotel, let alone a hotel in NYC!  Service - Troy our waiter was tremendous!

if you are looking for a refined elegant private unique place for a birthday party, this is the place!! I had a surprise birthday party for my husband and the owner Sammy accommodated us with everything, answering my emails every time and made sure everything was as I asked for!! What a fantastic place, excellent food and service!! Mario was absolutely amazing, professional and helpful! We had all our needs made!! Definitely will come back for another party!! All our friends and family members asked me how do I know about the place and complimented the food and the service! Thank you so much, Sammy and Mario!!

We came to this restaurant to grab a quick meal before our flight back to Chicago.  The service was really attentive and Marious (sp?) made sure we were well taken care of and made us feel welcome.  The food was good, and even finished our left overs when we arrived back home to Chicago.
No comment
No comment

We got into the Four Points late so I decided we'd disobey the rule never to eat in the hotel restaurant. We were even more apprehensive when we realized we were the only patrons. What a pleasant surprise! We ordered Pollo Sammarinese and Pollo Con Limone e Olive. These were generous portions of very juicy white meat strips, lightly breaded and with excellent, flavorful sauces, cooked to order and served piping hot. The julienne veggies were perfectly half-crisp and delicious. The pan-roasted rosemary potatoes were among the best I've had, with fresh rosemary crisped just right in olive oil. The one server was very helpful and attentive. Prices were reasonable for the area, which is counter to my usual experience with in-hotel restaurants.
No comment

Food and service were very good and the price was reasonable.  They could also take us on a busy night with graduations in the city.  Construction in the area, so could be better setting, but not their fault, and it is all for the better.  We were very pleased with our experience.

So I came in today and got some food at the restaurant thought it would be good got told the wrong price try to ask for refund and manager jesse didn't give it to me so very disappointed with the service wouldn't tell you to eat here if it was the last place on earth

My wife and I spend several weeks per year at the Four Points Soho Village while on business in New York City. We love the hotel and its restaurant, San Marino. We continue to choose it for its convenience, great food and a dedicated team of servers. Thank you Jay, Guan, Jasmine, Marius, Alda, Tony and Sammy for great meals and the great service you provide.

One of my favorite Italian place to eat in soho. I came here with my wife and we had a glass of wine it was very nice. The waiter there help us choose what to eat. I had the seafood pasta it was very good and my wife had a steak and we share it. Me and wife had a perfect night without the kids very nice restaurant. I suggest lots of people to dine here

Kind of a random spot attached to a hotel (I was wary as I was seated in the courtyard out front), but the service was really great, and the food was delicious, too. There isn't a ton in the immediate area, so if you find yourself around here I'd recommend stopping in for some pasta.

We checked into Four Season hotel for independence day weeked. We were hunger and decided to ordered Pizza and a bottle wine. These were generous portions of very juicy slides. Also, I remember this guy Miguel who was our server, he was very helpful and attentive. Prices were reasonable for the area, which is counter to my usual experience with in-hotel restaurants. Employee like Miguel make our trip priceless.
Came here on a friday night, service was incredibly slow. Granted there was a party, but no one else was in the restaurant as it was late. Appetizers took 30 minutes.

Being attached to the sheraton isn't the best selling point, but the place was suprisingly good and the service was attentive and made good recommendations. I sat on the outside area which provided some standard seats, while the inside had more of the traditional italian restaurant feel to it. Had a solid Minestrone soup to start and ended with an eggplant parmigiana that had a very good sauce cooked into it. Prices for an italian place in SoHo were more then reasonable, would return here for sure.

Small italian restaurant. Entrance is in the lobby of the Sheraton hotel, so a bit hard to find. Literally only one other table when I went to eat on a Sunday night. I ordered an appetizer of veal and a main dish of pasta - both were very good, but portions were a little small. The restaurant tries to put on a "classy feel", but the flat screen TV's playing football kind of take away from that. Service was a bit slow considering there were two waiters for two tables. Food is a bit pricey, which is expected since the restaurant is in downtown SoHo.

I organized a work dinner for approximately 40 people. Sammy and his staff were very accommodating. The food was fantastic, and all my colleagues had a fantastic time. Highly recommended for a large group! Also, the room is perfect for this, and the skylight brings in some natural light.

Fantastic dinner.  The food was excellent as was the wine.  Really liked the calamari salad and saltimbocca.  The branzino was also great.  Service was also excellent, very friendly staff.

My salmon pasta was delicious!  I am staying in the Sheraton 4 Points hotel: the San Marino restaurant is on the property.  I worked very late and decided to grab a quick bite.  Wow! Great pasta.  I ate in the patio - not so pretty - but the service was attentive.  I hope this restaurant gets the traffic it deserves.

We had dinner the other night and we could not be more satisfied.Great place for private parties, delicious food and the service is superb.I highly recommend it to anybody who wanna have a great time and great food.

Held  a morning after the wedding breakfast buffet here April 13, 2014.  Staff was great., food was great and the room was quite nice.  They allowed us to stay as long as we wanted and enjoy relaxing and celebrating .  Would recommend anyone staying in the attached hotel try San Marino out.  Other guests said the lunch and dinner food was excellent. Thanks for a wonderful time.
Got delivery..meh. I guess it was good. To me pretty average. BTW delivery driver asked me for a bottle of water.. lol hilarious.
Not bad for a hotel restaurant. Arugula salad was decent and the chicken special was good, although the chicken was a little tough. The staff was incredible.
Nice little spot.  I had a light lunch, Shrimp fagiole & sat outside on the patio...
No comment

My wife and I were so lucky to find this great restaurant before a concert at the City Winery. The atmosphere is perfect whether you chose to eat inside or outside. The food and service were both outstanding! The prices for the food and wine were extremely reasonable, especially for such a wonderful Italian restaurant in New York City. Try it. You will be glad you did!
Awesome place with a beautiful ceiling  and the service was phenomenal but most important the food was delicious.

Great restaurant with a very nice bar. Service was very friendly and I would go back again. Decor was worm and inviting . We started with fried calamari in a tamarind sauce . The taste?? ... Delicious . And than me and my husband share a NY Stake which was very big and was cooked exactly as we want it, medium well. We also shared same sides like roasted potatoes and Broccoli. You easy can understand that the chef was very talented and the food amazing . We didn't have a lot of time to have a drink in the bar but for sure next time we will.

Had lunch here with my two friends, and we were greeted immediately and seated in a beautiful dining area, with a very unique atmosphere with paintings and beautiful plants. My friend eats gluten free and the server immediately made a bunch of recommendations that all sounded delicious, and as for myself I had some delicious raviolis that had an amazing sauce, and we had a bottle of wine between the three of us. The service was fantastic, the food was so good that we were using the bread to finish any sauce left on the plat, and a great selection of wine. All together was a great dining experience, and that is what I enjoy the most, next to the amazing food!

I heard about this place from a friend. Just had a delicious dinner. I had a Caesar salad with a delicious dressing, just the right portion. For main course I had the Pollo Etna which had the right spices and the most tender meat. The service was amazing as the waiters kept checking in on the table and brought the courses in just in time. Great experience and food. Will definitely come back to try more in the menu.
Service was excellent.  I had the Papperdelle and the combination of hand cut pasta, mushrooms and goat cheese was amazing.
No comment
The food was wonderful! Very friendly staff! If you want great Italian food, this is it! Pleasant surprise in SoHo.

I was visiting New York for business from California to meet a new customer in SoHo. I let my new client pick the restaurant,  what a great choice! None of the 4 of us had ever been to this restaurant before, but we will be back next time I am in town.  From the attentive waiter/ owner to the timing of the service, all was excellent. I had the linguini with cream sauce and salmon, which was great!  The pasta was perfectly cooked as well as the salmon, and all at a great price!  4 of us with 2 appetizers, 4 entrees, and a couple rounds of drinks for less than $150, amazing meal at a great price in NYC!

Don't be fooled by the fact that it's a hotel restaurant. The food here was delicious and really affordable. Portion size is huge and the customer service was amazing. I love the homemade grappa at the end! Great for groups!

Was staying at the hotel and went there in a  pinch, by default. GREAT food and excellent service. Dull surroundings. But everything else was fab. We were the only ones there on a Friday night around 7:00.
We had a great time drinking wine and eating the fantastic Pizza with fresh mozzarella!! Definitely want to go back for the brick oven Pizza

We hosted a dinner for 12 people in this lovely restaurant and the food and service were just excellent.  There were three large parties like ours in the restaurant that night and each one was able to use and enjoy their own space.  The staff did an excellent job.  All the food was served together.  We thoroughly enjoyed our time and would happily return.

Very satisfied.... Happy I found this place just in time for great weather they have a beautiful outdoor seating area and too top it all off the food is amazing and the people are great highly recommend SanMarino ....ohhh and one more thing the cocktails are amazing

Went here with my family for holiday dinner and loved it. The wait staff was very attentive and helpful when ordering. The food was absolutely fabulous. It is also a byo which is always good. I highly recommend it and would come back.
Great service and terrific food! Highly recommended, large and open establishment.

I had dinner at this lovely cosy Italian restaurant. I loved the dining room, casual, chic and romantic. The service was quick and efficient but most of all the food was delicious to the last bite. The staff were friendly. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

Went here in the afternoon with my family, and had a great experience. The food was absolutely delicious. The manager was very professional and a great guy. My kids also loved it, the food, the waiters display of gratitude, and the atmosphere in the restaurant was amazing. Would come here again with my family and friends.

We had dinner at the restaurant last night based on some of the great reviews. The five stars were all deserved, so much so that I activated a Yelp account just to write this review. My parents came from northern Italy so risotto was a staple at special occasions. I also enjoy making it at home. I decided to order it for us as an appetizer and they obliged me as I kind of worry about risotto and didn't want it to be my main - just in case... It knocked my (our) socks off. It was perfectly creamy and the radicchio and arugula flavours were unbelievable. The last time I was blown away by a dish was a plate of pasta at a small neighbourhood restaurant in a suburb of Rome.  Hats off. Oh, and all the other food was great - Etna chicken in a balsamic reduction, the Sammarinese chicken, the artichoke and mushroom appetizer even the olive bread... My wife and I have eaten at a lot of restaurants in many places and it is great to chance upon such a wonderful spot in a "burb" of NYC.

LOVE SAN MARINO - from the ambiance to the amazing cuisine to the service. All I can say is San Marino is a warm delicious in so many ways Italian restaurant. They really are a traditional 'old school' Italian restaurant. From the vanilla lighting to the attention to every detail of comfort to the DELICIOUS variety of their menu they PLEASE!  The service is great and warm and they really want to make you happy and satisfied. I travel to NY many weeks in the year and always stay at the Soho Four Points so I may enjoy the comforts of San Marino. The owner Sammy is very hospitable, friendly and really wants to please every customer - in a genuine way! I have been there more than 20 times and any time I go to NY I am ALWAYS sure to go back. It is comforting like home and I love having a nice Italian dinner there (or even drinks and an appetizer). Attention to detail is superb. They want to make you happy so if there is something you need or want just speak up and they will make it happen! Enjoy!

No comment
Excellent !! Service was great and the food was delicious! I loved my experience at this beautiful restaurant!

The pork belly buns were nice but they are smokey in flavor and sous vide'd so they are nice and tender.  Not a big fan of that ham flavor but this was good. The brussels sprouts were flavorful and did the trick to get a veggie fix.  Pass on the bing.  It is nothing more than naan and some kind of sweet chili jam. The meati nuggets were a tad spicy and perhaps should have been made with the sweet chili jam from the bing.  My favorite was the crispy potatoes with the notes of sour cream and crunchiness.  It was comforting and tasty.  Overall, the bites were a smorgsbord of ideas and flavors, some tasty where you want to eat the whole thing yourself and not share with your companions (e.g. potatoes), some where 1 piece was perfection (pork belly bun), some where you can't eat but 1 piece (meati nuggets) and some where the description and expectation were too different (bing) and the deconstruction dessert which was a disaster in presentation but you still ate it.  Go here for the view with a group. Picnic tables exude fun with friends but may not translate as fabulous food unfortunately.

No comment

They sat my boyfriend and I right away. No reservation was needed that Saturday afternoon. We ate off of the restaurant menu which is a great value because it includes a drink and two courses for $45 a person. I had the best iceberg salad of my life. Typically iceberg salads have no flavor but this one did. I really like the sesame on it. The Palmer was a lemonade and I love how green it was. Really yummy. The waffle was average. It could have use more apple and more flavor. My boyfriend had the chicken burger which was a really nice portion. Feel free to ask for a knife and fork for that burger!Service was attentive but not overbearing. Beware that regular prices are expensive but hey it's Manhattan!

Food was amazing! Highly recommend the caico e pepe rice cakes, spicy rice cakes, pork belly buns, and caoullote sizzling steak! For drinks the stay good was a 10/10 the surfer Rosa was okay but gave a bit of a spicy kick towards the end which I didn't think agreed with the menu options I had ordered. Atmosphere: cute trendy and intimate place. Indoor bar seating with a few tables and outside they have a plexiglass enclosure with heated lamps to keep guest comfortable in the winter months. Very friendly and respectful wait staff. Impeccable restrooms. Most of you can't beat the views across the water.

I was really looking forward to eating at Momofuku Ssam Bar but unfortunately had a very disappointing experience. I've eaten at his restaurant in Las Vegas and have always had an incredible experience. With that being said, the food was ok but the service was awful. We made a 9:30 year reservation and received a call around 8:30 saying that we could come by earlier. We weren't able to so showed up a few minutes before our 9:30 reservation. We were rudely greeted by the hostess who seemed to be extremely upset that we had shown up so late (at 9:28 for our 9:30 reservation). I understand people want to call it a night early sometimes but don't offer reservations at this time if you're not capable of delivering on the David Chang experience. So once they begrudgingly sat us, the waitress comes up and says kitchen is about to close so you have one shot to put in all your food. There's definitely a more customer-service appropriate way to say that...anyways we ordered the ssam set which was overall very good. Drinks were also solid. The meats were all good and I really enjoyed the salad. The raw fish dish, hamachi I think, was a little fishy but the bing and salad made up for it. The meats were all tasty and the star of the meal. We ordered the oysters which were pretty standard but the $55 cacio e pepe rice cakes were not worth the price tag. You could tell throughout the meal that they were trying to rush us so they could get out of there, which really deterred from the experience. Once again, I know everyone is tired and overworked but we're pretty low maintenance so I just ask for a decent experience when we're paying to go to a nice restaurant. The subpar service really put me off to coming back to this restaurant. Would not recommend it unless there's a turnaround and more focus on service.
No comment
No comment
Hit n miss on the dishes.  The best was the fries that came with the ribeye, the oysters, and the rice cakes.  The bad was the fish, prawns, and shrimp toast.
Great views, friendly service and tasty food. Awesome place for a nice dinner by the water! Highly recommend reservations, always packed. Good variety of drinks and food!
No comment

I had brunch with a group of 6 here on a weekend. The wait was about 10 minutes. The staff were all very nice. The drink menu was impressive. We were all very satisfied  with our drinks. The galbi steak bowl was good, but not the best I've ever had. I've had a lot better for less than $39 so it was definitely overpriced. I would visit again for its location and drinks, but would probably not dine too frequently.

Didn't eat a full meal here but a group of 4 of us stopped by for pre dinner drinks and apps. Drinks were good - good balanced flavor profiles and decent amount of alcohol (not too strong either). Docked a star for the size of the apps. The ricotta with chili oil was great but the accompanying bread was TINY and asking for more bread was several dollars extra which seemed excessive.
No comment

I have mixed feelings about this new iteration of Momofuku Ssam Bar. I was a big fan of the old location and appreciated how intimate it was and how it reflected the David Chang swagger of the other earlier Momofuku restaurants. That vibe is nowhere to be found in the new location. It feels like an overpriced tourist trap geared toward people who have a lot of money to spend, want to dabble in some gateway Korean food (and/or perhaps are not comfortable with venturing to K-town), and want to see and be seen. It looks like it was designed for social media posts. That being said, the food was decent. Our group participated in the full Ssam tasting menu and liked all of the dishes. Nothing was exceptionally memorable for me other than the salad (randomly). All of the dishes were very "safe" and not terribly exciting, but they were well executed. The service was good until the end, when we were asked to leave because they had to "free up the table," even though all of the large tables around us were unoccupied. One other observation that I found to be somewhat interesting (as an Asian) was that I didn't see any Asians among the many staff members who were working there the night we went. I find that unusual for  an Asian restaurant, but perhaps this just happened to be case the night we went. Ultimately, I doubt I will return to Ssam because it just feels like a "new Coke" version of the old location, but I do think the overall experience would be enjoyable for most people.
No comment

Excellent food. Excellent service and friendly. Great low lighting. We got the back menu option of $100 a plate for a course meal to be prepared right in front of us. Fun! The apps and starters were some of the most flavorful dishes. This is the kind of place you sit down and slowly eat and savor. Loved it.
