This place is AMAZING! Wonderful, hole-in-the-wall  restaurant with delicious drinks, desserts, and dishes! Had the nasi lemak (which was only $6!!!) and the special of the day, sting ray in banana leaves! The nasi lemak was light and flavorful and the sting ray meat was tender and paired delicately with okra and string beans. For dessert, we got the layered pastry and the pandan cake. The pastry had a cinnamon and caramel flavoring, although the texture was more hard and dry whereas the pandan was so perfectly chewy and delicious without being too sweet! The white coffee was also great - not too bitter, very smooth, and quite creamy! It's a tiny place though so there's not much seating!

Are you f'ing kidding me? After so many years, I finally found a legit Maylasian cusine in 'Murica! This place has all the local dishes served exactly like the way I remembered when I spent months in KL. The owners are friendly and price is reasonable. If you were wondering if you should check this out, definitely DO it!
Very cute! Casual Malaysian coffee shop/food spot...ordered the nasi lemak which was great and definitely recommend. Order at the counter so good for a quick bite.

I have dined at kopitiam multiple times but this is my last. I tried the rendang and while it comes with a good amount of beef the sauce tastes super water downed and not thick at all. I also had a fish ball soup but they forgot it and it took a long time for me to get my order. The person who cleaned off the table after he told me to sit there was very brash and rude. Also I almost fell outside because their steps had a broken support piece
No comment

I've gone a few times now. The experience is pretty consistent: The food is amazing, service is horrible. The two times I ate with someone else, our food came out 5-10 minutes apart from each other. I would recommend you order takeout or delivery. Make sure you don't skip the drinks and dessert.

Food was delicious, except for one major problem. We ordered a soup, but there were no spoons to eat it with. If you're running a restaurant, it's imperative that you provide utensils so the food can actually be enjoyed. We waited for about 20 minutes while our soup got cold after initially asking for spoons. When I asked a 2nd time, they told me it was a busy day and the spoons were still in the wash. I was just about ready to offer to wash a dirty spoon myself so I could eat my now cold soup. The spoons eventually came out, and the staff brought out a dessert to apologize for the wait, but I was really disappointed by the service in the first place. A restaurant should have utensils so their patrons can enjoy their food.
No comment

Truly obsessed. I dream about the toast on a daily basis. The chilled spicy garlic noodles are also amazing. So many of their items are delicious, including the drinks! I love this place and the atmosphere is really cute, tho small and can get pretty crowded. Def highly recommend. One of my fave spots

I thought this place is pretty authentic. But considering one of the female cook with short hair and glasses didn't care with pregnant customer that needed to pee so bad and didn't have empathy at all to let her use their restroom making one customer let down. Plus the other better place Malaysian restaurant actually less pricey! So I wouldn't come back.

As a Malaysian myself I'm always on the hunt for authentic Malaysian cuisine - the first time I stepped foot into Kopitiam and had a bite of their sesame noodles and various kuih's I felt like I was instantly transported back home! The food here tastes super home-cooked and the menu has expanded significantly from their previous location. The interior decorations are cute! Note that portion size is Malaysian (aka a little bit smaller than what you'd expect a typical american portion to be) :)
No comment

Came here early in the morning w a friend to beat the lines but it still packs up quick! I'm a huge coffee person and had never had anything particularly Malaysian so this was a pleasant surprise. Not only was the coffee amazing but also the food was great and the kaya toast is a must!! Would come back again for sure
No comment

I can't say enough good things about Kopitiam. I love the sesame noodles. I get an extra bowl of noodles on the side (sometimes, depending on who is working, gets confused because it is not on the menu, but the owner always charges me the same price as an extra bowl of rice). The desserts are INCREDIBLE. I love the morning glory blue-stained sticky rice with grated coconut on top wrapped in banana leafs. Another favorite is the honeycomb cakes, which are super moist and rich. I opt for no sauce on these, though, which they usually drizzle all over the cakes--too sweet for me. The cakes are already sweet, and the sauce on top makes me feel like I'm going to be sick. The pandan coconut dessert is also very very good. As far as drinks go, I like the Michael Jackson one, but considering he was a pedophile, I think it's highly inappropriate and unappetizing (to say the least) to name a drink after him. This is my only criticism of Kopitiam. Do not name drinks after abusers, especially the most egregious ones who harm children. It valorizes and excuses the behavior of rapists and child molesters while ignoring the violence they enacted upon their helpless victims. Just gross.
No comment

Decided to try kopitiam because all the reviews we read overall 4-5 stars.we get into the line and look at the menu at the same time while we wait for our turn to order because it's pretty crowded.Food was alright,we try3-4 items from the menu,only nasi lemak that we really like,the rest of it not into our liking,especially the one with the pork meat in it,feels like we chewing rubbers.its just one of the menu only but the rest of it pretty decent.

Quick, cheap, authentic and really tasty. Would definitely go again. The chicken rice and oyster omelette were highlights from when I went. The chicken had great flavor and the hot sauces were great. The oyster omelette was a little runny, just how I like it, with lots of flavor.

Very happy they got a bigger beautiful location but it's somehow lost its charm food wise. You walk in place your order and are given a number and bus your own table. They expanded their menu to many noodle and appetizer options and serve a variety of drinks now as well. Me and girl friend got fishball soup, nasi lemak and pan mee (pounded flat noodles with anchovies). The nasi lemak was too salty for me. It consisted of a fried egg, some fried anchovies and coconut flakes and a tiny plastic sauce canister of curry sauce. Fish ball noodle soup wasn't anything to write home about, pan mee I didn't try but my girl friend said "this isn't that good" ... I noticed some cute things like salted egg wings that look interesting along with their signature blue rice in leaf and a dessert option of that as well, loved their rice noodle at their old spot so I'll def try this place again. Hoping it was just what we ordered
No comment

Great little Singapore breakfast place. What really sold me was the very nice cashier lady who gave me lots of advice for the nasi lemak and the white coffee. Brings me back to being in Singapore! It's a small and quaint little place. My fiancé also got the French toast which was good!
The bak kut teh soup was painfully oily and neither peppery nor herbal in flavor. I left most of it behind as it didn't make any sense forcing too much down. Definitely wasn't worth $8.
No comment

The coffee, or kopi, is so good. The food is made with love and the workers are always happy and friendly. I had the Nasi Lemak, which is anchovies on top of coconut rice. If you love anchovies, this is definitely the dish for you! Would go back again
It's not bad, but not great. Portion sizes are small and ingredients were cheap. Tastes good.
No comment

I've been in NY for 3 days, and this is by far the best dinner I had! I like their system because you would order the food first then sit at a table. This way if you want more food, you can always get up and order more. My bestfriend and I ordered the sesame chill oil noodles, chicken wings, and butter toast. Everything tasted amazing, it was well balanced and just the right amount of food for the both of us. Besides the food, the ambience of restaurant was perfect. The walls are colorful and filled with Malaysian and Singapore decors.

The food selections were very authentic and tastes great. Service was adequate and warm. Several selections on the menu were highlighted to us and we were properly reminded of certain special tastes. Took one star off for the ambiance. Even though it was midday time, the dining area was very dark, making delicious food hard to enjoy in my option. Otherwise it's a good place if you're into food.
