As someone who has tried a fair number of taco types, I confidently say this was one of the best tacos that I've ever had. I've been here once when visiting NYC and I only tried the carne asada taco, but it was so fresh and tasty and I can imagine other tacos should be good too.

Before I came to visit NYC with the family. I've already been doing my research of where I'd like to go to eat. I read so many reviews of Los Tacos No.1. Nothing but good reviews at that. I will say I was not disappointed.  I had tried the cactus street taco and OMG.  It was really good.  I was nervous at first because I have never had cactus before.  I can't wait for my next trip because I've had dreams of tacos from their.

Phenomenal place to get your taco fix. It was my first time trying no pal and those guys sure knew how to make it work. It's simple, it's authentic, it's quick, it's reasonably priced and it's freaking delicious. Don't miss this when in NYC.

Street tacos...YES!!!  There are several of these strategically places around the city.  I wasn't very hungry but had been wanting to try them and it was our last night.  Place was packed but the line moves fast.  Ordering is an adventure.  You wait in line to order and pay and are given a ticket.  You then have to fight the crowd and give your ticket to one of the cooks.  There they ask you how you want your tacos (con todo is with everything including guacamole).  Once they make your tacos you can eat them (STANDING UP) on the premises or to go.  I had one with chicken, one with steak, and one with pork.  The pork was my favorite and even came with some pineapple.  Tacos are amazing, authentic, and well worth the wait!

Although a bit pricey for tacos ($5 for 1), I would say it is worth the try when you are in the middle of Manhattan and looking for a quick bite to eat. The service was fast and the line moved along smoothly. I tried the carne asada tacos. The meat was tender and cooked just right. Pair it with salsa, onion, and cilantro and you'll have a tangy/savory flavor profile that is to die for! I definitely would go here again and only order the carne asada forever!!

A great spot to pick up a few tacos as you make your way through the concrete jungle. I managed to try all the meat options on the menu, and found them to be very tasty! Service was incredibly fast for the lunch hour rush. The traditional Mexican music sets the vibe well. I definitely recommend the pastor tacos!

Excellent tacos. When ordering you get to choose the protein or cactus, we had the carne asada and the pork (adobada, al pastor). You also get to choose flour or corn tortillas. Recommend getting corn tortillas for tacos.
Great Tacos, each time in NY have to get some! I prefer the adobados with everything!

So unexpectedly good!! For a chain this was so quick and delicious. The meat was so juicy. I tried steak, pork, and chicken. Chicken was my favorite surprisingly! Great flavors.
So yummy!!!! A friend told me to go check out this spot so I didn't and I'm glad i did.

Amazing tacos. Great spice and variety. I just find that they're very small for the price.

Service, location & kitchen are spotless. Fun and nice employees. Registrar kindly explained the menu as I wasn't familiar with some food and drinks. The kitchen staff making the tacos were fun to watch. Clean open kitchen. Great location at Times Square just a block away from many hotels. Not a bad choice for a quick healthy bite if you're staying in the area. However, I've simply had better tasting tacos in NYC, so I'm afraid I wouldn't be a repeat customer.

Eating here was so cool for being in New York I felt like I was in the motherland eating tacos ! Tacos were so good we ordered a pastor and asada tacos! The service was friendly and really fast and ambiance was so cool! I loved the tile bar tables and the detail of the place. Tacos are a little expensive but for it being where it's at it's worth it.

Too crowded, staff messed up order twice !even with ticket to follow. The place came highly recommended but i found it to be an overhyped taco. It was good, but I've had several places back home offer better (authentic) tacos and certainly without the chaotic atmosphere. We had the beef, chicken, pork, and cactus tacos. Only the pork were something special, so if trying it, I recommend that. I look forward to going home for some tacos now from our food trucks.

Going against the grain here a little bit, but my experience here was just a bit confusing. I got in line and ordered at the register, and seeing the multiple signs that say "no ticket, no taco", I gripped tightly onto my order ticket. After standing there for a while and seeing everyone else get their orders, I then realized that you had to give up your ticket to get your tacos. Which seemed to go against the signs everywhere, but I finally let go and picked up my meal. Since it was a late lunch, I wanted more than a single taco, so I went for the quesadilla, thinking that it would be just the right amount. It turned out to be just a regular taco with cheese - a quesa-taco, but not an actual size quesadilla.

Definitely a MUST try when visiting Manhattan! These are some of the best tacos I have ever had, and that's saying something living in Texas! They have several different options to choose from, but I chose the steak and pollo tacos. They have fried cheese for the shells, but they are not on the menu, so you have to be sure to ask for them. They do cost a little more than corn or flour tortillas, but you get so much more food with the cheese shells. They are literally twice the size of anything on a tortilla. A little on the pricey side for tacos, but well worth it!

No comment
The best tacos hands down. Yay! Grand Central location is perfect for a quick bite. Bring your own beverage.

My oh my! This is one of my favorite meals in NYC. I live in Los Angeles, so we have pretty good Taqueria's, Mexican food overall. When I was recommended this place, I figured that it must be really good to compare to what we have back home. At first the line and ordering system was a little confusing, but I think it works out great. He wait in line order at the cashier. then you take your ticket just left of the cashier, and they put together what you want I'm asking what your topping preferences are and tortilla preferences are. The flavors are so amazing! I would recommend to get the Carne Asada as that was everybody's favorite! It's so busy, sometimes the sauce bar is a little low. But don't skip out on the salsa. There's no seating, just a bunch of standup areas so it's to go grab a quick bite to eat. I did get the fried quesadilla with Kearny Asada, although good, I would recommend the tacos over it because it was very heavy with a fried tortilla. Do not miss this place, even for a after meal snack!!
The tacos are spot on Mexican as is the spot. Just expect to pay elevated prices due to its location.
Surprisingly good for where it is. I don't usually trust taco places in nice neighborhoods and especially not in Chelsea market. Sort of like if better in and out did tacos.
Got the quesadillas here but they are more like tacos with a cheesy tortilla. They were good but nothing special

Really enjoyed the flavors, how all the simple indigents, all combine with the meat and flour or corn tortilla to have the flavors burst in your mouth with every bite. Crowded and popular, but quick and fast friendly fast service! Each taco is made to order. So when you're in NY stop by for a snack or dinner here. I'll be back.
Best tacos ever. Fast service. Tienen que probar orchata y Jamaica............... a mi criterio los precios están por encima del promedio

Just a classic New York City spot. Take your family, take your friends, and take yourself to grab these delicious tacos (also serve up great quesadillas). They have yummy sauces you can add on the side and the tacos are fresh, hot, and wayyy too easy to eat. Try the pork ones (which come with slices of pineapple)!!

My friend recommended this place, and I have to say that it deserves the hype and raving reviews. I got a carne asada (steak) and adobada (marinated pork) taco. I would recommend getting the taco "con todos" (with all the) toppings. The meats was flavorful and the toppings plus lime added to each bite. The steak was salty and reminded me of brazilian steak while the pork had a more sweet flavor, and the toppings varied according to the taste profile of the taco. This place is definitely a must visit in Chelsea Market!

This place is amazing!!!! Quick line, helpful staff, and food slaps! We got steak tacos, pork tacos, quesadillas, and the special quesadilla. Everything we got was amazing but the pork and the special quesadilla hit different. This is a must!
Good authentic tacos, they were fully loaded in corn shells,  and having a fresh taste.
No comment

Oh man what an experience dinner was. We have watched tons of videos on YouTube about this place and we made it a point to hit this location while in town.  The line was out the door when we walked up but it does move fast. The staff are very efficient at their jobs so u need to know your order once u walk up to pay. I ordered the steak , chicken & pork tacos and Wow the Steak was imo one of the best tacos I've ever had. The pork was a little on the spicy side but it had killer flavor.  The chicken was grilled to perfection and was like the other two fantastic.  I'm pretty sure I'll be hitting this place again while we're here

Very busy to-go spot with organized ordering process. Authentic and simple menu. The tacos were very tasty and nicely filled. Order "con todo" to get the toppings, quite necessary to feel complete. ADOBADA (pork) stood out a bit more flavor-wise and came with strips of pineapple. Chips and salsa not bad; definite kick to the salsa so be warned if you have low tolerance. No real seating, just grab a corner and scarf it down. Quick and cheap bite in the hub of Times Square.
Absolutely the best tacos I've ever had! Fast, affordable and super yummy! Hard to find a place to seat but it's with it! Highly recommended!
All of the food is excellent and well priced. This is a great spot if you are in a hurry or need something quick to eat. Service was quick and excellent.
The best tacos you can get in Ny.  We tried the steak, chicken and pork and they were all amazing.   The guac was also very good. Highly recommend!

Best tacos in new york ! Super fast service, visit them about 1x a week ! Never dissatisfied!
first time coming and it did not disappoint! the homemade tortillas were to die for!!

The pepito pork (secret menu). Will make you come back DAILY.  Don't work about the line,  it moves really quickly!!

This place definitely surpassed my expectations. My boyfriend and I came here to eat during our visit to NY, and this was on his food bucket list. It was extremely good 9/10. The staff was super friendly and we received our food fast. The only con would be that there's limited standing area so you have to kind of have to watch whose eating and about to finish and then swoop in to their spot. I am not a big pastor fan but my boyfriend said their tacos were some of the best pastor he's ever had!

I stopped by this morning to get a breakfast burrito as it has been so long. The price went up to $6 for one burrito, same size but still delicious. The price increase was so surprising as I remember when they used to be $4 about 2.5 years ago. Now it it only be a treat for whenever I'm in the area.

Hooray!  What a pleasant surprise to see that Los Tacos opened a shop in the Theater District.  Perfect for a quick bite to eat before a show!  In this most recent visit, we indulged in all things adobado (pork) -- adobado taco on corn tortilla, adobado taco on flour tortillas, and especial with adobado added.  The adobado is very flavorful and quite addictive.  The especial was an eye-opener...it's a deep fried treat filled with melty cheese and the meat of your choice (if you so choose).  Highly recommend.  The guacamole was also very tasty and fresh.

I don't give 5 stars very often but man these tacos are legit soooo goood. Chicken is well seasoned to the point that they are juicy oozing with flavor. Well cooked chicken with amazing toppings. This place has become my favorite places in New York till this day. I love love love the tacos. Load up on the salsa that they have in the corner. The place also looks so cool. There's always huge lines so go when it's not busy.
No comment
Without question the best tacos in the country. Impeccable operation. Always on point.

Los Tacos No. 1 is one of my favorite taco spots in NYC and is a must try if you're a fan of tacos. As the name of the restaurant states, their tacos are second to none. For this meal, I got the Pollo Asado quesadilla and the taco, Carne Asada taco and the Abodaba taco. The grilled chicken here is probably the best protein that they have with rich flavors and simply not try at all. Along with the guac on top, the chicken protein is definitely my favorite. The Carne Asada is the steak protein and that one is great as well, the meat is quite tender. The Abodaba is the pork option and if you add on all the additional s including the pineapple topping, there are lots of flavor to that taco. If you're feeling hungry, make sure to go for the quesadilla which is only priced a little bit more than the taco. The quesadilla is pretty much the same as the taco but just more toppings and protein on a larger wrap.

The way the brand is growing in NY , is killing the uniqueness and flavor, I remember going to the market in lower Manhattan was worth to wait for this tacos, sadly after 2 years im back to to visit and try this tacos expecting the same flavor and quality but not no more. But they still stand out from any other taqueria, my point of view is just on their own standards.

The Adobada was probably the best taco I've had in a while. There was a nice kick to it and it was really flavorful. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and would make a trip back if I find myself in NYC again
No comment
Wow this place more than lived up to its reputation.  Thanks for everything. The breakfast burritos are super duper tasty. All of them. I highly recommend. Hope to see you there soon! Nos Vemos!
Great street style tacos very good and this location was packed with customers!  We ordered each of the different meat selection and guac, all very good!

Wanted tacos and I usually go to the location at Chelsea Market.  This was a quick walk and I went at non-peak. Steak was just ok, abodabo was a little salty but still delicious.   Flavors are good,  corn tortilla are my fav.  3 will fill  the average eater. Fresh salsa and veggies.  I wish they had birria tacos....

Amazing tacos! It is a must!! Some of the best tacos ever! They are always busy and for good reason! I ordered tacos de asada and adobada and we're delicious. They are generous with their meat in their tacos. The staff is efficient and friendly. 10/10. Recommend!

This place came up on a yelp suggestion and of all things I could've ate, (I really thought it was gonna be like a hotdog, pizza, halal, or sushi) I ended up eating Mexican food first thing on my visit to NY. I had to remind myself this is NY and the tacos were a bit pricier than I would've thought, but honestly I don't mind supporting my people at all especially when the food is good - which is is. Lol and I have no regrets, their tacos hit the spot, they really are number 1, closest  to actual street tacos in Mexico, even the way their warped in the paper. The production line is on it, they're quick af and have their system figured out. The line may be long but moves fast. I was very satisfied and only regret not having got more tacos lol I want to go back for more before I head back home! The steak was crispy to perfection and the salsas were not overpowering but complimented the corn tortillas and guacamole so well. I'm drooling as I type. I may have to go back mañana.. YUM TRY IT!

I have a new love, and it is you, Los Tacos No. 1. I love the chicken and steak tacos here, and the horchata. I also went to the location near Grand Central. Next time I will stay right next door to one of their locations. I have not stopped thinking about this place since I came home. We shall meet again, mi amor.
Such an amazing spot. Food is beyond delicious. I had the opportunity to meet the owners and they were so nice.

The tacos were actually surprisingly really good. Just don't expect it to be Mexican quality- how've pretty decent for the location

Best tacos in NYC hands down! I recommend this place to anyone who visits! Get the adobada on corn!!! The service is always quick and there's not usually a line between rush hours. There's no place to sit down, but the ambiance is good at the stall.

Was looking for a taco place in NYC and found this place. They had excellent tacos!  I had the carne asada and the  adobada tacos. The salsa sauces were very spicy and tasty. Ordered a bag of chips and salsa which rounded out a wonderful meal! We're going back for some of the other menu items.
I'm from San Diego and this is very comparable to the tacos we have and also in Tijuana! This spot is legit!
Probably the best tacos I've had in NYC so far. Long lines but line goes by quickly. Recommend the pastor taco and their horchata

I must have ordered wrong because these tacos were extraordinarily mediocre. Ordered the al pastor and nopal tacos on corn tortillas. I would not recommend the corn tortillas at all! I tried a bite of my friend's flour tortilla and it was much more enjoyable. The carne asada was aSADa.
