Wow! Fast service and amazing flavor. Coming from a Mexican American from Texas these tacos are legit. Pricey but it's time square.

Great fast Mexican street tacos - order at counter, get your ticket and then wait for them to be quickly assembled to your order and eat at stand up tables. Tacos come with a lot of meat (carne asada was awesome and the pork adobado was really good as well, prepared al pastor style carved from a vertical spit)  and topping options (we got con todos which included onions, cilantro, guacamole) so the price point of around $5 is fairly reasonable especially for New York. Definitely worth checking out!
Best taco spot! There's always a line but it goes fast. My favorite is Al pastor! Extra cilantro and cream! Only way to eat tacos!
No comment

Amazing!  They're just under 5 bucks each, so they're expensive compared to job site taco trucks in Texas, but not too bad for NYC and damn, they're good.  Super fresh and high quality meat and tortillas.

I'm from the southwest, so when it comes to Mexican food I am a really big critic. However this place does hit the spot when you're missing some good old tacos from across the southern border. If you're in New York and can't find a place to grab a few bites, come and check out this place!
No comment
No comment
Best tacos so far in NYC. Just don't forget to bring your ticket to the bar. Friendly staff had to show me how the two separate queues worked. Open, spacious, loud and enjoyable.
very good and juicy, but they never make it spicy, you can say it more than 30 times and still they didn't add the spice inside...
No comment
No comment
Bomb food - fast lines and overall great great place to eat. Seating is tricky but I would stand to eat those tacos again
No comment

This is my favorite taco place, not just in NYC but one of the best in US. Love their Adobada Tacos, those are the best, meat is cooked to perfection and the tacos are so fresh / fluffy. They have multiple locations in NYC. Definitely try them out if you are ever around.
Delicious... just delicious . I just could not think of anything else to describe los tacos. I do wish there was lengua, cabeza, o oreja but it's great.
These are THE BEST TACOS in New York City, hands down. I seriously dream about their nopal tacos. This is a must-try!

Excellent tacos. Quick bite before you go and see a theater show. Tacos have as Mexican as it gets ingredients. Chicken and beef is extremely well seasoned and grilled. Great drinks. Nice standing tables. Ordering is a bit uncomfortable but you get the hang of it. Excellent part of creating an experience! Will definitely return.

The Mexican food was truly amazing! The tacos were the best I've ever had in my life - the flavors were fresh and bold, the ingredients were high quality, and the overall taste was out of this world. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Mexican dining experience!!!!

Excellent excellent except they are always closed when we come! Should consider staying open for the after theatre hungry crowd..,?  This place is clean and really rocks the tacos, must stop for on the good quick bites as you are heading somewhere !
Tal vez uno de los mejores tacos que he probado en USA, servicio impecable, poco/nada espacio.
Great tacos on the go.  Get them CON TODO its the best way !   Small portions and pricey but still good !

My picky bf loves it. He's really picky eater so I would say it is good. Got him beef and pork i believe. I in the other hand ordered cactus, maybe it was what I ordered it was alright. Nothing special. It's simple place and everything moves fast. Service is quick. No frill nothing so extra sweet about it either. It's a fast food joint it runs and looks like a fast food joint. Okay definitely better than well known fast food giants. It's more homey compare to them. Regardless recommended it.
Looks packed at all times of day, but wait isn't long at all. What makes their tacos so amazing is that everything is freshly made. You can taste the difference.
The chicken taco was amazing! It was very crowded but the line moved very fast. Keep your receipt handy to give to the cooks. Will for sure eat here again & recommend.
Food was great.  Glad we tried 2 You Tube vloggers recommendations.  Location we tried was the one on Chelsea Market.  Very happy with their presentation.

I have been craving good Hispanic food for a while and happened across this place during a short trip into Manhattan from PA. There was a line out front during lunch, so I was both hesitant to wait and intrigued by the popularity, and the latter won so I got in line. After a wait of maybe 10 minutes, I was inside and ordered a couple of carne asada quesadillas. These were so good that lunch was with the trip today. If your looking for good food that isn't Tex-Mex or some watered down fast food version of tacos, then this is your place.

Pretty good tacos! I just tried a Carne Asada Quesadilla, and it was really good, but not #1. I would definitely stop by and get a taco if I really crave it, but it is also very overpriced for a taco. I like the sauces and the free serve toppings/salsa area, and I like the stand up style "just eat your taco and go" style.
No comment
In just one word: delicious.   Make it a required stop when you're downtown, or a destination
i didn't love the cactus which was the only pescatarian option but i think the meat options are probably much better

Let me tell you something these are the best tacos I ever had! I have mad many tacos but man these were amazing from the corn tortillas to the steak itself and all of the salsas were great. This is gonna become a must have every time I stop in NYC! Also don't be worried if there is a line outside everything went really fast for us.
No comment
Food was perfect! Service unmatched, and ambiance made me feel as If I was in Mexico !
Best tacos I had in NY, steak quesadilla and chicken taco.  Amazing.  Only quip is they are a little small, but worth it.
Best tacos in the city. They have 3 locations and growing! Nice athmosphere and great aguas frescas
No comment
No comment

Cuando vi que cada taco cuesta casi 5 dls. dije: ayyy gueyyy!:((  pero pense: ok estàs en NYC dale y no seas coda :)  para empezar las salsas tan very good, picositas  y con mucho sabor!:)) la cajera solo le falto pelar màs el diente pero :/ ni pex. los tacos estàn bien servidös y de buen tamaño para mi gusto, pedi 2 de asada y 2 de adobada la carne tenia muy buen sazòn:)  pedi  chips y salsa (muy rica por cierto) y me llene con 3. todo sabe y está frescò:) hastá los limoncitòn recién cortados no como en otros lugarès que están bien gachos y màs secos que mi alma:) hahah :) me quedan  3 dias màs aqui y voy a regresar antès de irme a mi rancho.:) vayan  y no se arrepentirán netaaa. p.s. las chavas que llenan el salsa bar fuerôn muy amablès y lindas :)
No comment
I am obsessed with these tacos!! I can eat them literally everyday. They're always busy and the lines are always super long which shows how much others love the tacos as well
No comment

Los tacos no.1 is always a treat! I was in the area after watching a Broadway show and stopped in for some tacos. Since we went near closing time, there was no more pork tacos left (which are my favorite) so I ordered the beef tacos on corn with everything. This location is crowded full of tourists but the food is just as good as the original location. The beef tacos were delicious and full of toppings and sauces!

My favorite taco spot in the city and this location is my go-to before a Broadway show! The tacos are so juicy and tasty! I have been to Los tacos many many times and been to all locations in the city. I always get their adobada taco and carne asada taco. They also have several aqua fresca options! I like the tamarindo one the most. They also have Mexican coke that uses cane sugar. A must visit taco spot for anyone visiting and for anyone that wants to get a quick bite before a Broadway show! The line can get long, so make sure to plan accordingly!
No comment

Big popular spot in NYC for Mexican style tacos. While they definitely have the atmosphere and vibe down similar to Mexico City (the order process, give receipt to cooks, and no seating, crowding around little tables to eat), the tacos are pretty steep in price. Giving this place 3/5 stars for the price to quantity. Tacos themselves were pretty good, but there are just other better taco spots in the city.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Easily the best tacos I've EVER had. Went here with a friend and I'd never been, but wow I was blown away. I will DEF be back.

Came here after seeing all the hype and seeing so many friends visit this place. It was definitely worth it!! This location is inside Chelsea market but was very easy to find (it had the longest line all day but moved quickly). I had a carne asada and a pollo asado. After ordering, you can watch them carve the meat in front of you and they ask you what toppings you'd like. I kept everything and squeezed a little lime on top. Let me tell you, these tacos were PHENOMENAL. The meat was so flavorful and juicy and were filled with just the right amount of toppings. I'm not a guac person usually, but this guac was so tasty and done right. For the price and flavor you get, it can't be beat and I will be returning next time I'm in town.

Damn these are consistently the best tacos I've ever had! Everything is incredibly flavorful and fresh and the tortillas and salsas are amazing. All of the tacos are great but my favorite is the Adobada. Thrilled for this new location which tends to be more convenient when we are in town for a visit but I'll gladly go out of the way for these any day.

Best quick tacos! The meats are so flavorful and you can customize the tacos to your liking. There are also sauces and other toppings set to the side that you can add yourself. Try to go before noon though because the line gets long!

Solid tacos for great prices, especially for Times Square! Line gets long, but they're super efficient! Love that they've got a separate toppings bar, and that they have homemade corn tortillas. Yum! No seating and even the standing space gets pretty crowded, but people move quickly. Would definitely come back!
I lived in San Antonio for a few years and I can say this place serves the closest authentic street tacos I've had! I love it here!

My wife is Spanish and she is from California and says that this is the most real taco place that she has been to. Been here 4 years and this our second time. Everything we eat is delicious. I promised to take her here more often!
Coming from LA I was def going to be a harsh critic but I was so surprised, I loved it all, ordered the pollo, carne asada and adobada tacos. The salsas were both great! I highly recommend!

Any place that calls itself #1, I am skeptical. This place delivers. The feel is between five guys and halal guys. I ate all three meat options: Chicken Tacos, Carne Asada Tacos, Al Pastor Pork Tacos. The chicken was my favorite. For $20, three tacos, and a drink later, you will leave full and very satisfied. The line was a little hectic, but they had staff to lead you along. No sit-down seating. All countertops seating.

Ten years ago it was hard to find good street taco spots in Manhattan. That has since changed. Los Tacos hand makes the tortillas fresh. Make sure you get the Al Pastor- they grill the seasoned pork sliced off the skewer and grilled pineapple the authentic way.
Amazing juicy tacos. Very authentic taste and the customer service despite how busy it was this day, they were top quality people. We got them from the Time Square location.

Let me preface this by saying, I love California street tacos, we ate them constantly when we lived in both Northern and Southern CA. I'm surprised by how highly rated these tacos are honestly, I thought they were just...fine, kind of blah. Maybe we visited on an off night but like I said, I didn't get much flavor from my tacos. The chips were good. The salsa was fine, no kick to it. I'm allergic to avocado, maybe the guac does a lot of heavy lifting. I was so pumped to try Los Tacos and had high hopes but ultimately grabbed a slice of pizza on the way home instead.

Are you missing your local taqueria food from back home? Look no further... this place (multiple locations), is delicious! It has the "look and feel" of an In n Out, in that the menu is streamlined, customer service and cleanliness are right up there with the caliber of food. I had the two tacos (asada and pollo)  and my husband had the Adobada tacos "con todo" (onion, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole) with chips and guacamole... prices are super reasonable (for NYC).  Soak in the Norteño music while eating at high tops and feel right at home:)
Simply the best; line goes fast   Favorite is pork but steak and chicken rock.  Lime available left side of bar

Delicious and fast street tacos near Times Square! They make the tacos right in front of you, and it's fast. I ordered one Carne Asada taco and one Pollo Asado taco. Both the corn and flour tortillas were good, but the flour were my favorite. Make sure you get them "Con Todo" - with onions, cilantro, salsa, & guacamole. This place has counters where you can stand and eat.
No comment
No comment

Los Tacos No. 1 is a religious experience. I waited in a long line to get tacos but it was so worth it. We ordered carne asada tacos on homemade corn tortillas with cilantro and salsa. The atmosphere was hectic on this Sunday night but like I said I would do it again in a heartbeat. The meal was topped off with a cold Diet Coke in a glass bottle, which is always a treat. 10/10!
My favorite taco in NYC! The tacos were very authentic, and the vibe was like being on the street of Mexico City. Especially great if you are looking for something fast to eat before Broadway shows!

It wasn't crowded when I stopped by on a Thursday night at 5:30 (I eat early, don't hate).  I would definitely eat here again. I had three tacos and was completely filled up. I decided to eat here just before seeing a show and would definitely say it was a fast meal. Really cool atmosphere , great music, chill vibe.
No comment
No comment
My tacos were SO good!! The Carne Asada was the best. Wish they had a location by me!!
No comment

I have heard very good things about Los Tacos No. 1 and have wanted to try it for some time. There was a decently long line outside of the restaurant but it moved very quickly. Definitely worth the wait and the hype surrounding the name. Recommend both of the tacos I got - if you are in the area stop by!

My only complaint is that I can't give more than 5 stars. This place is amazing. Fresh ingredients, quick service, and delicious food. The steak was ok, and the charred chicken was delicious, but the pork stole the show. Run to this place!
Best Tacos in town. We have never try tacos like this,even the salsa is not spicy's. Definitely will come back for seconds. It's worth the price and wait in line.
No comment

This place is in the heart of Times Square so it was BUSY! The food was ok, nothing special but good place for some authentic asada tacos. The selection is very limited since they only have asada and pastor.
Really easy fun cheapish taco place, the line is stressful and normally quite long but the wait is short and it was all cooked very well, great stop for lunch when you're tired of pizza!

10/10!!! This place was recommended by Sarah Funky as the best tacos in Manhattan and I 100% agree!! I tried to come here on a Friday during lunch.. WRONG CHOICE! The line was down the street! So I decided to try back a bit later and Great decision because there was no line then! They load the tacos up with meat and Ajax and give you a salsa bar for toppings! I would move to NYC just to have these tacos whenever I wanted!
I take the train from East Norwalk, Connecticut to Grand Central Station solely to eat the pollo asada quesadilla with cilantro and salsa - and a Mexican Coke. Enough said!

Great last meal in the city. We got there at opening, already had a small line outside. Small language barrier when ordering, but we figured it out. Tasted similar to tacos I make at home, so didn't knock my socks off, but still very good. Be aware you have to stand at higher top tables while eating. Would return and recommend!

Must go if in NY! They have a small menu however all the items are delicious! All tacos and quesadillas come with onions, cilantro, salsa, and guac unless you tell them otherwise. They run a smooth operation where you order, give the cooks your slip, and get your food. Small inside but ppl eat pretty quickly and you can get a standing spot. When you order guac and chips, that guac is thicker than the guac that's on the tacos. We loved it and will return!
No comment

Hands down the best tacos I have ever had, not kidding! The flavors were authentic and the meat was tender and cooked to perfection. The service was fast even though the line to order was quite long. I ordered the carne asada, adobada, and pollo asada tacos and the carne asada was THE BEST! Everything else was definitely delicious and I highly enjoyed all the tacos, but the carne asada is a must try for sure. I also had a delicious horchata and everything was about $20. I highly recommend checking this spot out!

I hadn't planned on visiting Los Tacos No. 1 but it came recommended by multiple friends, my partner and I were in the area after (finally) checking out the High Line, and it was dinnertime - seems like a sign, right? We waited in what we thought was a pretty long line (only to see it get even longer as we waited!) and placed our order: one of each of the tacos. We figured we needed to try everything (but also leave room for dessert). This was a mistake because we practically inhaled the tacos and wanted more, but didn't have the energy to get back in line. The pollo asado was my absolute favorite - the chicken was SO flavorful and juicy. Very happy to have visited and hope to be back soon!

So fresh and delicious. Worth the wait because the service is super fast. The tacos are full of meat and the guacamole taste amazing. Been in town two days and went both days. Will be returning before we leave town for sure!!!
No comment
This place has great tacos especially for here in New York City , a long line to get in,   one star is deducted for the high price of $4.75 each
Simple and delicious! Super flavorful and fresh! Reminds me of the tacos I love in San Diego! Very authentic
Just a great place for tacos! Very casual, fast, and tasty! I recommend the chicken tacos.
No comment

Mexican Taco Magic! Whatever you do, make sure to order at least one taco with the cheese tortilla. Basically, instead of a corn or flour tortilla, the taco toppings are served over a tortilla made from grilled cheese!! Amazing!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best tacos in Manhattan based on my experience. They are not cheap but they are packed with meat. They are close to "traditional" "true" Mexican tacos. I don't think most tacos in Mexico would have as much meat (I've been to plenty of taquerias in Mexico), but this is not necessarily a bad thing. The downside is that you don't taste the tortilla as much. They make their own tortillas as well so not tasting the tortillas more is perhaps a bit bad. My criticism is really slight though. The flavors are amazing. The meat is great. The sauces are great. The lime station is great. They use the traditional "trompo", which you rarely see in the US. The other place that uses a trompo in NYC is tacombi. The tacombi tacos are more expensive and too salty. Tacos #1 are better in my opinion.
I was hungry do I ordered on Uber. I was so surprised. The food was amazing and not expensive. Can order again.
No comment
No comment
It's like someone took a taco place from Mexico and brought over here. The vampiros are great!

Finally got to try these in person!!! Long line but totally worth it. So reasonably priced and it comes with all the toppings like guac! Their salsas are HOT! I loved the verde and the red one was good as well. So many flavors going on. Super happy and will be a regular spot i return to when I visit nyc!
Los Tacos No.1 is one of the best tacos I have had. They do feel like fast food but the flavors are of the best I have tried. Their ESPECIAL fried quesadilla is a must try!
Best tacos in the entire world. I don't say that lightly. We are making another trip soon to NYC just to eat here.
No comment

I will never miss you... when I'm in New York City, you can't skip this spot. The best tacos and quesadilla I ever had. It's really juicy and delicious. They have horchata so pick one up. We ordered first time and were bewildered so we got right back in line for second round. Line is always long but it moves fast, worth every second every pennies. Can you guys come to Southern California?

Perfect tacos. Just when I was getting bummed out that nyc food quality and value had deteriorated over the pandemic, along comes this taco utopia. Reminded me of the simple taquerias all over the mission in San Fran. But better quality and more delicious. I ordered steak and chicken. Tortillas perfect. Meat juicy and authentically flavored. Sometimes authenticity makes me put up with 1 out of 15 bites being gristle or some other unchewable. But here quality flew high and I just chewed each of these marvels while shaking my head in disbelief. I guess the only drawback is, hey, this isn't health food so I can't eat this every day, which is frankly what I was already plotting. On my exit, I locked eyes with the jovial affable manager who was keeping the whole train running. I grabbed his attention and said "hey I just wanted to say thank you for this."  Tacos #1 is appropriately named. Hasta pronto mi amigo
No comment

Hands down best tacos in NYC. The al pastor quesadilla is a 10/10, but really you can't go wrong with a single thing on the menu. Reasonably priced food for the high-quality taste, fast service, and great environment.
Awesome. Literally the best tacos ever and an amazing atmosphere. Would go back asap.

I was surprised that tacos were really good here in NYC. Coming from SoCal, I wasn't expecting much in NYC for tacos and man I was wrong. The long line outside kinda gave it away as a local foodie spot and I'm so glad I decided to wait it out and give it a try. The tacos were delicious and I would definitely come back here whenever I'm back in NYC.
Excellent tasting tacos !! They were really good the meat was very tasty and there was no fat on the meat. Nice people and fast service.
Super good and cheap food. Long line and moves quickly but counter space was limited for eating at due to being busy.
Cheap, fast, and good. If you don't want to wait for a sit down restaurant go here!!!!

If you are like me and get overwhelmed by NYC Midtown and food options in the city overall, a good place to start is here. It is simple and honest. Quick, affordable, and very fulfilling. Deserves the hype, I think, because of the guac crema that the tacos come with. It seems very popular by NYC Youtubers for a good reason and has multiple locations to try. The cups at the salsa bar are messy but with million people in town, kudos to the team for keeping the counters clean.
No comment

My favorite tacos!!! I order the steak, pork and chicken tacos. Changed it up today and ordered a chicken V quesadilla which is essentially a chicken taco but with cheese. The pork and steak tacos are my favorite. Very flavorful and today they seemed spicier than usual but nothing I couldn't handle. I always get a horchata; there's is perfectly made.
No comment
Worth the wait in line! Jam packed on even a Sunday night but the line was very quick. And the food was very good!  No pics-ate it way too fast! Next time I'm trying the fried quesadilla.
No comment
No comment

This is supposedly NY's best stop shop for tacos. It's alright, quality of food is fair the tortillas are bit tough and the flavors are mild veering on bland. Its nothing compared to what you could get in a local LA taco truck or restaurant.
Fresh made tortillas. Delicious adobada from vertical spit. Prices a bit high, but reasonable for NYC food
No comment
Really quick and delicious tacos. Such amazing steak ones and love their sauces. Rlly convenient lunch spot
Tacos were bomb! Friday night we went in and there was a lot of people! There's no sitting

I'm from CA, and it's hard to find a good authentic Mexican taco shop in NYC, but this is by far the closest one to real Mexican Tacos! So tasty! Line tends to be long but goes by pretty fast! Definitely give it a try! Handmade tortillas! Salsas are good, meat is flavorful and fresh!
Great tacos, very flavorful! Overwhelming to order and find a place to eat. Minus one star ‍
No comment
Can't really ask for much more in a taco. Always consistent and around Los Tacos No.1 doesn't disappoint. Got 3 chicken tacos and enjoyed all of them

Best tacos I've ever had. I mean I don't even need to write a long review since the food speaks for themselves! The meat was so juicy, tender, and flavorful. The tortilla was nicely toasted and flaky. The sauce just brings all the flavors together and helps with the fat of the protein. Even their lime. Best juicy lime ever. Service is quick and easy. Must come visit again!

Every time I come here everything is super fresh!!! My go to is an especial with carne asada with everything but salsa. I love the self serve pico de Gallo the flavor of the carne asada is delicious. The line was long when I arrived BUT it moved fast. It is expensive however it's so good it's well worth the price. It is bomb

Absolutely! Yes! Most definitely! This is not advertised on the outside that we saw, it's in a quiet street near the Taco Bell on time square. It was delicious! The tortillas a Mano. mulas, tacos, aguas frescas. I was surprised at how great it was. And the staff was friendly. I would come back only for this if I'm ever in town again.
No comment

We ordered the nopal and cane asada tacos, both of which were very flavorful! The cactus has such a unique, sour flavor and everything (especially the guac) was seasoned so well. Despite it being super busy and crowded, the service was still great and we did not have to wait long. That being said, the tacos are a bit pricey for what they are as they're pretty small. Would still recommend any visitors give it a try though!
Omg! The best tacos I've ever had! The food is hot fresh and so delicious! Definitely will return!
No comment
Best tacos I've had in a long time. Service is dialed in, similar to Katz's. I'd give it 6 stars.
No comment
Some of the best tacos I have literally ever put in my mouth. Fast service, pretty affordable, delicious. Wish I had one in my home so I could eat these 24/7.

Great tasting authentic Mexican tacos with fresh ingredients. Perfect for a quick lunch/dinner on the way back to the hotel. Carne asada, puerco (pork) and pollo (chicken) all good. They also have tacos with nopales (cactus).

Despite a line forming outside of the restaurant, the wait was not long and the tacos were so worth it! Came here with my partner and we ordered Jamaica and Horchata with chicken and adobado tacos and with chips and salsa and it was so tasty! Staff were very friendly too! I will definitely be returning here again.
THIS IS A MUSTTTTTTTTT! Definitely a FAV!!! A little pricey but boy are they worth it! Line is long but goes by quickly so make sure to stay!!!

I found this place a a bunch of food review YouTube. And as a big foodie who knows this places as THE BEST tacos in NYC and ohhh boy does it live up to the standers. AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. (And a bit spicy warning you especially the salsa) but it is a must for Foodie like me.

this place is a MUST when in Times Square. the tacos were amazing, we went back the next day! I wasn't expecting the food to be as good as it was, tortillas are homemade and truly gives you the authenticity you expect. ambiance reminded me of taco places in mexico.

Just adding to the other thousands of reviews about how this place has some of the best tacos!! A little pricey but worth every penny! Small standing area if you want to dine in. The salsas are so good and compliment the tacos so well.
Delicious!!! Chicken taco had a nice smoky flavor. Porky was good and yummy. Cactus was interesting in a good way. Will order one of each including steak next time....
No comment

If you need tacos near Times Square, this is the place to go! Line was pretty long, but it moves quick. Tacos are made right in front of you, and are delicious. If you've been walking all day, they might be the best tacos you've ever had!
I've been to their other location before but it was my first time trying this location, and I can say without a doubt that these are some of the best tacos I've had in NYC.
No comment
Delicious, highly recommend the adobado mula. Quick service and very friendly as well!

NYC is not known for its Mexican food, obviously. But this is some of the best you'll find in the city, and at a reasonable price as well. If you're from the southwest you may not be overly impressed. But as an easy coaster, whenever I have the itch for some Mexican, Los Tacos is always at the top of the list for consideration.
Speedy service, standing room only. Small menu of great bites, and not the most vegetarian friendly.

It is not surprising that this place is always packed. Despite having an influx of customers, the wait is not long. Quick & fast service, and the best part is of course the tacos. They weren't lying when they named this place Los Tacos No.1, because in my opinion these are the number one tacos I've had by far. There are limes, radishes, and a wide variety of salsas you can choose from to go along with your meals. BONUS... each taco comes with guacamole with no extra charge. This is a must try place!

There is nothing like handmade tortillas - so yummy. Pork was a bit spicier than I like but still delicious. You order at the register and get a ticket. Move down the line and hand them your ticket. They will ask you if you want corn or flour tortillas and what toppings you want. Fast service.

Holy, moly.  How delicious.  This place is not for everyone as you cannot comfortably sit and eat, and not everyone wants to order and pay, and then technically order again, and then move elsewhere to technically stand and eat...but it is all worth it.  Delicious, affordable, and a great quick bite in Time Square.  My favorite place to eat in this touristy of locales.  Authentic and delicious, despite being a bit of a pain in ordering.
No comment
No comment

I took my friend who was visiting NYC here for a quick bite; it is a tasty on-the-go spot with casual table standing option. I had the nopal (cactus) taco and carne asada (grilled steak) quesadilla, which hit the spot. I particularly like the way ordering individual items allows you to try different kinds of bites with different proteins if desired.
Ok - kinda spicy and didn't live up to the hype IMO. Would recommend but definitely not for everyone. Chaotic inside if you aren't aware of how the ordering process works . Very loud

Pretty good tacos. Busy af, we came here on a Sunday night. The location is in Times Square. Lineup outside of the door but moved pretty quick. Def worth it though. Got 2 chicken and 1 Steak. Chicken over steak for sure. Chicken is a bit spicy, but good. Def recommend :) oh and guacamole isn't extra
No comment

This taco restaurant is amazing! The tortillas were homemade and delicious. The workers were so polite and nice. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. It is a great hangout spot with a great environment.
Amazing, authentic tacos!!!! Fast, quick. If I lived here, I would come several times a week!
No comment

This is Bobby Flay's favorite taco place and he is not wrong. Tried the Times Square location after going to Chelsea Market location the last few time. Adobado taco is outstanding. Pork roasted on a spit, sliced off and put on the flat top for a sear. Amazing. Make their own tortillas right in front of you. Excellent tacos
No comment
No comment
This is my favorite spot near Times Square. Great place, gets very busy but worth the line.
Tacos were pretty good. It's a good place to grab a quick bite. It's a stand and eat stand place. Line goes really quick.

Amazing Tacos. These are authentic mexican street tacos in a setting that is like a real taqueria in Mexico. I wish i lived closer, i'd be eating here very often!! Please come to the Philly area!!!!!!
No comment
No comment
Great tacos!!! Pork tacos were amazing!!. Quick and easy place to get tacos ( in and out ) 5 bucks a taco. Reminds me if 5 guys was a taco place.

When I told my friends that we had great tacos in NYC, everyone was laughing because we're from LA... But honestly, I think Los Tacos No. 1 is probably the best tacos I've had in a loooooong while. It may not be healthy (as the oil drips from the taco) but they sure are tasty...  Adobada is excellent. The line moves quick so don't worry about the wait. It's worth it.
These tacos are highly rated by others on trip advisor. They did not dissappoint, and I have a pretty high expectation bar for tacos. The corn tortillas are very tasty.
Best tacos ever. Be sure to order 'con todo'. You can't go wrong with carne asada on corn tortilla
Best tacos in NYC. It's not California "quality"  but they're pretty close. Wouldnt really eat tacos anywhere else in NYC
No comment
Good tacos fast service not a place to enjoy there is not much seating space and the demand is so big they want you to get out fast.

Good tacos with plenty of flavor. They seem pretty authentic and made from scratch. They are pretty generous with the toppings, including the meat. I like that they played real Mexican music, while enjoying my tacos. The agua de horchata was also very good !
Normal, decepcionante incluso para la cantidad de gente que los recomienda, definitivamente no confíen en el gusto americano váyanse a un carrito de tacos mexicano!
No comment
No comment
No comment
We got the steak, chicken, and pork tacos. Best tacos in the city! I can't recommend this place enough!

Supper yummy. If in the area please try. We ordered chicken quesadillas, steak, chicken tacos with all the items included avocado , onion, cilantro and sauce. Everything was great will return. Please try.
Great authentic late night snacking pit stop. Quick turnaround times and the staff will direct you with the unusual flow of the restaurant. Would come back again
The al pastor tacos were delicious! So flavorful and juicy, the flour tortilla was so fresh and soft. Horchata and Jamaican drinks were tasty. Loved it!
Best tacos I've ever had! My favorite was the Carne Asada. The flavor was fabulous and the corn tortillas were superb.
Very good but wheres the bathroom? Just deficate or piss in the nyc streets like a true new Yorker bum. I had to thank God I didn't have to go #2.

Pretty tasty tacos, though I wouldn't wait on line for them.  Just happened to sneak in right as they opened, so it was pretty much instant gratification.  The first thing I noticed was the giant wheel of spinning meet (like for a gyro) and I tried to order the taco that came with that meat - I think I succeeded (and it was delicious).  A quesadilla is not a quesadilla here in the traditional sense - it's not folded and crisped in a pan, it's just some cheese melted on the bottom of the tortilla, but it was good, too.  For some reason I can't figure out, this food is missing the crave-ability factor.  I thought the same thing the first time I tried it a while back, and it's interesting to see that my feelings haven't changed.  Don't let that stop you from buying a taco or two when the line isn't long.

Best place for tacos. And if you're hungry they are prepped and served fast and deliciously! There's a reason they have great reviews in yelp. One thing- be prepared to wait in line especially during warmer months. But trust me... it's worth the wait.

Perfect for a very casual and quick bite in the area. There's usually a long line but don't be worried, it moves quickly and it's worth it! I had the pork and the steak along with guac, salsa and chips. The pork is so oily but it's SO good. I thought I would hate it dripping in oil but honestly loved it way more than the steak, which was also better than most tacos I've had. Guac was good, chunky and fresh and the salsa is pretty spicy! You do have to stand to eat here and finding a spot can seem a challenge sometimes, but usually the timing works that someone leaves just as you need them to (aka please don't save spots if you aren't ready to eat!!) I will be back anytime I'm hungry and in the area.

Great and delicious spot pre-broadway show A++! My friend waiting in line a few minutes and was able to secure us a spot to eat our delicious tacos. This was a quick and easy option before heading over to a show we had tickets for. I don't think we would have ahead time for a sit down meal so this was ideal.

Reasonably priced and very tasty. Place was super packed and tables are standing only. May be hard to find a spot if you're in a group but they offer aluminum foil to cover your plate for takeout, so that's a good option.

Stopped here for a late night snack on our first night in NYC. So glad we did and we made it just in time right before closing. We had heard a lot about this place and was on our "must try foods"  list . It definitely lives up to the hype. We had the asada tacos and they were good! We're from CA so I would say we have a lot of good Mexican taco places but this has to one of the best ones we've tasted!
I LOVEE IT they make the tacos so fast im in luv
Love this place, ate here 2 days in a row while I stayed in this area. Tacos de asada so fire with all the toppings & the hot sauce mmmm mmm mmm missing it already!

Discovered this place in 2019 while walking around Time Square area. Went back over the weekend during my visit & the tacos were still absolutely phenomenal packed with flavour! I do highly recommend corn tortillas over flour as to me it provides a teeny bit better flavour compared to flour but make sure you mention that as you order. Lime & sauces are located on the side to add to it. You'll find the menu on the right side wall by the cash area. They're about $5USD each which is a very good price for the quality that it is. I also love how its an open kitchen which allows you to watch the whole process! Visitors beware that it gets really busy during dinner time so best plan ahead but they do get through that line quickly. It is definitely a must visit for me everytime I visit New York now.
Line up was long but went through very quickly. Super cheap and every bite was scrumptious. Must try when you're in NYC!
The best tacos ever!!!!! My personal fave are Al Pastor  the pineapple is a great component along with the salsas they have there
Solid, quick, and convenient taco place in the Theatre district. Flavorful and a good snack. More of a grab and go place vs nice sit-down. Hits the spot if you're looking for a cheap and fast place.
Absolutely hand down, some of the best tacos  I have had in a while. Visiting NY, you definitely can't go wrong eating here.
No comment

Probably my favorite tacos in Manhattan! Super authentic and simple, 4 variations and a choice of 4 toppings, you honestly need nothing. Everything is quick without being hectic. Eat at the var table or takeout. I'm a regular here...
These tacos are scrumptious!!!! I always order the asada tacos and an agua de jamaica. It never disappoints  The salsa has a little kick but not really spicy, so it doesn't overwhelm.
Food is so delicious and truly authentic Mexican food!  Believe the hype and give this place a try.  We will definitely be back!!
Never disappoints! Carne asada is my fave, con todo, of course! The meat is cooked and seasoned nicely, can't complain here!

These tacos are so fucking good I could cry eating them.  We come to NYC once a year, maybe twice, and NEVER skip this place.  It's crazy, midtown manhattan has the best tacos you'll ever eat, but it's true.  And yeah I been out west.

Got the quesadilla but it's really the same as the soft tacos but with cheese. The carne asada was very tasty. I made the mistake of taking it to go. The taste wasn't affected but the tortilla got soggy. If you do take it to go, be sure to eat it ASAP or just eat there.
No comment
A great taqueria experience, enjoyable and cost effective. Fresh, quick and tasty treats every time.
No comment

I appreciate that they're open late in Midtown near Grand Central so I can pop by if I have a late night at work. They also sell breakfast tacos from a stand during the day. Tacos are slightly pricey ($5 each) but they are generous with the protein portions and there's also a table to the side where you can load up on pico, salsas, and radish.
No comment
No comment
Best tacos in town . The service was amazing frothing to complain about . They might be pricy but so worth it . Try the especial with carne asada oh lord .

Tasted like I was back at my grandmothers,Tacos were well made and the "Con Todo" option is perfect even for picky eaters, perfect amount of everything including Guacamole and Mild salsa, 10/10 definitely coming back soon.
The tacos are life changing, the ambiance is perfection, and the service is impeccable. You are guaranteed a great experience and amazing food !
No comment
Wow amazing tacos in NY city!! Everything was unique the taste was great. Loved this place!!

If there were a way I could add stars...I would. The best taco spot in the east coast by far. I have absolutely no complaints and each time I go, I go back on line for seconds. The line, although long, moves very fast and the staff is super efficient in how they work. I always order one of each taco, and theyre all SO juicy and flavorful. Also I can't help but mention how juicy their limes are. I can't stand when I get dried out limes, but this place knows what theyre doing. I recommend this spot to everyone I know and is a must try!
We waited about 15 minutes in line outside but it moved quickly. The staff was friendly. And the tacos were authentic deliciousness. Definitely a great stop for tacos.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Probably the best tacos I've ever eaten! The service was quick and the price was extremely reasonable! They make everything right in front of you too! We got the grilled chicken and cactus tacos and the chips and guacamole! So delicious and all the flavors were perfect!
No comment

Amazing food. I've recommended it a lot to other colleagues at my work convention and now, most of my friends have gone. The adobada is the best food I've eaten in a while. Tacos, quesadillas, tostadas, get it however you prefer. I wanted to dance and sing as I ate it the first time but I thankfully resisted that urge. I've tried the other meats as well and they aren't nearly as awesome. Wish I had pictures but the food never survives long enough for that. It's NYC and I'm a Florida girl where tacos run 2-3 dollars (for the amazing ones) so 5 dollars for a taco was a hard pill to swallow at first. Worth it though.

Delicious and authentic tacos in Times Square! Down side is that there where no tables or chairs. Idk if it's bc of COVID. But the tacos made up for it! I'm glad they opened near Times Square, something to eat other than hot dogs lol
Best street tacos in NYC!!!!! They also have a Keto option. Deliciosos!!! And now that are everywhere.
Great tacos. Full of flavor. Service is fast with friendly staff. Only downside is not enough room to eat. You have to eat and get out. Lines are long but go fast.
the tacos here were so delicious! the flavors in each of them blend very well and the meat just melts in your mouth.
No comment
Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! There are no words to describe this yumminess. If you're in NY fir the week ir weekend, its a must go to!
Perfect hole in the wall tacos place! It was a definite score for the taste buds! If your near Time Square and got a hankering for a taco go get one! Or even if your not up for a taco, GO GET ONE!!!!
No comment
Can't complain about anything from this shop, fast service, decent price, good portion, and great food

Dammmmn this place is delicious. I was caught off guard and I'm very very pleasantly surprised. I would come back here any day. I had all 4 tacos and they were all delicious I would say that the beef is my favorite because of the char on the beef followed closely by pork. Amazing food so happy yelp suggested it.

Get here early, like the minute they open. It's the only way to avoid the million other people that know this place is awesome. It's no frills - stand and eat your tacos or take them somewhere else. They're not fancy, but they don't need to be - the meat is seasoned and cooked to absolute perfection.
Yes no complaints the service is great the food is so good I've been going there through the pandemic once they open back up.

The service, and food is all great! The people who make the food do it at a great quality. Even though they are busy, they are all really kind. The seasoning on the Al pastor and carne asada tacos con todo, SOOOOO GOOD! Flavor is on point. Definitely recommend this taco spot for anyone! Location is also close to time square and broadway. Get a taco before you walk around.
Dare I say one of the best tacos I've ever had was in New York? This is coming from a person that has lived in New Mexico and California for most of his life where Mexican food is king.
The lines are long but it's worth it!  There is very limited sitting but the food was some of the best tacos I have ever tasted and I visit Mexico a lot!
Best tacos in New York! If Mexican food is your thing, go to the this place! Super professional and high quality food. Come here after work almost everyday. Love it.
No comment

Amazing tacos as street food! Packed with flavor at a very reasonable price point. Beware that there is no seating and after a long day walking around the city, standing to eat was tough but worth the hype!
No comment

I absolutely love the tacos here! They are tasty and I love that you can see the meat they are using while they make your order. Every time I've gone to Los Tacos No. 1 the food tasted fresh. The only downside is that there is not seating.
No comment
Always a line. Always my taco go to at chelsea. Amazing Tacos. Can't just have one or two
Tacos were very good, definitely worth the line. Although very noisy, there's a few tables inside.
Delicious quick Mexican in the city! It's perfect for a work lunch break and if you are going between attractions as a tourist.
No comment
No comment
Great for a quick bite before seeing a show! Service was fast, got steak and chicken tacos

3rd time we ate here. Always love it. Packed on sat night but the Line moved quickly. Very Fresh cilantro, adobado tacos and mula (which is similar to a quesadilla). Really look forward to my next meal here.

Authentic! Glad I had time to stop here after seeing a play. A perfect spot for a quick bite. Food was tasty, plenty of chicken on the tacos and there is nothing like fresh cilantro, onions, and guacamole. Absolutely highly recommend and I will be back!

Absolutely delicious, I've had Mexican food in California, Arizona and Colorado this takes them all. I had these tacos everyday while I was in New York City . Don't pass this place up if you are in the area don't let a long line discourage you you won't be mad at this place. They are finger licking delicious
We stopped here for dinner after walking through Times Square! The beef and chicken tacos were good! The salsa has a kick but the chips were awesome! We washed everything down with the horchata!

I love this place. This time I was bold and tried the cactus. Much better than expected. Their tacos are the best but make sure and grab a lime and some radishes and get the corn tortillas for the best flavors
No comment

Los Tacos No. 1 is the best taco spot I've had in New York. To be fair, I haven't had that many, but this place has some great tacos. Every time I've been here, I've seen a lot of people waiting to get tacos, and inside it's always filled with people eating--it's quite hard to find a place to eat if you're planning on doing that! The ordering is quick and efficient. You tell them what you want, you pay, they give you a receipt. And then you move down towards the people making the tacos, and you give them your receipt and they make your order for you. It gets a little hectic so if it's your first time here, it might be a little crazy. But even so, I've been back here because I love the tacos I've gotten from this place. We usually also order chips and salsa, and they have some good salsa options! Once we tried the Jamaica drink, and it was sweet and refreshing. Would definitely recommend this place--try their Jamaica if you're deciding on a drink to try!

some of the best mexican food I've had in nyc! you order and pay a counter, receive a ticket, bring the ticket to a chef, and they will make and give you your order. standing room only for eating, they have a lot of counter space. the line moves quickly and the food is so authentic!
Yummy tacos at a decent price that is served fast. Being that I am from LA I will upset some for not giving them a full 5 stars but still a great spot.
Always has a line, and I can see why. Amazing tacos and quesadillas! Super flavorful, and they don't cheap out on the meat!
No comment

Quick delivery to our hotel. I recommend the steak, it was juicy and flavorful. The chicken was a bit dry. The chips and guac was amazing. I would go back and order again. I would ask for extra guac on my taco tho.
No comment
Authentic delicious tacos with free sauces of your choice. Service is quick but tacos slightly on the expensive side.

The best tacos in the city. Every ingredient is incredibly well made and the combination is perfect. I highly recommend the carne asada taco (it is the best) and the pollo asada taco isn't far behind. I recommend getting the tacos on corn tortillas with everything in them. The only downside is the cost of each taco is fairly high but I figure that had to do with being located not just in New York City but also Times Square.
No comment
Tacos de asada were amazing! Adobada was a little too sweet for me for my liking. But their salsas were so good and the home made corn tortillas were really good too
No comment
Service is fast and the carne asada is delicious. The adobada isn't that flavorful in my opinion. The prices are pretty steep with almost $5 per taco.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The cactus, pollo asada, carne asada tacos were fantastic with onion and cilantro. The hot sauces kept there were amazing as well. And the horchata was decent.

column3: Harbor View / Orient Heights, Boston, MA
column6: No comment

My go-to taco place in Manhattan! I always come by whenever I visit the city. I remember being blown away the first time I ate here, but this time the beef taco was a little too salty. I ordered one each of the beef, pork, and chicken taco. 2 tacos is quite filling and 3 is more than enough if you're hungry or have a larger appetite. The pork is the best out of the 3 and if you only get one, I recommend trying the pork adobada taco!
Fast and good! All tacos are great here. My favorite is the al pastor. If you are up early, grab their breakfast burrito to go.

I craving food from Tacos El Pastor after a trip to Las Vegas, and this place comes fairly close in style. I think their steak tacos are the best. The pork is just okay. The service is fairly quick. You're in and out in 10 minutes on a busy day. Took a star away for the price. These tacos are expensive. I would gladly pay this at Tacos El Pastor, but even they don't charge that much... and they make better tacos.
Amazing!  I got the Especial and loved every bite:). Great prices to, right off Times Square!
No comment
No comment
Food was so spicy that we couldn't finish our tacos. Please put a spice warning and/or option to reduce spice level!
I had a pork taco that was juicy and flavorful. I also had a horchata which was very good. This is a great place for a quick bite.
Really great chicken tacos and their guacamole is sooo yummy! The price is very reasonable and the service is very quick!
The tacos are fairly tasty. It's a good place to go with friends for a pregame meal, but the drinks are SUPER strong. I really liked the nachos as well and would definitely go back.
No comment
Best tacos in NYC. Fast service, reasonable price, and plenty of coke to pair with your tacos.
No comment
Tacos were okay not the best. Deserves a 5 because sometimes the more fat a taco has the better it taste however thats not healthy. These tacos are not greasy. Quick service and great service
Best tacos I've had in the city so far, definitely worth the price and wait... will be back
No comment
No comment
I tried the cactus taco very good tasty and the hotness was pleasing highly recommend
Great authentic tacos, def no 1 in NYC at least, as it's hard to find good tacos here for some reason. Great price point too!
No comment

Carna is the best !We also ordered a chicken quesadillas. Geen Apple soda is on point with the tacos. Very simple menu quick service. Great for when you're on the go to explore the city. Customer service exceptional.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Their tacos were freaking delicious.  They were just as good  as the ones I had in Tijuana.  The corn tortillas were freshly made.  The marinated pork was juicy and well seasoned.  The grilled steak was prepared medium rare.  I can't believe I just discovered this place.

If you're in Times Square this place needs to be on your list if you're a taco lover. What a bustling busy grab-and-go eatery. We had carne asada, pollo tacos and they were AMAZING. Stop reading my review and just go there. You won't be disappointed.
Found this place by looking at near me on yelp. I have to say the vibes are real the food is even better and the experience is beyond. Super delicious and fresh.
No comment
Delicious food I recommend the protein sides! Ordered it Togo brought it back to eat, still was hot!

These tacos are amazing but they give me indigestion of sorts from the chicken seasoning for hours after I eat them and bloat me for days, I question what they season them with. I usually get 1 or 2 chicken asada tacos in corn tortilla and sometimes add a side of chips and guac. Very very filling so dont over order. If there is a line it moves quick. I prefer la esquina for tacos to be honest.
Best tacos ever! It's hard to find places this good with great quality meat and homemade tortillas. They are very efficient so don't worry, the line will move fast and it is definitely worth it!
No comment
No comment

Hands-down the best tacos I've had in New York. The most flavorful, filling, perfectly spiced tacos. There is usually a wait - it's not a sit down place. More grab and go. Recommend you try each taco as they are all delicious.
Taco supreme. Go for it. Try chicken and then try pork . Cant go wrong perfect lunch spot
Best tacos you can get in New York I love everything about this place only down side is almost 5 bucks a taco but the service and food are Amazing

Tacos were delicious. The carne asada was seasoned well and the chargrilled taste was delicious. We opted for onions and cilantro only on the tacos and were told that we could not get the salsa and guac on the side. Chips and salsa were good. Also recommend the green salsa at the self serve counter. Tacos are now $4.75/ each.
These are amazing tacos.   All great but pork are stellar.  Tortillas made in house. Get here and eat some. Nuf said.

As a native San diegan imported to NY, I have very high standards for tacos (tacos el gordo, las cuatro milpas, etc.) these maybe the best tacos I've ever had! Corn tortillas are made right in front of you, and the meats are always fresh and juicy. Salsa toppings are fresh and frequently replenished. Quality is very good here !!

I did not think that New York would have authentic Mexican tacos. Thank god I was proven wrong because this place had absolutely delicious tacos. I loved the chicken one. Not a big fan of the cactus one. It was kinda slimy for me lol. Like the inside of an okra before it's cooked kind of slimy.
No comment
Very good and delicious tacos but little bit expensive and so crowded. No too much space for eat inside

So happy that we found this place when the wait was short! I had three tacos and all of them were  perfect! Fresh corn tortillas were being made right next to the grilled meats and the salsa was the best I've ever had. It was packed, but we still enjoyed the atmosphere and our lunch!
No comment
No comment
Da Bomb! Loved it son much we had to come back! There might be a line but they are quick. Loved the carne asada with the flour tortilla and the pork with the corn tortilla.
Good ambience, atmosphere, and a overall a really fun experience. The tacos were delicious.
No comment

If you are visiting NYC and craving tacos or quesadillas, this place -- by keeping its focus on a few menu items done right -- checks all the boxes. They make their own tortillas in full view. Do not be deterred if there is a long line: it moves quickly.
Sooooo good! And even tacos de nopal for us vegetarians. Those were some of the best tortillas I have ever had.

Coming from California, we're spoiled and surrounded by delicious tacos all over. I heard really good things about this place and had to try their tacos. I got a taco with carne asada and they really pack it in! I think it could have used more onion and cilantro, but the taco was still quite delicious. There's self serve lime you can grab at the counter, so definitely grab some before you start eating. I'd say Los Tacos No. 1 is pretty legit! Can't wait to go back for more.

5 stars across the board. Very delicious mexican food in NY with 3 locations. Cant go wrong with anything on the menu. The line can get long but the service is very fast and the food is very good. Make sure to add pico de gallo at the self serve section.
Very good tacos. One of my favorite spots to go to when I visit New York. I definitely recommend this place
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fast and friendly service. Not too crazy about the tacos. Not as flavorful as expected.

After fasting for 48hrs for no particular reason other than food was not a priority. This was the perfect way to break it. I love tacos and this has skyrocketed to the top of my list of absolute perfection. The adobaba tacos are it. Burst of flavor and the corn tortillas taste like abuelita's homemade ones.
No comment

I tried chicken, steak, and pork tacos with corn tortillas. The pork taco was the best with very rich flavor. The chicken and steak tacos both lack seasoning in my opinion. The chicken isn't juicy, and the steak isn't tender.

Generally, I am not used to eating Mexican food in the United States, I don't like it, I have always thought that it is not similar, in fact I am from Mexico City.  However, this place is quite well done, I had a flash back of a typical Mexican taqueria, from the image to the way you order the tacos I thought it was great.  The handmade tortillas, the meat, the ingredients, as well as the sauces are excellent.  They are not spicy, but I understand they can't make them that spicy.  The only thing I did not like is that  there was no longer the tacos al Pastor (pork), the next one I will arrive earlier.
No comment

column3: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: This was the first stop in NY after a long 5 hour flight. We arrived around 8pm and it was packed. Luckily we were able to grab a spot to enjoy our tacos. If you order any one taco make sure you get the Adobada. Overall this spot was good for what it was.
Really good tacos especially the pork Tacos. Only thing that I didn't like was that there was no seating, just a counter to stand and eat.
Delicious tacos!! Great place. Standing eating only, no sit down. We almost left because of that but thankfully we didn't. The tacos were sooooo good!! Will definitely be back!

Delicious Tacos and their Nopal option is vegan if you get the corn taco. I also got it "con todo" and added even more things they had as garnish (all also vegan) and the cool the Nopal separately from the meat. A yummy experience altogether
Great tacos and guacamole. Went to the Times Square location. Long line but it moved quickly! Stand up eating only (tall tables) but people move through this restaurant fast. Definitely recommend.
First stop in New York and it did not disappoint. Highly reccomend the adobada tacos! Service was quick, even with the line. Quick dining experience but totally worth a visit.
No comment

Was so happy to find an AUTHENTIC Mexican spot on our visit to NYC. Very organized, efficient, and most of all delicious tacos. There is no seating all standing which is probably better given the current pandemic. It allows people to quickly eat and leave making room for the people ordering. My husband, I, and our two kids were extremely happy with this place. Coming from Southern California it is hard to find Mexican food we are happy with but this place did not disappoint... Definitely a must if looking for Mexican food during your NYC stay.
Authentic Mexican street tacos. Fresh ingredients, balanced flavors, but a bit pricey.
Best Mexican tacos in NYC, the service is great, food is fresh and tasty, these are real Mexican tacos!
No comment

This is my go-to food spot whenever I'm in Times Square or in the area for a Broadway show. It's perfect if you need to eat but don't want a long wait or to pay an overpriced tourist price at a restaurant. The tacos are delicious and personally the closest tasting to the authentic Tijuana style tacos in Southern California.

This place never disappoints.  The tacos are amazing. Service is very quick.  Staff friendly.  Tacos made to order.  The cactus taco is very tasty.  I highly recommended this place for a delicious quick bite.
As a Mexican these are the 2nd best tacos I've ever tried!! Good tacos. Highly recommend!

The long line was worth it. I tried everyone of their items and never disappointed me. Every top is definitely the steak one. I would always want to go back just might be a bit crowded during lunch hour.
Best tacos indeed! But need to order more than one because portion is small. Get the tamarind drink as well.
No comment
Stopped by for a quick meal before my train . Yummy tacos and yummy sauces to try out
No comment
Might be my most favorite tacos is the country. I know that's a huge statement. It give me joy.
Even though it's always packed the line moves pretty quickly. Good quality Mexican, although it is not very affordable at 4$ per taco. You should be aware that the salsa is SPICY.
No comment
Extremely good hole in the wall taco joint. Cooked in front of you on the rotating thing. Get carne asada

Standing room only, no seats. FANTASTIC GUAC OMGGGGGG IT WAS SO GOOD!! The grilled cactus tostada tasted like death if death were styrofoam, but that's a preference thing and not a reflection on the restaurant. Nice staff!
One word, AMAZING!!!!! Truly authentic, tasty and just delicious food!  The staff is friendly, clean location and definitely fast service.  I highly recommend it!

these tacos are by far the best tacos I've ever had. Im originally from california visiting New York and im not gonna lie these tacos beat all that tacos I've eaten in California!! Im already grieving with the fact that im probably not gonna be having these tacos for a while.
Great Taco spot ! Had a steak quesadilla and the pork taco and they were both great would definitely recommend if you're feeling Mexican cuisine and are in the area !

Found this spot near Times Square, ordered a quesadilla thinking cheesy folded tortilla but it was a regular taco with melted cheese. I came here for dinner and had to try one of each for their tacos. My favorite in order was adobada, carne asada, pollo, nopal. This is a great spot for lunch or dinner, would definitely come back here. Tacos were made very quickly and the cooks always asked if you would like corn or flour tortilla. There is no indoor seating, the tables for standing are closed due to Covid and I only saw one table out front with 4 chairs so take these to go.

I was skeptical about the quality of food here.  It's right next to Times Square, high foot traffic - people/tourists will flow in by default regardless of the quality.  But I was proved wrong!  It's popular because the food is good.  I had pollo quesadilla and carne asada taco.  And I tried both flower and corn tortilla.  All were executed very well.  Simple but very flavorful.  I came here around 5pm and there were about 7 parties ahead of me.  I had to start waiting at the sidewalk line first but the line moved quickly.  I cannot imagine how much more wait around lunch/dinner time.  Highly recommended.  Great Mexican fix in the middle of Manhattan.

I'm admittedly late to the party when it comes to Los Tacos No.1. My cousins and co-workers have long mentioned this eatery as a must try when it comes to Mexican cuisine. I finally made my way over a couple weeks back and it certainly did not disappoint. Rich with flavor is the first thing that comes to mind when it comes to their tacos and quesadillas. Each bite is better than the next! I will caution you that the lunch line is rather long, but it moves fast, and your food is served in a quick manner as well. I love the food truck/food court feel of the restaurant itself and the music playing over the speakers is a welcome addition to the entire experience. I will without a doubt be back to sample the rest of their menu!

Best spot for authentic Mexican tacos , my family and I love coming back for more . Pricey but definitely worth it . P

Good tacos and long line does not equate to long wait. They keep it moving to get your food as quickly as possible.
Absolutely tasty and delicious tacos and also the quesadilla was really nice.. highly recommended for taco lovers

Wow. I ordered the carne asada and pollo asado tacos on flour tortillas (so perfect) con todo (a must!) and chips + salsa (enjoyably spicy). For a moment, I felt as though I was transported to Mexico City, eating bomb street tacos. Highly recommend checking this place out!
Visited here today on my food tour for today. This is the best fucking taco I have had in my entire life.

Best tacos I've ever had. Try the adobada on literally anything but especially the quesadilla. It's more of a taco with cheese and is fantastic. Other standouts were the pollo taco and hot salsa. Make sure to get all the add ons on your tacos! Overall, a MUST try when you're in the area.

The best tacos ive tried. Mostly all the items are made there. Definitely worth a try if you are in the city. Went there on Sunday evening and it wasn't as packed.

Now let me tell you something!!!! READ!!! You MUST GO!!!! Like seriously!!! So yummy and totally to die for, super fast service & friendly staff . This a my to go to spot after or during work! Like what are you waiting for ? Check them out, you won't regret it.

I've been searching for authentic Baja California street tacos & proper Mexican food since moving from SoCal to NYC. I've been utterly disappointed for almost a decade that the city that touts its internationally famous cuisine could be so deficient in a quality street taco - offering only battered & fried versions of a fish taco or Tex/Mex options - pathetic... This foodie cannot be more excited to have experienced proper street tacos here! All the tacos were just tastebud treats and the experience also very taco-stand-true. There's always a line out of the door when I visit these days because you can't keep a good taco hidden! Where have you been Los Tacos No.1 ??? My search is over & I'm most satisfied with my new favorite authentic taco place in NYC. 5  would definitely recommend !!!
Amazingggg! Carne Asada Tacos are the way to go. get everything on it + the hot salsas. They won't disappoint.

This place was yummy! A little pricey for tacos but it was definitely worth it, very delicious, fresh, and authentic. Place was a little small and there were a lot of people but the workers were moving very fast and quick to clean and prepare food. These were one of the best tacos I have ever had.

Authentic taco spot in the heart of times square! Imagine that. Literally gives you the feeling of getting tacos from a stand in Mexico. Menu is clear and simply put on the wall- tacos, plates, enchiladas & "mulas" which falls somewhere between the two. Lines can get long here! Like wrapped outside long, but it tends to move quickly. They've set it up so you can order then move to the left to specify toppings and tortillas(& watch it get made) then lastly left once more to add your salsa. This taco spot has standing room only!! So don't expect to be lounging around here after your done eating. This is strictly for enjoying delicious, authentic tacos & bouncing. My favorite taco was the beef. I wish they did fish as well because I'm sure it would be outstanding! Prices are on point too.

As close as you can get to real Mexican tacos. Flavors are there. Salsas are tasty. Service is quick. Locations are everywhere in Manhattan. Definitely a must!

Great tacos made to order. Menu is small but taste great. Orders are easy and pickup is fast. Standing room only for eating. Flavorful tacos when you order them with everything on them. Tastes just like when we vacationed in Mexico.

I'm biased because I grew up in the Southern California region where some of the founders of this place are from. The style of tacos is unique to the Imperial Valley/Mexicali area and also a little bit to San Diego/TJ. But after living in San Francisco for 8 years and not finding decent tacos my husband and I decided to try NYC living and this place alone makes it all worth it. Best tacos for this area hands down and pretty close to how they make them back home. Small, fresh, handmade, flour tortillas make the perfect base for grilled asada and crispy adobada. This location in particular is generous with the filling and not usually very busy compared to the one in Chelsea Market. We come here at least once a week. They also reheat well so order extra to take home!

If you're in the time square area and in need of some delicious food I HIGHLY recommend.

I watched Bobby Flay's show, The Flay List,  and knew on my next trip  to NYC that I had to try this place.  We were lucky to walk in and it was moderately crowded.  When we left there was a line formed outside waiting to get In.  Los Tacos No 1 did not disappoint.  It's kind of chaotic but there were employees directing us on what to do.  When you finally get your Tacos , hit the salsa bar and find a table space to eat you'll be  in taco nirvana.    Its a stand up and eat situation and you'll very likely have complete strangers eating tacos face to face a foot across the table from you but don't let that scare you.  There is so much going on and the food so good you won't even care.   Visiting here has to be one of my favorite foodie experiences.  Thanks Bobby Flay for the great taco tip.

Tacos are good.  I usually get one chicken and two beef.  It's all in the hand made taco shells.  It's chewy and delicious.  Tacos do not travel well.  Eat asap...Either location is good but the line is too long in Chelsea.
Tried 3 tacos, chicken, carne asada, and adobada, all delicious! I especially loved the corn tortillas, super flavorful.

Love love love these tacos. Fresh tortilla, grilled and seasoned meats and great toppings. They offer 4 variations of tacos/tostadas/quesadillas - carne asada (steak), pollo (chicken), adobada (pork) and nopale (cactus). We got all the meat offerings. You a choose between corn or flour tortillas and they're topped with onions, salsa, cilantro and guac I believe. These tacos are incredible! The meat has this deeply grilled flavour and the toppings are nice and fresh. I could easily eat at least 4-5. Off to the side are some extra hot sauces and pico you can add. Only standing room available for eating so don't expect to sit down with friends or family. It's a quick, grab your food, eat and leave type of place which is fine with me! Love it and would definitely return.

Deliciously messy. I needed many napkins to clean my hands off from all the meat juice dripping from the amazing tacos. Carne asada, awesome. Salsa too hot for me but I'm a wuss. The thing you can't miss is the fried quesadilla, what?  Where has this been all my life?  A must have. Flaky outside and packed inside with pork, cheese, guacamole. YUM

Tacos are amazing and really cheap for Manhattan highly recommended! They are super fast would def go another time

Some of the best tacos in NYC. The food tastes fresh every time. Small menu that allows them to focus on great dishes. Always a long line which is always good sign.

Excellent tacos but with midtown prices. Got a quick bite here before meeting up with friends. The tacos are legit and delicious. But why am I paying almost $4 for a single taco when I can get equally authentic and delicious ones from a truck for practically half the price??

Quesadilla, without cheese... One of my favorite spots to go to for a quick snack or a full meal pre- or post-theater show. But only counter eating available. Surprisingly, they don't open too late, especially for Fri - Sun dining, considering it's such a popular spot with a line often to get in. Definitely highly recommend!

This location close to Times Square can get pretty crowded. But in terms of the quality, it's on par with Tacos El Gordo. Would highly recommend as it's probably one of the best taco spots in the world.

Walked by twice decided to grab a bite on our way back to the hotel. Tortillas made fresh. Everything tasted fresh and delicious, ordered "con todo" a little spicy but I savored every bite.
Best tacos I've had in the east coast. The prices are somewhat expensive but I guess that's what you pay for in the city. I recommend getting the carne asada tacos. Delicious.

My mistake in misunderstanding that the nopal (grilled cactus) plate was not nopal tacos + sides, but was essentially everything without the handmade tortillas. Still good, but will have to return and try as a taco.

Living up to having no. 1 in your name is a pretty tall task but I think Los Tacos does a pretty fine job. I've had this bookmarked for a while but haven't had the chance to check it out until now. As expected, there was a line to get in. They have a sign indicating estimated time but I found that it was much quicker, which was great because I was HUNGRY. I ordered the Carne Asada, Pollo Asado and Adobada tacos to try. Ordering was seamless and then you're directed to the assembly section where you're asked a couple of questions as to how you want your order - corn or flour tortilla and toppings, in my case. If you want to dine in, there's counter space and a few seats by the window for you to choose from. I absolutely love the Adobada taco - it was so well marinated and tasty! The Pollo Asado was a close second. Honestly, you can't really go wrong. It definitely exceeded my expectations. Look forward to coming back when I'm in the area.

Im from socal and lived in SF for the last 5 years. Compared to the tacos I've had in both norcal and socal, these tacos are definitely on par with them. Carne asada is great, and the chicken was bomb too. I only got corn tortillas since I heard the flour has lard (im muslim). It IS a little on the "pricey" side for me when it comes to tacos, but since I'm not next to a La Estrella 1.50 socal taco, these will DEFINITELY fill the void when I'm craving a taste of home.

Best tacos I ever had. 5/5. The pork, steak and chicken were all so juicy and delicious. They get you in very quick and have a solid method of getting customers through. The tacos were so juicy and very flavorful. It's in a great location too. I would recommend this to anyone. 10/10
I ordered two pollo tacos and they were delicious! The salsa was so good. I wish I could buy some to go!
Probably my favorite taco place in NYC! Delicious flavors. Helpful staff. There is often a line, but worth the wait.

Very good. Living in southern CA set my standard for tacos at a high level. Fast service even with a lot of customers.

Absolutely my favourite Mexican restaurant ever. Have been eating Los Tacos for a couple of years as their food has been consistently fantastic. Wow, I am not the biggest fan of tacos but these tacos were freaking amazing. I went with a few friends right as they had opened on a Saturday. Minimal line. We tried one of each taco. It's fun to watch as the corn tortillas are made in front of you. The pork was my favorite as it is shaved off of a giant spit rotating for all to see. The pork bits are moist, with delicious charred bits and smokiness from the grilling. The avocado, onion, cilantro, and salsa that comes with each taco adds a pop of flavor of freshness. The steak, grilled chicken, and cactus were also super delicious. Can't wait to come back

For my birthday weekend, l stayed close to Chelsea Market, so I decided to check out this taco spot that everyone's been raving about. The first thing you should know is that there is always a line no matter what time of day that you go, so be prepared to wait for at least 10 mins before ordering. Honestly speaking, I wouldn't care too much about the lines because these tacos are definitely worth the wait! I tried the pollo asado and adobada (pork) tacos and both were fresh and cooked to perfection. You get to pick whether you want it on a flour or corn tortilla and if you want everything on it (onions, cilantro, salsa and guacamole). I opted for the flour tortillas and everything on my tacos. I also tried horchata for the first time and it was so delicious! I loved this spot so much that I went back 3 more times during my stay. Highly recommend checking out Los Tacos No 1!!
one of my favorite tacos places ! the tacos r so good, i always go to the Chelsea market location.
No comment
No comment
No comment
OMGEEEEEEEE!  These tacos are the bomb!!!!!  Definitely recommend! Quesadillas as well!!
No comment
No comment

Hands down, best tacos in New York City. The prices are amazing for NYC, and the flavor is out of this world. I love their chicken tacos and chicken quesadillas. Truly packed with flavor. And don't leave without getting a full sampler of their salsas - they are fresh and delicious !
No comment
No comment

5/5 perfection as always. My order will always be corn tortillas "con todo" (with everything). Love how they've adapted to the pandemic while maintaining the full experience with the baggies of lime, radish, and peppers) for each order of tacos. Both locations I've been lucky enough to try never disappoint. If you have immigrant parents like me (Korean and Pakistani), they will likely enjoy the spice that American food can lack.

So as a CA guy, I was skeptical of coming to this place. But it gave me a vibe reminiscent of Tacos El Gordo from the West Coast. So I decided why not. And it did not disappoint. I tried 3 adobada tacos, 2 carne asada tacos, 1 pollo taco and 1 carne asada quesadilla. Everything was bomb. And I am dying to come back again. This place was great and despite the line, it went quickly and got the food even quicker. I highly recommend d this place especially if you're craving some bomb tacos and you're from the West Coast. A+
No comment
