No comment

This is probably my favorite Taco spot in the city specifically the Chelsea market location. The chicken taco are to do for. Tortillas are made fresh can't go wrong with either corn or flour. You'll bite your finger eating ; they're that good!!

Best takeout lunch! Ordered my favorite adobada tacos con todo - with everything: onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole - plus a pollo asada quesadilla and thick, crispy chips. Everything was carefully prepared and wrapped, including lime slices tied in a small bag with peppers. Clean, organized, and so, so friendly...definitely earned generous tips. Will be stopping by as often as I can!
Sensational street food. Limited selection but everything is so good. Maybe not a kids place but I loved it.
No comment
No comment

Carnitas tacos were great. I did try all three including the cactus taco. I really wasn't a fan of it. Service was very prompt saying there was a super long line outside of the place. Overall a decent place to grab a quick bite with a variety of tacos to choose from.

I had the Carne Asada Quesadilla with everything on it and it is now in the top five of things I've ever consumed. That quesadilla was magical. The Jamaica was great and Luis was super nice to me! Loved the experience! 5/5. Fast and delicious.
No comment

I heard a lot of good things about this place so I decided to give it a try. I honestly didn't expect much but man did it exceed my expectations!! The flavor was incredible and the staff was really nice too! Definitely coming back!
Súper fast paced taco shop on 42nd street!! Great tacos and atmosphere. No places to sit just some bars scattered around.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great vibe. Recommend Carne Asada Quesadilla and Carne Asada Tacos. A bit spicy, but that I love.
Excellent food! We had the pork tacos and the fried quesadilla and both were so yummy. The sauce was very good as well, just the right amount of heat. Really recommend trying this establishment!

It's crowded and during the busy hours, you might have to wait outside for a bit but it's well worth the wait. The energy of this place is so awesome and I love the idea of being a regular here. Definitely recommend checking out whenever you can.
No comment
No comment

OMG I will never go to Chipotle again!!! I had a chicken, a beef & a pork taco and each was delicious in their own right. Being from So Cal I can appreciate a real, old school, no frills taco and that's exactly what I got. I had mine on corn tortillas naturally. I'd say of the 3 the pork was my favorite but that's a personal preference. Anyway, go to no frills Los Tacos!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Like the original location in chelsea markets this "sister location" should be a new york institution like Katz. It is imho the best place to land a taco in NY. Everything is fresh. Everything is authentic. Everything is made on the spot no bagged tortillas around these parts. Staff and the lack of seating (they offer stand up tables) keep everything moving. Its impressive how quickly they serve up the amount of mouthwatering food they do so quickly. If you're in Times Square there are an abundance of tourist traps and overpriced fare. Los Tacos No. 1 has to be one of the best things to get in the area.
The hype is real! A little greasy but so so good! No seating, unfortunately, but really easy, fast and SO DELICIOUS!

Best tacos I've had, on the East Coast, so far. The guac and cebolla guisada was delicious too and the manager was really nice and alert of his customers. My husband however wasn't too much of a fan because he said the tortillas tasted too much like corn but the meat was good. (Maíz HANDMADE tortillas btw!) I thought they were fine but I also had a jalapeño asado so I couldn't feel my tongue after a while lol they also only gave him 3 tacos instead of the 4 we paid for but he went back in and it wasn't an issue, we had the receipt. I'll go again.
Popular taco place! Chefs very passionate but the service sort of messy. You may not end up getting what you order but the tacos taste absolutely good.
No comment

Wow, I am legit impressed with their tacos here! I only tried the carne asada tacos and it was legit. Their tacos were filled with lots of juicy steak and simple guacamole salsa. I really enjoyed the super thin flour tortilla which is something I've never had before. I don't eat tacos much but this was better than anything I've tried in the Bay Area.
Pricey, loud and slow. They make the same 4 tacos everyone does but charge a dollar more because they're a tourist trap

Delicious tacos. Tried the steak, chicken, and pork all on corn and all were amazing. I will say the tacos are a little greasy but they are packed full of flavor and definitely hit the spot. I would say avoid the horchata as it doesn't have as much flavor as a typical drink and tastes a little watered down for $5.
No comment
No comment

My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I ordered three tacos. One filled me up. I ordered the Queso taco, the shell was made out of fried cheese. Delicious but very rich and not on the menu but they know what you want if you ask for it. My daughter ordered a cheese quesadilla, it was tiny, made out of a 6 inch flour tortilla and not particularly cheap. You stand in line, order and pay, them give your ticket to the guys who make you food. There are lots of extra sauces for you, cut limes, and a limited amount of room for you to stand and eat your tacos. Delicious!
No comment

For quick, authentic tacos there's no where in the city I would go before los tacos number one. If Fresh corn tortilla's and bottled squirt soda don't get you excited there's also the fresh al pastor pork that gets shaved off the spit for every taco you order. Great for a quick snack or whole dinner if you're hungry enough. Either way los tacos is where it's at.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow, the tacos are incredible! So glad I tried it. The line was out the door and along the front of the building - a good sign of delicious food worth waiting for. Ordered carne asada and pollo asado - they were both totally delicious and flavorful. The tortillas are made from scratch, too, and both the corn and flour were so good. The chips and salsa were fresh, the salsa is definitely on the spicy side.

My sister happened to find this place and I was really hungry so we decided to stop by. The service is fast and friendly. I had two tacos de carne asada and it was beyond my expectation. I love that the corn tortillas are homemade. The salsa isn't spicy at all but that's probably just me since I love eating spicy foods. I went twice and they never disappoint.
Thank you to Mary and staff today for taking great care of us. You made this an amazing experience! Please know you guys have a couple of new friends from Los Angeles. We'll see you guys soon!

We were in town visiting from Florida and heard about this great taco spot. Being slightly skeptical,  we stopped by and had a few tacos for lunch. The line was out the door and on the sidewalk, but it moved decently. It only took us about 15 minutes to get our food. The place is pretty chaotic and a bit disorganized, but it worked. We got to the counter and ordered a pastor taco and a carne asada. We paid and they gave us a ticket while asking us to slide down. There were multiple stations where you gave the guys making tacos your ticket and they gave you your order. This took less than 5 minutes. Trying to find a spot to sit or stand was tough. We ended up crammed in the corner. We dug into out tacos and they were good. They were certainly above average, but not life changing as they had been described. The flavor and texture was nice on both. Overall, we enjoyed our visit. It was nice to try out one of the highest rated taco spots in the area, but it was a bit more hectic than I anticipated.

I honestly have not had better tasting tacos !!!!!!! This is a must visit . The place is  small and only standing room to eat but worth it . Excellent flavor . Amazing guacamole and spicy salsa . True authentic taste makes me want to come back here time and time again . My personal fav is pollo asado on corn or flour tortilla prepped with everything exactly how it comes and 3 is not enough lol .
No comment
This place is the bomb. Every food tasted fresh and delicious. I can see why this place has over close to 1800 reviews, I will definitely be back here again.

Los tacos son SUPREMOS. As a taco lover, these tacos have now become my vision of the ideal tacos. My favorite flavor is the adobada taco (marinated pork), which was a truly heavenly experience. The pork tasted beautifully with the assortment of vegetables (onions, cilantro, salsa, guacamole) and lime. The combination of flavors is superb, and the experience of ordering the tacos straight from the chef makes it all the better. It's straightforward, delicious, and authentic. You won't go wrong with trying these tacos either as a quick snack or a delicious meal -- and they'll have you hungry for more.
The best tacos in NYC! It was mouthwatering perfection! Ordering is so easy and quick. The workers are so professional!
Love love love can't get enough. I might need rehab if tacos didn't improve my life so Much. If you love authentic tacos then you should be going here. Period. Enjoy!
No comment

Probably the best tacos I've ever had - better than the ones in Cali. Service is also fast so don't get scared off by the line. This is a great place to get a quick bite before a broadway show if you're not looking to spend 3 dollar signs on average midtown restaurants.
No comment
Hands down the best tacos you'll ever have in your life. Choose between a flour or corn shell (or cheese shell from their secret menu).
So tasty. Carne asada tacos were so good. The Jamaica was delicious. I could eat here every day. Mmmm. Fresh and authentic.

This place is walkable from Timesquare. Food is tasty, but prices are reasonable. There are no seats, you can stand and eat in the counters. I went for 3 tacos. Carne asada and chicken tacos were excellent. Cactus taco was just ok, take it only if you are a vegetarian. For drinks Horchata was the best. Jamaica had a slight tamarind taste but good as well.
No comment

Beautiful, wonderful tacos, my first visit today with my daughter.  Outstanding, tasty tacos, bustling little place.  Employees couldn't be nicer or more attentive, and I was impressed by the cleanliness.  Definitely returning soon to sample other things.
No comment

Amazing, no-nonsense tacos that are reasonably priced? Yes please! What more can you ask for in this part of town. Los Tacos No. 1 never disappoints, especially when I'm looking for something quick and delicious. I enjoy this location over the Chelsea Market one, mainly because it's not overrun by tourists (at least not yet) and has more counter space for me to appreciate my tacos. My all-time favorite is the steak taco. The meat is so so flavorful and tender. Also love the salsa station that allows me to load my tacos up with more deliciousness.
No comment

Omg! Just looking at photos of their tacos makes me drool. Probably the best soft tacos , corn & Tortilla, that I have ever eaten. So so so good! The salsa, the guac, onions & cilantro... absolutely delicious! You will not be disappointed if you like Mexican authentic tacos! Don't forget to get the chips and guac on the side. Small bag of chips so if you're sharing, grab two lol

Great authentic tacos. Pork was amazing, but the steak was too spicy. The toppings were perfect--guac, onion, cilantro, salsa. Definitely a great spot to stop and have quick snack, as it's standing room only.
The best tacos ive ever had. The eating area has no seats so you have to eat standing up. The lines are crazy but they go quick. I always make sure to stop by here when im in the city.
No comment

This is the 2nd location I've tried and it is consistently good. It is bigger than the chelsea market location but not by much. Word of advice, stick to the carnitas. This is as close as you can get to an authentic Mexican street taco in the USA. Yes, even more so than CA or TX. The adobada is an acquired taste & honestly this time around the adobada seasoning was just a bit much. Stick to carnitas and you just cant lose with that combination.

100% worth the type. So so good! I tried the chicken and the pork tacos and they were both amazing. The place seems to be always packed but since there are no seats, people don't stay here too long and the tables empty out pretty quickly. I also love the vibe of the place - good place to eat alone without feeling awkward! Most highly recommend.
No comment
Great spot to grab a quick bite. Allot of flavor in the tacos. Would recommend. Prices alil high but that's midtown prices.
One of my favorite taco places globally! Can't wait to go back.
No comment
What a gem this place is. Line is ALWAYS long and you need to stay on the line cook to make sure you get what you ordered. Place is a factory.

So so so so good. Must have when in New York time square area. I would eat this place 3 times a day if I coulda! Everything we tried was amazing. Never will I find street style cookies as good as this place!
The food was fantastic!!  Quick and easy!  Tasted very authentic.  Staff was very friendly.

the only reason this isn't 4-5 stars is because unfortunately there are very few vegetarian options. the cactus tacos were good, as was the guac! but although they have beans in their cactus bowl they couldn't make a bean taco, possibly because it was made ahead of time. either way the food that i could eat was good and the place had a great atmosphere. you eat standing up at counters, so make sure your feet aren't too tired from exploring the city!
No comment
A must when you are in NYC! If you like tacos of course. Even if you don't, Los Tacos might change your mind. They are worth the price.

Visited NYC with a couple of friends and this place was on our go to list. The placed was PACKED! There was a line outside the door and we waited a good few minutes to order. I ordered the carne asada tacos with everything on it. It comes with cilantro, onions and salsa and I added on pico and guacamole salsa as well. I got three tacos and they were huge and filled with so much meat. They definitely do not skimp out here. The tortillas are freshly warmed up and the meat is running out quick so the carne and everything else was fresh as well. This tasted very authentic to me and living upstate it's hard to find delicious tacos like these. Next time I'm in the city I will definitely be back! It was worth the wait.

Adobada corn tacos is a classic favorite. The corn tortilla is amazing. Second best protein the pollo. The beef was okay. Horchata and hibiscus drinks are delicious. The go to place for legit tacos in nyc. Definitely one of the best outside mexico.

Overpriced garbage. Vegetarian options non-existent besides for a half assed attempt to customize another offering. Highly dissatisfied and regret wasting valuable $$$ when there are many more options to choose from. Don't fall for the bs reviews on here, you will get more value for your money elsewhere, especially if vegan or vegetarian.
No comment

Just finished having lunch here and WOW my day has been made. These are definitely some of the best tacos I've ever had. I was in the city looking for a place to grab a quick bite and this place delivered. I ordered 2 tacos: carne asada (grilled steak) and adobada (pork), as well as a chicken quesadilla and I pretty much devoured all 3 in 10 mins. FYI this is not a sit down spot. They only have a few counters for you to stand and eat but that's it. Service is quick and tacos are worth every single penny you pay. Will be coming back for sure.
Superb flavor. Tacos were authentic and loved them with everything on it. The lime took the tacos to the next level. The horchata drink was delicious too.

I am from California where you get authentic Mexican food and some of the best Tacos. So, I was hesitant in trying this place, but I am so glad I did it. Their Tacos are amazing. They are fresh ny delicious. One of the best taco places in bay.
No comment

I was looking for a quick delicious meal and i found this restaurant in google maps. Its one of the best tacos i ever had. They're quick and delicious and the portions are perfect. Highly recommended.
No comment
Great service! The food wasn't so great. Looked like dog food to be honest. I wouldn't go back. They were very nice and had great service and pick up situation.

The tacos are delicious, inexpensive, and definitely worth the wait. We tried the cactus, pork, chicken, and steak tacos on corn tortillas with everything on it. We had about two tacos per person, which ended up being the perfect amount for four of us to share. All of the tacos were fresh and tasty. However, one of the sauces is a bit on the spicy side, so be careful if you are not a fan of spicy foods.
The food was so good and fresh that I didn't take a picture but just ate! A good price for your money and try the chicken add on on your dish if you visit, it's very fresh and soft.
No comment
These tacos are freshly made with tortillas hand made so delicious  the guacamole is fresh and the mulitas are also good! The pork meat is flavorful!
Tacos were okay. My carne asada needed more seasoning; at $4.25 a taco, I'll go to my California taco spot instead.
No comment
Best tacos is 42 street hands down  I love every single bite . Great costumer service and nice employees

The tacos here are really good! If you order the quesadilla don't think it's your regular kind that you would get pressed at like a Taco Bell. They more taco like. Tried the chicken and the carne asada. Both equally amazing. Wait times are normal but even if there are long lines it moves pretty quick.

Having lived only 5 miles from the Tijuana-San Ysidro border for many years, I got spoiled with all the local yummy street tacos. A friend (also from San Diego) mentioned that the tacos from Los Tacos No. 1 were the best she ever had. Of course, I was skeptical. Until now...the adobada taco was off the chain and the carne was also soooo good. Coming back!
No comment

These Tacos are number 1 here in NYC. A convenient walk up style restaurant near Times Square. Spicy and delicious offerings will have you feeling muy bueno! Loved the friendly staff... be sure to hold on to your receipt after ordering, you need it to claim your food! PS... best Mexican Coca Cola I've had... The salsas were fresh, hot and sooooo good!

Busy line but great cheap Mexican food. I adobada Taco is the absolute best, no question. I would honesty just get this kind of taco. The asada and chicken were just ok, but the pork was one of the best meat tacos I've ever had. The line moves fast and the wait isn't too bad, nice sauces and pico de Gallo all on the side. I like how you can get so many toppings on your tacos for no extra charge.

We stopped here briefly while we were in New York City. We had been walking around and were starving. We had passed this place a few times and noticed that it was never ever not busy. Based just on that we assumed the food had to be great and fresh and we were not disappointed. The food was quick affordable and very tasty. I would suggest a stop at this restaurant if for nothing else than just for the experience

First day in NYC husband and I wanted Tacos for breakfast, we looked up places as we were walking and decided to try this place out. On first impression alone  It is not a fancy place. Just a walk up register with a grill behind it and standing tables only, first come first served kinda joint. You can pick a drink either from the coolers with things like Mexican Coke & Topo Chico or the homemade Horchata, Tamarind etc. the have Four taco choices I went with a steak taco and a pork taco on corn and hubs got two pork tacos on flour tortillas all of them "all the way". We didn't know what to expect but we knew it smelled fantastic. After we got our food we managed to squeeze in the corner and try them. When we took our first bites, we both looked at each other with wide eyes and proceeded to make love to these tacos. They were that good. All of the flavors perfectly balanced, the crispy fatty meat with the onions, guac, and salsa and the handmade tortillas all sang together. If we hadn't planned a big lunch we seriously would have gone back for more. And we plan to go again before we leave the city. Do yourself a favor pop in and get three Pork Tacos and a Mexican coke. You will be so glad you did!
No comment
Best taco place in NY. These tacos are authentic and taste so good. I recommend anybody that truly enjoys authentic tacos to swing by.
No comment
Good and quick service. Really good tacos. Standing area in store only. (At the moment the store is kind of hidden under construction stuff so hard to find) but still solid place for some good food.
No comment
No comment
Tacos were pretty good. However, they were oerly salty. Probably shouldn't eat on a daily basis. The guacamole was very thin.
No comment
No comment
Still my favorite tacos in New York (non-fancy division), and finally tried their quesadilla especial (with pork) on our latest visit, which was really incredible -- as good or better than the tacos.
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite place to go every time I go to Times Square. One of the best places to eat Tacos in NYC. Every time I come here I ordered 3 corn flour tortillas with grilled steak. The food is really tasty and fresh in this place. Be ready to line up because this place is always full (at least at night that is when I come ) - You can imagine how good it is -  The place is clean, not so big so you eat and go, people are friendly, and food is affordable. You kind of feel like in Mexico when you come here. RECOMMENDED!

Really good tacos and freshly made. The line they have is very efficient and they prepare the orders quickly. There is no seating just standing at counters to eat. They have different salsas varying from mild to hot and pico de Gallo to add to your tacos as well. Each taco comes with the choice of corn or flour tortillas and you can get your taco con todo (cilantro, salsa, guacamole and onions) or pick from the 4 toppings. I didn't really how spicy the guacamole/salsa that is included as a topping was and that was my only issue. I removed it from my tacos and still enjoyed them with just pico de gallo and lime. We ordered the carne asada and chicken as they had run out of the adobado (pork). It also very conveniently located close to Times Square. We really enjoyed the tacos and would recommend anyone to try this place out with caution: the toppings they add can be pretty spicy!
This is the best taco spot. They are so polite, fast, great tacos and a fun environment. Absolutely loved it!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food and today's tacos were one of the best things I've ever eaten waiting time approximately 25 min, but it worth it! Thank you
No comment
Some of the best tacos I've ever had. And the salsas are so yummy and spicy. Really fast service and I hear the quesadillas are really good as well
No comment
No comment
Last times, delicious tacos, what else would you want? Pork is the most delicious of the bunch. Also have tried their chips and guac, and the guac is very fresh!

The steak tacos are so freaking amazing I recommend only thing is it's super loud so you practically have to shout your order and you have to listen for them to call your name so it was a little overwhelming but worth it
No comment
Woah woah these were soo good. I recommend the tacos and chips and salsa and the tacos and definitely the tacos

Really great tacos at a good price!! The Chicken tacos, corn tortilla with everything on it are my go to! 3 tacos will is satisfying, 4 will definitely fill you up. You line up for a ticket and take the ticket to get your food. Line is long during peak lunch time and only gets longer. We were there by 11:50am on a Friday and a line was starting to go out the door. Service is great though and they're good at keeping the line moving. Highly recommend to get there earlier if you want to avoid lines.
No comment

I eat here almost every Tuesday or whenever I can! This is the only place I have had a chicken taco and it not be flavorless and dry. Amazing staff, they are always super friendly and have been before Covid! I have had one of everything on this menu. I love the adobada (pork) tacos the most but second comes the chicken!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best street tacos I've had thus far. The meat is packed with flavor. The sizes are relatively bigger compared to other street tacos I've had. I had two: carne asada and adobada - both fantastic - and could have probably ate another one to feel completely full. This place was pretty packed when we got there; the line was out the door. You order at the front and are handed your ticket. The cooks take that from you and you watch them make it before you. They put everything on it (cilantro, onions, salsa, guacamole sauce, and pineapple if it's adobada). The environment is fast pace, and you dine standing up.
Wow some of the best tacos in the north. Really authentic flavors and fresh ingredients. Their al pastor is incredible. Get the guac. It's worth it.
My favorite tacos in NYC! Taste like tacos from back home in Texas. I love the grab & go concept of the place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Coming from San Diego, I can attest that this what tacos should more or less taste like for American tastebuds. But New York prices for street food no matter how authentic makes my soul die. Check your order carefully if it's a big one, they missed one of my order even though we pay beforehand.

Best tacos I've had in a long time. Order and pay for food then move to the next station where the chefs ask how you want your tacos. Con todo is wonderful. Guac is sooo creamy and the salsa has the perfect amount of spice.
One of the best taco places I've ever been to! Delicious authentic tacos made on the spot. The shop is a little small and no chairs but the tacos are worth it!

Not only are the tacos always fresh, but the service is always friendly and the staff is very attentive and cleanly. There is usually a line during lunch but it goes by super quickly because of how focused everyone is. The food is easily customizable though all of their ingredients seem crisp. My favorite Hell's Kitchen spot for tacos.
No comment
No comment
Thought Chicago had the one up over NYC for tacos but this place has proven me wrong! Delicious pastor and steak tacos, and those homemade tortillas are amazing. Highly recommended!

what a gold mine. For NYC this place was fantastic. It was right in front of our hotel so we picked up and ate in our room. Just amazing tacos and how busy can a place be. The line up was massive but they had a great team(army) behind the counter.
No comment
No comment

Fast service makes up for long lines; tacos are simply made and very tasty. They have horchata as well as coke and Fanta in glass bottles so totally worth popping in for a fast lunch. I had a horchata with a nopales taco and a carne asada taco for $12 - in New York City, y'all!!

Ordered one of each of the four. Simply delicious! Favorites were the chicken and pork tacos (pork is cooked with some pineapple which gives the meat a bit of delicious sweetness to it, and they top it w/ a small bit of pineapple - the flavors all work great together). Order con todo + w/ corn tortilla
No comment
No comment

omg. wow. how did i not know that this place exist?! the line was long but moved quickly (credit minimium is $5 which is a joke because everything here is $3.75 at least so just buy two and you're good). the staff is nice and quick. my sister and i got three tacos each and a horchata (the total was around $25). no seating area, just standing tables. always clean. side sauces available. the pork was SUPER spicy while the chicken and steak were not. the tacos were all extremely delicious (almost as good as mexican tacos itself). definitely recommend this place to all!

column3: Old San Juan, San Juan, Puerto Rico
column6: Best tacos ever!!! BEST TACOS EVER!!!  Line is worth making, they are all delicious! Only down side you don't have an area to sit down and enjoy but I get it line would be way too long!
Omg this place it's so F** GOOD you won't regret it. The food it's delicious and juicy. If you love cheese try the quesotaco

This place was packed when I arrived but the line moves very fast and people are in and out. It's A bit expensive but they're generous with the meat and it's a great place to stop by for a snack. They don't have any place to sit but there are tables so you can stand and eat. Once someone leaves, a worker usually comes by and wipes the table down. They have limes as well as hot sauce ranging from mild, medium and spicy. Definitely a place everyone should try at least once.
No comment

You'll never be disappointed. It's definitely one of the best tacos in NYC besides Tacombi. They're both on top of my list of New York City Tacos. I love getting carne asada and chicken. those are my two top favorites. They even have horchata! SO GOOD!!!
No comment
No comment
Can't beat the tacos here. We always look forward to the Carne asada tacos and go out of our way to make it here when 8n the City.

One of the best lunches in NYC! Long line moves QUICK, in and out of there in 15 minutes easy. Not the place to sit and chat, but killer tacos. Corn tortillas are amazing. Best meat is Adobada, solid 10/10, carne asada and chicken were both struggling. 5or6/10 not sure what the weird or missing flavor was, but wouldn't order again. A must eat for New York.
No comment

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: This place has fast service, friendly staff, affordable food, and the tacos are delicious!

We went there the last 2 times we were in New York City , and if we go back we'll definitely go to Los Tacos No 1 for tacos . Even with a long line it only took 20 minutes to get in . The tacos were great
No comment

There never used to be much on this block but thanks to a fellow Yelper, I decided to give W. 43rd between 7th and 8th another look and found Los tacos #1. It is a large place-there is no place to sit down-all eating is done standing or taken away. I got the steak tacos [3] on corn tortillas withe the works-onions, cilantro, salsa and with a nice dollop of guacamole on top. You place your order, get your ticket and then bring it over to someone who prepares your food. The food was very good-tacos somewhat small. There is a condiment bar on one wall which you can use to customize your meal. Soda is pricey-Fantas In glass bottles are almost $4 each. Due to the fact there is no seating, it is a very quick meal. I would recommend and return-great for a quick lunch or pre theater [right behind the Lyric theater]
No comment
Worth it. Chicken tacos so good and filling whether it's corn or flour tortilla. All the toppings are good too.
No comment

Came here on a drizzly Saturday afternoon with my bf when our initial lunch plans fell through. We had only been to the Chelsea Market location before and were excited to see what the Times Square location was like. As other reviewers have said, there's usually a line but it moves fairly quickly. Although it was busy, it was easy to find a spot to stand and eat our tacos. We ordered the al pastor, carne asada, and nopal on corn tortillas. After a brief wait, we were rewarded with warm fresh colorful tacos. See pic. They were juicy perfection and quickly scarfed down. Almostttt as good as the Chelsea Market location - I found the al pastor to be (disappointingly so) just a tad saltier than when I had them at the 9th Ave location. Still worth the visit though, folks.
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite taco places in NYC! If you are near Times Square and looking for a quick bite, this place is a must-go place!! The tacos and quesadillas are great and the salsas that you add on the side are nice and spicy. Try the veggie and grilled chicken tacos!

So, I was staying in Times Square and wanted a quick dinner and thought of tacos. Saw this place was ranked pretty high on Yelp, and to get to the point, I'm not sure if it's because I wasn't expecting anything other than to satisfy my hunger.. but these might be the best tacos I have ever had. I tried the steak and chicken flour tacos and they were amazing. The meat is so flavorful and it comes with all the right condiments for a good price too. Definitely would stop by here after a night out or even go a little out of the way to get these tacos again

Phenomenal food--everything so fresh and delicious! However, quite a disaster getting the food. We ordered online and went in to pick it up. It took 20 min longer than they originally said when ordering and then they never called out whose order was up. I had to go to the counter and ask if it was my order each time they placed a bag of food out. Not very efficient but worth the hassle.

So good but a little pricey. For a little quesadilla I expected more than what was given but whatever, welcome to NYC! My friend got the tacos and she really liked hers too. The beef is great, it's fresh and you can see them scraping it off the giant vertical rotisserie (doesn't get better than that). Also, they don't charge for guacamole which is always a plus considering most places do. Fine for a quick bite/snack, but I wouldn't go for lunch or dinner. Also, standing only. So yes, you have to stand and eat your taco but at least this one has seating unlike their other location. Both the flour and corn tortillas are good- enjoy!

I come here every month for the best tacos in the city! Great for a quick in-and-out meal whenever you're in the area. Their adobada (spicy grilled pork with fresh pineapple) on anything is incredible, my favorite being flour-tortilla tacos. Grilled chicken is also really juicy and flavorful, and horchata is great too. I wouldn't recommend any of the other proteins or cactus.
No comment

I'm not sure what I can say that 1000 other people haven't said so I will keep it short. The line is long but goes by fast. The line is worth it. You need to be willing to eat standing up. Eating standing up is worth it. Know what you want before you get to the front of the line. The salsas and hot sauces at the salsa bar are so good. The corn tortilla adobada taco is AMAZING. Try everything!
No comment

Absolutely incredible tacos. I was born and raised in Southern California and have had some good tacos. Never would I have expected what might be the best tacos I have had in years to be located on the east coast. Fresh ingredients, fresh, soft tortillas, and delicious simple toppings. The way a taco should be made. Even my picky kids devoured these. We opted to dine take out style because my kids are too short to stand and eat at the counters (no seating), but so worth it. The ordering process was a little overwhelming at first, but just go with the flow and pick a meat, type of tortilla and get it con todo (all the toppings). You won't regret it. Just a tad spicy if you are sensitive to spice, but like I said, even my kids ate it.

This place changed my view on Mexican food. It was so delicious. The balance between crispy pork and sweetness of pineapple make my tongue extremely pleased. There's no wonder that my local friends strongly recommend.
No comment

Four kinds of filling. Two kinds of torilla (flour or corn), and then you let the taco-ista know if you want everything on it. If you don't know what everything is, read the signs. Super easy. This place was efficient, delicious, and fun. It's a stop in and stand place for a quick snack (one or two tacos) or a meal (3+). The vibe was energetic. Good music (again energetic, but not too loud). I would go here again and try more variations.  Horchata excellent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious food served quickly. It was packed when I went, and I still got my food extremely fast. The chicken was delicious and flavorful. Definitely a great stop, and super close to a bunch of fun locations to visit as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
My go to taco place every time I'm in New York! So glad my hotel was near 43rd location! There wasn't a line and the staff is quick and efficient! My favorite was the steak, pork then chicken.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fast service!! Great guacamole! When you need something quick, this is the place to go. The portion sizes are small, so order a couple of whatever you get. Prices are reasonable for NYC.
No comment

These are the BEST tacos I have had in the east coast. I am from LA and there are taco places everywhere and I love that! Here in the east coast I live in the DC area and have yet to find a place. West coast place with East coast prices so there's that but I'm still happy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
So good worth all the hype. Best tacos I've had since San Diego. Got the chicken tacos - perfect as a snack or a meal! Definitely stop by if you're in the area. Spicy salsa was soo yummy!
Some of the best street tacos we've ever had. Someone else in my party had a quesadilla and said it was fantastic as well.

Got 2 pollo asada and a cactus taco with everything. Cactus was okay but chicken was amazing. They're pretty spicy without the salsa but salsa lime and radish kicks it up a notch. Love those crunchy deep fried chilies they had too. There was a decent line but moves quickly!

There are only standing tables at this location. I came around rush hour so the line was out the door. Even though it was busy, staff was still very efficient on getting orders out which I really appreciate. My friend and I love their pork tacos that we each got 3 pork tacos and side of chips + guac. By the end of it all, we were both stuffed! I tried their Chelsea location and can definitely attest to the consistency between the different locations. I'd recommend this place to everyone to try out.

Delicious tacos for $3.50! Standing room only. Bit of a line at 6:45 on a Friday night but the line moves pretty quickly. You order and pay, then get a receipt and hand it to the cooks who prepare your taco. It can get a bit crowded but it's not too bad and worth it. They give it to you on a plate, not sure if they would put it in something you can more easily take to go.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best pork tacos. Period. Carne asada tacos are exactly as they should be and are quite good. The chicken was delicious. If you're hungry, get all three and you'll love it. I will definitely be back.

Pretty good tacos but expect long lines (sometimes out the door) and not much room to eat (there are no chairs but bars to stand and eat at). Definitely get the corn tortillas. I'd rank the pork as the best, followed by the steak then chicken.
No comment

I can't believe I haven't left a review for this amazing place ( I've been there a dozen times). This place is the ONLY reason why I go to times Square ( I hate times Square but this place is worth the visit). I'm Mexican and I've been here for 5 years. I missed the real Mexican tacos taste until I found this place. This is AUTHENTIC tacos. Really authentic. They way we eat them in Mexico authentic . The staff is super friendly. The meat, salsas are amazing. I super recommend this place!! Honestly, if you haven't been here you really are missing one of the best spots in nyc.

Best tacos I've had in NY. Had the carne asada taco, carne asada quesadilla and the pollo asadao taco. Honestly speaking i couldn't really tell the difference between all three - particularly the quesadilla, but they were all delicious and I'm already planning my next visit. They're around $5 per taco so in line with what I expect to pay in NY.
No comment

Simple idea so well done! Had the steak corn taco and a chicken one too, flavor beyond words! I'm not a guacamole fan so would add sour cream to menu. The salsa was so fresh and had a dlish kick to it. Staff works so well together very impressive!
Awesome, delicious tacos near Times Square. Be prepared for the long lines, but it will go fast. Highly recommend!
Absolute best place hands down to get an authentic Mexican taco or quesadilla, especially being so close to Times Square awesome hidden gem.
No comment
Heard this was the best taco in New York and I believe it. Got one carne asado and One pork and both were amazing. Pork def better than steak though. Added a bit of Arbol spice and it was perfect

I love Los Tacos No. 1 and was excited that they opened this location. The Horchata here is on point and the service is quick. The carne asada tacos are good, but the adobada are better and the reason why I come here. Too bad both times I have come to this location they have been out of the adobada. :(
No comment

I'm usually not one for popular foodie spots but Los Tacos No.1 has really earned their reputation. We came here about an hour before closing and there was still a line out of the door. You order the tacos at the end of the line, but you just move along the counter to give any available taco chefs that you spot to take your order, similar to how you wave down a bartender at a bar. I got the chicken and the cactus / vegetarian one, and although the latter was good, the chicken one was so flavorful and well balanced, I can eat 5 of them. Definitely don't skip on the salsa either. All of them are punchy and adds dimension to your taco. The only thing I would maybe skip on is the horchata. Maybe it was the end of the day but I felt like I had better. I will definitely be coming back to get more chicken tacos and try a different agua fresca!
Hole in the wall for sure. Bumped into it by accident and am so grateful as I'm from California and we love tacos. Got my fix in NY.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Don't be deterred by the line when you get here as it is long but moves quickly. You first order up and pay, they give you a order paper which you then hand over to the guys who will make the taco for you. I got the carne asada and carne adobada with everything on it. Both tacos were spicy, greasy and overfilled with meat. They were delicious but next time, we would prefer to add the salsa ourselves. There is no seating. You stand at the communal tiled counter and eat and make your way out. Good spot for a quick taco craving.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I wish I could have ordered one of everything!!! My friend recommended this place ... she told me to order 4.... I should have listened to her! There is almost always a line-up but so worth the wait! You have the choice of corn or flour tortilla... both options are great but I prefer corn in general! I had the steak and chicken tacos and we also split a porc quesadilla with my friend... not even the sauce dripping on my chin disappointed me! I highly recommend this place!

What's not to love about this place .. if you haven't already just go . Worth the wait . The drive . Everything . I take my Mexican food very seriously & these tacos are just simply amazing . The Abobada taco is a MUST the pork is so flavorful and they add that nice pineapple touch on top that gives it a slight sweetness to it . I also get the pollo asado taco which is another favorite . Both of them I get con todo. It's just the way to do it . Get it you won't regret it . Oh and also the horchata! Don't forget that.

I was thinking I would just pop in and grab a taco or two. Oh no! What I got was an awesome meal prepared in front of my by a friendly and enthusiastic staff. Fresh, with a wonderful grill flavoring these tacos were amazing. Tried them all fully loaded up and all three were amazing. The pork was the favorite amongst my group.

Good, authentic tacos have been so difficult to find since I've moved from California... but OMG! These tacos are so good! I visited on a Wednesday around 3pm and the line was so long (always a good sign). The line moved very quickly and the service was A1. The cashier was super attentive. The cooks energy was so inviting and were cracking so many jokes. The food was definitely worth the trip, will definitely be coming back soon!
No comment

Get in line. Order up. Communicate with the guy who takes your ticket. Enjoy! This place is easy. And I have to keep writing so yelp will accept this post.  Simple menu.  Great soft drinks.  You stand when you eat and get out the door.

This place was okay. It was pretty busy. The line was down the sidewalk And there wasn't enough places to sit and eat. The cashier was nice and she tried to explain how they Operate. The cook smiley spoke Spanish which made it difficult to let them know what I wanted on my taco. I'll begin to be a little frustrated And in the middle of the commotion They forgot to of my tacos that I ordered. I didn't realize it until I left the building but didn't want to get back in line again. I paid $35 for 4 tacos! The tacos were good but the service was not. I seems like they communicated better with the Spanish speaking community. The English speaking people would left to try to understand. With that being said the food was great the customer service was not.

This place is always busy because they have incredible authentic tacos. The line moves fast though, and on a Saturday evening we had ordered food within 10 minutes. It's fairly loud and confusing but you give your order to the cashier on the right, then take your receipt to the guys in the middle who make your tacos. It's easier to just shout your order out and say if you won't corn or flour tortilla and "con todos" aka all the toppings. I recommend corn and con todos, and both my husband and I felt the pork tacos were the best ones. We ordered 2-3 tacos per person along with chips, salsa and guacamole which was the right amount of food for 4 people. Overall it came to about $15 / person. Highly recommended for a quick bite, especially before a show - Will be back!

If you want a real taco experience, this is the place. If your first time and don't know what to order, do what I do....2 of each beef and chicken or 3. Now, there's a real tacos (they're not ground beef).
No comment
No comment
No comment

These are by far the best tacos I have ever had in my life. It was a bit of a wait because the line is especially long at lunchtime, but it was so worth it. I got two pollo asado tacos and one adobada. The chicken tacos were incredible, but I almost regret not getting another adobada taco because it was that good. There was so much flavor packed into each taco, I definitely recommend giving this place a try if you're looking for the best taco around.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent tacos! Loved the thick corn tortillas  ask for them with everything which includes avocado sauce, salsa, cilantro & onion

After a Yelp Off-Broadway event, we were herded through the Times Square crowd and stumbled into *gasp* a 2nd Los Tacos No 1 (No 2?) location. At this hour (9:30p), they were already out of the adobada (wah) so we settled for our second best, the carne asada. Still amazingly scrumptious. I liked that the condiments were placed away from the taco counter line so it didn't crowd up the space like their original counterpart. Stand up eating only. Hopefully this second TS locale will alleviate some of the congestion in Chelsea Market.
Get the fried steak quesadilla (especial) and carnitas tacos. Proceed to have your mind blown.
The tacos here are small but full of flavor and 2 of them is usually satisfying. It's a good experience, all around. My favorite is the adobada Taco (seasoned pork) Taco and the horchata drink.
It's a good tacos bar. Quickly made, tasty enough and not expensive. I liked the quesadilla, not very fat.

Went here early in the spring. I forgot to leave a review then. I really enjoyed their chicken taco, the flavor are so rich and spicy and bold. I especially LOVED the chips and salsa, so delicious. I get the stand up concept in the interior but I definitely was exhausted and wish I had a seat. Otherwise all was yummy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Some of the best tacos you can have in NYC for such a great price! They have a few locations conveniently available throughout the city which is great. I always get the Jamaica drink (red hibiscus drink) with chicken or steak tacos, a great combo!!

Went here last winter and only have good things to say. All items on the menu are extremely cheap and food is served fresh! Definitely a great place to stop by for a quick bite (no chairs or seating).
No comment
Delicious food, the people there were very friendly fast and efficient!!!! Definitely excited to come back
No comment
Amazing food!  It's like a taco assembly of love line lmao! So worth the line!! I had the steak, pork, and chicken. All tasted great!

It's my first time here, I have to say they have the best Taco in the city. Had a try for Mexican soda- (green apple soda) and it was suprisly not that sweet and I like it very much. The line was long but definitely worth of waiting.

This place is authentic tacos. The environment, the taste and everything. This is a fast food place, you have to tans and eat your food. Steak tacos are $3.95 thats the ones I got, they were very flavorful and I still stop by there every other week. This place is in time sq so if you have family visiting nyc or if you're visiting nyc and you're in times sq GO HERE. YOU WOULDN'T BE DISAPPOINTED!!!

We finally got to try one of the best tacos in NYC. Must say, we weren't disappointed! The tacos are around 3 bucks and they ask you what you want on it and they serve it how you like it. The personnel was very attentive and work super quick! We loved it and will come back again!
No comment
Really good authentic tacos at affordable prices. You go in and order and the cooks make the tacos right then and there after you hand them your ticket.
No comment
No comment

Get in line. This place is it. Looking for incredible, cost-effective, gluten/dairy-free food in Times Square? Look no further. Even if you have the funds and no allergies, this is a must-go place. They're quick, efficient, have a simple menu, and the food is outstanding! The al pastor was my personal favorite, but we loved it all.
I love the service at this place and the food. I come here a few times a week whenever I'm blocked on a project
No comment

Tacos are ok but the standing elbow to elbow while eating wasn't for me. It's definitely a get an go spot. It's fast paced, exactly like NYC but not for me when it comes to my food. I hate feeling like I'm in someone's face staring at then eat and I hate to feel like some one is doing that to me even more, this is the atmosphere in here. It's very crowded and small. We saw this spot on restaurant hunter, but I believe the sit down location is the meat packing district and that's prob what we should have tried. No shade but I didn't get a #1 taco vibe. Take a trip up to Westchester county and Try bar taco.
No comment
No comment
Tacos wereee amazinggggggg! The meat was so tender and seasoned. I'm from SJ but I'll definitely be back again
No comment
No comment

This place is such a go-to taco place for me. Tacos are delicious, especially the adobada. The workers are also efficient. Came in on a busy day and I still got my order in 15 mins tops. Don't know how they keep that energy but it's always without fail everytime I go.
No comment

Woooohooo! Very delicious and tasteful. I been dreaming of this place and today for lunch i realized they have a location 3 blocks away from me. Great portion and free mild salsa woop woop. I got the carne asada cause i love steak.  I don't know maybe because i hadn't eaten but these are one of the best tacos i've tasted in NYC. I will becoming back i didnt get a chance to try their guac and chips and other i'm sure yummy tacos and fried quesadilla. ALSO wanted to say everyone is very nice and friendly even though they are working fast they had a positive attitude. Yayyyy Los Tacos No.1 :)

The food is always incredible. We ordered delivery and they did mess up the order but the food was great and they were willing to fix the mistake. The only con is the salsa trio - it's not worth it for the price. Everything else is 10/10
No comment

Los tacos No.1 have amazing selection of different types  of tacos and has toppings you can put on your tacos on the side. However it is pretty pricey for the quantity of tacos. If you have money to spend on food this is certainly a good choice but if you are looking for something that will fill you up quicker and cheaper look elsewhere.
Only in NYC can you get such fantastic Mexican flavors in one place. It doesn't get more authentic than this guys. Nothing beats their Pork Taco...Nothing.

I would give it 5 stars if they had warned us about their salsa being spicy. My mom and grandma couldn't enjoy their tacos since they were too spicy but they were too hungry to have them remade. Other than that, the tacos I had were yummy and service was fast despite the long lines!

Wow! What can I say about this place? I don't think they have a word for the Flavor Explosion in my mouth right now!  The Pork Tacos on corn- Life altering goodness! Tiny slivers of pineapple accompanied by thick sliced pork with avocado salsa, fresh cilantro and  onions- WOW! Was not expecting that at a taco joint off broadway! Beyond "good"-  the charbroiled chicken is a close second on my must have list here! Cooked to perfection not dry at all plus the added charbroiled crunch on the ends of the sliced chicken blows this taco from avg to awesome!  Came out of a broadway show and found this place- I am now hooked and know where to stop when I come back! Portions are good and prices are CHEAP!  It's a must try!
No comment

Worst tacos ever! Just wasted $45 on the worst tacos. The asada tacos no seasoning at all, not even salt. No salsa and no lime. Went back to ask for some and guy said we had to make the line again and pay again. Horrible service.
O. M. G. The best tacos in New York!! Always a good line. Horchata is amazing!! Carne asada tacos and quesadillas are Bomb AFFFF
No comment
Amazing tacos! Some of the best I've ever had. Would most definitely go way out of my way to eat at Los Tacos. Rich flavors, clean foods and fresh ingredients! Love, love, love!!!!

Definitely one of the best taco spots in NYC. I got it twice during my 3 days stay. I ordered 2 steak tacos and a quesadilla with chips and salsa. Ordered online and delivery and both were fairly quick.
Pork taco was the Bomb! Abodabo! The meat was so flavorful and had amazing crispy edges.  The tortillas are made as you order, and plenty of cilantro and onions if you'd like! I will be going again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

BEST TACOS EVER!!!! If you're ever in New York, you must stop by and try Los Tacos! Everything they make is delicious! The only down side is that the line is always long, but it's worth waiting in. Los Tacos will never disappoint and I have yet to try a taco just as good as Los Tacos!
These are the BEST tacos I've ever had!!! The flavor was so amazing!! I had a chicken and pork taco and they were so good! My favorite is the pork!!
No comment
No comment

Absolutely love their pork tacos! As a person trying to eat less carbs (*trying* being the key word), I really appreciate their taco shells made of PURE cheese! They are a bit pricier than what I usually pay for tacos, but the cheese shells have me coming back for more.
No comment
No comment
No comment
These were some tacos! I'm pretty sure there was double the amount of filling to balance the size of the tortilla but I'm not complaining. 10/10 would recommend and will be going back for sure.

This is my new favorite taco place. The line was very long but we decided to wait, best decision ever! The line moved very fast and the staff was very efficient. When you order you need to know what you are getting because it's very quick. Then you are given a receipt which you hand to the worker in the next window. Then they make your tacos. I tried three and my favorite was the ADOBADA. I would recommend getting corn tortillas with everything on them. I didn't get onions and they were incredible. Watching the tacos being made was super fun because they are done so fast and so well. The only problem is there is no seating. We found a table pretty close so it wasn't an issue for us. Overall I loved it! I would highly recommend.
No comment
No comment

I am so glad Los Tacos opened here! My friend told me about it and I had to check it out. Really great place for a quick work lunch. The staff is super friendly and your food is made in seconds. Its high quality and flavorful. My favorite is the pork quesadilla.
No comment

Quick and delicious! It's standing-only, so it's great if you're looking for a quick bite. You can choose between corn and flour tortillas. The tacos are pretty small, so I would suggest getting at least two (probably more). The place is always packed with people but the staff works hard and manages to keep it clean. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Best tacos and it is not even close. Authentic, fresh, affordable, and everything is just on point. No seating, just standing and there can be a line that goes all the way outside. The line will move quickly and the tacos are worth the wait.

Went here today on a rainy Monday and it looked busy but we got right up to the cashier within 3 minutes. My husband speaks Spanish so that helped him order a bit easier, it is a bit loud so you need to lean in or speak up. Everyone eats at standing counters and it's a busy, loud vibe but the food is served quick and it really is delicious. We tried some tacos and everything was amazing. The guacamole is thinner and they gave us a generous amount, great spot for a quick bite (super quick--we ate it in under 8 mins!)

We came pretty late at night so they were running out of many things. However, they were very nice. They asked me if it was my first time and told me where to go with everything. You have to get a ticket and give it to the workers who are making the food. They'll ask if you want everything on it (which i got) and that's it. We got there around 8:50 and i music stops playing around 9 probably because that's when it's closed. I didn't know but it wasn't like they were rushing us out so they can close up. I didn't know after I was done but they also have spices on extra spicy salsa on the side if you want!
No comment

Newly opened outpost of one of the best tacos spots in the city. Order at the register and hand your ticket to the cooks to the left of the register to get your tacos. Don't lose your ticket, no ticket no tacos! The tacos may look small but they are meaty and filling. Two will be enough to fill most, three if you're starving. Corn over flour wrap. My go to are the chicken and pork. Condiments is available on the side and are self serve. No seating just standing bar tables. It can get pretty crowded during peek lunch and dinner hours.
No comment

Okay , if your from Los Angeles Ca , and you love Mexican for, and you move to the south and you travel to New York, you must stop Here!!! The first bite just brings back your taste memories of what real Mexican food should taste like. Sorry South Carolina, y'all dont have a clue. These tacos and salsa are amazing, I'm at a loss for words. The way younget your food is a little confusing,  and seating is lacking but who cares!!! So Good!!! Oh Yeah, might have to wait in line durning lunch,  but it moves pretty good..
No comment
No comment
No comment

Worst customer service, they rush you as you place your order , they mix your orders, they get upset if you don't eat the tacos the way they want you to eat it ....either you eat the tacos with everything they want to put on them ....Don't even date to ask for guacamole on the side because they will tell is the last time you dare to ask for it on the side ...come on!!!! They act as if they are doing you a favor to feed you .... on their dime ..... I had bad service bit this place by far TAKES # 1 award in SHITTY SERVICE , Eve the asshole that I assume is the manager. I gave then a star because that is the lowest they deserve no stars,  and their tacos are just okay... food quality gets 2 stars ...even if I lived in NYC I will never come back ...that is just because their shitty service .

Best tacos in the city. No lies, just go. These are true street tacos, which makes them worth it. There are not many Mexican food establishments in NY that remind me of what we can get in Mexico or California, but Los Tacos hits the mark. They have a few locations now, but the original is in the Chelsea Market. They have multiple types to choose from, even cactus tacos. Yum.
Ordered the cheese and cactus quesadilla and enjoyed. There guacamole is also of quality! If you are in town worth a quick visit! Enjoy..
No comment

Los Tacos No. 1 are # 1!!! They make the best tacos I have ever had. The meats are well seasoned, the corn tortillas are freshly made and the sauces are great!!! I for one always get the chicken tacos with corn tortilla con todo. Con todo means onions, tomatoes, cilantro and guacamole. Wow these tacos are out of this world. The place is seemingly small and there are no tables. Just counters for you to enjoy your tacos and vamous. They offer quesadillas as well, chips and salsa, chips and guacamole, horchata drink, etc. There is always a line but it is well worth it. I have visited the other location in the Chelsea Market but I prefer this location. Its centrally located and has more counter space. Check them out if you are in NYC. They are the best!!!
No comment

These were some amazing tacos and mulas. Definitely a must spot! Had just the right amount of flavor. No dine in available, but they have an open outside eating area. My husband and I didn't care how cold it was; the tacos made up for that.

I love this place. Really tasty tacos and reasonably quick service. They almost always have a line so you're going to want to add 5 minutes for that. The pork taco is my favorite, but the beef is a solid runner up. The corn tortilla is better than the wheat in my opinion. Basically no bad choices here :-)
No comment
No comment

Wow...simply WOW!  Great tacos...perhaps the best tacos I've tasted anywhere.  The crowd flows in and out so finding a place to stand and indulge is not difficult.  The employees are very helpful with menu suggestions and selections.  This is a MUST dine whenever I'm in NYC.

These are the best tacos I've ever eaten! We were in NYC for 5 days. We liked these so much, we ate there 2 days in a row!!! We ate at the Times Square location.  Expect a line to get in, but it goes pretty quickly.  We had some chicken, steak and carnitas tacos...delicious! The sauce was super spicy! I opted to not have it the second time I ate there. The quesadillas were delicious and the chips and guacamole were outstanding. There are no seats at the restaurant but you can stand and eat at the counters. The price was reasonable. Our trip was almost one month ago, and my kids are still talking about this place! We keep looking for places in Miami that have similar food...but no luck.   I guess we need to make another trip it NYC! Lol
There's no place better for tacos in NYC. My favorite is the carne asada but you cannot go wrong with any taco from here. Worth every penny. Never disappoints.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very crowded, obviously very popular. Limited places to eat and you have to stand while eating. I guess that keeps the crowd moving. The food was good no doubt, better than most places. It was an interesting experience but I'm not sure it was compelling enough to get me to go back again when visiting the city as there are so many choices

My husband and I love tacos so it was only right for us to come and try these out. We were not disappointed! The line scared us a little but it actually went pretty quick and they were quick when serving us as well. The tacos were so good that regret not getting more. We will be back for more!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was skeptical of everyone's raving reviews of this place because I am from southern Arizona where we have a lot of fantastic, authentic Mexican food, I wasn't sure how a place in New York was going to compare. However, I have never been more glad that my doubts were completely wrong! This place seriously had the best Mexican food I've ever had! Unfortunately, we came during the corona virus craziness, so we did take out, but it was still so delicious. We got adobada, carne asada, and the adobada quesadilla. Everything was so so flavorful. The meat was perfectly cooked, so tender and juicy with a great char flavor. The avocado salsa was also to die for. And don't even get me started on the flour tortillas! They were the perfect blanket for the explosion of flavors going on inside the tacos. I would come back to New York for those tacos alone!

Unbelievable! Great authentic Mexican tacos. Had the pork taco and chicken quesadilla (more like large taco), both were awesome. I heard the carne asada is even better. Also tried the aqua frescas just to try, which were refreshing kind of taste like chai tea/green tea.
No comment
No comment

One of my top spots for New York. Definitely a go to. Me and my boyfriend came to New York for a little getaway and we stumbled across this place since it seemed like it was generating a good amount of customers. The tacos were really good, and I mean REALLY GOOD. We also ordered a hibiscus juice not knowing what it really was because the area was really loud. To our surprise it was very tasteful and lovely. We actually end up coming back for a second juice shortly after our feast on the tacos. The atmosphere was also very joyous. People getting their tacos, servers taking our orders and telling us what to do. MY GOD, the servers were too kind. Loved the service. We ordered everything from the menu and loved it. My least fav would have been the cactus taco, it wasn't my favorite but I'm happy that they served a vegetarian option.
No comment
Can't get any simpler and overall flavorful than a nice authentic taco.  Service is very fast, smooth and staff is nice. Food is delicious and comforting. Great for a quick grab, snack and go.

bro i'm not even lying like not lying at all they are the best tacos i've ever had. and don't ever prefer tacos. like out of all places in New York why tacos? i have no idea. but once my lips, my Tongue, my taste buds touched that meat and home made corn tortillas bro *DROLL* the asada was fresh. you see them making it, the tortillas freshly made, cheese freshly melted with the perfect small coke

Simply the best tacos I've ever eaten in my life. The first time I ever eat here, my girlfriend took me and I was blown away! Word to the wise, get the queso shell. And split between the pollo and carne tacos. Do 2 of them because you won't be able to finish 3 unless you are starving or haven't eaten for a day!

The main thing that stood out to me with this place is the quality of their ingredients and the overall combination of flavor. We tried their adobada, pollo, and carne asada taco and all of them were superb. Adobada was basically like an al pastor with the pineapple and that one had huge flavor. Carne asada and pollo were seasoned really well. The tortillas were delicious and their salsas had the perfect kick to them. They are super generous with the meat as they definitely stuff these tacos. However, only downfall is that it is slightly pricey. Almost $4 for a taco is a little up there but like I said they make it worth it for the amount of meat and toppings they put in the taco. Great place for some authentic street tacos in NYC.
Delicious tacos! Feels like I'm back in Mexico.  Don't miss the pico de gallo and salsa on the side of the room opposite of where you order.

This place has been absolutely slammed every time I've been, but that's to be expected for a spot this good, this cheap, and this convenient. The adobada tacos are to die for, but there's really nothing bad on the menu. The tacos are great, but the quesadillas (more quesataco than quesadilla) are the way to go. You can leave with three of them for less than $15. Tough to beat the food for the price in NYC.
No comment
No comment

Living in Boston, I can't find authentic Mexican places. Mexican people in Boston said that Los Tacos No.1 is authentic, so I tried when I was in NYC. It WAS authentic. I had pork, beef, chicken tacos. Tasty. It reminded me of authentic Mexican foods in CA. So far this is the best Mexican place on the East Coast for me.

Quick service and delicious food. Nothing fancy here; there aren't even seats to sit down and eat, but everything we ordered was delicious (albeit the salsa was a tad on the spicy side). I'd definitely return for a quick bite. The pork mula was soooo good, it's kinda like a quesadilla.
No comment
Amazing tacos hands down. Great service and fast too. I must visit if your in midtown.

The adobada aka pork tacos are so tasty! Los Tacos No 1 are my favorite tacos in the east coast hehe. Even though I think there are still better tacos in California, they easily rival any of the best and personally I think they are much better than Tacos El Gordo. The store is standing room only, and after ordering with the cashier, you take the order slip and pass it to one of the cooks behind the counter. The funny thing is that the quesadilla is just the regular taco with a bit of cheese sprinkled in haha so I wouldn't get that option! I believe they also can do crunchy fried taco shell if you request it (not on the menu) but tbh I found it a bit too greasy and heavy even though the first few bites were really good. I think you probably need to order 3 to 4 for a full meal, and you can pick up salsas and limes at the counter.
No comment
Best tacos on the tristate area worth going to ny for these amazing i love the steak tacos with everything on a corn tortilla
The cactus taco is a 10/10! The ingredients are super fresh and the salsas always hit the spot. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area!

This place was pretty awesome! if you're wanting a place to sit however, I'd go some place else because heh have standing tables. I was fine with that, and the service was super fast! Food was authentic and the pork was amazing and salsa verde was amazing.
No comment

I just ordered through Uber eats, this was the best tacos I've ever had in my life! Being that one taco is $5, it's worth it! The quality is that good. The meat was tender, fresh, and seasoned well. I got steak tacos. Being that I ordered it I wasn't expecting it to packed so well but it was! Everything was wrapped and stacked well! During Covid it's hard to find food that will be delivered well and travels well. It also looks like they make their own tortillas too. I definitely recommend ordering from this place. The only thing I didn't like was the tamarind drinks I ordered, they weren't nasty but it was lacking flavor and didn't taste authentic, I suggest going with soda or the Mexican soda they sell there. Other than that I have no complaints.
Good food! Nice tortillas and nopales . Delivery guy was rude and demanding but the food was really good
No comment

This place is fresh, FAST and delicious. Standing room only and no chairs to sit and eat. The food amazing though. If you order a quesadilla it's an open faced taco with cheese melted on the bottom. I would order those 10 times over!
No comment

I ordered 1 carne Asada taco just to try and since i ate it (which was approximately 3 days ago) i haven't been able to stop thinking about that taco. I wish i had pics to post but i quickly absorbed the taco with a quickness! Anyway, i stopped here with a friend on a Saturday evening, the line was pretty long but it went by fast. I ordered the horchata (cinnamon milk drink) and 1 carne asada taco on a flour tortilla with everything (guac, onions, cilantro), i also added tomatoes and green salsa. and when i say that was the best taco i have ever had! It was sooo good, I've  been on the lookout for good tacos for a couple months now and i finally found them!! I have nothing bad to say about this place. Staff was friendly. The taco was spicy but so delicious! if the line wasn't so long, i would have gone back for 3 more tacos!
What a gem right near Times square.  If you want a good traditional taco, you will get it here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

WORTH IT, WORTH IT, WORTH IT! Could be the best tacos I have ever had in my life. Went to try another taco stand and it was so bland... Never again with a Los Tacos No.1 nearby. I got the Carne Asada and Adobada tacos - Flavors explode in your mouth. So good! Sauces are a great addition but not needed at all. There is a very good reason these are so busy -

One for the best taco spots in the city. Make sure to get corn tortillas. You'll need at least 3 tacos if you're pretty hungry! Also, make sure you know what you want when you walk up and be ok with a little organized chaos! Enjoy!
No comment

Quite possibly the best tacos I've had. I'm from LA which has an impressive list of tacos spots. I personally like the homemade corn over the flour. I still can't decide if I like the adobada more than the asada. Both are absolutely amazing! Salsas and guac are solid as well.
No comment
Amazing service. So quick and easy. I ate them as fast as i got them. Incredible. Get steak.

These are the best tacos that I have ever tried. The service is fast and the line is long. We tried one of each tacos. They have 4 options for tacos - chicken, pork, beef & cactus. All were fantasticc... i was hesitant to try the cactus one but it was great!! Tried the tamarind and the  other white drink (forgot the name), it was just fresh!! Best tacos!!!!
No comment
We just keep coming back to this place. Best tacos in the city - and no wonder they started in SoCal. Very happy to have a second location!
No comment

Great tacos right near times Square. I've had tacos in Mexico and San Diego and these tacos are damn near authentic as they come. A little pricey for a taco but they sure are worth it. Dont be afraid to try their nopal taco it's super delicious! Service is fast and friendly.

This review is actually for their new location, adjacent to Grand Central.  Picking up lunch from Los Tacos has been one of the best parts of returning to work at our actual office!  The  food is crazy good, counter staff unfailingly cheerful and efficient, and the place itself is immaculately clean.  Highly recommend.

So much flavor packed into the perfect size tacos! Don't get me wrong, if I could have a tortilla thrice the size, I wouldn't mind either...I think that's what makes you want to come back for more. It really is the perfect bite. I recommend the Adobada tacos. That pork/pineapple combo is to die for. The Especial is basically a cheesy empanada sliced open and stuffed with your choice of meat and toppings. You can choose corn or flour tortillas, but if you're feeling extra indulgent, get the fried cheese shell. They also have vegetarian options. What a gem this place is...

The food is good but the customer service was the worst. It was my first time visiting so I confused. I took a second look at the menu and once again the worker yelled and rolled his eyes at me. I got yelled at by the worker the whole time. Ruined my appetite.

Solid place to stop by in NY! Not too pricey and pretty quick despite its popularity. The best part was watching the cooks make the tacos-- don't miss them literally "throwing" the guac in the air and catching them in the tacos in a fluid motion...cool stuff!! The only con was that it was stand up dining and I was pretty tired from walking around all day in the city.
No comment
These are some of the best tacos I've ever had! Was visiting NY from LA and honestly wasn't expecting much. But the al pastor tacos and horchata were delicious. Came back the next day for more!
No comment
No comment

Some of the best tacos I've ever had. There's a long counter with about 10 guys behind it working at lightning speed to churn out tacos and quesadillas, and the place is really busy (always a good sign). We got one of the carne asada, pollo asado, and adobada quesadillas. The steak was smoky and the salsa on it was fresh, but my girlfriend's favourite was the chicken and mine the pork. All three were excellent.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: BOMB! Service is whatever but who cares when you're throwing tickets for food and eating standing up? Not them clearly, and neither should you. Spicy pork on corn tortilla shouldn't be missed.

This was my first visit, and I will definitely be back. I got the carne asada and adobada tacos. The adobada taco is so good. Loved the crispy bits on the pork. Also loved that a variety of toppings were included. They may not have gotten my order completely right, but it was still delicious!
No comment

Every time I come to NYC I try my best to make it to Los Tacos No. 1. I have yet to be disappointed every time I've been. It always busy and packed full of people. You can definitely tell it is well liked establishment. They always have fresh ingredients and fresh salsas. They have some of the best tacos I've ever had. I really like their chicken and carne asada tacos. I would definitely recommend them. I also like there quesadillas. If you like chips and guac, they have very very good and fresh guacamole. Can't say enough about this place
No. 1 Indeed. Best place where you can find to fill your stomach with awesome tacos! The place is clean and prices are legit.
No comment
Taco craving satiated! Cactus  and chicken tacos with their spicy and flavorful sauces tasted so amazing! Definitely going back and for more tacos.

Really good Tacos, one of my favorite in NYC. They're not that cheap but you won't go bankrupt if you buy from here. I specially love their taco al Pastor. They season their meats very well. It's just like eating tacos in Mexico. I love that they got all the toppings and sauces for you to add. I also like that you eat standing up and then you leave, just like in any street taco stand. Tortillas are freshly made in front of you and they're very quick to serve. Definately a must go!
No comment
Some of the best tacos I've ever had in an area I would never expect to find them.  Little hidden gem!
Delicious and authentic. Flavors are well maintained with integrity and no fillers. One of the best places I've been to in NYC.
This place is suuuuper popular. I live nearby and it's always very crowded. However, I tried them once and was underwhelmed by their food. Won't revisit again probably

Love the dynamics in this place! It's packed but the staffs are efficient. Have your friend looking for a spot while you order cuz you don't wanna look at your food when it's ready but can't eat! Tacos are delicious, highly recommend the pork taco with corn tortilla, and make sure to try the spicy sauce!

I think these are the best tacos that I've ever had to date. Tried the pork and steak tacos; the pork really stood out and was very flavorful. No wonder this place has a high rating. However, I do want to rate it a 4.5/5 stars but Yelp doesn't allow for half ratings.
