This is mostly due to the tacos being on the pricier side (I think all tacos are expensive for no reason and should be cut down at least $1) and the horchata tasting just okay. Definitely will come back to try the other menu items in the future.

Yassss! Tacos are bomb here. Meat is tender and so yummy! Do not be scared of the line it moves fast you will get your food. Standing room only to eat but you will scarf your food so fast and be on your way. The reviews dont lie. But be ready to spend some dough. $50 for 9 tacos and 3 drinks.
No comment

this is one of the best authentic tacos i've had in nyc. it is delicious! it is kind of pricey but so worth it. i am always craving their tacos! i highly recommend if you are in nyc and craving authentic tacos. their service is fast and it is delicious. staffs were super friendly. the line is long sometimes but moves fast!
These tacos tasted amazing. The meat was super juicy and fresh. They have a variety of salsas to go with as well. And the prices are great. I have found my favorite Tacos spot.
No comment

Almost as good as the chelsea location, but still hands down the best tacos in Manhattan (at least the group). The tacos adobado and carne asada will make you want to come back for more. I've been all over Mexico, and while this isn't quite up to that level (or price) its as close as you are going to get in Manhattan. If you like spicy you'll have to add it yourself, but come here during a time square excursion.
Best tacos in ny... highly recommended. Long lines but they go quick. Just be ready to order when its your turn
No comment
No comment
Quick service, delicious and inexpensive food! I had a cheese shell instead of tortilla. It was so tasty!

So I honestly wasn't expecting much when I saw that they were the #1 result on google for best nyc restaurants, especially when I saw it's near Times Square. I hate tourist traps but whatever I tried it anyway. I walked in, ordered the carne asada tacos 'con todo' and whaaaaaat I was not expecting it. The tacos are phenomenal. I ordered chips and salsa to accompany my meal, the salsa was fire  (wasn't expecting that either lol) very pleased!!
No comment

Great flavors. Standing only dining inside - but it is a quick, fast casual dining experience afterall. The quesadilla was our favorite because it is basically the taco but with melted cheese. Delicious. Would go back. PROS: tasty, affordable, quick. CONS: loud inside, standing only dining, kind of confusing ordering process (you order, they give you a receipt/ticket, you go over to the chef line and find anyone who you can that's not busy and give them your ticket, they work on your order and give you your food).  As a first timer, this was confusing.

This is the first place ever actually living up to its name, these tacos really are number 1! There is a reason why such a long line forms outside, the food is fresh and tasty, service is quick. I just wish there was somewhere to sit in this place, but otherwise 5 stars!

These are some of the best tacos I've ever had in my life. They're fast. The prices are great too. If you don't like eating standing, there could be a problem. But other than that, this place is absolutely wonderful.

Cheese shell tacos... OMG!! Keto and delicious... hard to find in NYC and Los Tacos No. 1 nailed it!!  Absolutely delicious and fast. Don't let the long line scare you - we waited less than 10 minutes outside and were waited on (even with secret menu orders -keto cheese shells) immediately!  Delicious and freshly made to order. Self serve salsa/pico/topping bar was an added surprise- also so good!  We got the chicken carne Asada and the pork carnitas tacos ALL on cheese shells. Both were HUGE servings- two tacos on these cheese shells was definitely a full lunch for us - much larger than the regular tortillas (little more expensive but worth it). Definitely a KETO friendly restaurant- and delicious too. Going back for our "farewell to NYC" on our way to the airport for last lunch...
No comment
No comment
Best soft taco restaurant in the city! Although the line can get long, it goes by quickly. They have self-serve salsa and limes that you can add to your order.

Awesome street tacos. Not many menu choices which means get the tacos. I had the carne asada and they come with this soupy green avocado green sauce on them and wow, super good. Even the little cup of guacamole and chips were good. Decent sized place but no sit town tables, only counters to stand at. Can get crazy crowded so go at off peak times.
No comment
No comment

LA girl moved to NY. Have been looking trying to find tacos as good as the ones in LA & I have. Tacos No.1. are definitely the ones. Their tacos are delicious and the staff are friendly. Def my go to taco spot!

Great tacos!  Having lived in San Diego half my life and now being back here on the east coast it's hard to find a legit taco, but Los Tacos has them!  Meat was flavorful, tortilla was hot & fresh, and the guacamole was perfect!  Great taco at a great price!

This is my FAVORITE taco spot in Hell's Kitchen. Tacos are always fresh and authentic. Usually I order in person but I ordered for delivery on their website for the first time last night. There wasn't a place for me to modify guacamole on the side so I called to modify. Although my order was already prepared, Alfredo readily remade the order. The service is amazing and I thank him for that tremendously since I have a picky 7 year old at home :) I will definitely order again. Thank you for your services during these times!
Tacos remind me of being home in Texas!  Very authentic and melts in your mouth.  The line is worth the wait.
I've had plenty of good tacos all over the country. Los Tacos is still my favorite hands down. The Adobado is the way to go!

In NYC for quick trip, and found this place on yelp when I was looking for some light lunch. Busy busy busy place, with long line, but line move pretty fast. The taco is amazing, try beef, chicken and pork. Not a huge fan of the pork, but chicken and beef.... wow.... just fabulous! So delicious and juicy. Probably one of best taco I have in my life. The person who help me taking my order is super friendly and helpful. She really explained everything to me and help me order. Overall great experience and definitely will be back when I back in town!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The best Mexican food I have had in NY so far. My first time there was today and the price was good for three beef tacos and a Fanta. Nice and fresh tasting, Definitely will be going back!
No comment

Traveled from west coast came straight to Los Tacos NO.1 in Chelsea for pick up order. I think this was one of the best tacos that I had. The chicken was well marinated and flavorful altogether, also I liked how the tortilla didn't get hard. I'll defit visit again before I leave!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty good tacos, came here because I was told it was among the best in the city. NYC has great tacos all throughout the city, and rather than going to a stand I came here but was somewhat disappointed. The toppings were good but the meat wasn't as good as I had expected, probably will not go again
These tacos are SO good! I live in Rhode Island and EVERY time I go to NY I have to get Los Tacos.
Amazing tacos! I got 3 corn tortillas w pork, steak, and nopal. Well seasoned and just enough spice. I recommend getting the tamarindo for a refreshing, sweet drink.
Authentic and excellent. Everything about this meal was tasty. Very reasonably priced as well. I'd recommend getting a mix of tacos and quesadillas.
No comment
Pork tacos FTW. Easily best pork tacos I've had in NYC.
Really enjoyed the tacos with beef ! The amount of coriander and guacamole was perfect.
No comment
Great Tacos the pork tacos awesome, the carna meat is ok but over over all this tacos are Awesome and the price is Right. I hate they don't have seats but I will still eat from here.

I ran in for a fast lunch while staying at the Westin Times Square. Although I had to wait on a line out the door, it moved fast and was WORTH IT. I am on a veggie-kick and had the cactus quesadillas and chips and quac and salsa. My friend had the pork with pineapple topping. We devoured the meal. We ate while standing, wearing winter coats, and not upset about it. Anyone passing through Times Square should eat here. I wish I took a pic but I ate too quick! Enjoy!

Best tacos in NYC. For vegetarians, there is only one option which is of cactus! But you can ask them to make cheese tacos though its not in the menu but you can ask the cashier. Don't forget to add the hot sause(best hot sause ever)and pica di galo.
No comment

Can somebody please tell me why these tacos are SOOOO good? They truly live up to the hype. I tried the carne asada and adobada and personally liked the carne asada better (again, just personal preference). However, I probably would recommend everything and anything on the menu. Horchata was delicious and necessary for the spicy salsa with chips. Great price point, great service, AMAZING FOOD. Cannot complain at all. Maybe the one complaint would be that the location is not closer to my workplace so I can't go all the time ;)
No comment
No comment
No comment
These are some of the best tacos I have ever had. I'm from Texas and I ate here twice on my trip. Service is fast and friendly. I can't wait to come back.
No comment

Glad to see more Los Tacos No. 1 in the city.  The Nopales plate with the pork is where it's at.  A heaping bowl of deliciousness, mixed in with a little fiber and some vitamin B. Add a side of chips and guac if you're feeling decadent.  Great for a quick meal and handy for a low frills pre or post theater bite (for me, it was literally across the street from the Harry Potter show).

All I could say is there must be crack in these tacos. My favorite is the pork taco on flour. My second favorite is a split decision between the chicken and steak. To die for. Add an horchata as your beverage and oh my god. Feel the food coma come. I've been to the location on 42, Church St & at Chelsea Market. The set up is the same. The staff is always helpful and gets right to it. No complaints. I will keep on going to get my tacos here, and will keep on recommending this gem.
Really good tacos! The tortilla Ame made fresh and all the meat. It's a chain, but it is a really good chain.

Omg this place is absolutely amazing. I dream with this tacos. They are absolutely amazing. I can easily eat up to 5 tacos cause they are absolutely amazing. The quesadillas are absolutely Amazing. They are not your regular quesadillas they are the best quesadillas you'll ever try. This place just makes me happy. If you ask the taquero to make your taco with everything remember that will have hot spicy salsa. It's the best salsa but some might think is to spicy. I love it. This place is amazing
No comment

Definitely the best tacos in NYC! We only regret that we weren't hungry enough to eat MORE. The place itself is pretty basic- menus written out on the walls, standing room only (no seats), nothing fancy, but it was very busy. Luckily, the staff know what they're doing and the line moved really quickly. We tried the beef, pork and...grilled cactus tacos! I've never tried cactus but it was definitely worth the try- the texture was interesting and the taste was actually very tangy and delicious. The beef tacos were our favourite but I would definitely have the cactus again!
No comment

Best chicken tacos I've ever had! And I've had some serious authentic Mexican tacos and hands down Los Tacos chicken tacos can't be beat!!!! Their guac is equally delicious and I was sad when I finished it. If you're in New York I promise you won't be disappointed!

So good! Just go! The line might seem long but it goes super fast. It might seem crowded with no counter space to eat at, but that clears fast as well. This is not a sit down place. You order, pay, give your order ticket to one of the guys preparing the tacos, who then makes your order and hands you your food. Selection of salsas to choose from. Walked there while exploring Times Square.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Im sorry but girl no, these tacos was not the tea. Just idk weird taste to them, one if the workers told me something about pork lard idk, just gross if u ask me, no shade to the little workers. I've had better tacos in the Bronx girl aka Taco bell

Some of the best tacos I've ever had! My old boss put me on to this spot when we used to have taco Fridays I remember my mouth salivating waiting for that yummy especial. Its a fried quesadilla with your choice of adding meat I highly suggest the pork its amazing. Guacamole is free!!! You can't go wrong with that. The tacos are super yummy i stick to steak or chicken or pork. I traveled all the way from Brooklyn to satisfy my urge which says a lot. Love this spot!
No comment
Best tacos I've had in New York. This place is a quick and great place to grab a bite. The tacos are super flavorful! Pork was the best!
No comment

We were out in New York for 3 1/2 days and we gave this place a try after seeing their food on instagram, OMG  may I say DELICIOUS! We loved it that we had to eat here more than once! Only bad thing is there's no seats for you to enjoy your food and chill for a while with all the walking you do out there! But food was amazing I really recommend it if your in time square
No comment
Incredible!! Like the Taco Nazi instead of the soup Nazi...they keep it moving.  Tacos we're exceptional.
Amazing tacos! Their pork tacos are amazing. The flavor was all there and the best part was the tortilla was perfect with a slight crunch on each bite. Definitely recommend stopping by here.

These tacos were so juicy and melted in my mouth, the carne asada was perfectly seasoned and tasted so fresh with lime and the toppings. It definitely scratched our craving for food truck tacos, 2 of these amazing tacos are well worth the 5$. Be prepared to stand in a line outside because that's how good they were.

YUM!!! The flavors are excellent!!! Loved the flour tortillas especially! Staff forgot a taco in our order but we came back and they gave it to us no problem!!! Definitely recommend going here for a quick meal!
A M A Z I N G tacos- and i'm from texas. The guacamole was fresh and tacos were insanely flavorful.
The carne asada on corn tortillas with everything on it is all you'll ever need. Best tacos I've had in NYC!
This place is BOMB!! Staff are really friendly and guess what this place made me eat 4 tacos!!! The pollo is my fave  Its was a good experience, hope they open a branch in California.
No comment
If you're a traveler and are dying to remember your last taco in Mexico this will be a huge lift right now! Go get your travel on! Best tacos in the US!! Al Pastor my personal favorite.
I had a cheese quesadilla & a chicken taco. Good portions & not too expensive. Generous with guacamole & pico de gallo is free!
I got the beef tacos with corn tortillas. So good. Line's long, but moves pretty quickly. The guac was good, not great. I'd come back for those tacos though.
by far the best tacos i've have in midtown.  I am so impressed, and I am a taco searcher in terms of trying to find the best quality.  perfect chicken and steak and pork.  just WOW
No comment

As someone who spent her childhood commuting between San Diego, Tijuana and the greater Baja California region, when I moved to NYC fifteen years ago, I came to accept that I would never again have the Mexican food to which I was accustomed. Los Tacos No. 1 makes the best Tijuana-style tacos you can find in NYC. They are absolutely authentic and incredibly delicious. Now, if only they can expand the menu to include burritos!
No comment

On a recent trip to NY, I had seen the ratings and planed in coming to this place. I now know what the hype is all about! The meats are very tasty and when you add it to the tacos and quesadillas it's out of this world.  The lineup was long as expected, but fast and friendly service. Enjoy!
AMAZING!!! Order from here right now. Tacos and tostada were delicious. The guacamole is incredible and I wish I had ordered more!!

Easily best tacos on the east coast. The line is so long so order two so you don't have to get on line. The pork was phenomenal and had such an amazing amount of spice. The process to make your taco is very fast. It is a great snack if you have one so you can move to other options in Chelsea market.
Amazing tacos. I got the carne asada and pollo and both were great. A little bit pricey, but definitely worth the try.
Just ate two beef tacos here with my niece. Loved the flavor of the tacos. Niece had two chicken tacos and also greatly enjoyed hers. Standing room only- no seating available. Definite repeat.

Omg!!! I'm Mexican and live in Canada and I been in so many mexican places but I can never say that is good, but this place is just so good!!! I got to try this place on visit to NY, it wasn't that far from our hotel, the price is good, and the tacos are very good!!! They made their own tortillas there so they are fresh and they put so much meat on it that u can make 2 tacos out of one, they have like 5 diferent salsas to put on it so u can enjoy some spicy on it something that i love, only thing is that is not where to sit but is like an actual mexican taco stand but inside a local and they don't have a washroom, but other that the tacos are really good!! If im back in NY this will be my spot to eat!!!!

Visited New York while on vacation and this taco shop was right down the street from my hotel. I had been following their instagram page in preparation for the trip but had no idea it would be soo close to where I was staying. I must say that these are awesome tacos! We tried the steak, pork, and chicken on flour tortillas. Toppings were simple, onion, cilantro, cheese, and guac. Delicious! This place is always packed and has a line but the line moves quickly. I enjoyed it so much, I ate there twice during my visit. There's no parking on the street but there is a garage to park in for like $30+ bucks. There aren't really any tables inside, so be prepared to stand at the standing hightops. Overall awesome experience and awesome food. If ever back in NY, I will definitely be back!

I was skeptical because people always say "these tacos are great" and when you eat them it's like meh. However the tacos here are really good, so is the guacamole. The line was a little long but the staff moved it along really fast. Will definitely add this to the list of places to eat when I'm in NYC.

This place is AMAZING! The food is so good. I got the steak, chicken and pork tacos and they were all superb. Full of flavor yet not so much that it overwhelms you. The people who make the tacos are also super friendly and the line might seem long but don't be deterred! It moves quickly and it's because the place is so efficient at serving you. They have a cute sauce bar where you scoop the salsas and the fresh lime slices. This place is as good as it gets! Highly recommend!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I am from Mexico and I've been craving for tacos a while ago. I must say they were OMG delicious!! you should definitely and go try them they are really authentic with handmade tortillas. They are a little pricey (5dlls each) but They are worth it. The carne asada is my favorite!
No comment
No comment

Best taco place ever!! The tacos are absolutely delicious!! I recommend the adobada quesadilla, the meat is juicy and full of flavor. All tacos include guacamole which is great!! If you come to NYC you must stop here!!

This place is insane. I stopped in before a show and it was everything I had read. The line was out the door but moved quickly. The choices are limited and so you can figure out the menu in a flash. The food was fresh and very tasty. I had the adobado corn quesadilla and a nopal taco.The salsa on the side is also a must. Both were so good my wife and I went back after the show for a "nightcap". The lack of seats just means that no one lingers, and that is good because they are so busy.  If you are in the area its a must do.

Amazing food for a amazing price.. tacos and the quesadillas are very similar sized and two of any should fill you up.  The pork is very oily but still good. Steak  and chicken was amazing. The Jamaica drink was decent.  Very different set up you pay then take your ticket to one of the guys who read your ticket and then read it and make RD food for you.
No comment
No comment

Delicious and fresh tacos for about $3.50-$3.75 each. Both corn and flour tacos were delicious. I tried the steak, chicken and marinated pork. My personal favorite was the chicken. If you like spicy, get the pork! My friend tried the cactus and described it similar to squash. All in all, you can't go wrong with any choice.
No comment

I really liked this taco place! I've been wanting to go for awhile and finally did. There was a line but it went by fast. The tacos were delicious. The actual corn tortilla did not easily fall apart from the filling which was so nice. Their salsa are spicy! I tried he medium and was amazed by how spicy it was. I would definitely come back again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The tacos were simple but soo good and I'm sad because there's nowhere like it near where I live! If you are in the area definitely stop by. The line was kinda long and the inside was packed but it moves fairly quickly.
No comment
No comment
BEST TACOS EVERRR. I love them so muchhh. The only thing is they are a bit pricey and small but the meat is so fresh and I just loveee them. My fav is the carne asada and the chicken.
No comment

As we were visiting NYC we found this authentic mexican place had great reviews.  We got tacos but for me I didnt realize it had onions but I got them off than my tacos were perfect.  Very authentic you can watch them make the tortilla.  Sauces were to hot for me Im a delicate flower lol  I dont do spicy but seemed all who were eating there loved tgeir sauces. There are several locations if your in the mood for a great taco go here for sure :)

The tacos are delicious, and the price isn't too bad $12 for 3 tocos. This was my first time eating here and it won't be my last. The only issue I have is that it's supper crowded no room to sit it's standing only and literally only standing room but for the taste and the price the crowd is worth it. I had the chicken tacos with onion,lime, cilantro, spicy salsa and guacamole

I've reviewed their Chelsea Market location before but I'll leave one here, as well. This place is AUTHENTIC! Something SO rare to find on the east coast. I'm from California and have searched high and low for decent Mexican food here. I've found a few places, but this one is at the top of my list! Everything is so flavorful, delicious, and affordable. Service is quick and efficient, as well. I'm so glad they opened a midtown location because this area is desperately in need of something other than chains. I'll definitely be back here soon for tacos and horchata!

Such authentic and tasty tacos, so close to Times Square! Waited in line for these before going to the Springsteen on Broadway show. The tacos are larger and more full than most in Mexico. I had the adobada, which were like tacos al pastor more or less. Slightly chaotic ordering process, but well worth it.
Excellent fresh fast cheap...everything you want in a taco regardless of where you get it...just so happens that this is in NYC!

In Times Square? You can't beat the food for the price. Seriously. The tacos are really good. I wasn't hungry when I came here, but I ended up eating anyway. My favorite was the Adobada (marinated pork) tacos, and had with it a Mexican coke. Eat here. You'll feel better about going back out to the crowded streets.
Line out the door and still walked out having eaten a wonderful nopal quesadilla and an asada taco in 20 mins. Ordering system is wacky but i don't care. Come eat here.
No comment

Sincere effort to offer vibrant flavors and impressive textures at an affordable price. Everything from tortillas to meat to salsas tasted fresh and good, although I thought the steak could have used a bit more salt and seasoning. Dine-in is standing only, but everything is sized to be a few happy bites. Very much enjoyed the variety of the fried quesadilla "especial."
No comment

Coming from Texas, I have high taco standards. Los Tacos proved worthy of the hype. The tacos remind me of my favorite taco truck back in Texas. They keep things really simple, choosing to really focus the flavor and quality of the few elements of their tacos. The meat is fresh and juicy and the tortillas are freshly made. & the prices are fair (chicken tacos were $3.50 each). I'm a fan!
Tacos were soooo good! Totally worth the line. I ordered chicken tacos and they had so much flavor. I would defiantly come back!
No comment
No comment
The food is amazing but it's not a family restaurant you can't even sit down.   This review was written by my 9 year old
Best tacos of my life ! Hands down ! And I live in Arizona where taco shops are on every corner ! Wish they were by my house and I would make this a weekly stop! Amazing !

I've been wanting to try this place for a while. In the city for some business and it was close enough to walk over and give them a try.  Got there about 12:15 and I was expecting a lunch crowd and a wait. About 20 to 25 people in front of me. Line went very quickly, maybe 7 minute wait, total. Ordered the marinated pork and grilled cactus. The cactus was okay, the pork was much better. Place is small, no place to really eat (all standing room) and they serve you the food on a plate, so there's really no grab-and-go.

This is probably my favorite taco place in NYC. The place is always packed with people. I wish there were more places to stand and eat, other than that is a great place to eat. It is very fast and the tacos are very good. I would warn you about the spice though if you can't handle it.

quick, convenient, and so freakin tasty. stuffed myself with carne asada and pollo tacos + chips and guac, never turning back. location has a chill aesthetic, as if you were out by a sunset and beach even though you're in times square. price is also unbelievable for the quality. have to go back to try the rest of the menu.
No comment

I love tacos! I could eat them for every meal and still want more, but that's beside the point. We stopped here the beginning of our "New York food journey" and were not disappointed! We tried their specialty, the Adobado tacos and the pollo asada tacos. The meat was flavorful and juicy, it was like a flavor bomb went off in my mouth and activated all of my senses. They have a variety of hot sauces to add to your tacos ( not that you need it but if you want to add some spice to your life) which range from mild to medium. They are delicious and do not skimp on the spice. Also the atmosphere made me feel like I was in Mexico chilling with someone's grandma eating these amazing tacos. Overall for the price (4 tacos  1 bottled coke and Jamaica water cost us 22.05 usd) the service is good and the food is even better! If you visit New York check them out!
The best tacos in nyc. Great people great food! Keep up the good work and I'll be coming back every week to support yiu
No comment
No comment

I usually refrain from calling a place "the best" in NYC or the East Coast, but Los Tacos is truly an exception. If the long line of smiling customers going out the door during lunchtime isn't a sign that it seems tasty, order a carne asada taco on a flour tortilla and your world will change forever. I thought I had good Mexican food before but this place really takes it up a notch. Everything is fresh from the tender meat to the cilantro that tastes like it was picked right from the bushel. My coworker from Mexico City says it tastes just like home. The energy of the workers here also soeaks volumes for the place - they work at lightning speed! I've been here probably ten times and have taken my tourist friends that visit here as well. I can't recommend this place enough.

I came here on Sunday and it was surprisingly not that busy. The line went by fast and then you hand off your ticket to cooks to make your order.  The tacos and quesadillas  were decent and packed with lots a meat but they skimp on the toppings. The quesadilla is basically a taco but there's cheese on the bottom, there isn't a top layer of tortilla to my surprise. So if cheese isn't  worth the $1 for you then I suggest getting the taco instead.

Best tacos I've ever had! I don't even like pork and I LOVE the adobada tacos. There are no seats but there are high tables that you can stand up to. Homemade salsas are amazing. Price point is super low. Definitely visiting this place every time I come to NYC!
No comment
No comment

really great Tacos and Quesidillas but no common sense here. Their Times square operation is so dumb they dont leave the door open for proper ventilation. Clearly after over a year of this they still dont get it... if they care for their customers so little why should I be a customer?

Great tacos, quesadillas, and mulitas. Very authentic and reasonably priced for how much meat they give you. They even go the extra mile by putting slices of pineapple in their pastor. Will definitely come back next time I'm in NY.

Holy Shit was this place good.  If you do not like spicy, be cautious with the sauces.  Get the tacos with the lamb inside - so finger licking good.  They always have a line but it moves fast, perfectly priced and has to be the best tacos in Manhattan for sure.  This is where the New Yorkers go (who know), for good Mexican food.  Thank me later!
This is what a taco is supposed to taste like. Go with the corn tortillas.
Standing table only. The taco is very affordable between $3.5 - $3.75 each with four options: steak, pork, chicken, and cactus.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We stumbled across this lovely place to satisfy our taco cravings while sightseeing in Times Square.  My husband and I both loved it.  It has so much character.  Just as you as walk up to the door, you are greeted with the smell of the tacos being cooked and the sound of cumbias ready to be danced.   There is no seating, just a set of bar tables lined up for your to enjoy your food.  We ordered three carne asada tacos on corn and one quesadilla with carne asada on corn.  They were delicious.  There are a selection of five salsas to choose from ranging from mild to spicier versions.   The red tomatillo salsa was just right for someone who likes their salsa medium.  The only downside was the guacamole sauce they added to the tacos.  It's watery texture was distracting from the presentation and didn't add much as far as flavor.  For drinks, we ordered the horchata and it was amazing.  All in all, we would definitely come back for more.

Delicious!! This place is a must. Tortillas are made fresh, tacos are amazing! They offer a variety of sauces! There was a bit of a line when we went, probably because it was during lunch but the wait was worth it. Once inside, ordering and getting your food is super quick.
No comment
This spot was amazing! The food was Excellent. The staff was amazing and the portions are nice. The chips and guacamole was on point!
No comment

This place was bomb! When I went there it was late night and a little bit dark as far as the lighting, but other than that the food was absolutely exceptional probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had in my entire life!
Had the carne, pollo, & adobada asada. The chips with salsa & guacamole. All fresh and delicious! So yummy! Definitely want to come back again!

I like to think that I'm a taco connoisseur as our Friday night ritual is to eat tacos! Our first night in NYC was a bust but this place turned it around and gave us hope that there is great food here! The adobada tacos are great! Lots of flavor and the tortilla is magnificent! Horchata was not the best. Asada taco was better than adobada. Over all cool place with tables outside so you can eat real quick since the lobby is closed

No comment
Simple menu. Great tacos. Great service. Great price. I knew it was going to be great when I saw the line out the door.  Check it out!

This taco bar is 1 subway stop from Penn Station. Quite popular but the line moved fast. Came here for lunch. Both tacos and quesadillas were good served with guacamole The steak, chicken, and pork were all enjoyable. The self service salsa were good but the salsa at the kitchen was better and more piquant.

The place was definitely meant for eating in rather than take out. I wanted to try this place out but ordered take out, so by the time I got back the tacos were a bit mushy and cold. The meats definitely had a lot of juice and flavor, and I could tell they would have been even better if I had them fresh at the restaurant. I got the steak and pork tacos with corn tortillas. The steak also came with some guacamole which was a nice addition. I also got their horchata which was very good.

The prices for a taco are close to four bucks. Now when I first saw this I was like, wtf that is so overpriced! As I ate my carne asada quesadilla and carne asada taco I understood why. The guacamole, I believe, is what makes the best part of the taco and quesadilla. It's creamy and explosive in flavor. Plus the meat was top notch and had a lot of meat in my opinion. I highly recommend this place if you want some tacos!

I'm a big fan of Mexican food, and since I've tried this place in Chelsea Market before, I really wanted to try this location. It's a great size and the line goes by really quickly. Everyone that works there is really nice! It's a cool spot to grab some tacos and stand around to eat them. They're pretty stuffed which is great. Since it was my second time trying, I will say that the tacos were good, but they weren't AMAZING. But it's cheap, and definitely a place to try if you're in the area.

Simply the best! You're getting California food truck level tacos in Times Square for Gods sake! I don't think you can top that. It's around $4 per taco so a crazy good meal would include this and some happy hour in the area.
No comment

BEST taco place to EVER exist in the Time Square area. Extra friendly place and cumbia  blasting in speaker. The cashier was more worried about her fake nail than taking orders. She mistook our order which was annoying. I mentioned to one of the cooks there and he corrected it. Absolutely delicious! We came two days in a row! Tortilla is either corn or flour. We had corn, carne asada. It was prepared so juicy. It was topped with guac & red salsa. It wasn't spicy but they also have different salsas in molcajete. I'm not trying to be biased because I'm Mexican and have had several tacos in several different Mexican stands but this is truly appetizing. The long lines are worth it!!

Came here with a dear friend as she was visiting the city after finishing finals. It was close and I was craving Mexican food, so we decided on Los Tacos No 1 - Being from California, I think Los Tacos is the only thing that comes even close to Mexican food on the West Coast, although it does cost a pretty penny to eat there. Tacos run from $5-7 as do their other goods, and they don't serve burritos. I thought for a taco that expensive that it would be more food, but alas it was just as small as normal tacos are. The quality of ingredients they use and the way they cooked it was really what sets it apart from other Mexican food places, and though I was a little salty about paying $6 for a carne asada taco, it was so good that I had to get another one. Would recommend for people wanting authentic Mexican in the city, although be prepared to pay a lil more than you probably would've elsewhere! Pro tip, they even have real Mexican Coca Cola made with cane sugar so be sure to try it out! Only comes in the large size, unfortunately.
No comment
No comment
best tacos! very flavorful and the meat was all nicely textured not overcooked or under:)

Holy Guacamole! The best tacos ever. We live in California and we have lots of great taco options - but these were amazing. Tasty tortillas, nice size portion of perfectly cooked meat, perfect salsa and guacamole!

Same goodness as offered in the Chelsea Market location, except this Los Tacos No. 1 attracts all the tourists in the busy Times Square area. Lines will form no matter what time you go, but at least there are dedicated eating spaces here, unlike in Chelsea Market.

I was honestly just looking for something quick and easy but also tasty and this was it. The wait was nonexistent for me but I've seen videos of it being very busy. Each taco was ~$4 and they even had grilled cactus option for the veggie friends. I chose corn tortillas (vs flour) and was very happy. They have salas on the side: regular, medium, hot and then radishes too. They had jarritos drinks and frescas too. The horchata was very good, not too sweet. Would definitely recommend stopping in for a bite. Two tacos held me over for a couple hours.

Really cool must go to place in Times Square area. Had the beef and chicken tacos but wish I tried the pork that looked so good. It's awesome and authentic Mexican food. Take it from a Texas girl. I also got the tamarind drink that I liked which is not too sweet for those that want something less sugary. They offer limes and customize your order if wanted. I got everything on mine. You may wish to grab a fork. It's standing room only and you might not want to lose your spot to retrieve one after the fact. Lines move quickly.
No comment
No comment

Los mejores tacos que a probados en Estados Unidos. Was very packed and the place was super small inside but something about that it made the experience more fun. We're definitely stopping here again in our next NYC trip
I mean, I LOVE great taco! Sauce was SPICY!! And I can take some heat! I'd definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very good tacos. Love the pineapple. Incredibly busy, but clearly for good reason. Efficient service. Generally clean given the amount of traffic. Several sauce toppings to choose from. Not exactly the cheapest tacos you're going to find, but you're  in the middle of NYC so it's to be expected and, frankly, is pretty reasonably priced given its location and the quality. Would highly recommend.

One of the few Mexican Food places we found here in the city. Service was quick. You go to the cashier, order your food and they hand you a ticket. You then go to any open chef and they prepare your food right in front of you. Great vibes and environment. Had Spanish music playing the whole time. I got the Fried Quesadilla with chicken and flour tortilla. AMAZING!!! Best part is that they have those authentic Mexican Cokes the ones that are extra carbonated. Hands down my favorite restaurant out of my whole trip.

I work around the area and have been wanting to try this spot for some time now but everytime I come by there is always a long line but due to COVID on this day there was no line ( LUCKY ME). I walked into the restaurant and placed my order with the women at the cashier who seemed bothered to take my order which was a bit suprising o me given that IT'SHER JOB. I placed my order and just wished and hoped that the food wouldn't be as bad as her attitude. As I waited excited to try my food, I took notice that people who had ordered after me had been served their food so I patiently waited longer and as the 4th person that ordered after me got served I asked the cook "would you happen to have my order ready by any chance" he ignored me and I asked again, he then grabbed my receipt and placed my food in the bag, I then asked if he could kindly pack up my chips and guacamole in the same bag and he just pushed the brown bag towards me and continued on with prepping everyone else's food. The excitement for this place was so not worth it. I will never eat at this place again nor reccomend for a corporate event nonetheless for myself, the staff working here seem to be very miserable.  Los Tacos No.1 consider training your staff on customer service, they sure need it.

OMG! Where have these tacos been all my life?? I stumbled across this place randomly while searching for another restaurant nearby. I peered in and saw that it looked pretty busy so I wanted to check it out.  The menu prices are very fair for the area, I ordered 2 tacos (1 chicken and 1 steak) and a side of chips and guacamole for about $12. You can order either flour or corn tortillas and have the tacos "con todo" which includes onions, cilantro,salsa and guacamole. The ingredients are of such good quality and the tacos are so flavorful. Go and try this place because you will not be disappointed. A word of caution to those with spice sensitivities, the salsa is a bit on the spicier side otherwise run don't walk for these tacos because they are absolutely delicioso.

Great taco place close to Times Square! I had the adobada taco which is marinated pork with pineapple. My only regret was having them put salsa on it. I expected cut up tomatoes salsa but it was pretty spicy. Still very very good and I'd highly recommend!

Line is out the door for lunch; dinner is much quieter.  I've tried the carne, cactus and pork tacos. I always get corn tortillas with everything on it.  Carne is the way to go.  It's standing room only, so eat and go.  Awesome food and a very chill place.  Totally unexpected a few hundred steps from tourist trap Times Square.  Two tacos and a drink is about $10.  No ticket no tacos.

I was really impressed at how fast I got my food and how delicious it was. While I waited on the food, I saw them make it right in front of me. Something to note - this restaurant has no chairs; there are bars to stand and eat your food. I came here because of all the other positive reviews and was not disappointed

Expect to wait a ton for this taco place in Chelsea Market. The line moves pretty quickly and it is definitely worth the wait. The tacos are simple with cilantro and onion but they are sooo good. There are options for flour and corn tortillas. All of the meats I had were great. Once you order you give your ticket to one of the many people working behind the counter to make your order. There are many salsas as well as limes available on the counter. There's nowhere to sit and eat so you'll have to eat standing up or exit the restaurant and eat outside. Such good tacos!

Lines are nuts but move fairly quickly. Pick up is crazy hectic, not sure how they remember several ppls customizations but they do. The pork adobada is nuts. Steak and chicken were good, but that pork, that's where it's at.

I have always enjoyed their tacos at the Chelsea location and wanted to give it a go in midtown. The location is spacious and in similar Mexican theme as the Chelsea location.  The only issue for me is it's standing dining only.  I see why they opted to make it standing to accommodate  loads of tourists and New Yorkers, but at least they should have seating for some patrons who wish to sit while munching on their taco.  I ordered 2 tacos, the adobada (pictured here) and carne asada.  The adobada taco was good, but I've had better at El Gordo in Las Vegas.  Las Vegas is my 2nd home and El Gordo is a local fave among it's residents.  It's the best adobada taco I've ever had.  I've tried a couple adobada tacos in NYC, and yes, Los Tacos is the best for the area.  I have to say, their winner taco is the carne asada. The carne asada is marinated to perfection and is just so damn good!  This place would be golden if they serve carne asada fries! Overall, if you are in the midtown area and need a taco fix, this place is spot on.
No comment
No comment

Def best tacos in NYC. That's coming from a tejano and my wife from Acapulco. Tortilla were sooooo flavorful and the al pastor was perfect. Jamaica was on point and the staff was fast, friendly and informative.
Aaamazing food... had Asada Taco and Asada Quesadilla. Line  was long but service was super  Fast.  Food was super flavorful! They had best sauces. I would come here everyday if I could.

Excellent tacos. Dare I say "authentic" even though I don't know what authentic tacos actually taste like? But I figure they are. Taste is phenomenal and they have an area where you can put as much salsa or lime juice on them as you want. The food is quick and easy if you want to be in and out in 10 minutes. My only gripes are that there's no seating, just counters. Carnitas is a tad too salty. And the drinks are way overpriced (I think it's like $2.50 for a soda but it does come in those old school glass bottles).
No comment

I think we went up for seconds, thirds, and then took another order to our hotel for later. LOVEEEE  the tacos they have their ordering system down and it makes it quick and fun! That little bit of pineapple on the pork taco is everything. The chicken, pork, and beef taco are all top 3 of course with the preference of flour tortilla with lime. Ate too quickly to rake pho tots of the tacos but I had to take a photo of the place for memories sake. * See if you can find my photo locations and send me the match! *

The No. 1 in the name is for a reason! This place really is the best place for tacos in New York. Located really close to Times Square. DO NOT LOOK AT THE HUGE LINE AND GO AWAY! The service is super quick and the line goes really fast. There's no seating available but lots of standing tables and that's how everyone eats it. The staff is super sweet and if it's your first taco experience they'll explain everything to you very clearly. We tried their bestseller Adobado taco, the vegetarian Nopal (Cactus) taco and from their secret menu Pollo Asado in a cheese shell taco. The cheese shell taco is actually a taco shell made out of CHEESE! Yes, just cheese! We suggest you get one of these for sure because it is just too good! The Adobado was the juiciest taco I've ever eaten and the pineapple slice just makes it a perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The Nopal was pretty average and we only recommend it for vegetarians. We also got chips and salsa which was slightly disappointing after the tacos set such high standards. Chips needed a bit of salt to make it better. Nevertheless, their taco game is too good and that's what their USP is.

I am their Chelsea market joint "cult" member, aka Super fan! So glad they opened this theater district location, less line up and I can grab on the way home or before movie at AMC Times Square. Beef with corn tortilla with everything topping is my go to dish. I added some radish on the side some spicy green sauce. They have imported Mexico Coca-cola and Fanta in retro glass bottle or you can try their traditional Mexico house drinks.
No comment
No comment
No comment
these tacos are really the best! no matter how much I eat I want more. Love this place

We needed a place to eat before our Broadway show and Los Tacos really hit the spot! I had a chicken taco and it was delicious. By far, my favorite part was the pico- it tasted very fresh and more importantly the whole meal was authentic. There are no seats in the place which really urges you to finish your meal quickly, so if you're looking for a place to sit back and relax this isn't it. However, it definitely served our purpose of a quick meal!
No comment

While in New York in October i was craving tacos of course!! I saw a post on Instagram of los tacos and a few minutes after i was going to their location at Chelsea marked then to to the location in Times Square the night after. It was sooooo good!! I got a quesadilla with just the cheese and meat both times, so juicy and yummy, to die for!! The customer service was nice and sweet, very quick with getting food out. I wish there were more tables to sit at, there's a lot of standing area at the times square location but little to non at the Chelsea market location, that would be my only complaint but the food kinda makes up for it. I would defiantly go back to ny just for this place! MUST GO TO
No comment
No comment
Definitely a hole in the wall with standing tables only but the tacos are delicious and decently priced for being 200 ft from Times Square. I will be coming here again on my next NYC trip.

It was our first night in NYC last April 3rd and we immediately went to Los Tacos and ordered Adobada and Carne Asada on corn tortillas. Both were flavorful and we loved them both. Tamarindo drink was a surprised. The serving was small so 3 tacos per person is recommended if you are hungry. We will definitely go back.
No comment

This is actually the 3 rd time I've visited this amazing place I preferred a carne asada taco ,chips &guacamole and chicken quesadilla. The lady behind the counter was very nice and knowledgeable . All were delicious and tasted authentic. Definitely a go to for tacos.

First time to New York and this place was recommended by almost every local possible. It did not disappoint. Be prepared for a long line to order but not a long time to receive your order. The meat was so tender and the corn tortillas are AMAZING! Absolutely a must place to visit and enjoy some authentic tacos!
Amazing - low key- true to its mission and over delivers in its promise.   What more do you need to know.   If you don't love Los Tacos you are defective and don't know anything
The tacos are SO GOOD. I can't get enough. I first went to the Chelsea market location and I was in midtown area and needed to get a taco. I could eat 7 if I wanted to!!
No comment

Let me start by saying no Bueno. If anybody knows Spanish don't know that means not good. I have never in my life tasted tacos so bland and that goes for the salsa too! The people who gave this place five star review has never eaten a good taco in their life. This is the place for white people to eat because if you're a true Hispanic person you would not be eating a fucking taco here. Anybody who says this place is delicious wonderful wow wow wow is bullshit! Why would anybody put my salsa on my taco before I eat it. It's like eating soggy bread.Let me tell you the meat has no flavor. Don't even get me started on the salsa it taste like water and blended tomatoes. I don't know how this business survives in time square. I tasted better tacos at the taco truck. Don't even get me started on the Tamarindo drink. The customer service was horrible they rush you to order. They push you down the line. And they give you tasteless food! Just don't eat here. FOODIE BE WARE!

The atmosphere is amazing! It's a great place to get a quick bite. It is worth all the hype. Definitely has the authentic flavors I was expecting. Variety of salsa for those who do not like spicy or enjoy the fiery taste! The aguas frescas are a must! Stop by if you're in the area, even for just one taco! It's worth it!

Excellent tacos and the long line just proves it. I've had tacos all over Mexico and still I dream of the pork tacos from Los Tacos #1. It's a no frills place, only full of flavor. The menu is simple but the pork tacos are a must! Standing room only so no seating. It's ok, their food is so delicious it won't take long to finish.
best tacos in downtown! it's nice because they are more like medium sized tacos than tiny ones so it's worth the money. great service, made quick

Phenomenal Mexican food in the heart of NYC. The flavor was authentic, the presentation was low key and the speed of preparation was awesome. It's a standing room only place so if you're a food snob or fancy person, this isn't for you however if real food with real flavor is your thing, you'll love this place.
No comment
No comment

this place is fast and authentic -- definitely check this place out if you like Tacos. The sauce is great and the meat portions are plentiful. Ther is no sitting area so be prepared to stand and get friendly with your elbow-space neighbors

I've been searching for a taco place here in Manhattan that can match the tacos back in LA and this place has come the closest so far! I ordered the adobada (marinated pork) taco, a carne asada quesadilla, and chips & guac. The guac was AMAZING! It tasted super fresh as if they made within the hour and the chips were nice and crunchy and not at all stale. The quesadilla surprised me because it was an "open faced quesadilla" which I wasn't aware of when I ordered, but it was tasty nonetheless. The taco was also pretty flavorful, but the adobada was a bit too salty for my taste. They have limes, different salsas, and radishes available by the counter and along the walls. The flavors are definitely there, but the prices are a bit high with tacos running at $4 a pop. I'll definitely be back here to satisfy my taco cravings in between visits to LA!

Don't let the line out the door or lack of standing room deter you from this place. The tacos and quesadillas are AMAZING. You can smell the hand made tortillas as you walk in. The meats are flavorful and tender
No comment
No comment
Holy cow!!!! AMAZING!!!!!! Close to Times Square, inexpensive and some of the best food I've had in New York so far. We will definitely be going back.
No comment
Mmmm! Came in 40 min before Lion King show and inhaled $55 worth of tacos. Thank you baby jesus!

This is certainly one of my new favorite hot spots for Mexican Tacos!  The Adobado and Carne Asada is by far my favorite.  The flavor is just right and the spices brings in a nice kick.  I'm a lover of spicey food and I nearly drowned my food with hot sauce.  Will certainly be stopping by whenever I'm around Times Square again.
The asada taco is delicious while the chicken is also good. One of the better taco places in New York. My wife and I will definitely come back when on the area.

After my extensive food research for our recent trip to NYC, it was obvious we had to try Los Tacos No. 1. If you blink you'll miss it so stop looking at your feet, look up and through the scaffolding so you're sure to step inside this brightly lit piece of taco heaven. We ordered the adobada taco on a corn tortilla, pollo quesadilla on corn and the carne asada (one on flour, one on corn). You can watch them make the tortillas by hand and even though the flour tortillas are delicious, order the corn. Trust me on this!  They are so good. I ordered my adobada with everything and although delicious, if you do not like spicy pass on the red sauce as it packs a punch and just use the condiments against the wall. The chicken and steak were so flavorful and tender as well. Eating here transported me right back to Mexicali, Mexico. Well worth looking up from your feet for!
This place is so amazing, the food and the atmosphere! No ticket, No Taco is my new motto for taco Tuesday at home !
Great tacos for NYC. Very quick and good portions for the price! Wish they were open later for late night snacks!

This place has some of the best salsa I have ever tasted. We ordered quesadilla and tacos and I wanted MORE. I found this place on a blog (can't remember the name. I'm sorry) who had listed the top 10 places to try in NYC. This was on there. Thankfully I was able to try their food while visiting recently. Thanks for the food and good music!
Best tacos in NYC. Not many options but everything I have tried has been good. My favorite being the quesadillas.

Delicious cheap quick lunch just off Times Square. No major ambience. This is a true joint. Get in, order, eat & get out. No chairs or tables. They don't want you to stay! Just eat your well seasoned, well priced food at the stand up counters and be on your way. And it's crowded. People watching kept me in my space on the counter longer than I should have been there. The line for the register where you order never had a break. Clearly this is a best kept secret that everyone knows about. Definitely come & get your fill!

LOVED their pork tacos. Was so delicious. Wait wasn't long, service was great, and everything was organized. Love going there for lunch during the week when tourism has died down a little. Overall, the best thing there is the pork tacos. Not too big on anything else.

The world's best tacos! Unbelievably good and they are so cheap! The first time I went I had to rejoin the queue for more and I was back as soon as they opened the next day. I would recommend getting one of each of the tacos. Every meat was so flavourful and it was great to try nopal (grilled cactus) - so juicy. The guacamole is so creamy and tasty and the choices of sauces is good. Staff were friendly, service prompt and efficient. Excellent choice of soft drinks. The only thing they are missing is tequila for after, it would wash the tacos down perfectly! Very sad to be returning to London now - please open there!

With all the positive reviews and the amount of reviews I had really high hopes/standards for this place. And it was just ok, in my opinion. There was nothing that made these tacos exceptional or stand out as the best. We had the asada and chicken taco and a quesadilla, which looks like a militia without the top tortilla. The salsa that comes in the tacos is like fire. Heed the hostess warning about that. Also true the cactus taco and it was ok at best. Was glad to try this place out, but as a avid taco connoisseur, I wouldn't go back again. Place was clean and staff was welcoming. And service was fast
Awesome food! The carne asada taco was wonderful! The pork had an excellent spice to it. Quick, friendly, delicious!
No comment
No comment

What can I say this is by far the best and closet thing I have come to eating SoCal Mexican food. One of the owners is Mexican and grew up in SD. He brought the SoCal twist to NYC. Amazing tacos!! Always a long line but so worth the wait. Just missing some Cali burritos  or carne asada fríes. However still gives you authentic taco shop feels from Cali (San Diego). Can't wait to try their fish tacos at Los Mariscos.

Super tasty! It is kinda hard to find a place to eat but you can make do with standing at the bar inside or finding somewhere around the market to stand. Their salsa is super fresh and tasty. I would highly recomend grabbing extra napkins and maybe even a fork since they pile them super high with the good stuff you will definetly be getting a little ditry eating them but it is worht it.
Best tacos in the the city, by far! No matter which one you go, you'll always get amazing tacos. Especially recommended the adobada and carne asada.

Fast place to eat something good. The tacos are very authentic & I would def recommend trying this place. You get the most for your dollar. There spicy salsa is very good :) unfortunately there is no seating so you willl eat while standing but completely worth it!
No comment

The Tacos are too delicious! Options include pollo/carne/nopal/adobada. The service is really fast as well! Be sure not to lose your ticket... cause it's no ticket no taco! Friendly atmosphere to eat in

I would recommend this place to anyone. I try tacos in every city I go to, and can confidently say these are the best I have had (my brother and mom agree). I have to eat gluten free and this restaurant has plenty of options for those who are gluten free. If you are in NY you need to eat here... I would eat here at least once a week I lived here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Number 1 indeed. These guys crank out tasty tacos at a blinding speed. Selections are limited, but all very good. Don't be scared off by the number of people lined up for these tacos; the line moves quick, and the short wait is well worth it.
No comment

My Son-In-Law was in town and said  Los Tacos No 1 had the best tacos he's every had. I tried them the next day and now agree with him.  Nothing fancy standup counters short menus quick service great work staff and tacos to die for

Visited tacos no. 1 with my family as we vacationed in New York for the Holliday. Upon arrival I was very shocked to see how big the line was outside the establishment I had previously heard these were the best tacos in nyc so we decided we would wait in line. We waited for about 15-20 min but it actually seemed to go by pretty fast! As we entered the restaurant an employee asked if we had been there before we let her know it was our first time. She went ahead and explained how the ordering process went which she said first we order they give us a ticket after paying and we give the ticket to the taquero let him know how exactly we want our tacos it is a very organized process! Keep in mind the restaurant is super packed! So the customer services given was over the top! When I got my food I had very high expectations for the tacos and let me tell you.. every single one of my expectations were met! These are one of the most delicious tacos I have had. They are full of flavor not to mention on a fresh tortilla! I will def. be back!
Just as great as the Chelsea Market location but more space to stand and to eat! You cannot go wrong

Great tacos, a little pricey but then again it's a good price for NY. The tacos were full and the fact they already put the guac and salsa on top of your tacos makes it better since you don't have to do that. The only downside to this place is that you have to eat standing up

Okay so we were searching for some really good Mexican food while visiting NY and I saw a few recommendations for Los Tacos. You know it's going to be good when you walk up and there's a line to get into a standing room only joint. The staff was super friendly and kept everyone moving. The food was amazing - best tacos my husband said he's ever had. The guacamole was awesome and for $40 three of us had enough food that we were stuffed. Would come back no question!
No comment
Love the place! Tacos are really good! There's always people so come prepared to wait at least 15 min! It's crowded so there won't be a place to eat right away. But the food is worth it!

Absolutely fantastic Mexican tacos. I got three tacos: chicken, beef, and carnitas. Absolutely amazing can't have asked for better. Corn flower is definitely the way to go. The staff is very helpful and dedicated to having a speedy service. Overall wait from entering till having the tacos in my hand was about 6 minutes. Great place for lunch rush. Sadly no pics since I ate my tacos in a line at the port authority.

This place has really, really good tacos. We went  after  lunch time on a Monday and it was packed. No seats so you eat standing up at the counters. Not many options but it is all good. Also had the horchata which was delicious also.
The especial quesadilla was amazing as was their carne asada tacos. The tortillas seemed fresh as did the condiments they used. Very good Mexican place in the Times Square area.
Great tacos! The salsas have flavor and the tortillas are nice and thick, only one is needed to hold all the  flavorful carne asada.

Tacos, they seem like a dime a dozen these days. Not here! Some of the best tacos I have had. Selection is a goof spread of traditional, standard and special. All the meats were great, the cactus I didnt like as much as I wanted to but not bad at all. READ THIS: Get a quesadilla filled however you want, but order it "especial" style. You'll literally ascend to taco heaven.
Most authentic Mexican tacos I have ever eaten in NY!!! Service is incredibly fast and employees are super friendly! Will definitely be back when I'm around Times Square !

Doesn't look like much but this place is super popular especially among the lunch crowd. For a really quick and tasty option, this place is it. There are no places to sit but I think that adds to the type of atmosphere it is providing. I highly recommend all the tacos but the pork one especially. Probably the best tacos I've ever tried
Steak & chicken corn tacos were satisfying and delicious, they were generous with the amount of meat and good service

Awesome and super fresh. The salsas are also have the perfect amount of spice, acidity, and flavor. I have never been disappointed by the food here and it comes at a cheaper price than many of the Mexican restaurants that serve tacos around New York. I look forward to trying Los Mariscos next for tasty seafood next!
Must try! We had it 3 nights in a row. My favorite was the chicken tacos and chips and gauc.

Like most NYC residents, I avoid Times Square like the plague, so I was unaware of the existence of this place until it was recommended to me by a chef in Mexico City. So of course when a self-proclaimed taco expert said he thinks it's the most authentic taco place in New York, I had to drag myself through the crowds to try it at least once- and sure enough, he's right, it rocks. I've gone a number of times now and had most things on the menu. I'm not usually a pork person, but the adobada mula (like an open-faced quesadilla) is my favorite. They also have horchata here, which is like, the most delicious beverage in the history of the world, but not super easy to find in Manhattan. Yeah, the whole line/standing/counter situation sort of sucks, but again, it's authentic. It's a great place to go for a quick meal (the line moves fast) on your own (because it's pretty easy to find a spot for one person to squeeze into at a counter).

These tacos are amazing! With a choice of flour tortilla or corn tortilla, we got the carne asada (grilled steak), pollo asado (grilled chicken) and adobada (marinated pork) with everything on it. These tacos were worth the long walk in the cold and every penny it cost. They are super authentic and delicious with a bar of sauces to choose from. Mouthwatering. I added some pico de Gallo and hot sauce to the tacos to enhance the flavors of the tacos. However, the tacos itself were extremely flavorful. I regret not trying the grilled cactus, but the next time I come back its definitely going to be on the top of my list.

You can't go wrong here, clean, friendly, and so delicious! Probably the best taco I've ever had. And the location is perfect! Even though it's standing only for eating, we didn't mind one bit! The food is so fresh, the salsa, guacamole, meat, veges, cheese, tortilla... its all good! Definitely worth the 5 stars!
No comment

OMG...this place is sooo good!! I had the steak and pork taco on a corn tortilla. I'm literally mad I only had two!! This is not the place you come to when you're on a diet..come on your cheat day and eat everything! The flavor is so amazingly delicious...these are probably the best tacos I've ever had and I lived in LA where there's tacos everywhere. Seriously don't pass on this place. There was a long line when I came but it goes very fast. I will be back for sure.
AMAZING TACOS ! This place is def worth the wait and the walk. The ordering procedure is a little confusing, but damn!! They make a mean taco  . Highly recommend this taco spot. Besos
No comment

These tacos are ok. Not the best, and they only have 1 vegetarian option. Cactus. Not all vegetarians like mushrooms, just like not all vegetarians like cactus. The line was also really long. Rather get my tacos elsewhere, where there are options.
Any taco here is absolutely worth it. I love there selections and flavors. I highly recommend checking them out and trying there tacos. I also love there fresh juices.
No comment
No comment

I really loved this place, the crew is friendly and the food is delicious. The only thing I could say about this place is the fact that they don't have a bathroom haha. I loved the agua de Jamaica I had and the quesadilla has to be the best quesadilla I've ever had. The grilled nopales tho.

Never knew this place existed until I saw Bobby Flay recommend it on his TV show. Great tacos, the pork is a must try absolutely delicious! The place is small with no tables and there was a line out the door but it moved quickly!

First off I'm from Los Angeles, best place for authentic Mexican food.. Have tried tacos from a lot of different restaurants, taco trucks, Whole in the wall places and let me tell you. Nothing has been as good as Los Tacos... the location is very close to Times Square, very easy to find. There are no tables, you have to stand and eat,,, which is pretty fair because the place is PACKED!!!! The tortillas are freshly made and grilled the minute you order. We had the chicken and carne asada and man oh man it was sooo juicy and full of amazing flavor!!! If you like tacos, this is a MUST when your in manhattan!!! You won't regret it!
For anyone that has tried real Mexican tacos this place is a must !!!!! I had 3 asada tacos and a mula.. sooooo delish and authentic ! I was transported to Mexico from the first bite.

On the positive side, all four of their tacos are excellent, with the pork being the most flavorful. On the negative side it is incredibly loud inside and when we tried to go in the evening we had to fight through the Times Square crowds.
Boy the food is good in this place. The place look well taking care meaning is clean and the staff are friendly. They provide the customer with free water.

This was a classic taco stand atmosphere!!! Full of Mexicans working and they knew what they were doing!!! I'm from Texas and we get some authentic Mexican food there and this place did not disappoint!!! Great tasting food and decently priced. I would definitely recommend this place.
No comment

I wouldn't say they are the BEST tacos but all their tacos are consistently good. There is usually a crowd at lunch and dinner time any day of the week but it's usually not too bad. When I want tacos and I don't want to travel far, this is the place to go.
No comment
No comment
Lovely taco place! great food, great staff, and great music!!haha

Perhaps the best tacos I have had! They were so delicious. If you are going prepare to stand up as they have no chairs but plenty of room to chow down on the best tacos. When you walk in you order and pay at one station and then they give you a ticket and go to the stations where they make your tacos! I suggest getting con todo!

Crowded, chaotic, and standing-room only, but DELICIOUS. Each taco comes with guac. Sort of Cafe Rio/Chipole style, located right in Times Square and without the scary prices. Line is consistently out the door. Don't miss this one!

Best taco joint in NYC, hands down! The chicken quesadillas are to die for, and the chips and guac are consistently amazing and worth spending up for. This place isn't cheap but is worth it every single time.

I love tacos! When I heard about this place I had to check it out! Glad I went! Prob one of the best tacos I had in a long time! I love the Market so stopping here was fun because it's in a nice place. The tacos were amazing, spicy and all ingredients were fresh. Great vibe for a taco to go place... was my first time ordering and the lady who helped me with the process was nice. I will be back!

NYC's taco game has really leveled up the last 2 years. Los Tacos No.1 delivers real Mexican style tacos no gringo gimmicks. Fresh flavorful corn tortillas. The asada is soft, charred and has some kick. Tacos come w guac salsa (not guacamole), salsa onions and cilantro. It's standing only which is great in my opinion but watch out for the white folks who take up so much space and even put their bags on counters where people could be eating. Get it together! It's a taco joint bumping elbows is ok.
No comment
Everyone should be very careful about this restaurant because the waiter sometimes mess up orders dishes has soap scum
The best taco spot in nyc. I am a Texan & never thought I would find a taco spot here. This place is a gem
No comment
No comment

Wow these tacos are exceptional. I got 2 carne Asado tacos and one pollo asado. This place was packed, and now I can see why, the tortillas were fresh and nicely toasted. The way they arranged the tacos was different and awesome because it holds all the meat together nicely without the meat falling off. The guacamole was fresh and flavorful. This place was delicious and  I recommend you try it if you ever pass through Chelsea market.

Omg omg I love this place. Best steak tacos ever!  Nice grill flavor to meat and pico de Gallo is right  on.  There is always a long line which shows how good it is. But the line moves pretty fast.  It's not cheap for taco but quality makes it totally worth the price.  They were in Chelsea market but noticed that they are now expanding. Hopefully their quality doesn't go down!

Truly authentic tacos! Favorite was the pork (adobado) and carne asada. Get the corn tortillas and "Con todo" (with everything) on it. Long lines at peak times but moves quickly. A must for the taco lover!
No comment
Best tacos I'm had in New York. You won't be disappointed. The service is quick even when it's busy. Great Customer service also do not forget one ticket per person lol
Best kept secret in town inside the Chelsea market. My wife and I go there at least one a week. Best tacos in the city and it is cheap
Down the street from work, finally found a great taco places that reminds me of the taco stands in Mexico! I love the guacamole that comes with the tacos "con todo"

Came here with my sister and mother for a quick lunch. We arrived 5 minutes after opening and it was still pretty packed! I tried 1 chicken and 1 pork on corn tortillas with all of the toppings and added the mild salsa from the salsa bar. My sister got the same with flour tortillas and my mother tried the Nopal Plate with chips and guacamole. We were skeptical of the cactus but it was actually quite tasty. We all enjoyed everything we had. The chips were salted perfectly, the tortillas were fresh and the meat was well seasoned. It is standing room only for a quick turn over. Would definitely come again.

The tacos speak for themselves. I got the chicken tacos and they were delicious. Savory meat. Sauces are also really good. Don't be scared to put the hot sauce on it's not that hot it has more of a chipotle flavor to it. Definitely coming back ! They're for sure comparable to "real tacos" you get off the street in Mexico. Worth the wait on the Long line (which also moves pretty quickly)
This place was epic. I must come back soon. Authentic taste, quick service and fun. No seating, stand and eat your deliciousness and move on.

Thanks for having this location walking distance from Port Authority.  The place is simple, nothing fancy but just like many simple things....they offer the best.   This place reminds me of Grays Papaya style kind of fast food.  Fast food yet the quality of food they can offer u makes u want to eat more.  Hard to explain but u have to try it yourself to understand what I am trying to say.  They offer the real deal taco...Legit.  I thought I was in Mexico ..the only difference is that they ddnt have shrimp or fish taco.  Maybe they should add that in  their menu list as a suggestion.  If ever u want to give this place a try, get carne asada, adobada and pollo in CORN tortilla.

Amazingly authentic tacos.  The corn tortillas were great...we enjoyed carne asada and adobada tacos. This place is SO hidden, but SO worth it.  Jump in line, even if it's out the door, because it moves fast.  Order at register, take your ticket (receipt) down the line and hand it to the team on the prep line.  They'll prepare your order, then you can add salsa and grab limes from the counter.  Delicious!

Easily the best tacos in the city. For a place know for amazing food, Mexican food is something that New York really does not deliver on. I had low hopes for this place by was blown away! Came here before a show and was so impressed. Tortillas and handmade, they have horchata, great salsas, amazing prices. Super flavorful. Would actually go to time square just for these tacos. Got the carne asada and the pork Taco (can't remember the name abodaba?) with everything on them and both were excellent. It's standing room only but service is super fast. In and out in about 20 mins. Horchata was so good.

Everything about this place is incredible. Great place to go in midtown if you want "fast food" but good food. There are a lot of standing tables, and it was pretty crowded when I went in the late afternoon. Absolutely delicious tacos. A bit on the pricey side, but definitely worth the extra dollar or two for a quick, tasty meal.
No option for vegetarians outside the cactus tacos. That being said I apparently love cactus.

Hands down some of the best tacos I've had. My husband and I had: tacos al pastor (here they are known as tacos adobada), carne asada tacos, chips and salsa (if you are used to eating non-spicy food then the sauce IS spicy) the guacamole (is not spicy) and the horchata beverage. It did not disappoint. A laid back atmosphere, great service, and a simple menu full of flavor.
Especial quesadilla is a delicious, flaky pastry-like pocket filled with cheese. Add some tomatoes/pico and salsa and you're good to go. Both the chicken and marinated pork tacos were good as well.
No comment

Great eat-your-tacos-while-standing-up-and-go type of place! Order at the cashier and pay, get your ticket and bring it to where they customize your order. Find a spot to devour the deliciousness. Food was awesome, simple menu, cheap, super casual. Not a place for people who want to be "served". Serve yo' self!!!
Wow! Tacos here are amazing. The adobado tacos were the best but they are still all delicious. Went for lunch and the line was long but it moves very quickly. Definitely worth the short wait.
No comment

This was our best AND our cheapest meal in New York AND it was in Time Square.  I had Otto's Tacos on my list of places to eat, but we ended up here one night because it was close and on the way to the show. I don't know how the other place could have been any better. There was a line out the door, but it moved quickly. I had a fried quesadilla with chicken and an adobada (pork) taco on a corn tortilla con todo (with everything: onions, cilantro, salsa, quac). They were both good, but if I went back I would be three of the the adobada tacos. They were amazing. Spicy but not hot and so tasty. I considered stopping by after the show as well. GO HERE!

Amazeballllls! I tried each and every type of taco because why not and the only one I can say I didn't like was the napal aka grilled cactus (can you blame me?) this is a grab and go type of place with absolutely no seating - but they do have Mexican cokes for the perfect finish to the perfect meal!
Amazing tacos. Never had better. The horchata is to die for so refreshing a perfect compliment to the tacos. Portion sizes are really good too.

Same great tacos as the ones in Chelsea, now in a more accessible location for tourists. This location offers standing tables to prevent lingering to allow space for all patrons, as I'm sure it gets packed in here.

I read reviews on this place before coming... great reviews about having the best tacos. Was not disappointed at all! And the rumors are true these are probably the best tacos I've ever had. Will def come back to this place and I live in NJ! I suggest the pork!
Literally the BEST taco. I can't wait to visit NYC again just so I can eat here!! Simple, but SO much flavor & fresh!!
Great spot!! I loved the Mexicali style tacos! I ordered 4 tacos and I was full after the second one. Super filling.
Hands down the best Tacos I have ever ate. I definitely recommend this place in Times Square. There is a line outside but it goes by extremely quickly. Do not just order 1 taco - 3 is minimum

Place was incredible! This place was recommended by a a bartender at tacombi.
