The only reason this is a 4 star for me is because the adobada tasted different from what I remember from my childhood ( from Monterrey, MX) and in order to order again (once inside) I would've had to go back out and to the back of the long line ( down the block ). Other than that, tortillas were delicious, environment was fun and overall staff was very helpful and friendly. Great place to go to if you're staying in Times Square!
No comment
No comment

I had the adobada and nopal tacos. There was a small line on a Thursday night, and the tacos were made really fast. Lots of counters for standing room while eating. Great place to get quick, delicious food! I had some time before catching my bus so I grabbed the two tacos. Both had great flavor - I enjoyed the adobada slightly more than the nopal. Would definitely go back!

Amazing tacos and super close to home!! The place usually has a really long line, but I got lucky with the time that I went and there was no line at all. Ordered two chicken tacos (pollo asado) and absolutely loved them!! They come with guac without extra charge, so that made me really happy. Also, pretty cheap for New York City prices!
Great quick and tasty experience! Small menu allows for an easy selection and nothing we ordered wasn't delicious.

If I can give more stars I would! Living in midtown Manhattan there aren't too many great taco spots. Coming across Los Tacos which is only a few minutes away from where I live, I have to say this is a gold mine! Great service and overall amazing tasting tacos!

Best tacos in NYC!  The al pastor tacos are amazing. In the taco world there are the haves and the have nots. To be part of haves you have to make your own tortillas fresh and Los Tacos definitely does. The fresh tortilla with the freshly sliced marinating meat and all the various toppings make you want to come back again, and again,.and again.

Pretty legit tacos I think I've found so far living in nyc. This place gives me the feels of LA and the flavors of street tacos back home. The carne asada on corn tortilla is a must. Top the meal with a ice cold horchata and you're set for a happy stomach.
No comment

HYPE IS REAL!!! Best tacos of my life and when I finally went here for the first time I decided to go three times that week. Pork is the way to go - steak and chicken are good but they're just like "hmm good" not like WOW.  I think it's a bit weird the quesadilla is basically a bigger taco with some cheese? But still into it. And great chips and guacamole here - also love that the line loves quickly & they have free self serve salsa on the side. I

I stopped by again cause I had to get my fix, what can I say I'm hooked on the tacos here. I came a few minutes after opening and there was a small line outside I didn't mind cause the lone moves fast. The food once again is consistent and stellar. I have to make my way over to the Chelsea location and see how it is over there. I'm hoping for more locations in the near future. Please come to westchester county lol.

Quick, easy, fresh, busy and tasty are some of the instant adjectives that come to my mind when I think of Los Tacos No. 1! You feel like you are in a different country when you enter here - it gives me In-n-Out vibes in terms of decor and how the staff uniforms with Hispanic music playing and it's bustling with people. There is always meat on the grill and always quick service, especially good when you are in a rush (like I was). The guacamole is made with fresh avocados and tastes homemade in a good way! The salsa is yummy with a hint of garlic which I love! The tacos are soft and delicious without it being extra. And I like that they have a simple menu and everything for everyone. It's an overall a fast and great taco experience near Times Square.

I thought it was a lost cause for me because of the crowd, but oh my goodness!! This is totally worth the wait!!! I wanted to try this place so we headed there and there was a line, but it was so fast. Staff is nice and super friendly! I got a pork taco and chicken quesadilla with everything on it. Super delicious! Spicy but sweet on the pork because of the pineapple and the chicken quesadilla is really good too. I very much recommend this place if you ever visit New York! Don't worry about the crowds. It's not that long and the wait is so worth it!!
No comment

I really like the environment of this place because being this place make me feel like I am closer to the Mexican culture which I find fascinating. At first when I went there I didn't know what to get because it was the first Mexican restaurant I go to and I wasn't familiar with the Mexican culture and food. But the staffs there help me and give me recommendations by asking me my food preferences and if I had any allergies. Even if it was busy and the line was long they took their time to help me decide on my orders. They were really genuine toward their service and treat every customers with respect. Even though the places can be hectic and stressful with a lot of work most of the time, the staffs was always able to keep a good and positive attitude and perform their work with such enthusiasm and energy. But i feel like this place can improve in its decoration more to represent their culture more. I hope that I will get the chance to visit this place again sometime soon. Thank you for the great customer services.
No comment
Simple ingredients, combined to give you the pleasure of great food! You know it when kids love it and ask for more...A short wait time was definitely worth it and we will go there again.

I really enjoyed Los Tacos No. 1. I went on a Monday afternoon at about 1:30. The line extended out the door, but it was very orderly and moved very quickly. The ordering system is a little confusing for a newbie, because it's very loud inside and you have to accept a ticket, pass the ticket to the men on the taco assembly line, and then answer the question as to whether you want corn or flour, and then whether you want it to go or to stay. Make sure to grab limes and little containers for salsa. The nopal tacos were really tasty and quite messy. Grab a fork! There is another counter with a mild salsa/pick de gallo, a medium green salsa, and a fiery, delicious, smoky red salsa. There are also radishes to add some crunch. The counters and floor are surprisingly clean, given the fact that the tacos are well-stuffed and handheld. Scarf down the deliciousness at one of the counters and then skedaddle.

Some of the lost authentic tacos you can find in NY. This place offers decently priced tacos in a no seat setting so you can eat them and move on. Their ingredients are fresh and flavorful. One of the biggest draws for this place in my opinion is the option to get a cheese shell taco instead of flour or corn. It's a great, albeit salty and a bit greasy, alternative for those that are on a keto diet. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food you'll be getting.

$4 for one street taco.. enough said! Plus their "quesadilla" isn't a quesadilla it's a taco with cheese thrown on top. No place to sit and not stroller/family friendly at all. Customer service was horrible and the food wasn't authentic. Maybe being from California and having travelled to Mexico  multiple times my standards are too high? Id recommend chipotle before this place. Super mediocre.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.. run super efficiently, delicious tacos and great employees, such a good all together experience. Love this place

Sooo yummy. It's always a bit difficult getting a spot to eat but it's totally worth it. One of my favorite taco spots in the city. Definitely worth it, I don't find this location to be very different from Chelsea just a matter which you're near.
No comment

I am usually skeptical about any place that bills themselves "no.1". But holy moly, this place actually deserves it. This is BY FAR the best steak taco I ever had before. The meat was incredibly juicy, the salsa and chips were incredibly fresh. I wasn't crazy about the price, $3.75 for one taco is a little too expensive imo. But this is actually worth it. Previously taqueria tehuitzingo was my favorite in the area, but now they've been overthrown by this place.

These tacos are worth the wait! Delicious California type of tacos. The sauces and marinated meat are perfect combo. In the morning, there's a cart that sells burritos that are equally delicious, with eggs & sausage.
No comment

Hey, I just wanted to mention. The previous time I stopped by to get tacos I accidentally dropped my tacos when opening the heavy door, my hands were full  one of the employees said it's okay, he cleaned up the mess and asked them to remake my tacos. They didn't have to do that... I was so HAPPY  Thank you so much!! Very sweet of you guys to do that!

They had great, speedy service for a nice light lunch in NYC. The flavors were amazing and the staff was helpful in choosing what to order (a plus for us indecisive folks). I recommend ordering more than one portion, as the serving size is smaller than most. In addition, be aware that there is no area to sit at this eatery, but that just adds to the atmosphere. Overall, a great experience.

So I hate going to Times Square because of all the people but this place is now my excuse to be here everytime I think about tacos. My sister and I had the steak tacos and guacamole with Chips and these are the best Steak tacos I've had in my life. The way the steak is cute thinly but cooked sooo tender...this place is it!!!! Good thing there was no chairs to sit cause I wouldn't sat and ordered 2 more . Only room to stand and eat!
Umm.. Mexican grape Fanta in a glass bottle and delicious tacos. Yes please. Always and forever. Served quick. Friendly staff great stand up quick-eat vibe.

I saw a video on Instagram about this place so It was a a must when I went to nyc so I took my wife and kids the place was packed ! So I ordered 2 tacos of asada and 2 adobada "they are the best tacos in USA " !!! I went everyday in my stay lol !
No comment
Simply put: these are my favorite tacos in NYC. They are consistently the best. I have yet to have a bad taco here. The pineapple pork is exceptional. This place is a go-to.

Some of the best tacos I've had ! When I took my first bite out of my Asada taco "con todo" my memory quickly reverted to when I was 9 years old and visited Tijuana and bought a street taco topped with that creamy avocado salsa that not quite salsa and not quite guac . These tacos did this for me and I think that is something special . When it comes to food I think there is no greater complement than when food transports you to a time or place in your life
No comment

Best Tacos in New York ! I'm a New Yorker and a taco lover I've been to many places in the city but the flavor of this place will knock your socks off. It's a Taqueria style place they make their tortillas fresh there's always a line but it's worth the wait. This is not a sitting type place you stand or you go. I had the pork and pineapple tacos so much flavor. The condiments are also good you can pack your own pico and dried chilies. Very authentic Mexican tacos. The staff there is efficient fast and friendly.

column3: East County Civic Group, Valrico, FL
column6: THESE ARE THE BEST TACOS IVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. I would eat them for every meal seriously. Anyways, the service was amazing and fast, the food was 10/10, and drinks were on point too. Trust me, I've had some pretty good tacos and I make them good myself but these tacos right here are the best.

This place is WAY overhyped. If you want the best tacos, head over to Bay Ridge for cheaper, more filling, more options, and more tasty tacos. LTN1 is set up to cater to the bustling crowds, tourists, and Google employees in a hurry - not satisfy your tastebuds.

Life begins at Los Tacos No. 1! The friendliest most vibrant place in the city, the friendliest service ever! Always crowded and always moving! EXCELLENT tacos, delicious agua fresca. You can see them making the tortillas behind the counter - go corn!

Amazing tacos! I'm a huge foodie and I've had plenty a taco..but these? The chicken is smoke kissed and tender, the pork has this spice to it..maybe cinnamon? So good as a taco and a quesadilla. The beef is good as well! Little smoke from the grill, tender, and wasnt so chewy like some places. It gets super packed but the line is worth the wait. If you're near 42ed on the 1,2,3  line check it out!

A total dive, but a great one! No wonder the crowds are so intense! Delicious, authentic tacos made with delicious meats! Tried chicken, pork and steak and can't pick a favorite because they all were seasoned and dressed so uniquely good! The chips and salsa are a must have side! Super crisp, fresh chips but the salsa- whoa! Too hot to handle!  Just wish they kept it a little cleaner by the condiments. I'll definitely be back!

I definitely gonna recommend this restaurant because their Tacos has impressed me a lot. There are various kinds of fast foods such as Carne Asada Tacos, Marinated Pork and Adobada Tacos. Customer service is very good.
Best tacos in Manhattan. Anyone who says otherwise doesn't know authentic tacos.
No comment

The best flipping Tacos in the city! You HAVE to get the steak tacos. These are the most flavorful tacos, I've ever had. I've been here too many times to count and never been disappointed. The deliciousness is consistent. I'm not really sure how the other options measure up, o always get the steak.

Absolutely lives up to the hype! The lines were long right when they opened but it went fast. We had the carne asada tacos and chickens tacos. We added the spicy and mild sauces and they were amazinggggggggggg. The prices were very reasonable.

Great Authentic Tacos in the city! I always love to find a good eatery near touristy places because most are tourist traps. Tortillas are home made and the al pastor trompo (vertical grill) can't be beat! The service is quick and friendly! Must try if you like authentic Mexican food!
Adobada Quesadilla on flour " Con Todo" ! One of the best things I've ever eaten in NYC. These guys are not f@$&in' around!
Tacos    need I say more this place is the best!!!! Fast and bright with juicy flavor....I can honestly say the best tacos I had ever had...
No comment
No comment

Unfortunately, I have no photos because I ate my tacos immediately. I was so hungry and this hit the spot. I ordered a carnitas and chicken taco. Then I loaded it with the works. I totally recommend you try this place for a quick bite. It's busy a lot of the time due to its location, but it's tasty and within reason as for pricing near Times Square.

There is always a line out the door at lunchtime, but the wait is well worth it and the line generally moves quickly. The staff is attentive and the tacos are authentic. Definitely recommend for a casual lunch.
Great Place to catch a late night snack in TS. If i visit again i will stop here
Over crowded. Food is over priced. Considering the location. I would say it is fair. Taste so so.
No comment

I've had a lot of tacos but this place is amazing! I love the stand up and eat feel. My favorite meat was the al pastor and the asada!!!! So delicious. They need to make a restaurant out in California so I'm able to come here more often

Amazing! I was hesitant to review because it is sooo amazing and I don't want it to get even more crowded !! :) but honestly amazing. I had a pork mulas and it was one of the best things I have ever eaten. I usually don't favor the corn tortillas but this one was delicious and I liked it better than the flour one. It comes with 2 tortillas with delicious melted cheese. I also had a steak taco with a flour tortilla which was also excellent and had a little kick to it. No place to sit, standing tables only, but that's not a problem because you'll eat it so quickly ! I recommend eating there and not getting to go other wise it will get a little soggy. Best eaten fresh and warm.
Awesome, authentic mexican tacos. The service was fast, the place was clean and everything was delicious.
Real deal taco spot, like a food truck in LA but inside a brick-and-mortar establishment. Fast and affordable.
Best tacos in the NYC area. And yes, that includes Queens. Must get the corn tortillas, which are freshly made, and taste like a piece of Mexico in your mouth.

Loved this place! I had an asada taco, al pastor taco, asada mulita and my favorite the nopal taco. (Not all in the same day, had to come back a second time during my vacation)The meat was so good, the salsas and the guacamole were delicious! Everything was good definitely worth the money. If I ever return to New York I will definitely make a stop here.

Best tacos ever!!! After a long day of walking around and sightseeing in the city, Los Tacos was the best thing that happened for our group that day. We tried one of each tacos and ended up with more tacos because our order ticket got messed up and the cook insisted remaking our entire order again even though we asked to make what was not already given to us. From the time of ordering to receiving our food, service is incredibly quick despite a constant line out the door. Definitely going to be coming back each time we visit the city!!

Some of the best tacos I've had and I'm from LA. Comparable to those found in CDMX. I think most impressive is pork, and then steak and then chicken. Cactus is apparently a no go but to each their own.

This is probably the best taco I've ever had, and I'm from Texas :) we came here on our trip to New York and we came about 3 times bc it was so good. I like their beef taco the best. 10/10 would recommend
I travel for food& this was worth the drive & walk to enjoy amazing tacos!! Clean, authentic, made my belly happy! The cheese shell is a must try!!

$15 for four tacos (cactus, chicken, beef, pork) including tax is a bargain for quality food anywhere in NYC let alone touristy-ripoff Times Square... I loved the food, everything was fresh & flavorful, however there is quite a bit of chaos & confusion when it comes to picking-up food -- I watched a cook throw away four "carne asasa" quesadillas because he didn't take the time to carefully read that the ticket said "pollo asada," that's how much of a disconnect there is between the separated processes of ordering and picking-up of food... It's like the wild west, after you pay you have to forcibly hold your place in line otherwise anyone who hands their ticket to a cook before you will get served before you even if you ordered way before them, I watched this happen three separate times and of course each was an uncomfortable predicament -- it's pretty incredible how they make you responsible for fighting for your own food, it really throws a curveball into the equation of trying to have a calm bite to eat when trying to escape Times Square -- why can't they give customers order numbers and why can't the kitchen prepare orders sequentially?

The holy grail of tacos . I wish they can give me free tacos for life because I love these tacos with all the fire in my heart. Thank you los tacos no.1 for blessing NYC with these gorgeous tacos. Very cheap for great quality, fast service, nice staff.

I got tacos during lunch and let me tell you - I haven't had such good tacos in awhile! I got the corn (omg so good) chicken tacos and chips and guac. The chips were PERFECTLY salted and the guac was to die for. I definitely recommend! It's definitely busy during lunch time, but too good to pass up!

Actually the best tacos I have ever had. I have eaten here 3 times in the past three days. It truly is amazing. I tried the pork, chicken, steak, and cactus tacos. The pork being my favorite. You get free guacamole here, what's not to love? The most flavorful tacos I have ever had. I get them with flour tortillas. So so so good. If you are debating whether or not you should go here YOU SHOULD GO HERE!
Awesome tacos located right in Times Square. The meat and ingredients are fresh. The tortillas are made right in front of you. The chips and salsa are amazing too! So glad I found this place!
If you have a bucket list, this belongs on it. The carne asada quesadilla with spicy salsa es un sabor del cielo.
No comment
So yeah. Randomly walked by this place. Had the Carne Asada, Chicken, and Fried Cactus. Amazeballs.

Probably one of the best tacos I've ever had. I had the carne asada one with everything on it and was impressed how delicious it was. Don't lose your ticket because they have a strict no ticket, no taco rule. Also, the line is usually long so take that into consideration.
No comment
No comment
No comment

WOW!!!  I'm visiting from California and originally from Arizona so when I saw this "NYC" taco place I thought ok I guess I'll suffer through a sub-par taco. The taste blew me away - better than anything I've had in the west (I hope no one I know from there reads this).  If you are anywhere near Times Square, run - do not walk - to Los Tacos!!!

Happy to have this midtown location in addition to the others around the city. If you need a quick bite that will leave you satisfied- this is my pick! Great chips and guac and you can't go wrong with the pork quesadilla.

Always good been here so many times different hours ,days of the week always good !! I can't say i really had a bad experience if you call waiting in a line a bad experience lmao!! Quesadillas are so f-ing good!!!! Nopales are delicious !! Salsas are always terrific !!!
Easily the BEST tacos I've ever had! Not badly priced and packed with flavor, a bit spicy but that's just how I love them.
The pork taco is amazing. Chicken is totally fine, but next time I'll have to do two pork.

BEST TACOS EVER IN NYC! Definitely give this place a try. The service is quick and the people are very nice to you. The tacos are 3.50+ depending on what you get. When I went I ordered a queso taco (part of the secret menu) basically it's a shell made out of cheese. And I also ordered a regular carne asada taco. Both were amazing. I definitely will come back when I come visit New York again
I stumbled in on a walk, the food is outstanding, service is outstanding, the concept is freaking awesome, great cheap place for quick food, ate there twice on vacation.
No comment

The Breakfast burritos are my favorite BUT they just raised the price to $5. Come on!!! They are SOOO tiny and now they cost more than your tacos. If they were bigger like regular breakfast burritos that ok but they aren't, they are SMALL.
Tiny tacos.  You need at least 3 and at $4 a pop that's expensive Mexican food.  No thanks.

Tried this very crowded taco house in NYC.  Mob scene trying to get a taco. They screwed up my order and left an item off. Very uncomfortable seating/standing. Food decent but messy and quite rough on my digestive system. Montezuma's revenge!  Won't be back.
Tacos definitely are legit!!!! But this place is overpriced and a tourist trap........

Tacos were all good they recommend the pork and so do i... i triad all 3 w everything but guac im a picky eater they were all torch ended up buying more of the pork flavor. They are social distancing only allowing a group inside at once to order... line outside and waiting area w make shift standing tables out front. Will come again.

The food is delicious. They season their meat very well. However it's just a place to grab a quick bite to eat since there's no where to sit down, only to stand. My only complaint is their quesadilla isn't your regular quesadilla with two tortillas. It's one flat tortilla with cheese slightly melted on it. I didn't really like it but i had a tostada and that was great.
I got the chicken and pork tacos and they were amazing.  By far the best tacos I've had.

As someone who isn't a big fan of Mexican food, I really loved these tacos. I got the corn tortilla and I like how they let you customize the toppings. The Adobada was supper delicious and I loved that you can taste that char in every bite. Prices were reasonable and having the Mexican Coke is definitely a plus. Not being a cilantro fan I liked how the salsa wasn't covered with it.

I never liked taco but!! this is real diff! my bf brought me here and im like whats with this long line? just taco, no?  but man.....srsly very good! esp the meat is very tasty and not hard or like gum like texture. I am very picky with texture and they did a great job! The chicken and pork is my fav!

Never a miss when you stop in. Just make sure you have a few extra minutes because the line can get a little long. The breakfast burritos are also a really great treat. Adobado alllll day! Staff is super helpful and patient even with all the chaos surrounding them.
Best tacos I've ever had. The place is small and crowded. We had to wait in line outside for 10 mins but the food was totally worth.

My friends and I came across this restaurant walking down 43rd street and we are so glad we payed a visit because the food was amazing! We are from Los Angeles, home to many great taco establishments. I must say these tacos are just as good or even better than LA! My favorite order was the Adobada (marinated pork) Quesadilla with flour tortilla of course and "con todo" (onion, guac, & salsa). We paid a visit here FOUR time while in Mew York for a week. The staff is nice and friendly and they get your order ready fast which is a plus!
Very good tacos... from a mexican, they amazed me.... ................................... recommended

Yelp reviews came through pointing to this little gem. Trying to keep good costs down while on vacation?  This is the place. Great tacos. Carne Saadi was my favorite. Suggestion by worker was pork taco but that one was not my favorite. Still good though quality food at very reasonable price.
Not much I can say about this place other than... freaking perfect tacos every time. Adobada tacos with extra pineapple and agua de jamaica or tamarind... nothing beats that!

This is easily my most favorite taco place in all of Manhattan. I live closer to this location than the one in Chelsea so me and my husband were very excited by this option! We have gone now three times and I've even taken a visiting friend! We love the quesadillas because the extra toasted cheese just gives it a good kick! The best part about it it has unlimited sauces on the side that are so authentic including the sun dried chili peppers soaked in oil.
Definitely my favourite taco place in the country, not just the city. Affordable and delicious !  The chicken tacos and quesadillas are an absolute must have

This place is 5 stars all the way!! We went for the first time today. My wife had a quesadilla and I had a steak taco and a pork taco; we shared chips and guacamole. Everything was fantastic!! This is an absolute must visit place, and its cheap and super fast! Do not miss out!!!
Really cute and fast food place. Tacos were quick and very tasty. Love the sides bar with the salsa and limes.

The best tacos I've ever had period. They don't have the American hard shell but what they do have is perfect. You can get a regular corn tortilla or a special cheese tortilla that's out of this world. Hands down the #1 taco joint in my book.

DELICIOUS !! Highly recommend!! Tortillas are made fresh and the meat has a lot of flavor. The spicy salsa is great not too spicy but just right. I ordered the Carne Asada and Adobada tacos and both were delicious. I am definitely going back before I leave vacation and going to try the chicken tacos. A must place to eat if in NYC!!
O M G ... these are the best tacos I have ever had... I have had tacos different parts of the US... the meat was so tender... very flavorful... I will miss these when I go back to my hometown...

Honestly some of the best tacos I will ever have and at such an affordable price. The adobado is amazing and I would also suggest the carne asada and chicken. Tried the cactus one and it's interesting...haven't had anything other than tacos there but excited to try all the rest!

One of if not the best taco spot in the city. Lots of options to choose from with freshly made flour or corn tacos. I always get 1 chicken and 1 steak taco. Absolutely delicious. Warning though, their salsa is a little spicy and was for me. I can't really handle spice well so for someone who can, the salsa may just be perfect level of spiciness. They also have something called an especial which is a chicken quesadilla that's fried. Very good and underrated menu item

Best tacos we've had in NY so far. Get the adobado! Tip: They don't sell alcohol. If you want beer with your tacos go to Los Mariscos. You can bring in food from Los Tacos and they have seating. Just make sure you order something from them. They have fish, shrimp tacos and ceviches.
No comment

A must when you are in the area. Fast and well priced, and fresh. We loved it, it was a family friendly environment. It's a standing establishment. The aguas frescas authentic and refreshing. I especially enjoyed watching the magic at the kitchen. The staff is like clock work, and keep the counters cleaned and ready. Fresh salsa and guacamole. Yum yum
No comment
No comment

This tacos are one of the best tacos I have ever had while visiting NYC! All the ingredients are fresh and service is quick! It is a little pricey BUT worth it. I ve also tried there location in Chelsea Market and it taste the same!! This IS A MUST if your in NYC!
Food tastes good. There's no easy way to eat the tacos so my hands are always left greasy.

Best tacos I've ever had. The pork taco made me cry. I had a brief relationship with these tacos but it was a special and romantic experience. I now need these tacos in my life and could never move anywhere that these tacos were somehow unattainable. See you tonight in my dreams sweet tacos!!
Incredible - just delicious. Standing only, but it doesn't matter. Carne Asada and Adoba Pork "con todo" (minus guac)... I am going back. So good.

This is one of the best places to get tacos in the city for an AMAZINGLY AFFORDABLE price!!! This location is perfectly placed near Times Square, making it one of the best places to go in the area period both for tourists and locals who work near the area. That being said, there is almost always a line out the door. However, don't let that deter you, the line goes relatively fast and the food is very worth it. Once you pay for the food, you give your ticket to the chefs and they prepare the food for you. The place itself has a "to-go" or quick bite vibe. There are no seats, just standing tables (a really important flag for anyone with mobility issues). The restaurant has limited seating but I've always managed to find a spot after waiting a few minutes. As for the food, the quality of the meats here is really superb. I love tacos and have tried them all! My favorites are the steak and chicken - they are mouthwatering. I have friends who really loved the cactus taco. It was interesting and a good try, but personally I think the steak or chicken are better. That being said, you should definitely give it a try!
No comment
Great environment and refreshing drinks! Love this place!

Walked by this morning and noticed a guy standing right outside the opening to the place selling breakfast burritos out of a cart. On the side of the cart it says 8am - 11am but most likely until they run out of food. For $4, you have a choice of Chorizo, Bacon or Steak. Each one comes with a small container of hot sauce. This is the best damn breakfast burrito I've ever had.
Overpriced and inauthentic -- if you're going to price gouge for guac (and pretty much everything else), at least give free chips. This place is about as touristy and money grubbing as it gets.
Best tacos in NYC. The service is great and people there are very nice. You have to go a couple hours they close, cause the Asada would be done.
I love this place. Only problem always a line and no seating. All of the items are amazing... fav taco spot in the city hands down.

Take and go Mexican stop.   May have to wait in line but it is worth it.  If you can find a countertop to stop and eat quickly, great!  Only reason I gave it 4 stars was I wish I could have sat down for 5 minutes to enjoy eating it instead of standing.
taco tuesday!!!! hands down! one of my favorite fastfood! so good so simple and so tasty!!!
Some of the best tacos in nyc. No place to sit but the tacos will be eaten before that matters.

Finding good Mexican food in NYC can be difficult. The tacos at both Los Tacos locations will do the trick. I suggest getting the adobada pork tacos. Also don't mess with the quesadilla, you should get a mula which is bigger and better.

This place has it all for a quick food stop.  Great food, fast service and good music.  There is something mesmerizing about a slowly turning hunk of caramelized pork being shaved.  My favorite taco was the Adobada but the Nopal came in a surprisingly close second.  Never knew how tasty cactus could be!  The guacamole is good as well

On my first trip to NYC, I visited the first location in the Chelsea Market.  I fell in love with Los Tacos No. 1!  When I came back to NYC I knew I wanted to go back!  I stopped by this location and it was good... but not the same!! For some reason, I felt the meat was overly seasoned with salt.  It was super salty!  I was just not as satisfied with the tacos compared to their other location.  (I did go again to the Chelsea Market and I thought it was better.)  I would recommend going to their other location.  I do appreciate the freshly made tortillas and salsa though!
No need for a long review, here. One word pretty much sums everything up: AWSOME!!!
SOOOOO GOOD!!!!!! Service is beyond amazing and tacos are A M A Z I N G !!!!!! Can't wait to go back!

What's not to like about this place aside from the $6 bottle of soda? The music is loud, the cashiers/cooks are efficient, and there's only 4 types of tacos so you don't have to stand there for 20 mins paralyzed by the choices. (FYI THEY'RE ALL GOOD.) There's no seating but there are rows of tables for you to stand and eat at. Despite the hundreds of people that seem to be in the shop I've somehow always found a spot to stand and scarf down all 4 tacos I got. I've also never had to wait more than 5 mins to order and get my tacos. Brought my friend from Cali here once and he said the tacos were good and comparable to the ones in Cali.

Been hearing about this place from my aunt who lived in New York. She is absolutely obsessed with this place, furthermore, another friend of mine from Dallas had visited Manhattan and had raved about this place being the best food she had all week. So, in spite of my reluctance (as we get good tacos here in Texas) I tried it. OMG, I was blown away, corn tortillas and all ingredients were so very fresh...I bought tacos to go and even though I was leaving the next evening, I made my way back to get more! Forget falafel, ny pizza, bagels and lox...GIVE ME LOS TACOS every meal!!!

This location that we went to was conveniently located right across the Lyric Theatre! If you want an easy, cheap, and worth it bites, this is the place to go!! I am weirdly not a fan of all tacos, but this place is really good! The staff are efficient and accommodating. This is a standing place but you don't really stay here long if you're just there for lunch or a quick hangout. The flow of the line is also efficient.

I found this place on Yelp! This is my go to place in the City! I brought my mom and boyfriend here to try and they absolutely love it! My favorite is the adobada on corn tortilla! Omg SO SO GOOD! This place is so popular! The line is always out the door. They have great prices for food in the city. I'm always going to come back here!

The tocos here is really delicious. There sometimes a long line but it moves semi quick as the tocos can be finished a a couple of bites. I ordered 2 and that would count as a light lunch for me but for some it would be like a snack. If your hungry order more than 2.
Finally great tacos! Used to live out west and you get spoiled. And you had to really find legitimate places out in the boroughs. But, real tacos can be had in Manhattan.
No comment
No comment

This place is absolutely delicious! From the aguas frescas to the salsas. The tacos are great. It's nice to see good, authentic Mexican food in NYC. We dined here 3 times during our 4 day stay. So good!!!

Needless to say we ate there twice during our trip in NYC. I had found this spot from a New York travel guide YouTube called Sarah funky and I even thanked her on her IG. These tacos tasted just like my native towns of Tijuana's amazingly delicious! Keep in mind there's always a line but the wait is worth it!
No comment

Worst experience ever! Do not go to this location. If you're gonna get tacos from this chain go to the one in Chelsea. When we visited this place it was gross, dirty, huge line, and the people working were soooooo disrespectful. I'm talking the rudest people you've ever met. We were shocked by how rudely we were treated. Total disrespect of the clients. Worst place. Do not go here!

Recommend the adobada tacos (just meat) then go add mild green sauce and mild tomatoes and onion mix the have there, and squeeze lime on the tacos. Ugh. My mouth is watering now. I will go back again soon.
Very good taco experience. Service was fast and clean facility. Nothing poor to say about this visit.
No comment

Fresh tacos made with simple ingredients was amazed with how simple the menu was as well . I ordered the chicken , pork and beef with corn & flour tortillas all which were delicious and filling, u probably can do about 3 tacos 4 would be overdoing but to each his own . Contrary to many reviews here there was actually no line when I visited Will definitely be back again .
This place has tacos that you would die far the line is always pretty long but it moves quick and the food is filling
Great food! Came back twice on our 5 day trip! Better tacos than some places in LA! It's the real deal. Has the vibe of tacos el gordo in Vegas.
The best tacos around and their taco de chicharrón de queso is so good and keto friendly! Love me some los tacos.
Best tacos in nyc. Cali style. Get the quesadilla which is basically tacos with cheese. Fav al pastor and carne asada.
I have been coming since they opened. The tacos are good, the service is mediocre. Recently the prices went up and the amount of meat went way down. $4 for half a scoop of chicken...no thanks!

Ehh didn't buy into all the hype. I'm from SoCal so this definitely didn't compare to what I'm used to, and definitely nothing compared to the tacos from Tijuana or Sonora. With that being said here's why 2/5 stars. So when you walk in you order at the register and then once they give you a ticket with your order you go to the taco maker and he will prepare your taco. So my wife asked for a quesadilla with only cilantro. Well this guy still adds salsa, onions, and guacamole. And we told him that's not what we asked for. And he has the nerve to say "well it's already made there's nothing I can do about it" I'm paying over 3.75 for a damn quesadilla and he can't accommodate on his mess up! That was bs number one. So now my order was 4 tacos with everything. And just because we wanted the quesadilla with only cilantro he made my tacos with just cilantro even after I told him "con todo"! So I tell him again and this time he does it with shitty attitude for no reason. But I guess with not many taco places in NYC some people settle for this. But if I'm ever back in town definitely will take my money somewhere else.

Stopped by for quick lunch before the show.  Everything was excellent except for the music which was bit too loud. Clean atmosphere and I really liked their simple menu. Had 2 beef tacos and had to order one more because it was so good. Their beef was not ground beef but real slices of beef strip chunks. Fresh salsa was excellent also. Friendly staffs and cooks. 5 star.

On our recent trip to NYC, these tacos were hands down the best I've ever had!  Location was close to Times Square.  Busy and crowded, standing room only but they got it down!  Line went by quickly.. Their motto... no ticket, no taco!  First you order, a ticket is given, then you need to hand the ticket to the cooks behind the counter, and they'll cook your order in front of you.  Their menu is simple but includes the main items- tacos, quesadillas and nopal (not sure what that is.. grilled cactus?).  We had the chicken and steak tacos in corn tortillas.  Ordered two tacos each but wow... chicken and steak was cooked to perfection, topped with cilantro,  guacamole and onion.. salsa was spicy so I didn't ask for it in mine.. My son said it was the best taco he's ever had.  They even had drinks, in retro style bottles, in a cooler..  Prices were reasonable.  We would definitely come here again on our next visit to NYC...
First time here tacos were good. Nice portion and wish I could of ordered the flour tortillas which are all homemade. Salsas are also really good and up for grabs as much as you want.

Some of the best tacos I've ever had the pleasure of eating. This location is in Times Square, so it's crowded. I tried the pork and steak tacos and favored the pork. Standing room only when eating and $5 min on cards. If you want tacos and are in the city, go here!

I'll keep this review short and sweet. I run a Mexican restaurant in central California that serves authentic food. I have eaten Mexican food all my life everywhere up and down the West Coast. when it comes to Adobada, I have eaten it by the border in Southern California all the way up to Northern California and believe me when I say outside of Mexico, the best place to get those tacos is los tacos no. 1 in New York City. Walking into this place it is kind of small and hustle bustle. The atmosphere is simple; counters to stand and eat at are scattered around or if you want to imagine that you are in a small dive in Mexico, that'll do. Spanish music playing through the speakers and workers shout orders to each other behind the counter. You walk up to a register and place your order and pay. Your food comes out the other side and prepare to be happy. People are friendly but the food is the star here. Carne asada tacos are mouthwatering, perfectly seasoned and authentic and the adobada as stated before is spectacular.  Truth be told that's all we ate, l wont be telling you just how MANY tacos we ordered though because I might embarrass myself. The offer nopales as well but we didn't have room in our stomach for anything else. If you love Mexican food and are in the New York area you must stop at los tacos number one in Times Square.  you will not be disappointed
No comment
The best tacos ever!!! The fried quesadilla is even better. The steak is so juicy and tender, chicken is juicy and seasoned perfectly. The service is fast
No comment

I went out one night searching for this place & it was worth the hunt. By far the best tacos this Alabama boy has eaten. Worth the crowded wait. A tip for Allison read the posted signs. That keeps you moving. Great place to eat. Find it!
A little pricey, around 3 dollars a taco. Overall, the were really good. It was like I was home away from home. :)
This place is next level. We ate there right before going to Harry Potter. The salsa is a little hot for those who don't like spicy things. The tortillas are out of this world.
Quick service, good quality tasty tacos...i tried all 3 - chicken, steak and pork...loved the steak most...salsa's on the side are very good too...reasonably priced for NYC!

There was a line out the door but I don't mind waiting 30 minutes for very authentic street tacos in NYC when I'm missing home (San Diego). I ordered one carne asada and one adobada "con todos". They have corn or flour tortilla options... corn or bust! Got a side of chips & guac as well. The salsa bar was on point. The tacos were really remarkable and the guacamole was just the way I like it! I will return on my next visit to NYC!
The food was wonderful And the atmosphere was perfect. It's busy, but the line moved super quick, so don't let that deter you. 10/10 would recommend.
Best tacos in the city. Enough said! During the pandemic there pop up window is organized and well executed.

The best tacos is NYC. Hands down...! I grew up in SoCal and these tacos taste just like (or maybe even better) delicious tacos from Tijuana!!! I looked up the company and I guess this is what they are going for - mission accomplished!!!! The first time I ate here it brought back so many childhood summer memories spent in Tijuana and Rosarito  My fave is the carne asada, omg the meat is always perfectly seasoned and juicy lol  all the salsas are perfect! also the Mariscos spot at Chelsea market is LIT and they have micheladas and Palomas  THANK YOU TACOS #1!!!! You make me feel at home in this crazy city!
Went here for dinner on a Bus Trip. AMAZING! The tacos were delicious (a little spicy) but worth the kick! Definitely check this place out if you are in the area!
These tacos are definitely delicious. In my top 5, maybe even in my top 3 taco spots. I like it a lot because anything you order on the menu is going to be really good.
No comment

This place has some of the most delicious tacos I've ever had! As someone from Texas, home of some pretty authentic Tex-Mex, my bar for good tacos is pretty high. But, this place hit it out of the park! Even better, the service is incredibly quick and the entire process is very efficient. Will definitely be coming back here for all of my taco needs.
Very delicious price is ok too.  Love this place  will go more ofter  since its near my workplace
No comment
Mexican approved Tacos!!! Great place and even great when ordering for delivery. Definitely my favorite taco place in new york

My favorite tacos spot in Time Square!! The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Very clean service and friendly staff. Chicken tacos on corn tortilla with everything is my favorite order. I love the dried chili and lime it gives just the right amount of kick and flavor. Every bite is perfection so glad found out about this spot. See you soon Los Tacos No.1

Food was amazing. Seriously delicious. BUT really small portions. With the delivery charges, we spent $70 on the tacos for two deal and were both still hungry afterwards. Like the bag of delicious homemade tortilla chips was like the size of a kids' snack, about 8 chips. That's how everything was. Incredibly delicious and about half as much as you'd want for an actual meal. We are skinny people, it doesn't take that much to fill us up. Oh well. It was an amazing and very expensive snack anyway.
Excellent tacos right at Times Square, awesome flavor and tortillas like in my abuelita's house...just perfect

This taco place is worth the hype. Each taco is roughly 3-5$, depending on what you get. I got my order to go, and ate it after lugging it back from 43rd St to UES, and was still tasty despite that the tacos were no longer hot and a little soggy. Now, these were pretty tasty, so imagine how good they would taste if I had them fresh. I ordered a chicken, steak and pork taco, and then a chicken and pork quesadilla. Now, the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that I really couldn't tell too much difference between the quesadilla and the taco in terms of the presentation. They tasted different, but the quesadilla wasn't the typical folded in half and with cheese. Maybe I just don't know what a real quesadilla is? Who knows. I also don't know if I actually got the right type of shells for the tacos. I think there was a choice between two shells, and while I chose the corn taco shells, they didn't taste like corn? But either way, the fillings were really tasty and fresh. I love that they give you a little guac inside each taco. So much veggies that there was no need for any additional salsa that they have on the sides for adding yourself. After I ate Los Tacos and then the next day had some tacos from a nearby UES place, I can definitely see why people like Los Tacos so much.
Run don't walk! The tacos are amazing. Food comes out quick and it's tasty every time. I only wish they had chairs or stools, so I could better savor each bite. Yum! Yum! Delish!

Pretty simple taco place. You walk in order your taco, give the receipt to the worker in the kitchen and tell them what toppings you want on it (I just said everything). There aren't chairs just tall tables for standing. The tacos are pretty good for the price.
No comment
No comment
Great Tacos to grab on the go. Good prices, great food, no surprises it's such a popular spot. A lot of people there, but the wait was way shorter than I expected.
Music top loud to place the order. This is a taco stand. No margarita. The aps wants more verbage but there is nothing more to say.
THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE WAIT IF THERES A LINE!! Soooo good!! If you're vegan or vegetarian you cannot have the flour tortillas or beans but the corn tortillas are DELICIOUS anyways!

I went there today for lunch and i was given the wrong order. Even after the person behind the counter READ the order back to me and to the person working the grill. I ordered the cactus tacos because i am a vegetarian but i was given meat. It was a waste of $11.45 and i had to go lunch-less because i walked there on my lunch break from 50th and 6th avenue. By the time i got back to work i didn't have time to walk all the way back to have them correct my order. It's one thing to make a mistake but to READ the order out loud, not only to me but to the person on the grill and STILL give me the wrong order is absurd. I would request a refund but i paid cash and the only receipt i was given had to be handed to the staff behind the grill.

Yes! Which is what I say when I find a real taco.  I crave handmade tortillas. Handmade tortilla shells at a taco joint is a rare treat and makes all the difference.  At least in DC there are a small number of places that put in the effort. These were excellent.  I had the pork and beef.  The meat was very generous, should be for the cost of one taco. The line moved pretty quickly, the only negative is they don't take amex.  Must try for taco lovers
This is ALWAYS my first stop in town whenever I come to NYC. It's sooooo good that despite being a slow eater typically, I always finish my plate within a minute when I come here. Amazing

I managed to get my food quickly even though the line outside was rather intimidating. Service and food was great; I personally would recommend the pork over the chicken. The pork taco had more textures going on and tasted more flavourful.
No comment
Best Tacos ever. Period. Worth every penny! The flour tortillas and adobada meat was an unforgettable combination
Just like back home in CA. Highly recommend. Hard to choose which taco is best. Perfectly cooked meats, fresh tortillas, what could be better.

Coming from San Diego, I haven't seen anything that comes close when it comes to tacos. Well This place surely does a helluva rendition! I tried every taco they had. Adobado is surely my favorite! I love the quick and efficient service and pricing wasn't outrageous. My only wish is that they had tables to sit, instead of us standing, but it's not a game changer, saves me time from standing back up to order more tacos.
AMAZING! Great fast casual spot. Tacos were sooo yummy and the atmosphere was really fun... I'll definitely be back.

I absolutely love this spot. Quick as lightning, the price is super right, and the freshness and flavor of the food is on point. Always squeeze that lime on your taco of choice. I have had almost every taco save the cactus one. But it looks amazing! Great spot when you are checking out the NYC library and need a quick but filling snack!
Long line that moves fast and SO worth the wait.  Loved the nopal, the pollo asado, and the adobaba.  Great meal, friendly service, AWESOME price.  Would love to come back!
Yummy reminded me of home in San Diego authentic Mexican food. I would definitely go back. They're reasonably priced
Fantastic!! This place is a must when going to New York!! If you see a line.. trust me it's worth the wait!!
No comment

If you have healthcare provided by your employer, you may be familiar with the term "Qualifying Life Event" (QLE). The same could be said about my experience at this establishment. In a word - transformative. In more than one word - life changing. In a sentence - The carne asada taco at Los Tacos No. 1 will qualify as a life event in case you need to contact your healthcare provider to make changes to your benefit elections. Not true, but they are that good - maybe even the best north of the border.

The best tacos in town!! I had the pollo asado, chips y salsa and horchata. All of them were delicious! It is extremely fresh and the flavors come through in every bite. I would eat here everyday if possible!!

Had to grab a quick bite before a play. Saw the good reviews here and decided to try it. I was very happy with my decision.  Very fresh, large portions and very reasonably priced. I highly recomend this place
These tacos are so good. Reminds me a lot of Tacos El Gordo from Tijuana. By far best here in NY
Based on one Al Pastor taco, I do not think this could compare to decent spots in California. Lacking any burst of flavor and a bit expensive.

I was heading back to my hotel when I stumbled across this gem.  I tried the steak chicken, and pork tacos "con tado", along with the Especial with chicken. Everything was delicious and at a great price point.  Highly recommended!!!

Tbh I actually scoffed a little at the fact that a taco joint in the middle of Times Square would have such raving reviews but now I know why... because their tacos really are #1! Get the adobado (al pastor) taco on a corn tortilla with everything in it! It can't get any better than that. The meat is packed with so much flavor, the salsa has just the right amount of kick, and the sweetness from the pineapple brings it all together. The steak taco is also pretty good but I'd pass on their horchata, which is not what I'm used to, at all... It is super watery and pretty much just cinnamon in milk water. But because their tacos are so good, I'm willing to overlook the disappointing horchata lol

Very authentic Mexican tacos. Ingredients are nice and fresh.  They also have natural juices like Tamarind, which I love, but find it a little on the expensive side.   Overall-will come here again for lunch when in the mood for Mexican tacos.

Fresh and delicious! I grab a couple of tacos here any time I'm in the neighborhood. I recommend the steak and pork on corn tortillas! The only downside is it's standing room only and it's hard to get a counter space when it's crowded. Otherwise awesome!
overpriced for the smallest portions that are served at room temperature. got my order wrong and it was a very sad excuse for a meal, especially around time square.

If you are looking to get an authentic mexican taco flavor and a bang for your buck this is the spot! Los tacos no.1 has amazing flavors and fast service. When you visit this gem in the middle ofnthe Chelsea Market, you may be intimidated by the long line. But fear not, they are so quocm that the line will vanish in 5 minutes! I will certainly be back for more Carne Asada Tacos

I saw a line out the door while heading somewhere else for lunch so I decided to change course. Worth it. This place is legit. Delicious. If you stop by in the morning you can also get breakfast burritos (cash only). I stop by any time I possibly can.

This place does not disappoint. Great price, quick serving time, delicious food - what more can you ask? It's around $3-3.5 a taco, I normally have 2-3 tacos every time. The cactus is very interesting - I normally like to have meat in my meals but the cactus has nice texture and interesting cirtrusy flavor. The steak is also consistently good. A bit of a wait, but once you order, it is relatively quick to get your food. Try their aqua fresca - my favorite is the tamarind one.
This is my favorite tacos in NY. They work so hard and fast. When I went there, people lined outside but just 5min waiting. Food is fresh and meats are juicy!!

The store was bustling with customers and had people waiting outside. Despite that, the time it took to get in and out was quick. Less than 20 minutes. The tacos were pretty tasty. I particularly enjoyed the marinated pork more and loved how flavorful and spicy it was but I wish there was more pineapple on it. The steak was just as flavorful and better than many steak tacos as I've had in other establishments. The prices are on the higher side compared to what other places are charging in the area. Overall it's got solid tasty food!
Best tacos I've had in NYC. Long lines are worth the wait! Prices are very affordable. Personal fave is the pork. Super delicious!
Best tacos in town, hands down  if you like spicy choose 'con todo', if not hold the salsa!

Tacos and quesadillas were delicious.  The corn tortillas are hand made in house.  Love the condiment bar they had set up.  There wasn't any seating here so you'll have to stand but honestly, I didn't need a seat bc I just inhaled my food and we were out the door.

I was at that place with my friend at the beginning of January. She never try Mexican food before. I decided to surprise her with tacos and quesadilla. When I got my order the quesadilla was look like a taco. I talked to manager what's that? He replayed its quesadilla I can find cheese under taco. Hahaha. Now I'm back to Los Angeles and I want to add photo of real quesadilla below. Now everyone can compare Los Tacos No. 1 quesadilla and real Mexican quesadilla.

Some of the best street tacos I've ever had!! I have never tried cactus and it was almost citrusy (maybe it was marinated in lime?) and good. The horchata was on point. Service was quick despite the long lines. To top it off they had Mexican squirt. It can't get much better than that.
The tacos are just ok. The flavor is a little subpar compared to traditional tacos and the service is slow and rude.

Had a great experience eating here with my wife. Staff was super helpful and not rude. Food was incredible and simple. Ordered Carne Asada and Chicken Tacos along with chips and salsa. The salsa is so, so good!!!! Cool at first from being refrigerated and the kick of the Habanero peppers gives you a punch and heats your mouth making you want more of the salsa to cool your mouth, it's strange to read you will understand when you eat it. Great Place, Great Atmosphere, Great Food!!!!
Im not a taco person. But they make great tacos. Very tasty... I will come here to eat tacos at some point...for example, when the time is a little tight before a broadway show.
This place is sooooo good!  Authentic. They serve a good amount. A mula is like a taco/quesadilla or a gordita ... good serving.
No comment

I loved the grilled cactus options they had here. It was busy but everyone was very efficient. The tacos were very tasty with just the right amount of toppings. It's super convenient and affordable as well!
Best hole in the wall street tacos. Don't mind the line, it goes really fast. After you order you have to give your ticket to the kitchen guys, don't back up and wait or you'll be waiting.

Tacos were amazing.  Cool unsuspecting place.  The Carne Asada tacos were to die for.  The salsas very good and had some kick.  Not much room to eat but who cares when the food is that good and fresh!

Great Food at reasonable price and worth the wait!  Line was completely out the door but it didn't take long for us to order and get our food. Everything we tried we loved.  Had all three tacos with meat - pork, steak, and chicken. Orders a side of chips and guac.  There are a couple of locations and this one was in time square area and energy music and atmosphere was lively.  Would definitely go back.
Fresh, authentic, and they have horchata.... so clean and organized. Mmmm will be back'
No comment
Excellent tacos.  Simple street food done right and quick in the heart of Manhattan. Nothing fancy, but delicious food.

I didn't have high expectations for this place, as for the price range, but it did surprise me. They did taco right, with fresh ingredients and lots of meat. They also provided different spicy sauces and pickles for free. Mut come back agin.

Was hesitant to get excited about tacos in Times Square. Taco trucks and small shops in Houston set the bar high. Los Tacos tasted just like home! They were so incredible that we got back in line for a few more after we finished round one. Absolutely incredible!!!

This is a great spot super close to Times Square and all the action, but not overcrowded by tourists. (And this is the second location-- the original is in Chelsea Market) We went on a Friday night and it was crowded, but we didn't have to wait to order. After you order they make your meal right in front of you, which is nice because you can customize (corn or flour tortillas, no onions, etc) as necessary! Another plus is the staff is super friendly and welcoming. And the food is delicious and tastes authentic. I ordered 2 chicken tacos on corn tortillas, and they were so good! And the guacamole and chips were yummy as well! To me the prices are comparable to other taco spots and for the quality of food you get, the prices seem fair. Enjoy!!
No comment
No comment
Obsessed! I've risked parking tickets a dozen times since I discovered their midtown location... best tacos after Bodedga Miami

I have tried many tacos, Los Tacos No. 1 tacos are definitely some of the best and in my top 5 when looking at authenticity of flavors. The tacos are fresh, flavorful, delicious, wonderful, magical, all of the above! The open concept of the establishment is great, people who are dining can see their food being made just feet away. It is absolutely an authentic place. However, I think they are a bit pricey! While I know they are in the city, I definitely think I can find tacos that are equally as flavorful at better prices. 4 people, each with 3 tacos and some aguas frescas is already $45 not including the NY tax. I live in NJ and have found tacos that are equally as yummy for $1.00-$2.00. I would definitely come back, but will keep their prices in mind.

I probably eat here two to three times a week. Sometimes I'll drive from Long Island with my friends just to get tacos! AMAZING! I love love love this place! Everyone that I show this spot to instantly become obsessed. Chips and guacamole are great! My favorite is the chicken corn quesadilla, so good!

If i could click a 6th star i would. Amazing. I ordered 4 of the Adobada, (marinated pork) taco's and i cannot remember having taco's any better. The pork was carved off of a scrolling scewer and cooked to perfection. The sauce was a little hotter than i expected but again just right. Squeezed a little lime on them and wow. I had to take a breath between taco's because i was inhailing them. Price was reasonable, the place was clean and the people were friendly. I will return for sure on my next trip to NY. Bravo.

Walking in here made me excited because I don't indulge on authentic Mexican food often. It's a stand-up restaurant that was busy when we got there. Looking on the menu made me nervous though because I didn't see many vegetarian options. The nopal (grilled cactus) looked interesting, but I passed on it. I settled for a quesadilla. Thankfully, the cashier asked me if I was vegetarian because turns out the flour tortillas contain pork. I got a corn tortilla quesadilla with salsa, guacamole and onion. My whole meal was around $10 for a soda and a quesadilla. Expensive - but worth it! The salsa had a bit of a kick to it - and the whole meal was overall tasty. Even the glass bottle soda tasted good. I almost went for a traditional Mexican soda, but I passed on it. Really good restaurant!
No comment
Best autentic tacos we ever had. I highly recommended the asada and pollo... the salsas are above and beyond.
Incredible tacos! Fantastic find for a quick, casual and inexpensive meal in NYC. Their location in Chelsea Market is my favorite.

Yummm this place is legit. I am from California so you can trust me when I say that. I had the steak and the pork tacos on the corn tortillas and man the meat was so flavorful and juicy. Price is not too high either

Honestly I don't understand why this place is rated as good value. Don't get me wrong... the food here is all high quality. However whenever you pay $4 for a taco that you can finish in three bites leaves you with something to be desired. The quesadilla is one dollar more but the only difference is that it is a taco with cheese. Overall we ended up spending over $20 for two three bite tacos, hibiscus water, and chips and guac. Not the best value.
No comment
They were so freaky fast, and the tacos were the best I have had. Even better than Nina's taco truck! I would definitely come here again!!
My mom and I came here on our trip to new york. It was delicious and fast and the service was super friendly. We both agree that it was the best taco we've ever had and we will definitely come again.
No comment

Can I give this place 10 stars? Because this place was so freakin good I had to come back twice on my trip like back to back days lol. And that is unusual for me. This place is so good efff all the pizzas this is hands down so good. You have fresh tacos constantly being made. Order the fried quesadilla with everything and the asada taco one corn and one flower to try everything! Everything is so fresh and fast and the food is perfectly hot! Temperature and spice wise. No photo because I wasn't gonna waist time with a photo it was so good! Order a horchata too!
No comment
Wow. Amazing simple traditional tacos. 2 will absolutely fill a guy up. Loved the chicken and steak, Will be back!

Wow was I blown away at the quality of these tacos! I have never ever had better tacos. I have been to Texas Arizona and most of Mexico and today I ate the best tacos of my life! (Sorry mom xoxoxo) the carne asada was the best. Tacos al pastor would be the best if not for the asada!  Did I say how go the carne asada is ? Thank you this place makes it worth the trip to New York City.

Great place to eat, just be careful guys when you do the asada because it taste some kind of dirty smoke or grill it's not been clean properly before placing the meat to grill, other than that everything was good.

We grabbed a couple of breakfast tacos in the morning. And then back for lunch for a couple more tacos. The salsa is fresh and so good. The steak and chicken were smoky and tasty. I only wish you could buy 2 and get a 3rd 1 free. Hats luego.

Great authentic tacos at a very reasonable price. Love this place. Stand in line to order, get your tacos and eat it at a standup table or take elsewhere. Fast friendly service for quality food at a great price. Conveniently located near times Square.

Awesome tacos! I always the the chicken quesadilla "con todo" and I highly recommend it. Ordering can be hard to understand for a first timer, but once you go multiple times, it's hard to stop. Moderately priced, but definitely not the most expensive lunch destination. Highly recommend!

My new favorite tacos spot, but honestly their quesadillas are even better. This is a diamond that's definitely not in any rough whatsoever anymore. Get there early as there is often a line out the door around lunchtime!!
No comment

This place reminds me of Cancun and the atmosphere. The tacos are priced at about 3.75 per taco so my boyfriend and I ordered 3 of the tacos on their menu except their cactus taco (even though I really wanted to try it but was a little skeptical!) there are sauces and pico on the side + lines that you can add based on your preference. There are no seats just standing areas with high tops where you can quickly chow down on your tacos and bounce. Absolutely amazing
Steak tacos were amazing. However, $4 for a taco is pricey. And also my son and I felt gassy snd not too good for a while. Did any body experience this?
Excellent authentic tacos. A game changer for quick cheap eats in the theatre district.
Waited in line for about 10 minutes during lunch hour.  Well worth it.  The order was easy and the tacos were made promptly.  This is the go-to place for my treat.
No comment

I lived in LA for almost 10 years, and hands down, they have the best Mexican food in the states. This place could easily plop right into LA and fit in. That's saying a lot! Delicious, fast service, and cheap. What can't you love about that?
What a flavor! The tacos are delicious and toppings fresh the adobada is one of my favorite foods of all time!!

I heard that these were some of the best tacos around, and I definitely agree. I tried the carne asada taco and adobada quesadilla. The meat was incredibly juicy and flavorful. The rest of the ingredients were high-quality as well. The only downside was how crowded it was, but don't let the long line scare you away! I went there around 6:30 and the line was out the door and wrapped around, but it moved pretty fast and was well worth the wait. At first it was a bit difficult to find a spot to eat at the counters, but the people cleared fairly quickly. Definitely worth a visit fro delicious Mexican food!

Steak tacos were delicious. The regular salsa had a nice is kick too it but not overbearing. Next time I will try a quesadilla, which looked like perfectly fried goodness. Customer service was great at both the register and the line near the cook to retrieve the food.

Best freaking tacos in the city. The line moves really fast (even if it is out the door) and regardless it is worth the wait. This is the place to go for great food. Less great for talking or long meals but DAMN the food

For the price point of this mexican food, it definitely has to be one of my favorites. I got a pork and a chicken taco and they were both delicious. The pork one was a little spicy, so be warned if you don't like that. The prices were pretty reasonable. There were a whole bunch if seasonings and sauces on the side to add to your taco at no extra cost. There are no seats though, so if you're looking for a sit down placed, this is not it. The food was really good though, so if you're looking for fast food that's not generic fast food restaurants, look no further than here!
A bit pricy in my opinion, tacos are about 1-2$$$ in LA. BUT these were amazing, great service, fast, AMAZINGGGGG taste!!! Would def recommend!!!!

OMG these tacos are amazing. The pork tacos are by far the best! This is not a sit down restaurant but well worth standing and eating. The staff is very nice and the food is super quick. Great place to go if you don't have a ton of time. Very quick walk from time square.

LOVE the tacos! This spot always has massive lines like the original location but it moves quick. Tell the counter exactly what you want with your recipe and they'll get it to you quickly. Don't miss out on the free salsas! It's a nice quick date spot.
Easily a 5-Star quick bite. Tacos were NOT pricey for what you get, yum. No complaints food wise, just sloppy self-clean standing tables for the stay-ers, but speedy service for runners/commuting.

Amazing. Worth the price and the steak tacos are so well marinated and the adobada was also amazing. Found this place by accident but what a great accident it was!! Can wait to come back to this jewel in the city!
It's a cute hole in the wall place. Always full. Food is fresh. Staff is nice! And it's very economical!
Best tacos in NYC, period.  It's not a sit-down place, space is pretty tight but lines move quickly.

The steak tacos are the best I have had anywhere!! Too bad we only go to New York once a year!!  Love love love this place.  We normally don't like to eat at the same restaurant twice when going to New York because there are so many to choose from but we just have to!!

The best tacos I've ever had in my life. I used to go to the Chelsea market location a few times a week for my breaks and always get the chicken and steak quesadilla. Just a quick TIP: get the quesadilla instead of the tacos...it's just a larger taco!  They don't skimp on meat and it's served so fresh! Also get the corn tortilla here. I just saw online there's a secret menu item (taco shell made entirely of cheese) and I'm disappointed I haven't discovered this years ago.
Really impressed with these tacos. Coming from Texas, these taste just like the ones in either Austin or Houston. Would recommend. Pricey, but expected considering this is NY.

Overall they have good tacos and fast service. This is not as good as a classic taco truck. For NYC this is pretty good. The steak and chicken meat are good quality. The quesadillas are pretty much tacos but are labeled differently and if you don't like guac then tell them because they automatically add it.
These are the best authentic tacos in town! Just like you'd get down south. Simple & delicious!!

We tried all four types of tacos. Not a huge fan of the cactus one but would order the others again in a heartbeat. We got all of them "con todo," and the toppings made the tacos even more delicious. They all had a little heat but weren't overly spicy. Friendly, quick service, even with a line out the door.
No comment

Amazing. Fast cheap and so tasty. Not much in the way of ambiance, it's all standing room, but it's bustling and the food was excellent. The menu is written on the wall and there are less than 15 different choices but there doesn't have to be cause what they have is great.
Doesn't look like much just passing in. But the food is so good. Standing room only, no seating .
Small street taco style joint. No seats just stand up and go "Mmmmmm!!!"  Best tacos ever!!

Awesome tacos. The homemade tortillas make a big difference. I've had tacos and quesadillas. I would pass on the quesadilla next time and just go with the tacos which I enjoyed much more, just seemed more flavorful. I tried the chicken and the pork and would pass on the pork next time. Chicken just tasted better IMO. Good salsa - help yourself on the side. I'll be back.
They're good, but I've had better. The cheese taco is pretty good though but a bit too greasy.
This place is as good as everyone says. They were very helpful to this first-time visitors. Flavors were marvelous!

Fantastic authentic tacos. Go for corn shells (they are floppy not crispy). Try one of the interesting drinks, I really liked the apple soda. The cooks/cashiers are really busy but are still pleasant and helpful if you need assistance figuring out the system. Standing room only, but well worth it!
The quesadillas are delicious. The market is very busy so it can be hard to find a seating area.
Visiting New York City I did not expect to find Mexican street tacos of good quality and in a clean place. Great "aguas frescas"! Freshly made tortillas! Yum!
You really can't find a better quick delicious taco in nyc like los tacos. They are so tasty and cheap!

This place is amazing. Love the tacos! The fried quesadilla is delicious as well. Personally, I love spicy food so there is no problem for me here BUT I can easily say that it is very spicy regardless. If you can't handle spicy food I'd recommend getting the salsa on the side or just getting no salsa and choose from the salsa bar provided. Definitely take the time to stop here! So ridiculous to me that people go to places they can find anywhere and not actually enjoy the amazing foods here - don't be one of those people!
Authentic tacos!  This place is good!  We had all 4 kinda of tacos, beef, chicken, grilled cactus, and pork.

The best tacos I've had. They are tasty they are worth the wait and the money. The salsas are spicy but really good. Just thinking no about them makes my mouth water. They need to expand to Los Angeles California.
Can't go wrong with Los Tacos. Best taco in NYC. The tortillas are fresh and the meat is seasoned to perfection. The guac they put on the tacos is spicy but delicious. You have to try it.

My fav tacos place in the NYC-NJ area.. really fresh and juicy chicken.. order the grilled chicken tacos with corn flour. Definitely the best i have ever had. Do visit this place if u r in the times sq area.
Hands down the best tacos in NYC, and possibly the best I've had Stateside. I cannot wait to go back!!

My favorite tacos in NYC!  I've eaten here multiple times, when I'm around the meatpacking area, and usually get one steak and one chicken, loaded with guac and salsa.  You order at the cashier and then drop off your ticket to the cooks and get your order within minutes.  There's no place to sit down, so you basically eat standing up.  Watch out for all the slippery taco juices and salsa that drips onto the floor!  If your fatass is still hungry, you can go next door to Los Mariscos and finish your meal with a Fish taco!
The carne asada quesadillas were the best I've ever had. And we scarfed down the delicious Adobada tacos. Best tacos I've had in nyc! The service is super fast too.

Calling all tacos lovers! Good fast service with great food. I ordered a chicken taco with corn tortilla and pork taco. The room is standing room only but it works. The tacos were so well favored and the meat tender and juicy. The corn tortillas did not fall apart too which does happen often with corn tortillas. They know what they are doing here and it will leave your taste buds satisfied.
Awesome place, well worth the wait. Some of the best tacos I've ever had. Highly recommended.
these tacos are so good. the prices are good and the food is amazing. best tacos in ny! definitely worth the hype.

My favorite taco spot in NYC! Went here for dinner with my boyfriend last night and we had a great experience. When we arrived there was a long line but it moved quickly. I ordered 1 chicken and 1 beef taco and agua de jamaica to drink. My boyfriend ordered 2 chicken and 2 beef tacos and horchata to drink. We both loved our food. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about ingredients in their food. Pork tacos have dairy but all others are dairy-free. After you get your food, you can take it to go or stand and eat at one of the tables they have. For people who like/need to sit down, this is not the restaurant for you as there are no chairs. If you are looking for good tacos in the city, this is definitely the place to go!

We found this taco place by accident. What a great find it was!  The food is truly authentic and the tacos are the best we've ever had. I highly recommend. I can't wait to return to NYC because I will for sure be going to Los Tacos No. 1.

Hands down the best tacos I have ever had! So sad that you guys are so far away from me but so glad we came to eat there! Please open some locations in Texas. Tried the carne asada, pollo asado, and adobada tacos in corn tortillas with a tamarindo to drink. Absolutely delicious! Their salsas were on point also. Despite the long line we experienced, service was fast and efficient! There is something about their corn tortilla that just differentiated their tacos from any others I have had. Favorite was definitely the carne asada. Please visit them when you are near one! You will not regret it.

Limited menu but helpful signs warn customers with dietary restrictions (pork in the flour tortillas? Yes!). The space is loud and tight but the tacos are delicious, the staff is friendly, and there is justification for those long lines.
