These tacos were awesome!! No space or seats just stand up and eat could be my only complaint. The tacos are nice size and very flavorful. I had carne asada, pork, and chicken tacos as well as some guac and chips. All of the food was great.

Great tacos. I was staying in the Times Square area while on a business trip from California. I really wanted tacos, real tacos. Not tourist trap tacos. Or high-end take on tacos. Tacos, just tacos. And Los Tacos was exactly what I hoped for. Excellent food at a reasonable cost. I travel to NYC frequently and will definitely head back to Los Tacos, even if I have to travel a bit to get there.

First off the location is fairly convenient for NYC residents as it's close to the central subway stations. I waited in line for about 3-5 minutes, I was greeted by the worker at the door who explained the menu and the specials they had for that day. The lines move fairly fast and before you know it, your paying. You get a ticket which you give to the cooks and they make your plate in front of you almost like a lunch line esque assembly line. The food is great, real authentic tacos and so on. The only drawback is there is no seating and during peak hours it's just as packed as those trains. You have to find a spot to stand. Overall a good place to check out just try to avoid the peak hours.

My favorite place for tacos anywhere in the U.S. The food here doesn't feel greasy and heavy like some Mexican food can. The tacos are light and fresh, and the meat is well seasoned. The toppings and salsa all add great flavor, and the addition of cheese on quesadillas is not overwhelming! It's just right.
No comment

One of the best tacos I've had in the city- I come every time I go to the high line/Chelsea market. It does get messy though so make sure to grab a lot of napkins! Also it's a bit scary ordering/grabbing your food/very hectic/long line so be prepared to maneuver yourself around to grab your taco and put all the extra ingredients on yourself( they're on the counter). Fun vibes, fun food, and delicious!

There was a line outside when I arrived with the family.  However, we got in quickly, it didn't take long to order, and the food arrived shortly thereafter.  I had two steak tacos and one chicken, both on corn tortilla with everything.  All of the tacos tasted great. Just the right amount of spicy and hot.  I'd recommend this place if you're like good tacos.  Also, it wasn't that expensive which was even better.
I had al pastor and cactus tacos. They were good and can be compared to LA street tacos and TJ style tacos. Their prices however, are a bit high but well worth it.
No better taco will ever be created!! No matter what location you go to, make sure to get the carne adobada
Stopped by after finding this place on Yelp, so glad I did. Delicious tacos, homemade tortilla right in front of you, so good! I'll be back for sure.
It's a hidden gem right in Times Square. I took a bite and was immediate surprised by how delicious the meat was. It is a stand up only place but definitely worth it.

Delicious tacos and quick service. They only had chicken left by the time we arrived (half an hour to closing) so it's best to get here earlier if you want to try the different flavours. Will definitely be back for more!!!

The husband and I stopped in here when in NYC last month. We LOVE tacos and have them at least once a week back home in Nashville. We had read reviews prior to our trip and decided to grab some lunch here during our trip. We each had 2 tacos and we got some chips and salsa. It was all pretty basic, but super flavorful and hit the spot! Most of the places we eat at when we visit aren't memorable once we get home, but this is somewhere we'll likely return to on a future trip.

We found this spot randomly while walking to meet out Uber driver one night before heading to dinner, and seeing as how traffic had been horrible, we figured we would need something in our stomach to hold us over until dinner. Los Tacos has been one of the best random finds in NYC! The carne asada was AMAZING! So juicy and tender with great flavor too! I would definitely recommend this to any of my friends visiting, and come back myself if I'm ever back in the big city.

Yummy tacos on the go. I had two chicken tacos. Great addition to the Times Square/Hell's Kitchen options. The price point is reasonable as well, $3.50 per taco (for chicken).  I plan to add the location to my lunch rounds.
Coming from California I did not think that we could ever get good tacos in New York, but boy were we wrong. These tacos are amazing and can't wait till we are back in New York to have these again.
Amazing flavors and melts in your mouth. Even though it was small inside we enjoyed our variety of tacos and moved on. Would go back everyday oI could.

I saw this one on Facebook as a featured video, and it lived up to the hype. I got one of the chicken tacos, one of steak, and one of pork. The pork one was by far my fav, but they were all awesome. The tacos tasted fresh, authentic, and homemade. If I had to think of a complaint, it would be that the place requires everyone to stand to eat, there are no seats. I don't see it as a negative though, it means people will get out quickly and make room for others. This place was worth the long lines. Loved it!
Literally the best tacos I've ever had!! There system gets you in and out in no time. They are also very filling. Try the fried quesadilla #amazing

Coming from Texas I wasn't expecting good  tacos in NYC, especially in Times Square. Color me impressed by this place though, piping the music and the pumping out the delicious Asada, this quenched my Tex/Mex craving. The queso taco is unique and works well with the chicken and lime.
Awesome tacos and soda. Music makes the place seem really warm and joyous.
Went to the one in chelsea market and the al pastor was burnt but the one in time square was cooked perfectly wand was soo good.. guess all about luck here

The taco with cheese shell was amazing! I had it with chicken. I loved the carne asada taco as well. Spicy but good. The quesadilla wasn't what I expected but good. Kind of like a calzone. They cut it open to add meat. I can see why there is a line to get in the place. Wish there were stools to sit but understand with the popularity it would slow the line down. I'll go there next time I'm in NYC.
No comment
Okay nothing else to say but this place is great. I am wiring more because yelp is forcing me to but it's just that simple.

Picked up tacos for lunch and ate in the middle Time Square before heading back to our hotel a couple blocks away. We ordered one of each taco between the two of us; steak, chicken, pork and cactus. I ordered the cactus as an adventurous pick, it was a little slimy (I think that's normal?) but had an interesting flavor. The chicken taco was really good, the pork and steak tacos were insanely good. This is a must repeat if I'm ever back in the area.
Holy shit that was soooooooo good. Steak is my least ordered because the meat at Mexican restaurants is normally crappy but this was the leanest and best ever. Order extra because it's that good. OMG
Best taco in NYC. Plus, you don't have to wait in line like the other chelsea market location. What's not to love? Hopefully the tourists in time sq won't find out about this place any time soon....

WOWZERS. I was blown away with how juicy and delicious these tacos were! There were already a line when I got there and it was easily crowded cause it a small place! However it really lived to the hype. I got two carne asada taco and the pork one and oh boy both of them were BOMB. I wish every bite last longer cause it was absolutely wonderful. Asked for everything on it and oh boy the dash of lime made it even 100% better...damn these tacos were so damn juicy and flavorful. Honestly craving for some more and they will be heavily missed once I leave NYC.

Los Taco No. 1 was an eye opening experience.  I heard about it from a friend who loves street tacos.  Tucked away in the Chelsea Market, you know you've arrived by the long lines. After quickly ordering a few Al-Pastor tacos, the cook customizes your order to your liking after taking your ticket.  A few seconds later...Bamm.. the most delicious street tacos ever.  I was there with a friend from Mexico City (Al-Pastor origins) and he stated they were the real deal.  Literally could have eaten 4 more. No joke, try out Los Tacos for an unbelievable experience and a taste of Old Mexico.
I used to live in Mexico City. These tacos are the truth. If you're in the neighborhood it's a no brainer. Don't be scared of the line, it moves fast.
Best carne asada tacos I've ever had!!!  Service was friendly and quick. Feels like a little bit of Mexico in NYC!
No comment

Best tacos I've ever had, and I've had A LOT of tacos. In fact, probably the best meal we had in NYC, and we tried many different places at many different price points. After trying the Chelsea Market Los Tacos yesterday (and loving it), we decided to check out this location. They were both equally good.

Best tacos I have had in the city!!!!!!! The price is great and the flavors are explosive!!! My personal favorite is the adobada which is basically pork with some julienned pineapple, make sure to get it "con todo" on a corn tortilla.
Very friendly staff at the till and great tacos that tasted amazing. The only reason I gave four stars it be great if the could make a deal the buy a few together as part of a meal deal
Yummy quick and fresh tacos! Very authentic, one of the best I've tried in the city...

As I'm writing this review I wish I could have those tacos again. Fresh, authentic and tasty. Service is fast and efficient. They don't have any seats but I'm not going to remove a star for that. They need to feed a lot of people fast and they need these people to move fast. I had grilled chicken and grilled beef tacos, both were delicious served with salsa and guacamole. Did not have any of their drinks, trying to lower my calorie intake but they looked homemade. I will be back to try other things on the menu.

Today was my first (and definitely not my last) time coming here. The cashiers are very nice, and the line moves quick! I got the Nopal (grilled cactus) taco "con tudo" (with everything) as a midday snack and found it filling and appetizing. I'm ready to come back here sometime this week for another quick and inexpensive bite.
No comment
Amazing! The most delicious steak tacos we have ever had!! Our tastebuds thank you ! :-)

Amazing! Love this place! My husband and I have been twice in the week we have visited NYC! The people working are super nice! The tacos are awesome! Would definitely recommend to anyone coming to NYC!
Great Service and amazing tacos and Margaritas! Plan on coming back soon! Happy Margarita Day!

If you are looking for good, quick, cheap food in the theater district you are in luck - so long as you don't mind standing at a counter to eat(!) - and you like tacos.  This is a simple but very busy Taco shop. The line moves fast so don't let it discourage you. I like the steak tacos.

The best tacos I have had in NYC. I was skeptical because there was so much hype around this place. However, it is the truth! I got the steak tacos and the flavors burst in your mouth. Skip the guac and get an extra taco!

stopped by recently to pick up a quick lunch. the menu is simple and luckily the line was short. i tried the cactus, pork and chicken tacos "con todo" but it included spice. you have to bring your ticket and hand it over to the guys to make otherwise you'd be standing there for a while. the tacos were nice and tasty, a bit messy to eat so if you plan to eat there (standing space only), make sure you go with people you can make a mess with.

Believe the hype - this place is GOOD. It reminds me of In N' Out - menu is simplistic but the food is amazing and fresh, and the workers are really friendly. I live in Boston, but grew up in Southern California, which is home to Mexican food that's just as tasty as Los Taco's. Given that, Boston should take notes from them about what real Mexican food should taste like. I'll be back for more next time I'm in NYC!
Fresh authentic Mexican tacos. This place keeps it simple and excels at great tacos hitting all the right flavor notes.

After reading other reviews, I decided to stop by while in NY. It. Was. SO. Worth. It. I got the adobada taco (pic) with a horchata. Don't be discouraged by long lines--after you pay, everything moves along pretty quickly. It took about 5-6 minutes for our orders to arrive. The only minor problem was that there are no places to sit. There's a limited number of standing tables to eat at but if you're looking for a sit-down place, you'll want to look somewhere else.

I'm from Arizona and I've eaten at hundreds of Mexican places in AZ and CA during my lifetime. Sometimes NYC taco places don't quite stack up. Los Tacos is an exception. Absolutely great tacos. Flavorful meats, fresh salsa, fast service. This place is no-nonsense and I wouldn't have it any other way.

Just had this for the first time for lunch and these where the best tacos ever!!! I had the steak and pork taco. The pork was way better. I can see this place having lines during peak times but the lines are moving. There are no seats but tables for you to stand and eat at. Will definitely be coming back to get more pork tacos and to try other items!
Amazing! Hands down some of the best tacos I've ever had. Carne Asada was seasoned well and flavorful. The corn tortillas weren't oily! Add a squeeze of lime and you're in heaven!

i work right down the block and this place is heaven sent. you know it's a gem when the line is always out the door. I get the grilled cactus tacos & grilled cactus quesadilla. everything is amazing from the actual meal itself to the sauces you put on. service is great, staff is super friendly, and pricing is great. highly recommend to anyone. They need to open a location in Queens and/or Brooklyn!!

Finally some really Mexican food in the heart of NYC. This little place feels like a home away from home. The food is incredibly tasty and delicious. Always always get the ADOBADA anything lol. Try a Mula and ask for their secret Queso Taco. Worth the stop and definitely appreciate the space because the Chelsea Market location is always cracking.
Simple. Fast. Phenomenal. This is easily the best taco joint I have ever eaten. Every time I am in Manhattan for business or otherwise I find a way to make it to Los Tacos.
No comment

Amazing tacos!!!!! Just give them all a try I promise you will be back asking for more. At least we were. The corn tortillas are delicious and perfect. My favorite was the carne asada and adobada. Make sure to get everything on it, the flavor is mouthwatering. Service is quick and tacos come out nice and hot. If you're in town make sure to stop by and give them a try. You won't regret it!

I would be lying if I didn't give this place 5 stars they truly deserve this this is the closest you'll get to real Mexican tacos the meat is well seasoned and the tortillas are corn like legit corn ! I always come here even thou it's far but the taste is worth it ! It's clean and fun to eat here the waters are amazing ! Try the steak tacos ! You won't regret it and the music in this place is really original!

So we went to Los Tacos no. 1 on 9th ave our first night in New York. It was amazing. The next day we decided we'd have to try them again because they were that great. We found this one in a different part of town. Great service. Delicious food.

had some amazing tacos!! the environment is really upbeat and the workers are amazing. 10/10 recommend if you're looking for some good latino food. The chips and tortillas are made fresh and are delicious. there is no place to sit but they have places to stand up and eat, this did not get in the way of a good experience
Honestly the best taco I ever had in my life. I will return with a bigger stomach and bigger wallet

I stopped in and intended to eat two tacos and a horchata, and bring back a quesadilla for my wife. It was so good, i had to pick her up a gyro from a street vendor! Many times street tacos are dry, but not here. The chicken and steak are fresh and juicy. I wanna go back!
Legit tacos. They make the flour tortillas onsite. And the fried quesadilla is where cheesy dreams are made.
No comment

Good day from a Guy who was born on the west coast, spoiled with amazing tacos, moved east and practically gave up on finding comparable tacos. Until I found Los Tacos No.1! Ok, just go and you won't be disappointed. Enjoy!
Best tacos in NYC. If you haven't tried already you have no idea what your missing. Tacos are amazing.

This is my favorite place in New York! Everytime I visit the city I have to come here no matter what! I have introduced everyone I have come with to this place and it does not disappoint. It's a very nice authentic Mexican place. I always order the enspecial which is the fried quesadilla with pork! Everytime I take a bite I can never stop eating
Great service and even better food. Definitely would recommend trying the carne asada quesadilla. Will definitely be coming back to visit when I am in town.
No comment

Definitely try the carne asada (steak) taco!! I prefer flour over corn tortillas but my friends loved the corn one and that seemed like the more popular choice for people. Really can't beat the price and taste here especially for the area! The self serve salsas and toppings were flavorful and I liked choosing how much I wanted of them.

Best tacos in NY I've had so far and I'm from California. So happy they have this location close to my work. It gets pretty crowded but they have a good system going. Just as good as the Chelsea market location as expected. Yeah it's not cheap but you get so much meat so it's worth it.
Awesome hole in the wall! Yummy yummy and reasonable . $7 for a big plate of food. $3.75 for a full taco. Can't complain ! Definitely going back & telling friends .
No comment
A little pricey for only one tortilla per taco. The taste is worth a try but was a little disappointed.

Best tacos I have ever had. Literally everything here is incredible including my favorite the beef tacos from a schwarma-like spit. The only downside to this place like any NYC favorite is the long lines and massive crowds. The line generally moves pretty quickly though and Chelsea market is a delight to visit during non-busy hours.
I stopped in for a quick late lunch and got two steak tacos and one pork taco, all in the flour tortilla. They were awesome.
No comment

Finding delicious authentic Mexican in NYC is rare. We ain't no west coast. Let's be honest, however the tacos here are just like what I remember in Rosarito, Mexico. And it's affordable. Help yourself to delicious fresh Pico de gallo was another plus. Even my picky son liked the food here. He says dad we can go here every time we are in NYC. Yummy

The best tacos!!! Stumbled upon this place on Facebook and was determined to try in our visit. The tocos were amazing best flavor ever. I had there pollo asado, adobado, and nopal tacos and the flavor with the corn tortilla were exquisite and amazing. If you are ever in the city make sure to visit them and try all their tacos.
No comment

Simple and good!, no wait simple and awesome!!  Order 1 of 4 choices at the counter, get your ticket, hand to the guy behind the counter and watch your tacos be made! The corn tortillas as thick and so good. All tacos are $3.50-$4. You can make it a plate with cactus and cheese as an option.
No comment
Very cheap and delicious. Carne asada quesadillas were incredible. Place seemed very authentic

These tacos are Beyond Perfection. Freshly made right infront of you. I tried Grilled chicken corn tortilla tacos & quesadilla Especial which tasted really good. Service is quick and huge line during lunch hours. Highly recommend it. You will enjoy the food !!

Delicious tacos! Filled with meat and plenty of flavor. There was a line out the door but I had tacos in my hand within 15 minutes. I got the chicken and steak tacos "con todo" but without onions. Would definitely recommend two as they are small but at less than $4 per taco, it is a cheap, delicious, and quick meal in Times Square.
Went here with a bunch of my friends....we're all from California (socal & norcal)....and the consensus was its bomb af.
These are the best tacos...the beef is fantastic! Corn or flour, doesn't matter, it's great! I find taco stands wherever I go and these are the best so far! Thank you!

I grew up and and Los Angeles. In the 6 years that I lived in NYC, these are the best tacos I have had. And I have searched! I prefer the carne asada. The tortillas really make the biggest difference--Fresh, soft, had-made corn tortillas. Yes, please! The only thing I don't like is that you have to be pretty scrappy about handing your ticket to the taco makers as there is no distinct line order after you pay. I go here when I feel homesick.
Hands down best taco place in NYC that I've tried so far! You have to try the corn tortilla and the flour tortilla and decide which one you like the best! So so yum!
Lots of meat in the tacos. Pretty delicious, too. Nice grab and go spot in midtown with not much crowding as 43rd is a generally quiet street.
I could eat here again! I've have great tacos in Texas but these guys are pretty close!

ADOBADA. The god of taco meats. Sometimes it is a bit on the saltier side but still delicious overall. They also put quite a lot of spicy sauce by default so beware! I ordered three adobada tacos and it got me sweating by the end. My go to taco place in New York, though it is on the pricier side.
Tacos were Amazing! Must try the cheese shell taco! The tortilla is made of all cheese! It was absolutely perfection!

Great and fun time. Cozy, comfortable, dignified. Thanks to all the staff. Menus discussed in advance. Everything happened as desired, as ordered. All wishes were counted. Everything was very tasty, especially tacos
Amazing tacos! Fast and good service.. the only downside is that there is not enough space for so many people! I loved the tacos de Nopal and de Adobada! Simply Amazing!

Some of the best tacos I've tasted! I got the adobada pork tacos with all the works! I also ordered the chips and guacamole, chip bag was pretty small, however, the guacamole tasted freshly made! The only thing I didn't like was that they had no stools, my girls (5 and 6) couldn't even reach the table top. Other than that it was a great place to get a quick fix of some of the best tacos I've tasted!

Not worth $4, not worth standing in line, it's a $2 mediocre taco that would be $1 in Mexico, lol they even sell the $1 Mexican cokes for $4. This has been my experience with everything in NYC, it pretends to be a foodie haven but it's it, sorry

The reviews don't lie -- these tacos were amazing, fast and so tasty. The corn tortillas were some of the best tortillas I've had outside of Mexico. Very happy I was able to try this spot while in NYC.

Honestly, I had high hopes. I saw the great reviews and I have been to the Chelsea Market location before, so I had an idea that these were going to be great as well. Well, maybe not. Me and my girlfriend each got our usual from the other location, one steak, one pork, and one chicken. Our pork one was definitely on the dry side, the chicken was cold and on the drier side, and the steak was okay, nothing special. To top it off, the guac didn't really have all that much flavor to it and was really only there to counter the heat from the salsa. Maybe it was an off day, but will definitely continue going to.the Chelsea location and stay away from here

Finally!!! The only time I've had better tacos were from street vendors in Mexico City! LTN1 keeps us simple and authentic. Scratch made corn tortillas, the marinated pork is amazing. Accoutrements are simple and bursting with flavor. Been waiting for this place, in a neighborhood accessible to me forever! Well done!
This place was awesome. Food was great. However they did forget a piece of our (very large) order. Given the circumstances and the  tacos I'm still giving 5 stars.
The most delicious tacos I ever had! Tacos are always warm and fresh. Been here almost 50 times and still keep going back for more. Their chips, salsa and guacamole are super yummy too!
Place is the bomb, some of the best tacos I've had! The vibe is great and the tacos are authentic as they can get! I went in there expecting alright food and came out amazed!

This is the place where you can go to before a broadway show - right on 43 St! The beef and pork taco are great! Quesadilla are not like what I tried before, but stuff on top. Very nice service - they let you try while ordering. Fast, tidy and intimate.

Incredibly good tacos, glad they opened a location in a work area. Although expect a looong line at lunch time... which is understandable given the location. But again, definitely worth the wait on a slower work-day
Coming from california and finding an actual authentic Mexican restaurant.... Amazing
Great tacos! Better than King taco in LA and that's a huge statement for me to make. Quick easy and fresh!
No comment
Great food and atmosphere... from Texas where we eat a lot of Mexican food and this is top notch. Fresh hand made corn and flour tortillas
Service was nice and quick.. I love their model no ticket no tacos ha ha lol. Steak tacos was well seasoned  also the quac and chips. I will return for sure next time I'm in NYC
This is by far the best part of Times Square. Traditional street tacos without any fuss, and it's cheap too. I've had all 4 of the taco varieties, and you can't go wrong with any of them.

You don't expect much when you walk past, but these are the best tacos in the city. It's never too long of a wait, and the pork tacos are to die for. Make sure you know what you're getting because they try to get people in and out quick.

Great Tacos. I am visiting from Southern California and let me tell you this place is good. Very hard to come by a cool taco shop like this. Great place to get a quick bite. Very clean place and great food.

This was so tasty. Quick service and really delicious. Had two tacos and a quesedea and was really full. The chicken and beef were really great. Possibly the best tacos I've ever had, really fresh salsa!
No comment
Seriously, probably the BEST TACOS EVER!!! I have to eat here again before I leave NY!
wow!  even better than many taco stands that I've had across mexico! similar flavors but way more meat. Yum! great value as well.

Food is great! There is always a line but it goes by pretty fast. The tacos are delicious and fresh. I eat a lot of tacos, and these are one of the best I've had. Disclaimer, they have a little spicy kick to them.
Delicious and authentic Mexican food. We tried various offerings and all were very delicious. Staff around tables are very attentive and helpful. Great for a quick bite.
This place was outstanding. Queueing out of the door but served in under 10 minutes. The food was out of this world. Can not recommend this place enough!
One of the best tacos I've ever had! At first I was skeptical because of the price but definitely worth it. I'll be back before I leave from this vaca trip
I grew up in Arizona where there was no shortage of good Mexican food.  It's been tough to find good Mexican food out on the East Coast, but this place delivered!  Excellent Tacos!

This is my favorite taco place in NY and I'm so glad they opened up one near my apartment so I don't have to go to Chelsea to get them. It's such a nice place to grab food on the way home from work and the flour tortillas they use are so good. Be aware that's it's not a sit down place, there's no chairs, it's a place for you to grab food and go.
Love this place - great vibes, real Mexican food, fresh guac, and the adobado tacos are the best tacos ever!! Fresh, cheap, and delicious. Best Mexican I've had in NYC
Simple and wonderful. Perfect size tacos and the flavors were perfect. And yelp doesn't like my short succinct review so I am typing more because they are making me

I attended a conference in NYC recently and I visited Los Tacos No. 1 - OMG, the absolute best tacos and quesadillas that I've ever had! I went back a second time before I left NYC. I actually went to this location and the one in Chelsea Market on 9th Ave.

I had the Adobada (marinated pork) quesadilla on a corn tortilla and it was amazing. It reminded me of my time living in Mexico. Super authentic. I also had the horchata and tried all of their hot sauces. Must try!!
One of the best tacos I've ever had...anywhere. One of the few places near Time Square that isn't a tourist trap and is DEFINITELY worth your appetite. Get the adobada and carne asada tacos!

This place was awesome! Let's start by saying that it's about $5 per taco. The quesadillas are. It your standard quesadillas (they basically melt cheese in the taco and call it a day then they add condiments and it's officially a "quesadilla"). There is absolutely NOOOOOOOO seating!!! You eat standing up on bar tops but I told myself I wouldn't be frightened by that nonchalant ambiance and seating. I was glad I didn't walk out that door! The service was great. The lady at the register was calm despite the ruckus around her. I could hardly hear her but she didn't mind repeating herself 3 times lol! I only really like chicken but my parents wanted carne asada so I ordered the chicken quesadilla and two carne asada tacos. I wasn't a fan of the quesadilla because of what I mentioned before BUT the carne asada was AMAZEBALLS!!!  I didn't end up eating the chicken ones because to be they were average compared to the juicyness of the beef.  They pour a green sauce over the tacos and you get to put pico and some additional sauces afterwards in the condiments section. This place is a must if you are having lunch near Times Square. Unfortunately....we were looking for dinner and we were so hungry we decided to stay So the lack of seating was unexpected BUT let me tell you that at 8:30pm that place was PACKED!!!! Plus the bar areas get cleared because since there is no seating people eat within 15 minutes and are gone! Go visit this place. You won't regret it!

They have amazing food!! I enjoyed the tacos. I have been there a couple of times and I will definitely be back! I've been looking for a place that has good tacos and they definitely met my expectations. I definitely recommend !
I came here for their tacos and like every person I knew who went here, the tacos were the best. I doubt that you will be disappointed!
Right across the street from Lyric Theatre, this place is the perfect spot to grab a quick bite. The food was filled with flavor and was delicious!

Closest thing to the real thing! I work in Times Square and most places around there are garbage. However this place right here.. so great. Steak or chicken with everything. Whatever tortilla you prefer. Can't lose.
Love this hole in the wall near time square. One of the most authentic taco places in nyc

I would give 4.5. Prime steak taco-delicious. Very tender and juicy chopped steak. Good quality. Pork taco-very good. A lot of grilled pork. Pretty salty. Chicken taco-delicious. Very juicy chicken. Cactus taco-average. Sour cactus pickles. Not very used to this taste. All tacos are "con todos". Tasty sauces. The best tacos I've had so far.
Beat tacos ever!!! And the staff is really nice and accommodating. Definitely will go back. It's a great pit stop in Times Square id you're crunches on time
Best tacos in time square hands down great service as well .. so tasty & full of Flavor so today's
No comment

By far the Best tacos! (And I've had some of the best tacos in TJ). They really are all that! They have the authentic taste! The meat is cooked just right! I had adobada, finger licking good and the tortillas are on point! Makes up for the place only having bars and no chairs/stools to seat!
Excellent! Pork was the best and the Mexican cokes and diet cokes were nice! Beware there is about a 4-5 level of spice on a 10 point scale but it was perfect just not expected on the base tacos.

Amazing and non-touristy option in Times Square! The tacos are juicy (drippy but I can forgive that) and so delicious. They also offer radishes, spicy whole peppers, a mild salsa and two types of sauces that really spice up your meal. I don't mind that there are no seats as tacos meant to be a quick and easy meal, and it definitely cuts down on congestion and lines.

Super spicy and super good! Nice to be able to not have to go to Chelsea market for their amazing tacos, but I would If that was the only option. Fantastic as always got one of each meat. Love them all!
Only had the cactus tacos and quality was good. Salsas taste great. Wish they had more veggie options.
Go up and order then give your ticket to one of the guys behind the counter. Pretty low key and quick paced. Good for a quick bite.
Great street style tacos.  Marinated pork was excellent,  streak was great and chicken we pretty good.  Great value

This is one of the best taco spots I have ever tried!! Their spicy sauce is the perfect amount of spice and the tortillas are all hand made! Definitely will eat here next time I visit New York!! I would recommend the adobada tacos and carne asada ones!

I've been wanting to go for a long time, it was totally worth it walking in the middle of Times Square to visit this place, the tacos were very tasty and the people who work there very nice, I would go often if it was closer, definitely try the quesadillas.

Hands down the best and most authentic tacos I've ever tried. I consider myself a taco-snob, so finding this place, and for it to completely blow my previous Taco favorite out of the water that violently was an incredible surprise. The meat is juicy, tender and extremadamente sabrosa. A good friend of mine was visiting the city with me for an event, and he was equally blown away. He's from Mexico, his dad is a chef, and he considers himself even pickier with his tacos than I do. Lol. This is the only reason I'd be okay with ever going back to New York City.
Awesome, authentic,....worth the wait and the money! The carne asada is full of juicy flavor. All the topping are included, too! Went twice in 12 hours!

Surprisingly great tacos. Line moves quickly, so don't be intimidated. The quesadillas just mean they add cheese, not your typical two-tortillas with cheese I between that you may be used to. Can't go wrong here.

Most amazing tacos!! I'm from the West coast and am used to tacos from Sonora and damn they got the perfect authentic recipe here they definitely know what they're doing by far best tacos in the US! Super delicious

Have I ever had better tacos? Probably not. I tried the steak and chicken tacos in corn tortilla, with all the toppings it comes with. Absolutely loved the steak tacos - well cooked meat with a smoked flavor. Mind you, that the sauces they add are a bit spicy, but they truly complete the taco experience. They also have self-serve pots with different toppings, for customers to add some kick to their already-so-delicious tacos. These toppings include - medium sauce, spicy sauce, mild (tomatoes,onions,cilantro mix) sauce, radish, and arbol peppers! But be careful, even their medium is kind of spicy, if you can't take the heat you might want to first try a little. Though all these toppings were all freshly made and go well with their tacos, my personal fav was the arbol peppers. From the tacos, to the exciting toppings, to the setup where you eat standing (no seats here, only counters to eat while standing) - the whole experience is so authentic! I can safely say - probably the best tacos I have had so far!
Best tacos ever! They live up to Aziz Ansari's hype. This new location by Times Square is clean and fast. Staff very friendly. Line moves quick. This is the real deal!

Just like the old days in Tijuana aka TJ for all you outsiders ;) jk.   Seriously simple street tacos...the they way they should be....but seldom are.  Few choices because when things are done right you don't need choices. Gracias mi amigos!!!
Best tacos I've ever had. The first time I had Los Tacos, I had just eaten and wanted to try it because of the hype. I bought one for just a taste, but ended up waiting in line again for more.
Fast and delicious. They made the tacos right there fresh. No frills meal but excellently priced

Honestly some of the best tacos I've ever had. My wife and I were so happy because we love tacos and really wanted some good ones.  I guarantee you won't be disappointed, I want some now... the steak and pork are by far the juiciest and most flavorful, the chicken is fine but not as delicious as the alternatives.  they offered grilled cactus which was interesting but we didn't try it.  Cashier said it tastes like green beans, which is fine but we decided to go with the meats.  Also the flour tortillas are incredible, corn tortilla lovers definitely wouldn't mind them either, that good.  They also got a small salsa bar and the guacamole is really delicious(not included in the salsa bar).

People vote with their feet, and this place is always crowded because Los Tacos No. 1 serves up some of the best tacos in the city. This place gets really packed at meal times, but the line moves fast. The tacos are delicious and the portion size is perfect. My personal favorite is the steak.

Hands down the best tacos out there. Period. Great hand-made tacos with either flour or corn tortillas. Steak and marinated pork are a go-to! If you're going through NYC, Los Tacos #1 is a must visit.

Absolutely the most amazing place in TSQ! Hands down best tacos ever. Love the simplicity of the menu (written on the wall), options, prices, ambiance and overall atmosphere was fantastic. The food was exceptionallly tasty, well portioned, fast, and their slogan "no ticket no taco" was cute. Great team work behind the counter and manager in duty was proficient. HIGHLY recommend. all-day, everyday.
Some of the best tacos I've eaten. Homemade tortillas, perfectly seasoned pollo asada & carne asada. Loved the 'con todo.' Try them out!
Amazing tacos, especially if you like spicy. I'm from Texas and they're equivalent to what we get there. Definitely will be back.

This was such a random surprise, but this is flavorfully legit Mexican and something that greatly needed in Manhattan and the city as whole. It's a simplified California taqueria authentically done with quality. Tortillas are hand made on the comal behind the counter, house made sauces and aguas frescas, queso oaxaqueno and of course made to order in front of you. This reminds me neighborhood taquerias I grew up with in SF,  LA, Salinas, Ventura, San Jose, etc. Streamlined cuz smaller more accessible menu (no sesos, no cabeza), super clean when I was there, and sadly no beer or alcohol. There is nothing tex mex about this place as some reviewers incorrectly mentioned as taquerias are not a Texan tradition and no tejano dishes like faijtas, migas, chalupas, charros, cabrito, etc. A tex mex will always have a bar also.
Real tacos the way they taste in Mexico.  This place is the real deal.  Strongly recommend. As they say in the DF, "tacos de poca madre".

We were in city for some site seeing. We were so tired after doing touring nearby Gulliver's gate and wanted to eat quickly. Other places had long wait, well it's NY. We were almost going back to our car disappointed when we saw people going to this Tiny restaurant. The lines were quick and the service was fast. We got our food within 20 minutes. The food was fresh and had new twist. I never had cactus. Did I say it was reasonable. Loved it, will go back if I am nearby next time.

This taqueria is just like in Mexico! Music, seating (or lack thereof), drinks, and best of all - the tacos! I got there pretty late and missed the al pastor (adobada) but they looked bomb! Beef, chicken and cactus all surpased expectations!
Yes a real deal Taco Shop near Time Square.  Expensive for street tacos, however I thought worth it.  Try their hot sauce or smoked salsas well done!!

Loved their tacos.  This is the one of the best taco place in NYC.  We were in the neighborhood and had to grab quick snack and stopped by this restaurant because the review was good.  There were four to five people waiting on line, but the line moved pretty quick.  We ordered beef tacos, pork taco and chips with guacamole. Everything were really fresh and delicious.  I will definitely go back.

When I went, there was a line, but it moved pretty fast. Good prices. If you don't mind standing and eating, this place is amazing. Probably one of the best tacos I've had! And watching them perfectly fling the ingredients into the taco shell is like a mini show!
No comment

One of the best tacos that I ever eat outside the home , and I eat a lot , you won't be disappointed it should be in your list to visit the city I got the chicken and the steak taco and I loved everything, price is good , customer service was awesome friendly staff must see must try if you visit the big Apple state

I can't say enough good things about this place! What a gem to find an authentic taqueria in Manhattan! Everything about Los Tacos No. 1 is authentic from the food to the atmosphere. Great service and delicious food at a more than reasonable price. I would consider coming to NYC again just to have tacos here. If you are looking for a great taco shop travel whatever distance around the city to come here! The one and only downside is that they don't take American Express so be sure to have another form of payment with you...

This place was crazy busy with no place to sit, only long thin tables to stand at while eating. However the fast paced environment and Latin music made for a fun albeit chaotic environment. The tacos were delicious and briefly transported me to Mexico. The whole family including kids and older parent enjoyed our lunch and would go back again. Line moved quickly and we were in and out within 20 minutes.

As tacos go, The tacos at Los Tacos are very good. I had the beef in flour tortilla. The guacamole was nice and so was the salsa. The salsa was on the hot side but not too bad. Get two as one is not enough.

Came here after seeing great Yelp ratings. Line was out the door but went very quickly.  Steak tacos were awesome. We live in Az so Mexican food is something we usually don't have when we travel.  This place is great!!! Yummy! You will not be disappointed!
Hands down some of the best tacos I've ever had. We waited in line but it didn't take long. The food was phenomenal!

I wish this spot was open 24/7 because it's a hidden gem in the big big Apple ! Not crazy about the price but the quality is superb, the music and the ambiance makes you feel like you're back home in Mexico City waiting in line for some tacos and horchata ! Skip McDonalds near Times Square next time and visit this awesome Taco Spot !!!

Interesting new "pop up" kinda place, IMO. the owner/manager guy is very friendly. Think there is another location. the place doesn't quite have their flow-of-people and logistics down just yet; standing there for 30min eating people look just as lost as I felt. might need more concrete directions. also would help to have some visual menu, maybe - my definition of quesadilla being raised on TexMex, is very different from their tapas-sized taco that they call a quesadilla. My "quesadilla" was VERY VERY good, but like I said, unclear what to do exactly, and I guess I expected more food, maybe. They also have fresh juices (horchata). There is fun standing-only seating at small booths, which fits the smaller tapas-sized entreés. great staff as well, it seems.

I usually like all types of taco, but they were kinda overpriced and didnt get my order right. Maybe cuz of the long line...  I understand because many tourists visit there, but I wasn't really satisfied with my experience.
Absolutely delicious carne asada tacos. Pricey at $3.50 each but that's Manhattan for you.

Definitely worth visiting if you're here in NY.. great flavor, fast service, decent prices. The spicy was too much for my daughter but just right for me. If ordering for a kid, skip the spicy sauce they give you on the tacos. Be prepared for a little line, but it moves quickly. And they do have the option to stand-up while eating in if you want to stay there and eat. My advice, squeeze a lime & eat them while they're hot! We definitely be back!
Very small dishes. And the taste 3 stars. Location is perfect, in the Broadway, especially near the Lyric Theatre (Harry Potter and the cursed child)

We went to Los Tacos after hearing all the rave about it. We were disappointed to find that they did not have any fish options. Most of the menu included meat, the only vegetarian option was the napoles (cactus). That was the only thing we could order, it tasted just okay.. nothing special. Not sure what the big deal was.
I went there last month. Food was ok,  but service wasn't great. Definitely, not going to go there again.

The tacos taste ok. I really enjoyed the taco shell. It's very thin. Waiting in the line outside was annoying. The staff inside don't really have any patience. Or maybe they don't understand English well.   I have had better,  if you're in DC try District Taco and compare the tacos for yourself.
Had the carne asada taco, the chicken taco, and the guacamole and chips. Everything was amazing! Ended up going back a couple of times during our trip.
Same as the original one in Chelsea Market. I love that I can eat here now that it's close to work! Get the pork Tacos, they are the best!

DELICIOUS tacos ! There was a long line but it went by very quickly(which is awesome) all the workers are very friendly and give you suggestions on the menu. As busy as they were the place was very clean with workers walking around asking if you needed anything else. Great tacos AND Great service!
My favorite taco place in NYC. Tacos are fresh and authentic. Los Tacos No. 1 is no doubt a great choice for quick service and tasty tacos.
This will be the last time i tip at a fast food restaurant. The chef was so rude when i asked for extra onions and cilantro. He gave me the dirtiest look. Not worth the hype.
Best tacos in NYC, probably in all of NY. Try everything. Seriously. Every damn thing they have.

Wow wow wow! I'm from Texas and I have had legit tacos most of my life. This tastes like tacos al pastor straight from Mexico. If you want a beautiful atmosphere with culture and friendliness this is the place for you! It's super clean and affordable!
No comment

column3: Orange County Great Park, Irvine, CA
column6: I think....no, I know, these are the best tacos I have had in the US. The pork ones are the best. I wish we would have eaten here everyday! The line is long but they are fast so the wait isn't bad. There is no seating inside. You have to stand at the counters to eat if you choose to eat inside but it was perfectly acceptable for us. You have to try this place out!!

The taco with the fried cheese shell.  You have to try it.  Its amazing.  All of their food is delicious.  The service is fast yet personalized.  I would recommend this place to anyone thats in the area or away from it.  Its worth the trip.

column3: Fosterstown North, Dublin, Republic of Ireland
column6: Yeah the food is nice but it's crazy busy and I feel rushed eating my food standing up it's also very messy to eat the tacos ... tacos are quite fillin and it's not expensive but personally would rather a seating area also hard to hear the staff!
Authentic and good food but we were not prepared for how spicy it was!! I recommend getting radishes so your mouth doesn't light on fire.
If you want delicious tacos, this is the place to go. Super delicious and decent pricing for the location. Don't read these reviews anymore, just go GET THEM TACOS!

Adobada tacos are the best. The nopal taco was good but nothing special. Definitely get the corn tortillas- they're filling and do a great job at holding all the contents together. Their horchata was good as well.
The tacos here are deeelish. If you're looking for a quick yummy bite this is your place. Also if you're a nonpork eater make sure to avoid the beans and the flour tortilla. Yummy!
No comment
No comment

The pork taco is the best taco I've ever had. I work in Times Square and most of the food around here is terrible but not this place. I'm so happy it's here. It's also clean and the service is great. Very authentic feel too. Also very bad for my diet but suddenly I don't care.

Best tacos in NY. This is coming from an Arizona native. The carne asada tacos are excellent. Looks like they offer breakfast burritos during the week. It is an order at the counter and stand at another counter to eat style place. Definitely worth the trip of you are looking for authentic tacos.
The most delicious tacos I've had in NYC. Reminds me of the tacos I had in Mexico. Authentic Mexican food! In and out place, cheap food and great service.

Best tacos I ever had. The Carne Asada was amazing. It was quick and fast to get, barely any line. Conveniently located across from Lyric Theater where we went to see The Cursed Child. Definitely a must when eating between acts.

Discovered this while walking to the train station... got the steak and also the pork taco with the flour tortilla. I tried the steak first and bought it was pretty good but then I tried the pork AND MY MIND WAS BLOWN. It was so juicy, flavorful, and slightly spicy plus the pineapple they put on top was sweet. Will definitely return to get more pork tacos!! They also have soda in the glass bottle, which indeed makes the soda taste better.

Honestly the best tacos I've ever had. Get the carne asada quesadilla (really just a taco with melted cheese) on flour with everything on it. Add lime, add some mild salsa. Best thing you've ever tasted.

Best tacos I've ever had in my life! Spicy and flavoursome, just so good! it's a great experience and located in the heart of Chelsea Market so you can stroll the shops before or after your delicious meals.

Let's call it patina.  This second outpost of my favorite taco joint doesn't have it yet.  It's not just my imagination either.  The grill grates at the midtown location are shiny and new; they haven't been seasoned with day after day of baked on grease and spices and flavor.  The carne asada tacos as a result...taste good, but there's something lacking.  Devoid of that extra dimension of depth of flavor.  Adobada - different story.  That cone of luscious slow-grilled meat doesn't rely much  on contact with the griddle for flavor, so it's as good as ever.  I love this midtown location and hope it's just a matter of time before it's as good as the original location.

I loved their salsa, it had a really nice kick to it. I also had the chicken taco and it was good, but on the smaller side so I recommend ordering at least two. I'm not a big pork fan so I was hesitant to try their pork taco but I will the next time I come back. The pork is roasted on a giant rotating stick with pineapples on top. Looked yummm

Super easy and fun. Tried my first mula - the adobado. YUM!!! The spices were amazing. Great joint - walk up and order. Friendly service. Stand to eat at a counter-bar but that's not a problem. Don't forget to try the different sauces!
Delicious! The employees were nice and friendly. Fast but delicious fresh food. Will definitely come back when I visit the city and definitely will recommend.
No comment
Food was so good!!! Not a fan of the hustle and bustle, yet again it's NYC.  Next time, I take to go and eat peacefully at a park.  Food was delicious!!!

Good food bad service. I bought my food on this system they have where you pay then you pick your tacos after. So I long story short I finished them and still had room for 1 more taco and went back to the line and the lady refused to sell me the extra taco because it was less than 5 bucks and I was paying credit. After explaining that I had just bought more stuff she still refused. I wonder what the owner would think on refusing to sell one taco or anything to a wanting client. It's this type of details that can kill a business. Really mad. I'll take my money where somebody else appreciates it.
This is a MUST EAT if you are the city. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The pork tacos were absolutely sensational. Very simple ordering and friendly to gluten sensitive.
Best tacos in town, hands down. The only negative thing I could say is that they don't have seats but I mean, it's Chelsea Market. I don't recommend the juices though, too much ice.

The worst customer service, they're rude they rush you, they don't listen. Literally want you in and out. You'd think that their food was at least worth the terrible experience. It lacks any sort of flavor and is sloppy. Don't waste your time or money please

I'm a regular at the Los Tacos in Chelsea Market, so I decided to check this one out on my lunch break. The space is a good enough size to accommodate a lunch rush, but there's absolutely no seating (just counters to stand beside). The food was the same high quality that I'm used to, but the service fell short of the other location's high standard. Despite the fact that there were only a handful of customers in front of me it took 11 minutes to get my 2 tacos. This isn't a huge deal, but the other place can get 2 tacos to you in 4 minutes tops. The food and prices are unbeatable, just be patient and take it to go if you don't want to stand.
Best tacos I've found in New York yet. Minimalist menu, good prices, quick service. Salsas are great. Highly recommend!
Got a steak, pork, and chicken tacos with everything on it. Quick service. Tacos we're delicious and the spicy salsa was pretty spicy.
Best tacos in NYC!  I tried the chicken, pork and carne asada tacos.  I think pork were the more tastiest!
Affordable, quick and delicious. Hard to beat qualities - especially compared to other options when you are around Time Square.

Hole in the wall place with heavenly tacos. Perfect for a quick meal when you're stuck in times square. All their meats pack so much flavor, especially the pork and steak. Make sure to get it "con todo" (onions, guacamole, cilantro) and add your own salsa later for the full experience. Also if you come when it's busy, expect standing room only.
Tacos here are legit. A bit pricy but what do you expect in NYC. Line moves fast and there's always a counter open.

Absolutely delicious! We traveled from Phoenix to NY and got a taste of authentic Mexican tacos! Flavorful, salsa was perfect, home made tortillas and fresh ingredients used. Only down side is the quesadilla is really an oversized taco (not much cheese on there) and a little over priced. Other than that, definitely would return!

Best tacos in New York! Super quick and easy to order! It is very unique style of restaurant and have very polite workers. They make ordering and figuring things out for the first time easy. There is no seating so be prepared to take food on the go or use the standing tables.
I'm from Texas & these tacos are just like I would get at home. Priced well especially for being near Times Square.   Highly recommended.

Delicious tacos. Pork were tastiest. Love that you can just order a little snack or order enough for a meal. There are long lines and it is a little chaotic ordering (especially if it is your first time). The staff was friendly enough and patient while we figured it out, though. Great place to stop just before seeing a Broadway show. We'll be back!

This place is so good that I'm writing this as soon as I walk out. The tacos are small but they're absolutely delicious. I had the chicken taco with everything on it and it was to die for. I went back and got another one! I even heard that the steak and pork is better than the chicken. 10/10!

This place is amazing. The beef fajita tacos and quesadillas had so much flavor. They let you choose the toppings you want to add on- salsa, guacamole, onions, and cilantro. There isn't any seating in the restaurant, but it is so worth it to go. Probably one of the best and cheapest meals we had in New York.
Flavor, flavor, flavor. Outstanding tacos! The place is very clean. Great customer service! New York, you are lucky to have a place like this!
Some of the best tacos you'll ever eat! Communal standing only dining. Get the steak and pork tacos...you will not be disappointed!
Decent street style tacos was pretty good! They have a good variety to choose from and might as well get everything on them!! It is standing only so it's just a quick spot n go type of thing
Best tacos I have ever eaten. Great salsas, awesome service. I can eat these tacos everyday, unfortunately I live a little far.

Tacos are my favorite food, and I try taco places all over the city. I may be rating this place harshly but the tacos are just OK. They are reasonably priced, but I don't think they are as amazing as everyone else seems to.

Awesome! Definitely recommend this spot. Do not expect to sit but that's the best part you stand up or if you get a stool. It creates an ambiance to enjoy not just food but the company of those you are with.

There is now a sign to help you locate this amazing gem. Everything is fresh, quick and delicious. The quesadilla is a taco with melted cheese on he inside of the shell. For $15 I got two tacos, a quesadilla, and a bottle of water. The food and the atmosphere are authentic. A must on the list of places to eat for tourists and New Yorkers.
Omg tacos here are amazing!!!! I had the adobado and carne asado and they were absolutely delicious. I would definitely recommend this place

Two thumbs up from everyone in my family.  The tacos were fresh, well-seasoned, and had a subtle hint of heat.  I tried the steak and pork tacos.  I knew my tacos were going to be good when I saw the chef carve the pork from a roast hanging in front of me.  My boys said the chicken tacos were really good, and they aren't big tacos fans.  I need to go back again to sample the cactus taco, which I've never had before.

This place is already crowded and deservedly so. Its just as good as its Chelsea Market counterpart but with more space. Coming from California it was hard to find a comparable taco spot to the taco trucks back home in the Bay Area and LA but this certainly fits the bill. In contrast to the taco trucks on the West Coast, the tacos here in the city are pretty expensive (almost $4 each compared to $1.50-$2.00 to what you would find in California) but I don't think New Yorkers mind paying for the best tacos in Manhattan. If there are better tacos than this in New York I'd love for someone to message me because this sets a pretty high bar.
Was staying at the Westin. Walked here. Glad I did. Loved it! Suggest ordering at least 3 tacos. Had the steak, pork & cactus. Can't go wrong here. All good.

This is my first time in New York and for obvious reason my first time at Los Tacos No. 1 and I wanna say that they are the best tacos I ever tried in the United States. They remind me of the tacos from back home in northern Mexico
Very expensive as far as tacos go, but the tacos were so good I didn't even care about the price. The pork was so good I just wanted more and more.

This place is taco heaven. I eat here once or twice a week. I leave it as a 4 because I want to see them step it up with some shrimp or fish tacos or something else. Also would love to see some coffee or fresh juice with the breakfast burritos in the morning. The cart at the corner of Times Square has good iced coffee though.
Best tacos ever !!!! Fast and natural ! Cooked right in front of you !!! Wow and I have ate tacos in LA and more states and wow these are truly amazing !!!! 5star
The Good: Cheap authentic tasy mexican tacos. Clean, great customer service. Spicy sauces at the condiment table.The bad: no seats (just stand) and no bathroom.
The best Mexican tacos in NY!! The meats are cooked with all the flavor of Mexico and the hot sauces are the best!!

The tacos here are delicious. My husband and I have high expectations when it comes to tacos and this place did not disappoint. I had the carne Asada, he had the chicken and pork. I thought mine was good but he could not stop raving about his. You won't be disappointed.

So, good. Was surprised to find this location as I've always gone to the one in Chelsea. Tacos were still fantastic, with great flavors and ingredients. Any taco I have I always compare it back to these. Highly recommended with a Mexican coke!

We had lunch here. The food is very average in taste, flavor and variety of ingredients. They have very limited options each in tacos and quesadillas.  They put just a light layer of guacomole and the other basics like cilantro and onion.  The cost is low and the quick in-and-out are sure conveniences, but yes, that's all. Overall, very average.

This is absolutely, hands-down, the BEST tacos in all of New York City. I go out of my way to cut through the shit show that is Times Square to eat these amazing tacos at least bi-weekly (usually more) because they are THAT GOOD
No comment
At first I got one pork taco and one steak taco. They were so good so I got another one pork taco and one cactus taco.
No comment
Bombest tacos for sure.  I come here atleast once a week.  The staff is also real coo

I am not only Mexican but come from a Mexican restaurant owning family but since I moved to Long Island, it's been difficult to find truly authentic Mexican food.  I can honestly say that Los Tacos No. 1 is hands down the best Mexican Food restaurant in all of New York.  They're not just good compared to Mexican food in New York, they're really good compared to Mexican food in Mexico.  The friendly staff is an added bonus which earns this place a 5 star in my book.
This place is delicious and very fast.  Had the steak and chicken tacos and omg they're amazing. My fiancé loved the steak quesadilla.

Made the mistake of going here for lunch and it's all I think about now ;). Really, really great tacos. Had the carne asada and the chicken and they were phenomenal. There was a line outside when we arrived just before 1 PM on a Tuesday, so we knew we were in for something special. We were not disappointed. Will definitely be going back the next time we're in the area.
Don't believe the hype. Cheap- yes. Greasy- yes. Wanted some tacos and was disappointed. Meat was tough and mysterious.
I'm from TX. This place is the read deal! Don't miss out! It's very clean. Great customer service. Easy fast in and out. Steps from Times Square.
This is the best taco that I have ever had this far from Mexico. I tried the steak, chicken and pork. All three were a hit. Definitely coming back when I'm NY and need a taco fix.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Los Tacos is awesome. Specifically this location, the line is pretty long for lunch. Mix of tourists and people at work. There are some standing tables for you to eat inside. Los Tacos is very good value and high quality so you definitely get your bang for the buck. Get their tacos - they're awesome! Highly recommend!

This place was freaking amazing!!!! My family originates from Jalisco Mexico and we even own and operate our own Mexican restaurant in Texas and I can genuinely tell you that these were some of the best authentic tacos I've ever had. It was packed when we entered, but that's alright because their service was not only impeccable but fast. The manager even found time to socialize with the customers and make sure they were happy. I forgot to mention that the whole place had a very nice authentic vibe. They wrapped the whole Mexican theme up by playing Spanish music in the background. It was great, so If you're in the area I definitely would recommend this place.

I've literally been here at least once a week since this place opened. I've never had a better taco in my life and I've tried tacos from Mexico, my dude! The carne asada tacos are always bomb and juicy and their hot sauces are serious. I typically come here for dinner because their lunch lines are out the door. See you guys tonight!
Holly mother of God this place is beyond good and will keep coming back for more. If you are a first time person in New York make your way on over to that place

Yes, these are the tacos you are dreaming about! I like the personalized approach to food preparation as you hand your ticket over the counter for a friendly worker to assemble your tacos. The ingredients are fresh and cooked on the grill right in front of you. Every bite was perfect as the meat had just the right amount of seasoning with grilled flavor cooked in. These aren't the cheapest tacos you will find (about $3.50 each), but with a location close to Times Square, it is cheap enough. I was full after eating 3. These are authentic and worth the trip from any part of midtown. Go now!

I'm not from California, I'm an east coaster. But I LOVE Mexican food, and when I'm not in California, I don't have many options to compare. Visiting New York, I knew I had to find some place. And this is definitely that place. I went with a friend and we couldn't stop talking about how great our tacos were the entire trip! Only regret was that we didn't go back again for more.
This is probably the best taco in the east coast! It's located in Chelsea Market in the city. The long line is worth it. The mouth watering tacos are to die for!
best tacos in town.   good prices.   good service.   quick lines.  standing options only.    i pass 3 or so other taco places and it's  totally worth it.

Amazing, quick eat. The marinated pork was my fave. But all were great. Standing room only. You keep your paid receipt and hand it to one off the chefs, tell them if you wanna stay or go. Tacos can be messy, but there was someone there to clean.
No comment
Really cool, hip spot.  Had the carne asade quesadilla fully loaded and it was awesome. Very fresh ingredients.
This place is amazing. It felt like I walked in little Mexico. Loved it and the great food.

I decided to come over here after I saw the all of the positive reviews it got on here. I usually don't have high hopes for tacos in this city, but los tacos no.1 are some of the best I've ever had even for LA standards. Accidentally, I ordered a pork taco with a shell made of fried cheese. It was so good! The cheese was crispy and salty and the pork was tender and well seasoned. I also got a steak taco and it was equally as great. The food here is cheap as well, with a real the staff give it a true authentic feel. I can't wait to come back here
Maybe the best Tacos in town. Love the quality and amount. The green sauce is DELISH!!!
Good food.  Fast and friendly service.  Enjoy the steak tacos.  Place was clean and bright.

Moved to NY 8 years ago from Mexico and never found a good place in Manhattan to get my taco fix until now. This are good tacos even by Mexican standards.  one of my favorite places to eat , also visit " los mariscos " in Chelsea market ( same owners ) to get a taste of real Mexican seafood.

Coming from Phoenix and Southern California My taco standards are pretty high well these did not disappoint! I love adobada/al pastor and and the adobada here is some of the best I've had if you're craving tacos in NYC make sure to check this place out!
In Times Square but very few tourists! Cheap, fast, very tasty tacos. Simple food, no tables to sit down, but definitely worth the stop.
Handmade tortillas are phenomenal. Vegetarian friendly. Wonderful bit of Mexico in Times Square. Cheap, quick eats before a show.

Really fast service here and hands down probably the best tacos in New York City which I was expecting that. I had them once before in the Chelsea market. This shop is a lot more organized then the other location. I had 2 quesadillas carne asda and the pollo and a side of chips and salsa. All amazing.
AMAZING!!! Staff is so sweet and the carne asada tacos were SO GOOD!!! I've been. Wanting some GOOD tacos for a WHILE and these hit the spot! I went twice in one day because once wasn't enough hahaha
Great place to eat! The service is good and quick. Especially when you're in a rush.The chicken tacos are awesome.

If you find yourself hungry and near Times Square then go here. Don't eat at the chain restaurants around Times Square. Place is half a block west of Times Square on 43rd. Tacos are best in the city. The steak tacos were the best.  These are the same folks who operate the taco spot in Chelsea Market.

Great simple tacos with tons and I mean TONS of flavor, would recommend the pork over everything, best pork I've ever tasted. Chips and guac were delicious as well. Relatively fast service and just a great experience. Recommend to anyone
Good food. A little confusing and unorganized for handling people. Not a lot of room to eat and it's all standing only. But very tasty.
This place is awesome. There al pastor tacos are seasoned very good and enjoyable. Definitely coming back here for lunch.

This was probably the best taco I've ever had!  I ordered the carne asada on a flour tortillia and added mild salsa to it.  The steak portion was much larger than I expected and the flavor was amazing!  Others in my group ordered the chicken and pork tacos and they were equally pleased.  I will definitely eat here again on future visits to the city.
The tacos were great, but the portions were a little small for someone coming from Texas. There was no place to sit, so be prepared to stand :)
Best Tacos In New York City !!! The service is great and the Horchata Water is amazing .
The line is long and there are not seats only standing tables but totally worth it. Their food is authentic and nice music
Katherine processed our order quickly.  She was very friendly.  The Tacos were amazing.  I love their chicken tacos and my wife enjoys the shrimp.  Can't wait for the next time.

Totally delicious tacos! About as authentic as you can find (probably) in the big city. Quick walk to it if you are hanging out in Times Square. Would definitely recommend! The salsa spiced me up for sure, but I like a little kick to my food.

INCREDIBLE. Best tacos I've had in a long time, my fiancé and I inhaled them and are hoping to go back before we leave the area. Only standing areas but we found somewhere right away. Will definitely be back!
These Tacos are so delicious! Beware of the long lines during lunch hour, other than that it's the real deal.
I'm from Texas I know tacos and I Love this place for a quick bite. Tacos were amazing!!! Guacamole fresh, drinks were cold, service was quick, restaurant was clean. Loved it so much we went twice!

I first regretted getting 3 tacos thinking it was too much. But went back to get more. The tacos were sooooo good. The meat was cooked just right. Lines are long but they move really quick. Definitely want to go back for more. Probably the best tacos I ever had
Best tacos in NYC without the wait of the Chelsea market location. Take a step into Mexico right off 43rd st.

Located right near times square with a beautiful interior. The service was very quick and ordering was simple. The tacos were not the best and left more to be desired. No other flavours except chilli hits the tongue. The corn tortillas were fresh and the highlight of the whole meal. Overall it was just okay nothing extraordinary.

I ordered four tacos and only got two. You have to give them your ticket and then they make your tacos for you. I didn't want onions on our tacos. The employee making the tacos was working extremely fast, rapid fire, like a machine. His boss was standing right by him smiling the whole time. I got two of my tacos right away. They mumbled something that I could not hear in the loud din of the place. I waited and waited for my next two tacos, the boss said they were coming. Finally the employee made two tacos for me after serving five other people first. Only he made them with flour tortillas instead of corn tortillas. I asked for corn tortillas, which is what had ordered. After waiting for more than 5 minutes my wife came over and said to go eat my one taco after she had eaten hers. She waited in my place for the other two tacos. We finally gave up having paid for 4 tacos and only getting 2, because we had to rush off to a Broadway play. No way to talk to anyone about it. Very frustrating. Great tacos if it works, but the experience was very inhuman, like a machine. I feel sorry for the employees that have to work in such a place.
Best tacos ever!!! You will never know what real tacos should taste like until you've come here!

Came in here with my mom during the break between part 1 and 2 of Harry Potter and the cursed child. Went in mainly just because it was across the street from the theater and we wanted to eat fast. Although the system for ordering was confusing and could lead to mistakes easily I still enjoyed the food. I got some stuff I usually don't like on my tacos by accident but here it was good which gives me a good impression of them and there was no denying their flavors were great. In total it's a little confusing but worth it.

Food was excellent. It's extremely busy here. No seats it's all standing room only just keep that in mind. It's a little pricey for what you get. Like $5 for guacamole and chips and it's a very small portion. $4 for a mini bottle of coke. The food tastes very good. Great atmosphere with the music playing. It's not somewhere to be for a long period. Your just going to eat and continue on your walk in New York. But the food is worth the stop.
Excellent Tacos! Would have thought I was in a Texas Tex-mex hot spot, not NYC. Definitely worth a try.
Had this place on our list. Easy process. Not too expensive. Great food. I recommend that you go before dinner time because the line can get long.
Tacos were very good, loved the atmosphere, would recommend, , gets a bit busy sometimes but line goes fast

Outstanding food.  Fast, friendly, delicious and incredible value for money.  Open kitchen lets you see everything that is going on.  Everything freshly prepared.  I had the pork tostadas with a side of guacamole.  My daughter had the same but thought she'd try the salsa.....beware it is hot.  We ended up switching sides as it was too hot for her but I won't change my 5 star rating.

Los tacos was one of the best things that ever happened to me. The line was out the door but I had tacos in my hand in less than 15 minutes. Best tacos I've had in my life. Ended going back for seconds.
No comment

If you really like Mexican food, this is the place to visit.  Eating tacos in this restaurant is like being in Mexico.  Excellent food, excellent prices!  Fast service, big portions, and great service.  I would definitely come back to this place, and recommend it to anyone.

The most authentic tacos you can have in Times Square. Fast service, clean and friendly! If you go during lunch hour there will be lines, however, they're super quick so you won't be waiting more than 15 minutes. Get the corn toritilla :-)
You will not find a better tasting taco around - so flavorful and filling. Get the adobada and the others while you're at it!

My boyfriend and I enjoy trying tacos from different places we visit and I had read about Los Tacos No 1 and how it has some of the best tacos in Manhattan so we decided to try them out. We went to the location in Times Square. We went in and there wasn't so much of a line but there was still plenty of people eating. There's no chairs inside but it's more of a stand and eat place, which I didn't mind. We each ordered 3 tacos. One asada, chicken and adobada. You first order and then give your ticket to the people preparing the food. I got the salsa on the side because I wasn't sure how spicy it would be. The tacos were out quick and I first tried the adobada taco. This one was my fav. The meat was juicy and the pineapple they add to it compliments it very well. The asada and chicken were good too but I think they needed a bit more seasoning. Both the green and red salsa were good not too spicy as I thought! Overall the tacos were good in size (Bigger than usual tacos) and for the price ($3.50 each) they were okay! I would come back to eat them again when I go back to NY.

The best thing to ever happen to Times Square. These tacos are too good for this world. They don't belong in such a dark and twisted place yet somehow they are here and for that I am truly thankful. Adobada all the way, if not well sorry but you fucked up. Ask for the queso shell if you want your day simultaneously made and ruined at the same time.
Best tacos I have ever had. Went back for more. Have to get the Adobada with everything. The Carne Asada was fantastic too.

This had five stars we took a chance on it because it's kind of not real fancy but this five stars are well deserved. The salsa, guacamole, Steak and chicken tacos are outrageously good... Definitely give this one a try
Best tacos!! They are small- menu is super affordable and really good food! I'm going to be here a lot :)

Pretty impressed with the quantity for the price especially with it being just off Times Square. No line when I went. I got 3 tacos and they were stuffed with meat! The pork was a little salty and the chicken and steak lacked some flavor but by no means bad! I love that they have fresh limes, pico and salsa at the self serve. There is no seating, just standing tables. They were pretty full so I took mine to go.

I live down the block on 43rd ST. I'm originally from queens and there are plenty of authentic taco places on Roosevelt Ave but I have yet to find a decent one here in Hell's Kitchen. Most of the ones around here have a bland taste to the meat and have overpowering dressing that drowns out the flavoring of the meat. This spot is my new taco spot that is even better than most of the places on Roosevelt Ave. The meat was so flavorful and the dressing were subtle but perfect. So glad it is close to home. I'm going to be coming here all the time. Thanks to my wife for find it.

Amazing tacos....try the Especial for an extra yummy treat. 100% worth the wait and standing to eat. Authentic Mexican and a great place to grab a bite befor or after a show that's delicious and not overpriced.

Good food and basic menu choices.  They churn out fresh tacos and tostadas with choice of meat and topping (vegetarian option is grilled cactus, quite good).  Quick ordering and eat at the standing tables.

Incredibly delicious tacos!! Very authentic, you can't really go wrong with any of the choices (the chicken and carne asada were my favorite). The only difference between the quesadilla and the taco is cheese, but both were delicious. You can't go wrong at this place!
Their homemade tortillas are so good! You can feel the difference to the others. I like their steam and pork. Chips are also good.

The tacos and empanadas are delicious.  Remember to hand your receipt over to the staff who will prepare your food.  One star off for the lack of seats (standing room only).  Overall, a great place to grab a quick bite to eat near the Theater District.

I've had tacos all over the map--these are up there with the best! Fresh corn tortillas (the only taco tortilla), great meat, right toppings. Fast, friendly people. I found them the last day of my trip, 1/2 block from my hotel--only bad news, or I'd have been there twice a day. So good.
