You will not regret coming here, these are some of the best tacos I've ever tried and tastes super authentic. One of my favorite places to eat in NYC and will definitely be coming back here!
Guacamole sauce was AMAZING and the chips wonderful. Meat tortilla very good, cactus one a bit weird for my taste but still very good

Really good street tacos Style food in a fast-moving counter-service environment. Standing tables only, good to dip in for a snack when you're in the Times Square area-- where places like this aren't actually that common. Recommended!
Pleasantly surprised that there was such a great taco place in the middle of times square. They were a little pricey though
No comment
BEST TACOS on this side of the border. Their adobada is a must! Be careful with the salsa it's SPICY!
The tacos are sooo authentic and so good. There was a line and not really any where to sit. But the tacos are so worth it!!
The food was good but on our way out I stomped on a roach and the worker just swept it up like it was nothing
No comment
Great food!!!!! Nowhere to sit, but worth it to stand and eat. :)

The tacos are amazing! We waited a bit in line but it was so worth it. The quality of the meat was great and the employees were super cool. You order at the register and take your ticket to the cooks and they will prepare your food on the spot. It was a little crowded when I went and they have stand up tables only, no chairs - so it was a little hard for us to find a spot to eat. However they have a salsa bar which is a plus. Definitely recommend this place if you're in the Times Square area

Saw a video review on Facebook about this place.. made my husband grab take out and bring it back to our hotel.  Seriously the best tacos I have ever had. The chicken was so good... I don't think I can every eat tacos anywhere else ever again. Don't miss this place when you are in NYC!!!!
Great Tacos, very affordable. Very convenient for a quick bite before a show or a casual date

Bomb af tacos. Ordered chicken and carne asada tacos, and they were so tender and moist. There wasn't any sharp shards of chicken in these tacos AT ALL. I also enjoyed the guac and the salsa, which just pulled the taco together and makes it no. 1. mmMhM my tummy is rumbling just thinking about it. The horchata was great! It wasn't sickly sweet, so if you're wondering, you won't feel like you're drinking sugar! The lines are usually very long, but it goes by pretty quickly. They are very efficient in taking orders, making the food, and handing it to you. Pretty straightforward once you're in line. Just follow the person in front of you, put in your order, hand the person your ticket once it's your turn, tell them if you want corn or flour (for tacos), package the selections of salsa and sauces while you wait, and pick them up! There wasn't much seating, so I can see how it's more convenient if you Togo the order, but standing and eating tacos is also an option too! Still tastes amazing ;)
So good - and cheap. Maybe the best taco as I'd gotten in the NE/mid-Atlantic.
Amazing!  The most authentic Mexican food you can get in the tri-state area in my opinion.  Definitely worth the trip to get it.
We stumbled upon this place last summer and loved it, so it was our first stop this visit. The tacos are perfect size and made fresh...Thank you for a great start to our trip!

I ate here after having an amazing taco at the chelsea location. This time I ordered 2 steak tacos, and the tortillas were stale. The meat was also more chewy. I asked the person a few questions about the toppings and he was unable to answer, his eyes were half-open, he seemed high. Next time, if I ever go back, it won't be at this location.
best tacos in nyc!! a must try. they are authentic mexican tacos  line is a little long but definitely worth the wait.
Best taco spot in the city. There's usually a long line but it moves pretty fast. Great for a quick dinner if you are going to see any broadway shows nearby.
The best tacos I've had in a long time. Super fast service and awesome music. The prices are super low too.
No comment
First time here.  Great tacos.  Fast and nice services.  Will return again and again!!!!

Authentic and tasty. Decided to stop in during my lunch break. Had two chicken tacos and one steak on a flour tortilla. Will def say the steak outweighs the chicken but both are absolutely tasty. Recommend getting here outside of rush hour--a line begins to form.

We visited from Phoenix, AZ and by far some of the best authentic Mexican street style tacos we've ever had. The tortillas are being hand made as you order. Their salsas are great as well. Definitely recommend this place I don't eat meat so I had the nopal tacos and quesadilla, my husband had the al pastor mula, kids had tacos de asada we all loved it.
Hand made flour and corn tortillas. Absolutely the best tacos ever! They 110% live up to they're name, "los tacos No. 1"
Best tacos everrrr!!! I had the Asada tacos and it was seriously so good. Highly recommend
THE BEST EFFIN TACOS EVER!!!! Try pork and steak but definitely pork. I've had my fair share of tacos.... this is the best in nyc
Tacos are amazing, inexpensive, and best I've ever had. Fast and friendly service. Its totally perfect.
Perfect taco place at the perfect location. Close your eyes and order away. Wish they stayed open til 1am.

This place is a mediocre taco location. There is nothing special about it, it tastes like meat and tortilla and the salsa is below average. With this premise you should understand that it's an undesirable restaurant, and if I could give it less than a star I would. What caused me to write this review was the fact that it's pricy as hell and has nothing to offer. A taco will cost you about 5-6 dollars each, and they aren't big. The drinks will cost you 5 dollars and it's just a drink. What angered me the most was when I ordered their Mexican sweet waters, which weren't even good, they gave me one of those little plastic cups and filled it 3/4 of the way with ice. It was bad enough that they did this to me, but when I asked for a refill on the tiny cup they gave me, they said I'd have to buy another one for another 5 whole dollars. This place pissed me off so much, how dare you be that stingy, your business is not suffering. Please don't eat here, honor all those who have been screwed by this place by avoiding it at all cost.

Went during busy lunchtime but it wasn't too crazy. You order your food and give your receipt to a cook (no ticket no taco). Getting it to the cook is a little tricky if it's busy because it's kind of a free for all. Tried one of each of the tacos (except the cactus; sorry, it's not for me) the pork, chicken, and steak. The pork was by far the best, especially with corn tortilla. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting.
Legit. Had some bomb tacos. No seating but definitely worth it. Real Mexican coming from a Mexican

Don't ask what took me so long but I just ate lunch here 2 days in a row and I might make it a third on Monday. I've known about this spot since it was the #1 restaurant on all of Yelp in 2017 but every time I visited the Chelsea Market location, it hadn't felt worth the wait. I recently started working in the area of their Times Square location (which I didn't know existed) and stumbled upon the spot on Thursday. THERE WAS NO ONE ON LINE!!! Ordered 3 tacos (2 steak 1 chicken).... best taco in I've had in NYC by far. Taqueria St Marks maybe comes close but the way the taco chefs make your order is legit an art form. Not only is the food good but it's a cool experience, you bring your ticket to the counter, pick corn or flour tortilla and your toppings and your food is ready in 5 minutes. I got a steak pork and chicken today, just as good if not better. This is my regular taco spot from now until further notice.

Best food I've had in a while. Tried the chicken tacos with everything and chips and salsa. All I can say is oh my God, it was delicious! I would definitely come back and I'm telling everyone about this place.

Insane tacos. Pork and steak are favorites, flour tortilla comes pre glazed with pork flavor, which is absolutely fire. The especial tortilla with pork is a must try as well, favorite tacos (non breakfast related) easily on the east coast
Fresh tacos and solid ingredients. They need somewhere to eat though! Very hectic to get the food.
Probably the best tacos I've ever had and im from Los Angeles so that's saying something. the meat is so tender and juicy . It would be better with seating but still a 5/5 for food

my favorite tacos by far. long line, but it moves quickly, so make sure you know what you want. after you pick your meat (adobada!!), you give the receipt to the next counter and tell them if you want flour vs corn tortillas and what toppings you want. ps, there are additional salsa toppings on a separate counter.

Stopped by because we know the owners family from So.Cal.  Loved the authentic tacos, salsa and service. Tastes like home. Great quality food for a reasonable price with friendly fast service. Definitely recommended!! We will be back!!
For the love of God..please make a black bean taco because the cactus is not cutting it for the vegetarians.
The friendliest, most amazing tacos I've had in a while. Reminds me of home, in a great way!

Went here early one weekday and had the adobada tacos and cactus plate. The tacos were amazing, highly recommend. The cactus plate kinda reminded me of green peppers, good vegetarian option but would add pork to it next time if I went again. The place has no seats so it's great for a quick bite. As I was leaving I noticed the line was outside the door, it seems like a busy lunch spot but worth it.

found communication to be the biggest issue. Had to explain order to cashier and then all over again to cook? We didn't speak the language and found it difficult. The food was good once we got it. Be advised, no seating. Standing tables only.
Tacos beat any I have ever had.  I don't usually care for beef but Carne Asada are so good.

i got a cheese and chicken quesadilla and it was kinda small but it made up with it with filling and taste! they loaded it with chicken so much that i could barely close it. the chicken was so tasty and the dough was delicious. everything was greatly seasoned. there wasn't seating, there were just table to stand up but when we went they were all taken. i will definitely go back.
Best tacos in the city, the whole family loved it. We tried it all on the menu very authentic and delicious. Been back twice already.

I guess this is what a great taco is in New York? I mean, it's fine, but I'm from California, where great tacos practically grow on trees. I've had much better tacos, in places that don't have long lines and stressful chaos like this place.

This is the best taco joint around. Everything is amazing! Insider tip: get the breakfast burrito - before 11 it's $4 delicious. The pork was my favorite. Quesadilla was great (taco size with cheese). I wish they opened up somewhere else so I wouldn't always have to deal with tourists but I live right down the street and I'm so excited that they joined the neighborhood.

Coming from a Mexican, this are the best tacos I've eaten in the NY/NJ area  Came here with my boyfriend and we both left absolutely satisfied. Loved the corn tortillas! I usually never like tacos with flour tortillas, but even those were pretty amazing.

Yes there is a huge line out the door at lunch every day. I have tried the Tacos 2 times. There secret to success is not the meat as it has literally no flavor. The meat acts as a filler so you think you are getting your money's worth. Once you order your meat for your tacos, you are asked for what free extras you want. Most everyone says 'everything' and there in lies the flavor for the Tacos. There is a reason they give you free Guacamole for your tacos. No one gives free Guacamole. Walk to 9th Avenue. Between 42nd and 50th on 9th Avenue there are so many Mexican places to eat. Not a tourist trap either.
I am from San Diego and know authentic Mexican street tacos. This is the only place in NYC that even compares! Great place!!!

I love this place.  Some of the best tacos in the NY area. The steak taste great (seems like skirt steak).  I love the flour tortillas...very unique.  I prefer the quesadilla with steak (I like the cheese though it would be nice to have a little more cheese). Still, the toppings are excellent.  Even the horchata tastes authentic (served from very large jars, like one would find in Mexican grocery stores in California).  Hope they open a NJ location soon!

Carne asada tacos were really good. Loved the fact you can see the cook make your taco. Doesn't take long to get your tacos. Old school Spanish music was a plus. Price wasn't bad either, and looked pretty clean.

The food is amazing, service horrible! I found this place on Facebook and it looked like amazing eats. You have to ability to put as much salsa as u like. But there is no seating near by and the girls at the register have a bad attitude.  The one that took my order seemed like she did want to work then got my order wrong. I hope they get the service part right soon. I probably won't be back.
No comment

I heard this place was great but always wondered "how good can a taco be?". Well I finally tried this spot and it blew away my expectations! I ordered pork (Adobada), steak (Carne Asada), and cactus (Nopal) tacos with a corn tortilla. The pork was marinated so well and was dripping with yummy juices, the pineapple balances out the flavor! The cactus was also very enjoyable. The steak was also very good but a tad spicy, which I found to be not so balanced (give me more of that pork!). I will definitely be back and soon.

Great authentic Mexican food! I'm originally from the south, so I find myself craving some good street tacos, al pastor or the like, often now that I live in the north east. When Los Tacos opened up a few blocks away from my work, I immediately went to try it out for lunch. Although there was quite a long line the first time I went, it usually dissipates within 5 to 10 or 10 to 15 depending on when you get there. Lunch time it's the most packed, but they take your order efficiently and the cooks serve you just as fast. You hand them your ticket once you order and they create the food for you on sight. I get the chicken and pork tacos with chips and salsa each time, and each time it's awesome. The meat is marinated well, and the toppings (cilantro, guac, salsa, onions) are all great. I like spicy, and the salsa is hands down the spiciest and best i've had in the city since I moved here. pro tip: if you want it to-go you'll have to mention it for them to give you a bag for your stuff because otherwise it's served to stay. There are also no places to sit, you just stand and eat your food, but I don't mind it. You usually end up scarfing it down in a few bites because it's just that great!

Don't leave NYC without a stop here. I've enjoyed tacos all over Texas where I live and many other states in the US. I've also enjoyed taco while in Mexico. Tacos here at Los Tacos #1 are the best I've had. Don't know if it was the food itself or a combination of being in NYC and the restaurant, but it was excellent. My mouth is watering just writing this. Yum!!

This place deserves a million 1 star reviews. With how many people are constantly in and out of the place, you'd think it would be a mess, but the staff is always working hard and getting my order right. Horchata= amazing. Carne esada taco/quesadilla= amazing. Not sure why you'd even look at a Chipotle if you can go here.

Excellent tacos! The corn tortillas are soft but not chewy, the meat is tender and well seasoned, and the portions are hefty. They definitely fill each shell as much as they can without busting it. You can get guac an it does not cost extra which is a nice treat. Also for being in Times Square the price is unbeatable.

Would be 5 stars except there was a bit of a wait. That is only because they are so darn good. We found this place because of yelp and very happy we did. Tried 3 different meats in tacos. You won't be wrong picking anything!  Just be ready to wait a little if you go at a normal meal time.

Just had a late lunch there and the tacos were excellent. Great size tacos for the price. The staff is also attentive in ensuring customers are placing their orders right as you have to give your ticket at the counter after paying for them to start up your order.
Great food, great service, definitely worth the wait!  Make sure you try the salsas and guacamole.

First time trying this place :) Very pleased with the freshness and taste of the food.  The menu is simple but enough to give your palette a real party.  The place is not ur typical "sit down" type of joint. But still very good! Would definitely come back.

The best tacos I've ever had. I'm not a big fan of tacos but this place has amazing ones. The meat is not dry at all, it's juicy and flavorful, which cannot be said about all other taco places. The guacamole does not cost extra and comes with the taco. Also the cooks were super nice and actually interact with the customers.

Best tacos in NYC!!! (They even got a shoutout from Aziz Ansari in "Master of None".) This location has a lot more space to stand and eat than their original in Chelsea Market. The staff is super friendly and the location is bright, cheerful, and fun. This is a can't-miss when visiting NYC or as a local. I recommend getting the "mula" on a flour tortilla, al pastor - somewhere between a taco and a quesadilla because it comes with cheese.

Quality fast food--fresh and delivered quickly. I enjoyed the grilled cactus and my mate loved the chicken and steak. The tacos have a great zing taste from the sauce at the end. The ordering is simple and makes me eager to go back for more. We went for a quick bite before catching a matinee. It was a treat to have quality and quick wrapped into one.
Fresh and very tasty. Great casual lunch with authentic food. The medium salsa was a little hotter than expected but still really good. Had the pork and steak and could not decide which was better.

Best tacos I ever had! Especially the steak ones! Wow! Had to go back and eat there a couple of more times before we left New York! Pork and chicken were great also, but steak is definitely still a favorite. Staff is very friendly also. Great experience!
My favorite Tacos.  Actually never been to the restaurant but only eat take out lunch in the office. The quality of the steak, the corn tortilla, salsa, and all the sauces, perfect!

holllly shizzle, this place is ridiculous. finally a good taco place like they have in the mission. fast service, no frills, limited menu. the pork is the best meat, but they're all good. get the quesadilla and have your mind blown. What a gem in this neighborhood.

Have been coming to New York for last five years and never did I think I was going to find a place like this. Being from Los Angeles and having the best tacos around this place is just up there with any taco place from LA. This is a must when you get tired of having pizza.

DELICIOUS AUTHENTIC TACOS!! There is no seating- standing room only. Get there before the lunch hour rush or you'll be on a line that goes down the block! I had the chicken flour taco and a chicken taco in a cheese tortilla (the cheese tortilla is not listed on the menu, just ask for it ;) - so good) Thumbs up

Came here for the first time today and wasn't disappointed. I sent my husband here the other day and he made me come try it. Get the pork taco! So many wonderful flavors and the pineapple adds so much to it. They also have very flavorful guacamole, as well! Plus, you can't beat the price. It was a bit too loud, as far as music, but it was so good!
I work in Times Square so I've tried every restaurant around the area and this place is THE TRUTH!! So good, so fresh, and wallet friendly! Easy to take back to the office and chow down

Fast, efficient and really yummy tacos. Of the meat tacos (chicken, beef and pork), the pork (Adobada) was definite winner. If you don't like pork, then get the grilled chicken (Pollo Asado). No line and not too crowded on a summer weekend.

Had the Asadado & Carne Asada, was DELICIOUS.  You pay, take your ticket to one of the preparers and they make it right in front of you.  Choose corn or flour tacos and what sides you want.  Awesome!  Will be back!!!
This place is amazing... Food is authentic. Horchata is awesome. Pretty fast. Would definitely recommend.
Very good!  We had all types of tacos. Really liked the chicken. Did not like the cactus but probably a preferred choice for non meat eaters. Chips and guacamole very good!

I had the adobada Pork tacos and quesadilla with everything and Horchata. Filling, great for a snack. I loved the pork tacos they are juicy and just the right spice. Service is quick and there are various condiments available. Try the Horchata too. You would eat standing up. Do take the corn tacos.
Small portion but totally amazing tacos and quesadillas. This was our first stop in a the city just on a hunch but I'm glad we did. Seasoned and topped to perfection.

This is by far the best taco I have ever had. It was so juicy and the meat was flavored so well. I love how they basically made everything from scratch  (like the tortillas). The pork taco was by far the best. I just wish there was one by my house so I could go I've been craving them ever since I got back from New York
This is a great place! Tacos are just amazing. A true taste of the south. I need to go back before I head back to San Antonio.

The food is REALLY good, possibly some of the most authentic tacos in NYC. however, it wad ridiculously pricey. i had two carne asada tacos and a drink at $12. the staff was very nice and quick with the food. if you are looking for a splurge on tacos then this place would be great for you.

Staff was really friendly and fast! I got two tacos; one carne asada, one chicken, chips, salsa & guac. Very juicy tacos and they are generous on the meat. Recommend eating there on your way to your Times Square adventures and you can walk it off. There is no seating (or restroom) so if your feet are tired make this a stop for on the way to where you're going. The chips are delicious, perfectly salty and crunchy. Salsa is a bit on the spicy side, all in all great flavor!
LOVE these tacos!  A hugely welcome addition to Times Square business district.  Hence the big ol' line at lunch time.

I never really liked authentic tacos till I tried it here. This place seriously had the best tacos I've ever had! I would definitely come back to NY to eat at this place again. My favorite was the steak!
Fantastic tacos and salsa... and the 'hot' sauce is actually hot! Can't believe this is in Times Square!

This place is exactly what Manhattan needed in the heart of Times Square.  Good quality inexpensive food that hits the spot every time.  If you're a fan of street style tacos, Los Tacos will rock your world.
Best tacos in New York.  From Merced CA where there is lots of taco shops.. this is very authentic Mexican food.. must use for parties!!!

The food is tasty but coming here is an experience in discrimination if you don't speak Spanish. Man taking the ticket will look at you and then take ticket from the Spanish speaker who stepped up after you. Haven't had that experience in the Chelsea market location

Really authentic environment and food. Delicious. Fresh ingredients. Real Mexican food truck style just like being in Mexico. Take a trip to the border and stop by Los Tacos No.1 to enjoy some really good and cheap tacos! Must try!
Best tacos I've ever had!! I live in California and would definitely come back to New York for these delicious tacos!!
Love these tacos! They are so flavorful and good, I would say my favorite is the steak taco. Not very cheap but it's worth to try since they are the best tacos I have tasted so far.
Quick and delightful stop for tacos at times square! Definitely try the pork and beef tacos which were flavourful!
Had already eaten dinner when we walked passed this place. The smell was so inviting and the taco was so good!

I loved the food!  It was authentic and spiced to perfection.  The atmosphere was simply perfect for exquisitely tasting tacos as you're immersed in the excitement of Manhattan and want to grab a bite to eat that will complement a vibrant day.

Food was great! Although on the spicey side. There servings were small but surprisingly fulfilling. There place would've been so much better if there were seats. Once it's packed there's a greater chance you'll be standing and eating outside our waiting for a table inside

After you pay for your order, you hand your receipt to the chefs behind the counter and they are made fresh right in front of you.  I had the pork taco and quesadilla and both were so good with all the topping. The steak taco is good but the pork is definitely the highlight. The pineapple that they put on the tacos make it pretty tasty too. The only thing I wish were that it could be slightly cheaper. But other than that I would definitely return!
The best tacos/quesadillas you will ever have. It's a little crowded but the food is absolutely amazing. Would definitely come here again..

I'm from California and this place has by far the best tacos I have ever tried! You have to try their pork and asada tacos with everything on it! So sad about not having something similar to this place in Cali. You have to try them, they are #1 like their name says!
food is very nice, but the cleanliness of the place and the amount of tourists make it hard place to really enjoy yoir meal. would suggest to take your food for take away.
THE BEST Mexican food I have had since I moved to the City from CA! Reasonably priced for the city. authentic. Quick. Hot. Great!

Tacos were delicious, although I was a little thrown off that there's basically no seating and I had to eat standing up.  My friend who's from Mexico recommended this and stated it's the best taco place she's ever been to, and I agree!
love this place!!! the staff is super friendly and the tacos are great. especially the grilled steak tacos. It also has a great mexican vibe to it.

Great tasting tacos- the ingredients, spices and sauces they use make for excellent tacos that'll make you wish you had ordered another one! Prices are also excellent for the quality food that you are getting. I love the pork tacos with pineapple!
Hands down the best street tacos/quesadillas I've ever had in my life! My kids that don't even like steak absolutely LOVED the carne asada! We will make the trip back her before we leave town!
Authentic, affordable and delicious Mexican fare central to Broadway and Times Square.  Stand up eating only. Highly recommend it.
I was visiting NYC from Dallas and could not believe the I eat the best Mexican tacos ever in Time Square. The corn tortillas are handmade and delicious.

I was an instant fan thanks to the quality tacos, friendly and efficient service, and laid-back vibe. I tried the chicken and marinated pork tacos with the corn tortillas. Once you pick up your order, you can go over to a little salsa bar to enhance your taco with complimentary radishes (yes please!), limes, spicy, medium, and mild salsa. I recommend trying a little spicy salsa on the chicken. And on a hot day, nothing beats a mexican coke. I'll be back!
It's so good that I'm mad about it. This place has officially ruined all other tacos for me. These are hands down the best tacos I have ever had in my life.
Doesn't get any better than this! Maybe the best tacos I've ever eaten, get the beef and pork ones! Super cheap, fast service and amazing flavors!

Best tacos ever. I go here once a week minimum (they just opened). But that wont stop! they are so fresh and delicious. The workers are all very nice and the owners are too (I assume an owner asked how our food was) I look forward to my next meal (next week for sure)
found this place while needing a quick, affordable last minute preshow snack and it definitely satisfied! it was sooo good and the line moves quickly

This place is amazing! The tacos are divine and so are the quesadillas.  They have a small station of salsas and condiments that add a lot to your meal. Will definitely be going here when ever I'm nearby.
No comment

The entrance is beautiful and the atmosphere is lively. A lot of young patrons given its location in Soho and that it is in the lobby of a trendy hotel. Overall the food was tasty but it came out cold. To be fair, our party was in the larger side (at 6) for brunch. The service was good. Our waitress was sweet, but she did not come to check on us that much. Overall a trendy restaurant with good food, but I was not blown away.
No comment

Super romantic place and best on an early Sunday morning brunch when there is no crowd. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious! Highly recommended if you want to feel transported to another place...
No comment
No comment
honestly the best steak and eggs i've ever had even though it's such a simple dish. i've always liked steak but never craved it. ever since I came here I always crave steak and eggs.

If you love cold food, poor service and lots of fruit flies to swat when you are eating, this place is for you! I've heard some good things about this place so I was looking forward to going, however, I left disappointed. Was there with a friend who has been there before and said when she was there last year. We had a flat bread and the steak/eggs. the food came out cold and the steak was overcooked. Server never really came around to check in on us, and the restaurant wasn't overly busy at the time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The first time I came here was pre pandemic in 2018. I don't remeber it being THIS good. If anything I remeber not liking it. Then, we same here again this summer for our friends birthday and we loved it. The service was amazing, the food was just perfect and so was the desert. We got a lot of good drinks, the food was amazing and we definitely will be back again. The whole restaurant was just gorgeous and so pleasing to see.

If i could leave 0 stars i definitely would. We walked in for a 12:30 reservation at 12:10. The restaurant had about 4/5 tables seated and 3/4 servers and busters. We were waiting for 15 minutes and no one approached our table. A table was sat after us and they were greeted and offered water while we were still sitting for 15 minutes with no service not even a greeting. 0/10 would not come back "NOMO".

No comment

Went here for a birthday breakfast to start our day and really enjoyed it! Sat outside and the atmosphere was super cute with chandeliers and a bar outside as well. The food was good for the price. We ordered the breakfast pizza, French toast, and pancakes which were all amazing! The only complaint would be the service wasn't very good. They were busy but the server couldn't seem to keep up with his section and was not very attentive. Over all I would suggest this place to try but probably won't be back regularly.

NOMO Kitchen exceeded my expectations! We walked in on a Sunday morning before 10 am and the place was not nearly as busy as I was prepared for. The atmosphere inside the restaurant is gorgeous, loved the amount of light and decor in the room. I ordered the breakfast sandwich, and felt I got my $22 worth between portion size and quality. The soft ciabatta was perfect for the sandwich and the addition of the bacon jam and arugula to the eggs and sausage was delicious. The side salad was also good. I did not try my friends breakfast pizza but she enjoyed it as well. I thought appearance wise it could have been a little more glamorous but sometimes that's not the most important :) Would return if in the area and willing to spend a bit more!
No comment

My apologies for not posting this sooner. Leytin and the staff at NOMO waited on about 18 of my professors and cohorts as well as myself Thursday evening. We did not make it easy on the team. We kept changing seats consistently. Some of our party left mid meal and showed up late. They were ever so gracious and lovely. They accommodated every challenge we placed before them with a smile and kindness. They made sure everybody had the right orders at all times. The manager even came out to greet us and make sure that we were all taken care of. Bravo NOMO. I had the pan seared octopus which was cooked perfectly. The duck dish made my taste buds dance. I want the straw mousse recipe! We all agreed that it brought back memories of childhood. Being educators and students from a hospitality and tourism school #fdu we are definitely hard to please. You made our evening enjoyable and most importantly without incident. We will definitely be back, thank you again!
No comment

Nomo kitchen is one of my most favorite places in nyc. They have an undefeated charred octopus and one of my most favorite mock/cocktails I've ever had, the "Nomo regrets" I can't visit New York and not go there

Cute place, food looks presentable but doesn't taste as good as it looks. We asked for medium rare steak and they gave us medium well, the waiter knew that it was medium well and he was trying to argue that it was medium rare. I got it sent it back and it came back rare... At that point, I didn't want to argue anymore and ate it anyway. I had a feeling they would do that because they didn't seem to care about accommodating us. The only thing that was actually good was the lemon ricotta pancakes but not worth coming back here.
No comment
The ambiance is very pretty! The service was awesome. The food was bland. The drinks are good depending on the bartender that makes them.
No comment

Beautiful space with an upscale ambience! My wonderful friends brought me to NOMO kitchen to celebrate my birthday, back in February. It was way better than I anticipated. Firstly, NOMO is located within the NOMO hotel. A fairly short walk from the Canal street subway stations. Upon arrival, there is a beautiful lighted garden and walkway that offers great photo-ops. Inside was just as nice. The lobby is well lit with a variety of spaces to take photos or lounge about chatting. I loved the variety of colors, from the painting, to the lighted signs. Inside the restaurant gave off a beautiful rustic feel with sky light roofing, draping, big plants, colorful artwork, and big chandeliers. So pretty! My friends made a reservation via resy, so we were able to sit within minutes. They started the night with drinks however, I did not have any alcohol. We also did not partake in appetizers. For my entree, I had the half chicken with seasoned fingerling potatoes. The chicken was moist and delicious. I especially enjoyed the crispy skin. I honestly did not expect it to be so good. My friends also enjoyed their meals including: bone-in pork chop and a butternut squash pasta dish. We did not opt for dessert as we were going to a dessert bar afterwards. All-in-all, our meals were wonderful. Staff were also very kind and attentive; no issues. The ambience itself, was very upscale. I don't know if there is a dress code however, most people seemed business casual. We were dressed up fancy since it was my birthday. Overall, a wonderful, upscale experience. I would definitely return as I am interested in the brunch. Highly recommended.
No comment

Super cute interior, very nice service and super easy to get a seat during the day. I would definitely come here for pictures and drinks! But probably not the food. It's really terrible hotel stale food but it's not the servers fault it's just the hotel cutting cost! But overall it was still a good experience and would go back for a drink!
No comment
The ambiance was great, very pretty and clean. Our server Tenzen was splendid!! He was very attentive and caring and made sure we were 100% satisfied.The food was also spectacular and came out quick.
I loved it here. We stayed in the NOMO hotel and this was a perfect breakfast treat in the morning. Amazing atmosphere and amazing food

Beautifully decorated place in a beautifully decorated hotel. The food was tasty and the service was decent, but like many places in New York, the food was overpriced. I tried the ricotta pancakes and brisket eggs Benedict and both were good!

Both our dishes had something wrong with the salt levels; the Cacio e Pepe was too salty and the Rigatoni needed more salt. The main appeal of this restaurant was the ambience and aesthetics. I would recommend getting a table inside rather than in their outside seating area. Service was very good as well. This would be a nice restaurant for a first date or just a date night in general.
Came back for brunch and the food was so good and also got the mocktails called roll with the punch.
The tomato sauce pasta with shrimp tasted like canned tomato sauce. The cacio e pepe was good and the drinks were alright. The service could have been a lot better. The atmosphere is amazing tho.

Had breakfast here during our last stay at the Nomo hotel. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the staff is very friendly and attentive. Every dish we tried was truly amazing. Excellent breakfast place in Soho.

Good food - the service was spotty. We had a decent sized group so giving some grace there. We tried several apps, entrees, and desserts and was not disappointed.

Came for an early morning brunch, and couldn't have found anything better than the adorable dinning room, good prices, and great food at NOMO kitchen. Split the breakfast pizza and the pancakes, both had great flavor and were very unique. The chandeliers and patio area were so beautiful, great brunch spot off the beaten path jn soho!

The menu is very limited on weekdays during lunch time. I made a reservation through open table and I formed them that we would be late for an hour and they still were able to accommodate us despite being busy. I'd say that the only good thing about this restuarant is how beautiful it is decorated. Other than that, the food is not all that and the price for it is way too high.

Super cute atmosphere. Our server was so friendly and sweet, food was great. At first it came out cold but they quickly sent it back and returned a fresh new order which was delicious. They took our coffees off the bill for the inconvenience. If going for brunch definitely get the lemon ricotta pancakes and nutella stuffed french toast! Great spot, would definitely come back for drinks, lunch/dinner.

Lovely second experience at NOMO Kitchen. I haven't been here in years and I loved the brunch and decor before so I finally got the chance to revisit. It is such an instagrammable place, once you arrive, so definitely take some pics! Make sure to make a reservation as it does get busy and people do special occasions too. When me and my friend arrived we were seated quickly. It was right by the door to outdoor seating so the draft was annoying though. Our waiter came immediately and was attentive and nice the whole time. I'm the only one who got a cocktail, Soho Dreams, and it was so tasty! I love herbal-y drinks and this was one of them. For my brunch meal I got the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with mixed berries and a side of eggs. I don't really like lemon that much but I do have to say it was really good and the taste wasn't too strong. Me and my friend were trying to figure out how they made the pancakes so thick and firm yet so soft inside! I originally ordered the French Toast but I have a serious nut allergy and the waiter let me know it was infused with nutella. Sucks! The pancakes are very filling so be prepared. My friend got the Roasted Tomato and Basil flatbread and that was soo good too. Prices are standard for NY...pricey but worth it in my opinion!

Service was kinda slow. They took forever to bring our food and drinks and the checks as well due to a confusion?? Idk. Despite that, the food and drinks were pretty good and the workers were very nice.
The marble with blue accents in the rooms with the natural light open the rooms. Really loved my stay and the art in the restaurant.

A great place for outdoor dining! They have a great patio. My friend and I came in for brunch this past weekend. We made a reservation which I suggest. We started with oat milk lattes. They were large and tasty! My friend got the breakfast sandwich. I got the Nutella French toast. I should have gotten the pancakes though because they looked absolutely amazing. The French toast was pretty good. But not very filling. A good brunch spot to check out.

Foods are so good , the restaurant is very pretty  3 stars for service  for the price point we expected the great service . She didn't ask if we have any foods allergies also nobody explained about menu

When I arrived they wanted to give us an indoor dining (which mind you the indoor greenhouse is gorgeous but also we are not ready to dine indoors due to covid) when we asked to be seated outdoors the staff member kind of gave us attitude and made us wait, even though it was on our reservation. Once seated the waiter was not at all pleasant. It felt like the attitude of the staff did not match the beauty of the decor and the food. It was like every mistake they made that we asked to be corrected was a hassle. Which is a shame because the food was so good! But not sure I would go back.

I love the ambiance of this place! The entrance is so beautiful at night and the interior is amazing. This is definitely an instagramable spot. One thing I will say is the host and bartenders were kind of rude to my friend which was annoying, they definitely have an attitude. But our waiter inside was super nice. The food we ordered was good but definitely overpriced for basic pasta and added grilled chicken. The drinks were good though, the espresso martini is a must try. But again I do feel they're overpriced for what they are. I would say this was a fun place to check out for the ambiance and some photos but overall not worth it for the food. Would maybe come again with someone who is visiting just for drinks.

I am a guest at NoMo Soho for a 4 night stay.  I've had some service issues, but nothing like dining at NoMo Kitchen.  Waiter is incredibly rude and one dish for our 3-guest brunch arrived with plastic mixed in.  Despite bringing this serious concern to his attention, his interest in providing appropriate service remains unchanged. This is my third time at NoMo Soho.  Will have to rethink where I stay next month upon my return. Very disappointing!

Everything from start to finish was wonderful. When you walk your you are greeted by the host and they took our temperature and requested we use the hand sanitizer provided. The decor and artwork is beautiful. The food was made perfectly and the ingredients were fresh. The burrata and brisket tacos were a table favorite. I'm definitely coming back for brunch or just drinks and a bite. Highly recommend.

Nice protocols in place for COVID. The food was delicious. The venue is stunning. Only compliant was our serve. He seemed to rush us and if we asked for an extra plate/napkin, etc. he seemed annoyed. Don't want to ding the place on one worker.

The outside area was heated and filled with trees or something like plants. Felt very green house. The entrance as you walk in is a great spot for photographs. I'm going back soon and will leave another review, but perfect for date night.

Super aesthetic restaurant inside a trendy hotel. The entrance of the hotel is gorgeous and perfect for pictures. Their outdoor dining setup is really nice, they have 1-2 heat lamps for every table and fire lamps outside. It is very nicely decorated. We made a reservation for dinner and arrived 20 minutes early but it was no problem and we were seated. There's a scannable menu. We ordered the truffle prosciutto pizza to share, and a pasta dish each- the lobster fusilli and the rigatoni with added steak. Everything arrived promptly, but the service was a bit slow. Besides taking our orders, we never saw our waiter. Our dishes were brought out by a different worker. He only stopped by once right before we were done to refill our water bottle that had been empty for most of our meal. The pizza was a great starter and tasted great. The lobster pasta was really flavorful, you could taste the lobster flavor on the pasta, and it came with a good amount of lobster. The rigatoni was really undercooked and hard. I like al dente pasta but it was just hard to chew. The steak, however, was nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. Would come again for the atmosphere, but not the food.

Nomo kitchen is restaurant inside of Nomo hotel. Great spacious place perfect for meeting friends and very aesthetic decorations. I wish their lunch menu was larger or they would have brunch daily. We both got pasta,the Vongole and the spicy tomato rigatoni, the portions weren't that big but I had to say I was impress with the taste. Both were really good and flavorful.

We went for a brunch at NOMO kitchen yesterday with my 2 year old son. I made reservation 2 days ago and I always wanted to go there. The ambiance is nice and we had overall good experience with service and food. We had ordered flatbread for my son and he didn't finish it so we bought leftover at home. Today, I was feeding him the flatbread and the piece of plastic paper came out from middle of flatbread as seen in picture. I felt so bad as my son ate this yesterday and today both days. I am disappointed and I think they should inspect and take extra precaution while cooking.
Food was amazing and very tasteful! I also got the rotini drink and it was yummy  definitely would go back!

Food was good for the price. We got the salmon and the chicken. Chicken was sooo good and juicy! Cute for a brunch date or a girls day out!

I've been coming here for years such a fun spot! For starters, the entire ambiance is 10/10 and it's really pretty so you will get lots of good pictures. Usually come here for brunch - the pancakes are the thing to get. Would also recommend the avocado toast if pancakes aren't your vibes. Drinks are good too! I really like the bloody mary. Coffee is good and strong. They also have plastic straw which I deeply appreciate. The outdoor setup is super cute and super warm! They have heaters for every table. Always a good vibe here!!

My friend and I made a reservation here about a month ago for brunch since we saw they had outdoor dining and heaters. We specifically stated on our reservation that we wanted to be seated outdoors. The food was great! But the service was terrible. I got there on time, and they said that I had to wait for my friend to get there, which is fine. But when my friend got there, they seemed to forget that we reserved outdoor dining and made us wait indoors for them to prepare the outdoor area. The server seemed very grumpy and rude, and they also made a mistake when bringing out our order. My friend ordered a tea, but he brought her a coffee, and he gave us attitude when we pointed out that we never ordered a coffee. They also gave me a tea bag in a cup without any hot water; I had to ask for hot water which seems like a no brainer. It was also very cold and our feet were freezing. They had a heater above the table, but it would have been better if they had a heater on the floor too, or a different style of heat lamp that would properly heat the area more. 3 stars for the food! The food was delicious and filling, but for the price of the food, I'd expect better service. The food itself was also overpriced for what it was (dessert brunch items). And tea was overpriced, although I suppose that's common for most Manhattan restaurants.

Great, lively (and somewhat upscale) establishment. Perfect for brunch but I have a horrible impression of the food based on the kale salad that I ordered which was basically kale drenched in SALT. Breadcrumbs were essentially salt crackers and I dont think Ill be going back again. Eggs would have been the safer choice but still, I did not enjoy my brunch experience. Basically paid $20 for a few pieces of chicken. Kale was essentially untouched and staff didn't seem concerned at all.
The cutest lunch spot in the city. It's a must visit for tourists or locals. The breakfast pizza is lovely.

This place is very pretty can't deny that. When we got there we took pictures because there is a beautiful area to take pictures worth taking your jacket off for in the cold. Then they let us sit in the lobby while we waited for our table. Only took about 10 mins w our reservation. Being outside, we were freezing. Shivering. But for the people who sat by the heating lamps they were more comfortable. I got the pancakes. They were good, but I asked 2 different ppl for syrup and never received it. Waitress was sweet though. That's my review :) I would recommend this place . But make sure you're by a hearing lamp(I wasn't) or you're wasting your time.

Found this restaurant for a final day in NY. Disappointed with the menu, and kinda reminded me of bad hotel food. I ordered GF avo toast- )16- for 2 soggy toasts with mashed avo that could have used some salt. ...meanwhile my friends breakfast sandwich with many more ingredients was only $9... and they forgot the GF bread- then there were 2 servers giving conflicting information if it was in fact GF... turns out it was not- and no discount was given for the inconvenience. The ambiance looks cooler online that in person. A restaurant designed for instagrammers. Will not be returning.

Don't know why would anyone rate it less than 5-stars! I love this place and have been to NOMO at least 4 times, which is a bit shocking given that we do not go to places more than once or twice, but NOMO is something else, its special. I love the ambience, service and food. My favorite Avocado toast in all of NYC, fluffy pancakes and delishh Eggs Benedict. Would keep going to this place, but we keep it for special occasions, birthdays and anniversaries.
This place is great for drinks and meting with friends. They are haven good breakfast but don't have much options for dinner or lunch.

The only thing I liked about this place was the atmosphere, it was such a pretty place. I had made a reservation and was so excited to come here. We came for brunch on a chilly morning, and were seated right when we got there. None of the egg dishes or brunch dishes were very special/exceptional EXCEPT for the Nutella French Toast. I love nutella, and this was absolutely delicious (but definitely on the heavy side). The service was a little slow, and they weren't able to find any hot sauce for my friend's eggs, but overall it was a nice experience.

Very instagramable corridor to walk into the hotel lobby. The restaurant itself looks very pretty and bright. The brunch was decent. Nothing creative, but all taste good. Service was OK, you need to make a bit of effort to get waitors to come over. They take reservations, and we got a reservation just an hour before we go. Good place to go for last minute brunch at weekends

Admittedly, I've tried everything on this menu, but I'm here to talk about a specific dish--the spicy rigatoni. If you are unsure what to do order, get the rigatoni. If you like pasta, get the rigatoni. If you like mild spice, get the rigatoni. If you enjoy heaven in your mouth, get the rigatoni. I have dreams of this dish. I think about this dish on a regular basis. It's that amazing. If you're still reading this review and haven't ordered...what are you doing?!

The food came fast and absolutely love the decoration and environment, the portion of the food was a big disappointed, price is higher than average

A gorgeous place that is perfect for dates. I enjoyed my time over-there. You have to make a reservation before you go. The prices are moderately expensive.

Bombass food. We ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, the steak and eggs and the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. I think the food was exceptional and its one of the best brunch places in Soho. The environment was great and we went on Saturday during lunch and it wasn't as crowded as expected. I love the greenhouse interior, its a great environment to be in. However, the servers were not that attentive and we were seated by the door and it was cold.

This place has one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. It's a spicy Red sauce that's second to none and also their spaghetti is really good. The bartender made me a custom cocktail that was made from a Norwegian alcohol and it was amazing. Definitely a go to spot in SOHO

Came here for Sunday brunch for a friend's birthday. We had a reservation for 9. Even though we were late, they still seated us right away! I really appreciated that. The service was great and the food was delicious! Their lemon ricotta pancakes are easily the best brunch item! They were so fluffy with just the right amount of lemon flavor. I still crave them time to time. The decor is absolutely beautiful- a very instagrammable backdrop. If you're looking for a trendy and classy brunch spot, this is the best spot!

NOMO kitchen has always given me a pleasant experience. I come here a lot with friends because the ambience is stunning and it's a soothing place to come eat, laugh, relax and have a good time. Everyone comes in dressed up. The food is amazing and the staff have always been great to me. The only reason I don't give them the last star is because there have been times when coming in to eat and utensils are not cleaned properly and we have to request something new and cleaner. Other than that I enjoy coming here. I love sitting outside and having coffee with a friend. Dining in even feels like an outside experience and I always have an amazing time. All my friends enjoy coming here and I need to finally make the time to come in for dinner to enjoy the food too.

Love love love the ambience at this restaurant, so bright and uplifting. I really enjoyed the brunch here. Traditional brunch menu that lives up to expectations but portion sizes are quite modest. Will definitely be back- perhaps for dinner next time!

The food was good and the decor was beautiful. However, the service was terrible. Rude waiter and extremely slow service. I understand that it is Covid and they might be understaffed, but the service was out of control slow along with the waiter being very rude. They also no longer offer bottomless brunch and that was the whole reason we went there. Very disappointing.
Perfect romantic cozy place for out of town guest brunch or coffee or glass of wine to chill and chat.

Came here for brunch and it was horrible! Had reservations and there was no host outside, so we had to go inside the restaurant to get someone to seat us. The worker then told us to go upstairs to get checked in, when we went upstairs they told us to go back downstairs. What a waste of time! Speaking of time, when we finally got seated they waiter took forever to take our order. The people who were seated after us already had their orders taken. And the food took forever to be served!!! It took over 45 minutes for our food to be served. We had reservations at 10:30 and didn't finish until 1:00 and the manager told us that our time was over and we had to leave, we were basically getting kicked out. No one told us that we had a time limit and if the food didn't take so long to serve we wouldn't even be there for so long. After we started eating we ordered a side of bacons and we were worried that  it would take long so we asked the waiter how long a side of bacons would take and he said 2 minutes but guess what?! It took 20-25 minutes to serve and it was served when we were being forced to leave. And good thing we checked the receipt because they charged us for an extra mimosa and an extra steak and eggs and that we did not order and did not get. The waiter never came and checked on us, service was horrible, didn't like the fact that a 20% gratuity was added on to the bill automatically. If the service was good I would obviously leave a good tip but we didn't even get any service. Paid $50 for tips to a server that didn't even check on us to see if we needed extra water or anything. I know it's busy, so maybe the restaurant should get some extra staffs. Also food was subpar, ordered a medium steak got it well done. Had to send it back to the kitchen but took forever because the waiter never came back to check on us! Ugh save your time and go somewhere else with better food and service. Really should've checked Yelp before coming here because they have a low rating and now I see why.

Great food! The meat dish I got was a lot for one person and could definitely be split between two people. The scallop appetizer was underwhelming for $30+ and I could not taste the peas in the pea sauce. It was hard to get the attention of the waiters which lead to a lot of unnecessary waiting for the check. My father ordered a fish dish and the plating+ size of the fish DID NOT justify the price. The decor is nice and it's definitely an experience. Don't come here if you're not willing to wait ~30 min for your main course since they probably make it upon order.

The pancake was good, but nothing super special. Giving it 4 stars because this is one of the prettiest brunch places in NYC. From the entrance to the inside, everything is so pretty! If you are coming here for the picture and the vibe, you won't be disappointed.
No comment

This place has such a pretty interior and nice ambiance. The only thing I would recommend is making a reservation if possible. Last time I came here on a Sunday there was a wait. The pancakes were so light and airy it was super tasty. Usually I'm not a fan of pancakes when its drenched in syrup but honestly it had the perfect amount of syrup. The seasonal fruits are also fresh and sweet. Honestly this place is quite pricy but for a nice instagram worthy picture and some pretty good food I would say it's worth a one time splurge. Just not something I would go to all the time though.

Beautiful atmosphere, beautiful food, and beautiful people at this restaurant. It's like stepping into a greenhouse full of hipsters and fashionistas who deciding, we all should have brunch. This is a great place to escape the city and enjoy the little things. It may be pricey to some but it's well worth it in my opinion. I wasn't too hungry so I got the fish tacos and it was just what I needed. It was delicious and beautiful to look at. My fiancé had the salmon burger which she said was one of the best burgers she has ever had. We will be back!!

We enjoyed an incredible out door brunch today. Everything was absolutely amazing from the food, ambiance and service. Chef Omar truly made delicious works of art and our server Angelo was on point. He was very accommodating to my entire family. Can't wait to bring friends back.

Always such a pleasure to brunch here. Beautiful interiors with natural light just have you start a day perfectly. The lemon ricotta pancakes are on point. Overall great experience, we first sat in the lounge and were assisted by Maddie , she didn't look like she was happy to be at work. However host was very accommodating and moved us to the dinning room quickly were we had great brunch with delicious food and bottomless mimosas, interior and atmosphere is beautiful! I would recommend! Our server at the dining room Peyton has been phenomenal!

AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING experience . I had my bridesmaid brunch yesterday . They sat us in a booth in the back so we had privacy . What made this experience so amazing was the service provided by our waitress . Her name is Keely. I went to So many restaurants in my life and I have to say she beat all of them. Sooooooo friendly , welcoming , so attentive , and most importantly no attitude. The place is beautiful , the DJ played really good music. Not loud enough that you can't hear each other speak but loud enough to dance a little in your seat while eating. I had to Nutella French toast . Very delicious . My bridesmaids had eggs , sausage , their bacon was delish . The desserts were sooooo good . I love the sundae with the vanilla bean ice cream . I would love to go back . I highly recommend ! Ty Nomo Kitchen for our free mimosas!  5 stars all the way !

Worst place! Don't get me wrong, the scenery was beautiful but the food and service was horrible. Wonderful, friendly staff. Went for brunch and food was amazing. We had the avocado toast and eggs Benedict. Highly recommend.

The worst I have had in a long time in NYC. firstly the sat us in the middle of the empty restaurant and if you have been before it's very bright rectangular space so we felt very odd. Loved this place! Their service is awesome, everyone was super friendly. The food was really good, just a bit pricy. Their cocktails were also super yummy! Would recommend to anyone looking for a gorgeous restaurant for lunch or brunch.

Beautiful ambiance and the food wasn't bad either but the service was terrible. The host who sat us down also messed up our bill at the end, charging us double for our meal, we had to send it back to correct it. That's never happened to me in any restaurant I've ever been to.

I know the food here is bomb but omg. we paid so much money for food plus to stay at this hotel and the hostess treated us like s***!! the restaurant was COMPLETELY empty. not a soul in sight seated. we were the first at the hostess table and she asked if we had a reservation and when we said we didn't then said ok then move to the side, and she proceeded to ignore us for over 10 minutes while helping out multiple guests in line behind us. i mean are u KIDDING. like all she had to do was be kind. we pay too much money for that. i don't know if she was having a bad day or something, but the amount of attitude she was treating us with was extremely unprofessional and disrespectful.

Love love Love! It's not only beautiful it's delicious as well. I ordered fish tacos with mango salsa and they were cooked well I just needed hot sauce which they have but you must ask. This spot was amazing. I was looking for a brunch spot in Soho to take a friend who isn't from NYC. I was hoping I wouldn't find a crowded place. NOMO is so large there was plenty of seating & the food was delicious. The music was kind of loud. But overall, it was a great find!

Had a really great time this past Friday for Valentine's day. The ambiance was great, the staff was very attentive, and the food was delicious. Don't be fooled- it's not just a brunch spot! I would recommend this spot for a Valentine's Day date.

Love this place. So pretty and romantic! We came here for dinner and really loved the setting. Our server was great and so friendly, I have no idea what others are talking about. I grabbed the risotto and my date got the tagliatelle. Greatly enjoyed both, he said the tagliatelle was his favorite pasta dish in the city. The drinks were delicious. It was a great night!
This is a great spot for lunch/business meetings. I bring clients here often and it's always a hit. The shishito peppers and brussel sprouts are my favorite. The service is always great too.

Some of the best food I've had in NYC. Strong drinks go see a bartender named Freddy he's great at what he does and easy to hold a conversation with. Beautiful entrance and the chandelier and glass ceilings are to died for. Food and service was excellent.
Great ambience and decor, dog friendly, good breakfasts. A hidden gem or oasis for locals. And free coffee!
You need a second round meal after dining here to rinse out the taste because the food is so bad

Nomo is always a must whenever I'm in New York! Not only is the atmosphere beautiful but the food is amazing! I love the flat pizzas , they are so crispy and unique in flavors !

Everything about this place was STUNNING. From the decor to the food- definitely a 5 star rating. It was a hot day so I ordered the fish tacos. They were not only aesthetically pleasing but delicious as well. They were light battered and the aioli was creamy and it added a lot of taste to the meal. It was a light meal - 3 tacos, not heavy at all and yet I was so full. For desert, we ordered the cobbler. It was great too. The vanilla bean ice cream complemented the dish nicely. I would hands down come back again !!!

Very hip and swanky restaurant.  I came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch.  I ordered the salmon scramble and the French toast.  Literally one of the best and most savory brunches I have ever had.  The bloody Mary was strong, the coffee was delicious.  Left VERY satisfied.
Maria is the best!!! Made our whole experience so much better! She did the most for us when we were celebrating a birthday!

I came here for lunch one afternoon. I ordered grilled chicken, it was displayed beautifully but it didn't do anything for my stomach. The taste was mediocre and I was still hungry afterwards. It was just the chicken for $25, without any sides -_-. My desert was really good but still overpriced. It is a beautiful place that is bright with lovely chandeliers. Under the table have a convenient hook for hanging handbags. The service was great, overall my experience was wonderful.
No comment

I heard about this place through social media and friends and was excited to check the place out. I went with 3 other friends and we got there around 4 pm. There was no hostess in the front and so we waited a few minutes. I decided to walk up to a waiter to ask for a table, and he answers with "we're closed" with an attitude. Obviously we were confused sense they close at 9. Another waiter came by, he also looked irritated for some reason, and explained to us that they couldn't sit anyone else until 5. We even asked if we could reserve when they open it up at 5 again and he even seemed irritated with that question. We didn't understand why they were pretty much closing for an hour, especially sense there were still people who were eating and drinking there. We would've waited until 5 to be seated, but because of the bad service and unnecessary attitude towards us we left. Definitely won't come by again.
Great atmosphere and staff for the dinner crowds. Special are nice, however, a combination of appetizers can make for a great choice.

Went with a few friends for brunch. We had an amazing experience great food and drinks. We had a lot items on the brunch menu and the food was flavorful and the service was superb. Our waiter was wonderful his name was ANGELO. We had kids with us and they loved all the food. Burgers are flavorful. Lamb chops the bomb. Pancakes awesome. Shrimp tacos. It was all amazing. Chef Carlos and Chef Omar rock. Now Go eat!

Amazing start to the weekend here! We ordered lemon ricotta pancakes to share! This can't be missed at all..! Eggs Benedict minus the bacon with avocado on the side! Delicious! A friend ordered the avocado toast! Gorgeous decor makes for some great pics on insta

Really a 3.5 stars experience, mostly because the service/waitstaff was superb, specifically Ari. Get the lemon ricotta pancakes! If you're looking for an Insta-worthy ambience, you've found the right place.
No comment

At 25% capacity due to covid restrictions, there were maybe 20 tables.  The restaurant was full but not slammed in the traditional sense.  Ambiance is nice, food was excellent, but the wait was extremely unnecessary.  Had a reservation and several parties that arrived after us were seated before us.  Waited about 15-20 min after seating before server appeared.  Waited another 40 minutes for drinks.  But they did seem to have it more on point by the time they brought the food...aside from the 2 times they brought our table someone else's order.  The pan fried octopus was stellar.  And the salmon was cooked perfectly, moist and flaky with crispy skin.  The lobster pasta dish also very good.  My friend thought the risotto had too much pepper.  Overall, well worth it but pack your patience and don't go super hungry.

The food and drinks were good. The manager was obnoxious. We had a reservation and waited to be seated for 45 minutes. We were not offered anything while waiting. Have a back up plan if you plan to go!

Overall an amazing experience at NOMO Kitchen! Their outdoor space is amazing, has ambient lighting and lots of greenery, perfect for dinner with friends or date nights. Our server was attentive and pleasant and offered great suggestions. My friends and I shared multiple dishes; the duck ragu pappardelle, arugula salad, roasted chicken with scallions, rack of lamb with tzatziki and the steak & asparagus. All the dishes were flavorful, seasoned well, with decent portions. The standouts to me were the duck ragu pappardelle it was just damn tasty tbh, noodles were perfectly cooked and the sauce was full of flavor. Other standouts would be the rack of lamb dish cooked perfectly med rare and seasoned well & the arugula salad was simple but tasty and well dressed. The only reason I wasn't as drawn to the steak or chicken dish was probably because of how flavor packed the pasta and lamb was, but still not bad!! Highly recommend checking this place out.

Came here on a Tuesday at 4pm. Took almost 1 hour between ordering and receiving our food even though the restaurant was only half full. Over 30 minutes after placing order, server came out to "double check" what we ordered - and we only ordered 2 food items, 1 for each person! Not much to get confused with, unless the server completely forgot. Another patron that had come after us had placed order, received order, ate, paid, and left, all before we even received our food! Absolutely terrible and will not return.
No comment

Because of the decoration, we made a reservation at NOMO Kitchen for our anniversary. We are very pleased at the ambiance and we don't regret going here at all, especially since we know coming in, that it will be on the higher end of the $. We ordered a cocktail, and it was strong, perfect for the occasion. The food tasted fine and overall, it was a great experience for our first restaurant in NYC.

Okay the bartender Conor absolutely made this this most AMAZING experience. Extremely attentive. Not just looking to give you your drink but make sure you are having a good time. The atmosphere is also so cute. You will not be disappointed

Love love love this restaurant. Went here for brunch on a Saturday and my mom, my sister and I liked it we came back the next day! Collectively we adored the food and the restaurant is just stunning. My sister and I loved that they had a dj. All around a great experience and the food was just as pretty to look at as the surrounding restaurant. If you have yet to go... GO!
Came here for little a birthday dinner.  Pleasant staff, and good food.  Very cute ambiance.  I highly recommend the Zombie Punch can be shared between 2-4 people.  But be prepared it's pricey at $50
Such a cozy place, good food, good environment to hangout, excellent service, we have good family time in this place, I recommend it

The atmosphere was incredible and everything about this place was so pretty, from the huge chandeliers to the glass roof. However, the food was average and the portions were on the smaller side so I'd say this was a one time thing. The service also wasn't great - we ordered the duck wings which came quickly, but then had to wait well over an hour for our entrees (my friend ordered the risotto and I got the pappardelle). You're definitely paying more for the atmosphere than the actual food!
Love this place I would recommend my family and friends to come. The scenery was amazing and the food was great.

Service was slow and not good at all.  I should have followed the other reviews and chosen another spot for dinner.  We both had pasta dishes and they were very basic.  The best thing about my meal was the fresh pepper that was added to the top of my pasta.  Beautiful setting, but just visit the bar and then find somewhere better to eat.  It would probably help if they actually cared that you chose to dine there.  Very disappointed.

Amazing brunch! My friend and I shared the pancakes and the eggs Benedict (with Salmon). First time on a long time I've been to a restaurant with amazing food and nice ambience. Very affordable considering the scenery. The staff was attentive. No complaints. Manager even thanked us as we left. Will come again.

Exquisite decor. Stopped by for brunch on Saturday and we were pleased with the service and friendly vibes. The restaurant is beautiful and the food was great. I ordered the eggs with turkey bacon and potatoes. My meal was satisfying and I would definitely recommend to friends!

The food was great! However for the amount that the food costs, I expected service to be a bit better. I ordered pancakes without berries, but they came out covered in berries. Besides that, the lemon ricotta pancakes were great.

Great and trendy spot for brunch! Absolutely loved the bright and airy atmosphere and delicious meal. The way they scramble the eggs is so good and velvety smooth. Went for a friends birthday and looking forward to coming back!

Our group of 6 enjoyed our brunch so much, the location was beautiful!! The food was delicious but the service made the experience incredible! Our hostess Kiara was so kind and professional. From the very beginning of our experience she set the bar extremely high with her friendliness and conversation! The amazing hospitality definitely continued with our server Robert!  Thank you both!

I am beyond disappointed by this place. It used to one of my favorite places in the city for brunch for a couple of years now, but the the past two times I went were shocking regarding the service and the food. First of all, they increased the prices significantly, which I think is not justified at all. 19$ for pancakes or a french toast?! I mean, I would be fine paying that amount if the food would be really good and the sizes relatable but we ordered the eggs benedict (also around 20$) and found them not even to be mediocre. We were still hungry afterwards since the size of the food was ridiculous. And don't even get me started on the service. The past times I went, the service was lacking more and more and I was surprised it can even be that bad considering that this place belongs to the hotel and that they offer (or at least try to) good service. We basically had to call for the waiter multiple times to finally get served, while it wasn't even that busy. And we were not the only ones to experience this. Would be great if they could improve on their overall service and I would happy to come back - but as for now I would not recommend this place.

This place is so cute!! The menu is simple, but perfect options! I ordered the avocado toast and my friend ordered the granola and Greek yogurt. Both of us were very pleased with the portion size and taste. The atmosphere is beautiful, I would highly recommend this restaurant for a girls brunch. It is also conveniently located very close to awesome shopping in Soho.

Meh. Beautiful space, the food is alright (decent burger!) but the place is overpriced and the staff pretty JV to be honest - multiple forgotten items over the course of 3 hours brunching. People come here to take pictures of the space and the vine tunnel leading into the hotel, but the restaurant feels like a bit of a trap.

Extremely poor services. I have been wait for fifteen mins right at front of the door, and nobody came over and asked for assistance. After sat down for 20 mins, no menu, no water. What a shitty services!

Went there to celebrate a birthday. The moment the server came to get our drink order we got a bad vibe about her. It was the worst service we have ever received before. Bartender didn't even have basic bartending skills. Server shouldn't be working in a customer facing environment as she didn't look like she wanted to be there. Very sad to see this kind of service at such a beautiful place. Everything was terrible except the food. The food was actually pretty delicious!
The atmosphere is great and the food is ok. And the cocktails I think is so so. The most I like here is people who visit here why is so beautiful.
No comment

This place was great. A+ ratings for food,ambiance and hospitality. Came here with a group of girlfriends to celebrate a baby sprinkle. Perfect for a girls brunch. The setting is gorgeous. It's set in a very posh greenhouse. There was plenty of light and these beautiful chandeliers. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes. Let me tell you, they were fantastic. There was also a very good mock tail menu for the preggos in the group. With regards to price, I was surprised at how reasonable it was. Perfect combination of beauty and substance. I would definitely come again.
No comment
No comment
This spot was horrible. My food was terrible along with the service. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Server refused to give me a new fork and fill up my water. Never again.

Dinner was average for what you pay for. The portions were tiny. The servers aren't friendly either. Majority of them had straight faces on. I heard really good things about this place and decided to check it out, but was disappointed by the service and portions. Only good thing about this place was the aesthetics that's why I'm giving them a 3 star review.

Nomo Kitchen is in The NOMO Soho hotel which used to be the Crosby Hotel. The space is a glass house / green house which is pretty cool. The decor is nice and the atmosphere is lively. There's a DJ playing good tunes to keep the mood just right. Good spot for couples friends or large parties. The food is good but portions are really small. For the prices they charge it's not justified. I like to share and try multiple menu options so I recommend going with friends. The truffle flatbread, fish tacos, fish and chip are must gets. The skuna bay salmon is also very good. The cacio e Pepe would have been better but it lacked salt and pepper. Overall a good meal.

I have been going to Nomo Kitchen for the past few years, and it has always been a special place. My fiancé and I love their cocktails (specifically the gin bramble in the summer time has tons of fresh blackberries, they do not skimp on ingredients) and the beautiful chandeliers. Over the years we have been here for causal happy hours, taken both of our parents when they are in town, celebrated promotions at work and most recently our engagement! We came in tonight after our engagement photo shoot and had a great time. Kevin and Chris at the bar were so friendly and helpful in picking out our cocktails, and who knew they have happy hour! A great cocktail list for $12, truffle parm popcorn, and tempura cauliflower! We had a great time. Chris makes amazing concoctions and Kevin gave us a ton of recommendations for the neighborhood. If you're looking for a truly craft cocktail, fun bartenders and a beautiful setting look no further!
No comment
Great brunch experience. The kitchen was very accommodating of my vegan diet. Recommend!!

This restaurant originally attracted my friend and I due to the beautiful environment. However, the food was amazing as well! The downfalls were that service was a little slow and the food was on the pricier side. I got Eggs Benedict, which was very filling even though small, for 18 dollars. We split the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, which were 13 dollars. Overall, I would definitely eat here again. Even though it is on the pricier side for smaller portions of food, the environment makes up for that. It's a great place!
No comment
No comment
