Lovely brunch spot in SoHo! Went on a Sunday at 12:30 and it was surprisingly not too busy. I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and my friend got the cacio e pepe - both were delicious. Service was fast and attentive.
No comment
Went in for brunch. Eggs were over cooked. Asked for medium burger got a well done... Ordered a medium rare steak got a medium well... The place looked very nice, but other than looks it got nothing.
Second time here. Atmosphere is great, nice decor and glass roof. Perfect for night out. But the taste and variety of food can be more improved.

We are only giving 4stars because of our waitress Victoria, I am from Australia and we heard a lot about nomo kitchen on yelp so we decided to come eat here, everything Victoria recommend was fantastic the pancakes,unfortunately my sister got her avocado toast before all of us, our waitress saw that and approached the table to let us know that the rest of our food was being delayed due to a little error we waited 15 more minutes and this Asian guy said the food spilled on the floor so they had to make us new one, so my sister eat before us, overall Victoria is an amazing server, food was delicious,and she was very respectful and gracious, we will try dinner to see if we will all get our food on time.

Perfect spot for a birthday dinner. They offered outdoor seating at their beautiful patio that has vines and twinkly lights. The service was fast and the waiter was very friendly. I ordered the steak and cheese wrap that kept me full all day.
Nice view, DJ, moonroof, lots of indoor plants/flowers, chandeliers, very good foods. A hidden gem near Chinatown/SoHo. A great summer brunch location.
No comment

Came here in a beautiful Friday afternoon. Seating was immediate we didn't have to wait at all. Lunch menu had a very limited selection around -6 item for appetizers and lunch. Though the restaurant was more on the pricy side around $40 per person for 2 dishes each, the food was pretty tasty and savory. Would recommend the chicken lollipop and the wagyu burger.
No comment

Food is standard. Nothing super impressive. Most ppl come here for insta pictures. Didn't get a real table when we came. A table of 4. We sat near the door. Very low mini table. Very cold inside, so we had to wear our jackets on. Food portion is decent. Price wise - standard, but coffee price is too much and quality is not there. I am a big coffee person and we ordered 4 types of coffee. None of us were impressed.
Terrible lunch and terrible service. Honestly I can cook better spaghetti than the one I ordered. Don't waste your time and money given that there are so many great dining spots in Soho.
No comment
No comment

This is a great place to take friends from out-of-town to impress them because the restaurant is beautiful and grand and the food is bougee and aesthetically-plated. All of the food is quite overpriced, however. When you come here, you're paying for the experience as much as for the food.
No comment
Horrible service, food is meh. We made reservation a week before we came and they still have us waited for 30min because they OVERBOOKED. Food is a total disappointment. DO NOT Recommend!!!!!!

Delicious food, great service, and fun ambiance. I've been to Nomo Kitchen for brunch twice and I would highly recommend. The Avocado Toast (with the farm egg) is everyone's favorite. The Smoked Salmon Scramble is delicious. The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes is a sweet must have. The coffee could be a little stronger. For more recommendations follow my blog @nyto_theworld
No comment
Brunch tips : lemon ricotta pancakes & the eggs benny. You're welcome - easy Peasy. Definitely will be returning. Friendly bartender who made his job more of an art
It made absolutely no sense how good the ricotta pancakes were, I definitely have to go again and you need to go for a first time I promise its amazing. The chandeliers, Bay windows, omg everything!

I would give this place 5 stars if the host wouldn't have been so rude! My friends and I came here for dinner and drinks and it was so nice. The food was great but I wish we would have gone for brunch instead. What I really loved about this place was the portion size because it wasn't too much or too little. It was just right and left just enough room for dessert! I'll definitely be back to try their brunch.

Love the place itself, just disappointed with the Cacio e Pepe - the pepper grans were whole are far too many of them. Also I had ordered it with the egg on top and they didn't give me one and when I pointed it out they 5 minutes later just brought me an egg on a plate. Would still go back, just order something else :)

Such an amazing place, I had a great time for my birthday! The food was amazing the service was top tier! I want to highlight that our waitress Brittney was absolutely amazing! I would definitely come back here soon! Perfect for all special occasions !
This is the first time we have been there. The brunch is so good. Highly recommend the lemon pancake!! We also ordered the fish tacos and egg Benedict. All are perfect!!!

Took my lady out for dinner on her birthday. The decor was very nice especially the entrance.  Staff was very pleasant. Only knock is that the price was a tad bit high for the simple entrees. All in all it was a good experience
Delicious food! And awesome craft cocktails.  Amazing NYC vibe.  Our server, Kevin was the bomb! He was very likeable and attentive.  He makes you want to come back! Thanks for a great time!

When you first arrive you can't help but admire the interior design. The glass ceiling windows and the beautiful chandeliers just sets the mood for a perfect afternoon brunch. I'd have to admit I didn't expect much because I thought the main focus was the setting of the restaurant but I was surprised the food was quite tasty. I got the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon and my friend got a parfait. I think my eggs Benedict was delicious, the eggs were perfectly poached, hollandaise was seasoned well and had the perfect consistency. Overall, I agree with other yelpers the price may be on the higher end. For the type of food they serve you can easily find it at any other restaurant in New York City for less but after all it's a restaurant in a hotel situated in the heart of soho.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Tuna tartar is delicious.  Staff is nice. Other than that. Nah. Maybe I should try the weekend brunch next time.

Disappointed with this place. Such a bad service, we asked a server for the menu in the middle of our dinner because one of our friend didn't eat meat and we wanted to order something else for her. Waited 15 min never got it. The server was just walking around and totally forgot about us. And the look... they look at you like you are a piece of sh**t. Specifically the host and the one of the server. We felt uncomfortable. Never coming back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Just had brunch there. The cocktails are awesome! Food is good too but not that impressive. A bit pricy. The ambiance is the best part! Great place to go with your girlfriends!
It's a good place for friends together to hang out/ brunch. Especially at day time, sunshine see through the glass ceiling. Food is good and the cocktail is amazing.

I came here on a Sunday with a reservation for a party of 6. The food was average tasting, expesnive and the portions small; not filling at all. The location is absolutely beautiful which is why I believe people like to come here. The main and most pressing issue I have with this establishment is that they double charged my friend for her part of the bill. When she saw this she called the restaurant and they did not handle it immediately. They told her they would look into it and give her a call. I will definitely not be returning.

If I could rate the space I would give it 5 stars. While the music was way too loud for just brunch, this place is stunning. There is so much going on but the glass house/garden theme was so charming and I'll definitely be back for just a cup of coffee. And I say cup of coffee only, because the food was below average. The baked lemon ricotta pancakes looked pretty but were a bit of a disappointment. Sometimes you can taste a messy kitchen in your brunch, like the eggs in the batter, and berries that have been sitting out for a bit too long.

Cute place.. very artsy. Definitely a place for "candid pix" the restaurant is located inside of the hotel. Clean and fresh looking. The restaurants decor was also nice, creative...great lighting looked like a little garden party. Annoying screaming kid, ruined the whole experience. The service was ...uh.. mediocre. Not very attentive. Everything takes forever. The food was bland. Got egg Benedict. It's was not great. It had kale in it that could not have been eaten no matter how hard I tried. I don't see the point of putting it in the dish.. also asked for mushrooms and they said no... not very impressed. Just like the decor.
Very modern interior and good service! The atmosphere and interior are beautiful!!! I had pita bread and Tuna Tataki! Amazing taste!

If I can give it a negative I would! This place was overhyped. Service was horrible. Our server gave us nothing but attitude. The food was alright, could've gotten it better at McDonald's with a smile on my face. 1/10 recommend. That 1 is for the pretty arch outside so you can take a pretty insta pic!

I travelled for food and finding "instagram worthy" kind of food. This place is so terrible. I never had such as bad experience in a restaurant before. I ordered cacio e pepe with additional egg, tuna sandwich and steak torta. Cacio e Pepe was so bland and the spaghetti was cut off. The poached egg turned to be boiled hard egg and I asked why is it bookies hard egg? They replaced me with a new poached egg. Yes! Just the new egg and my spaghetti was cold.  The tuna sandwich, the bread were so hard like it's been sitting outside for couple days. The tuna itself has very unpleasant smelly (so fishy and bad) and yes everything was cold again except fries. The Steak Torta was a normal okay burger that cost $17 which I can get better burger for cheaper price. Yes. It was cold burger again. I don't know what's wrong with the restaurant cuz I was waiting for almost an hour after the order and all my food were cold. And, no courtesy at all!

Reserved an indoor table at Nomo because it was too cold to sit out and they sat me right next to the door that the waiters and guests would constantly open to enter in and out. Wind was blowing at me repeatedly making the seating very uncomfortable and cold. When asked to have my seat moved they would say that the table was for four guests and we were only three. While our original table was also meant for four guests... Also they moved another table with guests when they asked because they were getting cold too. They should've offered me a table by that time too because our food was not even out yet and we've been sitting in the cold shivering for a hour and a half. We waited for about an hour to get our order taken and I asked for a waitress 2-3 times. The waitress was extremely nice but the hosts (the men in blazers) were unwelcoming and not attentive. But the food was really good and I would come back for it. Best waffle fries I had.
No comment

Went here last night with some friends. Ambiance was spectacular to say the least . However if you go here extremely hungry prepare to drop lots of dough.  Portions are extremely small and very pricey unfortunately. The food was good but nothing to make you go home and crave the next day. We had the duck buns, chicken lollipops, Asian chicken salad (which was basically chicken salad on top of lettuce...), the steak, and the rigatoni. Not sure if I will come back (maybe for a work event), but if you are into a chic atmosphere to impress coworkers who are trying to stay thin then this is the spot.

The design of the place really sells you, fabolous atmosphere with amazing service. Food is small portioned but very expensive, must be a New York thing. Overall the place was amazing and they absolutely great at servicing. Selective menu options don't give you much variety, but that is expected from an upscale, modern, trendy type of restaurant.
No comment
No comment
Really cute location and beautiful trendy spot. Only went for breakfast and everything we had was amazing. would recommend if you're staying in the SoHo area
No comment
So far so good! Our server is Yoni. He's super great and we are on our drinks and so I'll come back to write more after we eat!
The chicken noodle soup is a must. Funny and friendly staff. Bloody Mary was yummy too

NOMO looks swanky and gorgeous inside and outside. It's a great date spot and group dining spot, though a bit pricey, though our discount helped smooth that out. The service, food, and ambiance were wonderful and I would wholeheartedly recommend this spot for a night out.
No comment

Decided to go here for my girlfriends birthday celebration!!! All I have to say is the FOOD is amazing!!!!!!  Octopus was delicious nice and toasted on the outside and not chewy.  Best I've tasted.  Artichokes, cauliflower and Brussels sprouts were deliciously seasoned and not over cooked.  For entres we tried the rib-eye which fell off the bone and the chicken were both flavorful and delicious.  I can't say enough about this place the decor elegant,  service exceptional and Chef is amazing. It's a hidden gem!!! Can't wait to return to try the brunch.  Beautiful picture spot as well.

We have a horrible experience at this restaurant yesterday. My friends stayed at the hotel and there were so many bad things that contributed to a terrible experience. One of my friends ordered a pizza. It didn't taste good, was burnt and asked several times for olive oil. They forgot the goat cheese in my other friends salad. When the food came we had no napkins or cutlery. We had several waiters for some reason and they often forgot about us. On top of it all, it was quiet and we asked for a booth which they refused to give to us although they remained empty the whole time. Also, there were no places to charge our phones. It's a hotel!! Overall, this is really unacceptable for this type of restaurant in a hotel like NOMO. I'm extremely disappointed.

Service was bad, the menu wasn't exciting but I liked my cod. Worst of all: the music was awful and very VERY loud. Couldn't wait to get outta there. Overpriced for crappy service, mediocre food and loud music! Will not be going back.
Food was pretty good, service so-so.  Great ambiance and good drinks.  Skip the diver scallops and sashimi.

Beautiful location and ambience. Horrible service and food. Ordered the burger which was overly salty, brought it to the attention of the staff and all they had to say was sorry. Didn't take it off our bill or offered any sort of help. Servers walk around like they own the place. Stay in your lane.
A pretty good spot for stopping by and taking photos. The food is good but the service needs some improvement.
Spaghetti is tooooo salty, the cake is strange. Food is awful, though the environment is good.
Second time coming here, the food is seriously so bad even though the environment is pretty good. Hope the restaurant could cook better food and make this place perfect

Ambiance is great, interior decor and music were on point. Food is okay for the price, not spectacular but still yummy . Service was somewhat slow for Sunday brunch and an iced Americano came with a lemon wedge on the rim... I'd still come back tho! Loveee the ambiance

This has become one of my favorite places for brunch! Our reservation was at 11:30am and we were seated promptly. To begin, we had the lemon ricotta pancakes (must eat!!) burger and a side of fries. The cocktail I had was the Rose Royale, it was strong and delicious!!! Definitely worth the price. Our waitress was attentive and overall provided us with great service. Will be coming back again, perhaps for dinner!

After an amazing night out, a friend and I ended up at the Nomo Soho. I'm glad that I did!!!! We stopped for a drink and a bite, to have the pleasure of meeting Warren, a fantastic bartender! Personable and friendly to say the least! As manhattanites, it's always a pleasure finding a haven amongst the chaos that is the city. The Nomo is such a place! Everyone we encountered was friendly and Warren was so knowledgeable with his drink recommendations. Thank you Nomo Soho for making a teacher summer night out a fantastic event!

It's a nice place, it has good food, and everyone mostly likes it for the trendy aesthetic. But here's the issue. Even after making a reservation, you have to wait at least 10-15 minutes to be seated. Then another 45 minutes for your food to come. The waiter is nowhere to be found when taking your order. The waiters by the way, all egotistic and rude, wish they had a reason though. But regardless, I've been to many upscale restaurants in Manhattan and never received such poor service. Definitely won't be coming back. It's all hype, no good vibes though. Also, just to mention, people who came in AFTER us received their food BEFORE us. It seems like they like to serve wealthy looking Asians first. I immediately picked up on that, and did not enjoy this at all. I would rather pay $200 for an amazing brunch experience at the baccarat.

had dinner here last night Feb13 2021 we had no reservations but the host got us a table .. the service was great .. drinks were perfect .. attention to detail throughout the dinner . now i have eating in a lot of places in my life and i have a lot of very good meals , but i can't remember when i ever said i had a great meal until last night i ordered the RibEye for two,,it was beyond words i never ever tasted something that was so tender and flavorful..o my regret was not asking Chef who we meet while he was in dining room on how the steak was cooked i believe the Sous Vide technique was used to get resin like this! amazing

The space is beautiful but we came here for a rehearsal dinner that was a disaster. We were a bit over twenty people. The food was fine but they took forever to bring food out. 2hrs in we hadn't received the second course yet. Furthermore they did family style but only brought out enough food for half the amount of people. So very slow service and not enough food. Very disappointing. Eventually we cut the dinner short because we were doing a cocktail thing right outside the private room. What a disappointment.

They did not change this place at all after the new management. Good thing because the venue is beautiful with lovely chandeliers. The food we had for brunch was on point. Order the truffle flat bread, and definitely do not forget to order the pasta. Very unique.. but we loved it.
Such a cute spot for brunch! Highly recommend the smoked salmon scramble, eggs benedict, & french toast!
No comment
service wasn't so friendly, had to wait a long time for the food to be served when people who came after me were served. but their rigatoni tomato sauce tasted very good but was over priced

visited Nomo restaurant Friday evening the 20th of October, after a long day of work, I was looking forward to enjoying the evening with my sister and brother in law. However, it ended up being really lousy, as the server spilled and broke 2-3 glasses of wine on us. The treatment I received was unprofessional, the waitress momentarily walked away and the manager was inconsiderate when I expressed my concern of the stains in my jeans and silky shirt. The manager's statement and I quote was this "well she didn't do it on purpose" and walked away. I spent the evening soaked in wine, and just appalled at the whole experience. Surely, an apology would have served its purpose.

This is such a good date night spot! The entrance is super cute, it's like branches with lights as you walk up. You have to go through the hotel lobby in order to go into the restaurant. The drinks that day were named after inspiring women, I happened to get Frida Kahlo (tequila based). For the app I had the tuna tartare. It was a group of 4, and it was very little for 4 hungry people lol, but delish! I also had the tagliatelle with mushrooms and it was very very good! The dessert we chose was the cheesecake...YUM! This spot is super cute and chic and I would definitely come back for a nice date night with my bf.
No comment
No comment

I think some of the reviews for this place are unfairly harsh. I came in on a Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend who was on crutches, they were extremely accommodating in providing him with a table that would allow him to put his foot up, while still being able to enjoy the view of the restaurant, and seated us almost immediately. As for the food--it was great. The portions were pretty big and very substantial, not sure what others ordered but we got the burger and the chicken sandwich. Semi expensive but what do you expect for a hotel restaurant in soho? Overall good experience and would definitely recommend.

Amazing atmosphere, very friendly and good service. Delicious food . I liked everything I ordered.Dog friendly hotel and restaurant. I like the decoration. High glass ceiling make it very bright . I will definitely come again
Great ambiance and location, modern, romantic and classy.  Food was over priced and not that great.
Pretty restaurant in the Mondrian hotel!! Love the ambiance!  Fun for an event or a girls night out dinner!  Good for big group!

My parents treated my husband and me to dinner to celebrate our one year anniversary.  I suggested NOMO as we had gone on one of our early dates and loved the restaurant.  The food, service and ambiance were wonderful.  We started with pasta bolognese-- couldn't have been more delicious.  I ordered the half chicken w broccoli, my husband got the lamb burger ( the bites I stole were so yummy) and the pork chop and steak my parents had were delicious as well.  The manager Adele was very attentive and made us feel special and welcome.  I highly recommend NOMO and look forward to returning for another fabulous night.
No comment
No comment
The food was excellent but there is a bit of a wait. The look and atmosphere is great and quite unique. Would go again.
This is a great place with good food and vibes. They have chandeliers over head that makes you feel like your in a Disney movie.

No doubt NOMO kitchen is a super gorgeous place. It has amazing chandeliers and cute buddy status. My friend and I went there for brunch. Unfortunately, the food tastes so so. However, the amazing view of the restaurant make me feel like in a glasses garden.

The food is great, awesome environment and everyone takes pictures there... but during my last visit, me and my friend's entrees came at different time and it just kinda ruined our celebration dinner: I got my dish 35 mins after my friend got his.... they also took orders wrong multiple times and took FOREVER to return our credit cards...id only visit again when in extremely good mood

Soho Nomo kitchen is a great little hidden gem!! The waiters/ waitresses are attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The menu doesn't have many choices, but what you have to pick from is unique and tasteful.

food was decent tasting, portions of the size of your fist, and nothing below 30 dollars. Typical overpriced, overrated, pseudo-elitist filled manhattan junk. Staff was kind and we were seated quickly but that's about it.

I have severe food allergies to seafood and nuts. I told the waitress to let the chef know. To make sure I was 100% ok, I double checked with the waitress, and they had to redo the whole order. The service wasn't that good. We also waited over an hour for our food.
We came for breakfast outdoors adorable inside bright and fresh aesthetics.We enjoyenjoyed the ricotta pancakes service was very good.

Went here for the cool ambience and really everything else was below expectations. The food happened to be good, but it was weird that within 3 minutes of ordering it came out. To me, that means the food is sitting under a warmer already prepared waiting to be served, probably from the morning. The other thing that was weird was the drinks came out after the food did. Isn't the proper way of serving drinks than food? Idk. 2 minutes after we finished they brought us the check. Everything felt rushed and there wasn't even a wait outside. Last but not least the host was not really nice. Kind of militaristic and treated us like shit because we weren't their "ideal clientele". Probably will never come back here.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant with great food and service.  Great vibe and atmosphere.  We ordered the soup of the day, shrimp tacos and a chicken salad.  All delicious!  Our server, Nicole, was more than patient with my questions and food order.  I would definitely recommend this place.
No comment

Let me start off by saying, that when my best friend told me she wanted to go here for her bday, I automatically thought this was going to be another overhyped place people go for just the decor and the instagram worthy pictures that offers mediocre food and horrible service. And yes, upon arrival, just as I assumed, my group was quite pleased with how beautiful this place was from the bright room to the gorgeous chandeliers (and yes, we too, like most of the people there, had our photo shoot haha); however, the most surprising aspect was the food, it was delicious! Now brunch in the city is often a excuse to drink bottomless mimosas while chowing down whatever egg assortment comes with that deal. And while NOMO Kitchen doesn't offer bottomless brunch drinks, it does offer amazing food. I got the steak and eggs and it was cooked to perfection. My friends were also equally as impressed with their food. I can't stop raving about this place. However, do note, it does get busy and service can be a little slow, but that's something that's usually expected with places like this. Regardless, great experience.

It's a stunning venue. From the moment you walk in and all throughout, you feel like you're in Cinderella's art gallery. It's a sexy mix of modern, pop art, and romance. I was here with my girlfriends last night and I was impressed with the staff. I must say all the front door men, the hostesses, and our waiter were super friendly and charming. Although our drinks were carefully and deliciously prepared, the food was not as impressive. I would come back for the drinks only.

I've been here twice, and I'd say to get a couple of appetizers instead of an entree, they are way better than the entrees. The truffle bread is delicious and the fish tacos are also great. The fish and chips were disappointing (small portion and not even battered). The drinks are also very good, my favorite is the Mamacita. The snow cake is also a winner.

Went here for a 2 year anniversary, the restaurant had a great view but the food was just alright. Steak was charred at medium and didn't really enjoy it as much as I should. But what made it worth while was the crispy fries !
I have not seen many restaurants with 400+ reviews. Place is gorgeous with an amazing menu. Be prepared for trendy but it's worth it
No comment
Only go for the lemon ricotta pancakes or nutella french toast. Got the eggs benedict (no meat). It came with a bed of spinach and salad on the side. It was tasteless, standard and overpriced.

Mediocre food and terrible service- I would suggest passing on this place. We went there on a Saturday night- beautiful space. Our apps, salads and entrees all came to the table at once. The food was just mediocre at best and the server barely cared as to what was going on with the table. Finally I went to host stand and asked them to help end the experience.

Food and staff were mediocre at best. Cocktail menu lacked creativity, and the food descriptions completely oversold what was actually brought out. The little gem salad and kale had minimal dressing/seasoning. The pizza and eggplant were fine, but aren't worth a visit to this restaurant. Unfortunately the waiter never came over to check on us during our meal either. Do yourself a favor and take your Instagram worthy photo of the restaurant and dine somewhere else.

My friends and I were there for birthday dinner. Upon arrival I requested if we can be seated before two more people arrive since it was a surprise birthday party. They didn't seem to like the idea and had to check with the manager but upon manager's approval we were seated. Because balloon is not allowed in the restaurant they told us that we should hang the one and only balloon somewhere by the door (with a whatever-attitude). I asked if they can keep it and store it - not just somewhere by the door (which had some lounge seating for hotel guests) - and the person reluctantly took it away. Anyways, inside service was so friendly and food was delicious. Presentation of food was beautiful and stylish. Ambience was lively and lots of lights flooded in during the early evening and when the sun was down lots of lights were around (really pretty inside). Food was four-five stars but the front experience, not so much of a good one.

We made reservation and specifically requested to be seated by Hearts wall for our daughter's sweet 16th. It was her request. They assured me she would get the wall table. Unfortunately it was not available when we arrived on time for our reservation. They had just seated another party at our reservation spot. Very disappointed. Beware reservation does not mean a thing at this place.

Gorgeous venue, naturally lit though the greenhouse sunroof, decked out in crystal chandeliers, walls covered in plants and lined with a full bar, and a beautiful ivy corridor entrances. I highly, highly recommend this place for brunch if you're into classy drunk brunch with an bright, upscale, and trendy ambiance. Nomo even has a live (and pretty) DJ mixing edm + top 40. The pancakes (baked lemon ricotta pancakes with mixed berries and candied pistachios for $17) were so beautiful! They were very thick and reminded me more of a spongey cake though--undecided whether or not that's a good thing, but great for insta. Margherita flatbread with mozzarella, garlic pomodoro, and pasil ($18) was good, though not extraordinary, and great to share (6 square pieces). Chicken paillard with tomatoes, arugula, and basil ($29) was mixed. Chicken was too dry but the tomatoes stole the show. We couldn't get enough of 'em. While the food overall was 3 stars at most, the overall experience bumps it up to 4 stars for me and I will definitely come back with large groups.

I've been here about 8 times I believe. But the last few times I was so disappointed. The employees work with attitude, which is great in a way, because they want to build a confidence like they are actually something important. But, actually they should realize they should treat customers like actual people, actual PAYING people, and not ignore them. If we are doing to order $19 cocktails or wines, be smart, be educated, and learn to treat customers with manners and intelligence. But barely giving water and taking menus away as soon as you're gone, maybe you should re think that, and remember your actual place. Are we working for you, or are you working for us?  New York man. I'm telling you.

5 stars for the food. Absolutely delicious. Beautiful decor and ambiance. There were 8 of us and we finished every bite. Not a place to visit if you crave huge a huge portion, but the quality was superb. The service was extremely slow though, and it was a bit pricey. Once the food came out, magic!

I was craving their lemon ricotta pancakes (who wouldn't) but found out that Chef Gary King had been replaced by Chef Jesse Olson. The place had seriously downgraded. First of all, hostess was like a mouse. She whispered everything and I had to ask her to repeat everything she said. I didn't make reservations this time and she seated me at the bar instead of a table  The place was half empty and atmosphere was gloomy. Last time I came, the place was packed and everyone was happy and laughing and had a good time. The bartender made my Bloody Mary cocktail literally so salty. She most likely just dumped a bucket of salt in a glass. The pancakes were such a disappointment Jesse Olson is terrible. The pancakes came out soggy and lukewarm and literally fell apart when you cut into it. The pistachios were chewy and soggy (literally do not understand how someone can make a nut chewy), the raspberries were black and bruised, and the lemon cream was barely there. The potato hash remained okay. The staff of waiters had all changed and I was so upset because I was hoping to see the waiter who served me last time. He was an excellent waiter. The manager was running around the restaurant all flustered and sweaty and nervous and I found that annoying. Definitely will not eat here again unless Gary King comes back or the restaurant finds a better chef and waiter staff. No pictures were worth taking this time.
Nice scenery however only 4 stars because the menu could be better. Kale salad (added chicken)was great!

Nice seating area. Probably want to make reservation for brunch. Slow service. Paid $20 for a very small serving of very basic pasta (just cheese and pepper). The smoked salmon with egg was pretty good.

This review is long overdue, but I have to write it because I had such a great time here. NOMO kitchen is a modern, upscale restaurant inside NoMo Soho Hotel serving mainly American cuisine. I came here for an evening dinner with a party of two. The place was fairly busy, but we were seated promptly. Kevin was our waiter and let me tell ya..this guy knows hospitality. He was attentive, helpful, and funny. We ordered mocktails and a bunch of dishes to share including the cheese platter, margherita pizza, truffle fries, and carbonara. I found the pasta dish to be extremely salty..probably wouldn't order it again. However, the rest of the food was good. Afterwards, they served the cake my friends brought. There was a cutting fee but because it was my birthday, Kevin took it off the tab. I think our total was $125 including tip, which was worth it given our experience. Do note that we were sharing dishes though! I don't see myself coming here often because of the price point, but realize that you're paying for the upscale experience.

Fantastic restaurant if you want to go somewhere trendy and delicious. Wait staff was wonderful and attentive. Drinks were great! Food was so delicious- the focaccia and ricotta appetizer was by far one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth. An overall unforgettable experience!
Amazing restaurant. Great drinks and we loved our waitress Courtney. Cool space and great vibes

Food an hour late. Burnt Avocado toast, cacio Pepe was cold and tasted like cup noodles, and salad came with dressing and breadcrumbs - we asked for dressing on the side and NO breadcrumbs. The drinks were extremely disappointing too - the pimm's cup was really sugary and tasted more like juice than an actual cocktail. After two hours, we are still hangry, frustrated, and disappointed. They sent a complimentary pizza that was burnt. I don't plan on brunching here again. Also, I don't feel the need to ask for water..... should be given and refilled with out asking. Finally, they admitted the kitchen lost the ticket. However, I will say they comped the meal and the atmosphere was lively.

Space nice.  Food decent.  Service not good.  Was kinda loud so cut our server slack when she messed up the drink order. Unfortunately, despite confirming our food order that was wrong too.  Would say this is a perfectly fine place to go to the bar.  Don't invest time or money in dinner or other meals.

Went for Lunch and had the Skirt steak, the portion was just right and It was cooked perfectly. I am in love with their sauce paired with the Brussels sprouts! The side of fries were crispy and not too oily, and the space is super cool and bright, nothing like feeling you are outside in the middle of winter! Will definitely be coming back!!

The service here is terrible. I came here with my husband and 2 kids (1 in stroller). It was around 3pm and we just wanted to have drinks and maybe a tapa or 2. I walked in and the hostess was right there. He didn't even look at me or acknowledge I was standing in front of him for literally 3mins!!! I was waiting for him to finish whatever he was doing to seat us. Let me just remind again.. it was 3pm the place was dead with maybe just 1 couple eating. So when interrupted him and asked him can we be seated? He straight up said "NO" and pointed at the lobby bar (not even part of the restaurant). He said we can sit in the lobby bar but there's no room for a stroller in there. Like really? The place is spacious...and it was empty. And I could of folded up my son's stroller. He didn't say anything else afterwards.. just straight up "NO" with out even looking at me. We left. What a jerk.. NOMO, you need to retrain your hostess. Just because your place is cute doesn't mean you need to be jerks. There are plenty of other cute places in Soho.
No comment
Beautiful restaurant with great service! We were with a large party and the staff was amazing! The food not only tasted great but the presentation was amazing!!
Customer service is great. Nice ambiance. Ricotta lemon pancakes are delicious. Would definitely come back!
No comment
poor service, made a reservation but waited for half an hour, they said they were overbooked like wtf?

One of my favorite places to stop by after work for drinks. The service staff is impeccable and are very attentive to our needs. Other than that, probably the best Art Deco in all of Manhattan. Must visit on your travels through New York

the place was beautiful love the chandeliers but I went for lunch ordered the fish tacos and was not a fan ,the ambiance is super cool but the food was just mehhh there are plenty of places around the area with a better menu selection its a good place to go for a drink but as for the food id definitely explore your options

I really wanted to like the place - I did. I walked past the hotel one day after shopping in SoHo and thought this place would be perfect for drinks with friends! So last night me and my girlfriends headed in at around 10pm. We loved the chandeliers, greenery and fairy lights. The atmosphere was bomb, super Gatsby-esque. We weren't too impressed by the drinks and service though. I had a mojito from their cocktail list and it was not good. Our server was rather rude and he seemed almost annoyed when we asked for suggestions (shouldn't that be normal at any restaurant/bar?). He also plopped down the check  before we finished our drinks and came back the second time around asking us to settle it. Maybe I caught the waiter in a bad mood so I'll give this place another shot next time.
No comment
No comment

It was my birthday and Maria was the best server ever. Robert the manager was so accommodating and amazing. I recommend this place 100%. The Brussels sprouts are incredible as is the octopus. Thank you so much for an incredible night. Also the ambience is amazing. The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. Instagram worthy!!!!!
Maria is the best waitress here. She made our experience here so amazing, I would eat here just to be served by her again. And the food is great too :)

Excellent food and excellent service. Our waitress was Maria, and being a restaurant owner myself I know how hard the job can be and making sure everyone is okay. She was beyond helpful and absolutely amazing. Can't wait to come back !

Ambiance is very romantic in the evenings. Love the glass ceiling, great lighting during lunch time. Service was good. I had to give only 3 stars for the food . It came out slow. Margarita pizza was good. Chicken lollipops not so fabulous! It's literally 3 giant chicken legs. Might have been better as actual chunks of chicken on sticks. We ordered the steak and asked for med-rare, we got well done. Waited for corrected one and it came out after everyone finished eating! Plus it was med-well! Manager supposedly try to fix! Oh well.

This has been on my list to try for brunch for awhile & I finally got to enjoy it for my birthday. We made reservation and i love the entrance and the set up inside. The food was delicious, the menu providing a variety of brunch choices. Everything was fresh and the service was amazing, well maybe a bit over attentive. We had zero idea who was our waiter. Three people came by back to back asking for our drink order, so there was no communication but that didn't really bother us all that much.

was definitely taken in by the decor of the place, restaurant look s amazing by that is pretty much the best of it. We ate there on a Thursday night, it wasn't packed but it was busy, our starter s came out in good time and were pretty good, we had the Bao Buns and the cheese and tomato flatbread. Our main course took well over an hour to arrive as the kitchen "lost" the order, we had the steak and also a tomato pasta dish, first off the steak should have been medium but came out well done, intact the bottom had actually been burnt. The tomato pasta was so overcooked it came out in thick clumps, we brought both to the attention of the waiter and after speaking to the manager they comped both main courses and a round of drinks. Although I was happy with how they handled this it shouldn't have come to this in the first place.  After this experience I probably won't go back there again.

OMG!!! My husband and I ate her last night. I ordered the Bronzino--freakin delicious. It's was crispy on the outside and flaky and filled with all types of goodness in the inside. Also the fried cauliflower is out of this world!  The ambience was perfect for a date night or a girls or boys get together. The icing on the cake was we got the opportunity to meet Chef Salaam. He came out and introduced himself to some of the tables. He was super nice and smart.  He's a food genius--u must come and visit this place--it's a hidden gem.

I came in last night and had the most amazing experience. The restaurant was not too busy however ; after we sat it did began to get a little crowded. There was a young lady that gave us an amazing table in the back, with a perfect view of the restaurant. My mother met me there as she was just getting in from Hawaii and I wanted to take her out and giver her the NYC restaurant experience. To my pleasure we had just that. Our waiter guided us through the menu for each course. He (Stephen) was very nice, full of energy,  and had the most amazing glasses. I would come to eat here over and over! I will be back!

We had such a lovely experience here, one of the few good services we had during our entire stay in NYC to be frank. Shirley was our waitress and she was wonderful. She did everything in her power to make our brunch lovely, and the food was wonderful as well. Overall great experience!
No comment
They absolutely have no food, that's on their menu. Their service is a complete let down.  I used to enjoy the Mondrian. But I will not be coming here NoMo.
Insta worthy ambience but food is average. It's a place to go to if you want to have a boozy evening/afternoon out with friends. The food isn't great for the price.

I came here after I was browsing around for a decent brunch.   The infamous reviews are definitely a hype.  Food was okay, service was on the not so great side, but the decor was aesthetically pleasing.  It took us 45 minutes to get a cup of coke and we only got it after we had to ask several times, then someone in our party got up to get one from the bar.  Instead of owning up to it staff was playing the blame game.  Food was not the best nor was it the worst.  It has  a very trendy vibe to it and its a nice place to take pics (bloggers??) but overall definitely not worth it.

Great night! Despite the fact that there was a medical emergency at the party next to our table, our waitress JOY was incredible!!!! So attentive, and friendly. She called 911 for the party and still found time to place our orders and bring my gin and tonics! The half chicken and pork chop were both well executed, but the real draw here was our service and Joy's outstanding attentiveness!

If I can give zero star, I would. I had a brunch at Nomo kitchen and the service was horrible and the staff was very unprofessional. And the most importantly the food was disgusting. Restaurant was pretty empty but it still took about 10 minutes to get my coffee refilled and the pastry basket came without Jam and butter. When I asked to get them, one of the jam bottle was already open and had bite taken out of. Rest of the dishes are not even worth mentioning.

Decor: Amazing, they kept the glassware from the previous restaurant and it feels airy but when it's dimly lit, it looks gorgeous. Food was okay, presented beautifully but nothing more than that. The vanilla icecream is something magical though- I don't know what they do to it but it's much more than your regular vanilla icecream! Id come back for a drink and dessert, probably not dinner!

Had a great time and delicious dinner there. I was mostly impressed by the professionalism of the team and the overall service experience. I never leave feedback on Yelp but I felt compelled to do so this time. Great job guys

Great, cute, Instagram worthy place! Also great happy hour to meet up with friends! I came here for dinner and drinks with my friends after finding this place on social media and we loved it. Food & drinks were a little pricy but for a special occasion it's fine.

The food was good but what I enjoyed the most as the decor. I went at night and it was beautiful to see the chandeliers light up the restaurant. The only downside was the service, it was really slow and the restaurant was not busy at all.

We went there to eat brunch 2 Sundays ago with few friends visiting from Miami,we had no idea that we had to pay for the bread! Best part, we asked the busboy for bread he just said Yes and left, we never got it till we finished the second course, I mean seriously!! When we asked one of the managers who was very rude! By the way it's a She! She did not want to give us her name but I can tell say she was chubby ( so she can know who she is) why did the bread take so long!?? She said we don't give bread here for free like some restaurants do we bake our own bread here! I said well if you bake it here then we need to order on our way here to eat so it can be ready then? I was trying to be sarcastic and funny, but she just did a weird face and walked away with an attitude. Service was very slow! The food was not bad after all, the atmosphere and the music was excellent

Nice atmosphere from outside. Terrible serving. After talking with a waitress about the order, two of us had to wait for 20min just for glasses of water (later we asked busboy to bring one). Now it has been 35 min and no word about our dishes (just got coffee). Manager came to us and apologized saying that our orders are on him. I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody.
I ordered French toast. It was with Nutella banana and maddening nuts and I asked them to replace banana with strawberries and they charged me 9 dollars! The server wasn't helpful at all !

Overall was okay. You're basically paying for the atmosphere and vibe. Food- I had the Eggs your way and was not worth $16.. My friend had the eggs Benedict and food was cold. The place is decorative, pretty, and clean which catches the people's attention, especially for pictures, but that's it. It's definitely a one time experience.
Amazing! If you go for brunch try the French toast and the pancakes! Double cheeseburger is great too! Make sure to call for a reservation because they are very busy.
The ONLY good thing about NOMO Hotel -- Tasty food, great service, and professional staff.

Ate here with a friend while we were in town to see a show.  The restaurant is beautiful with lots of photo ops for all you Instagramers.  It was definitely slower paced, so I wouldn't recommend it if you are in a hurry but we had plenty of time to relax so it was nice.  I got the Prêt-à-Porter cocktail and my friend got the Smoke & Mirrors (I liked hers better then mine).  We shared the House Made Focaccia & the Pork Belly which were both delicious and beautifully plated.  I had the Cacio e Pepe (Spaghetti) per the waitresses recommendation.  I thought it was very salty; they could have done without the added sea salt since pecorino is already very salty on its own.  My friend had the Duck Breast which she said was wonderful. We also shared the brussel sprouts side which was amazing!  I would go back just for them!

Atmosphere was enough for 5 stars, but for the food? Soso. But if you are planning to visit this restaurant, it must is because of the atmosphere and a kind of instagram mood. Then it's good to go :) For me, their salmon burger was not satisfying for the amount of money i paid..

Stayed at the NOMO for the weekend and had a great experience at the hotel, but I can not say the same for the restaurant. We ate here twice, both times receiving marginal service. The food was decent, however no bacon should cost that much if it's going to be served cold. The eggs were heavily salted and barely warm. When our food was delivered our coffee cups were randomly taken, so we then had to wait until our server showed up to ask for more. At the end of the meal our server was nowhere to be found and we had to talk to three different people just to have a room charge. Unfortunate that such a nice hotel has such a marginal restaurant.
I wish I could give a zero  to lazy service according to prizes & food not even  good not recommended!!!!!

This place really killed the night. A group of 8 of us went out for a birthday dinner celebration and we were really disappointed. It took over 45 minutes to order and then the food took another hour. The food was mediocre and as expected small portions. (Which is fine if the food is to die for) We brought a birthday cake and they forgot to put our candles on it before they brought it out. They didn't bring us any silverware to eat it with and ordering coffee was another process. For dinner, I recommend another restaurant.

We made the mistake of going here last Friday night when there was a DJ, which meant having to listen to outdated loud music and not being able to hear your friend across the table. I ordered the "Greek Salad" which would make any Greek or Mediterranean person roll over in their grave. It was a salad filled with lettuce, a couple of olives, a few slices of cheap and tasteless tomato (I mean come on, we are in tomato season!) and swimming in some cheap bottled vinaigrette. My main course was the eggplant couscous dish, which didn't disappoint in disappointing us. I wasn't sure if I was chewing a piece of eggplant or if someone salted my belt and served it to me. My friends went as far as ordering dessert, which I didn't bother after my experience. They regretted their decision as they tried to eat some panna cotta with the forks I brought for them from other tables as our server was super busy to bring us spoons. And the bill was so high for what we ate (horrific food prepared by kindergarten students) that I had a tear in my eye as I was walking out. Please do not patronize this establishment unless you've already eaten beforehand.

Extremely rude service + overpriced food. Barely give bad reviews but the servers here are just so rude. The tables are arranged so tightly back to back, and one waiter kept kicking our chairs when walking in between tables. He never said one "sorry" for kicking us 16380428+ times, but yelled at us 4 times saying "YOUR CHAIRS ARE BLOCKING OUR WAY". Excuse me???? How else do you expect us to sit??? Ridiculous
Beautiful place, excellent food and service. We were a few friends who visited the place for the first time, all of us were surprised, the place is sensational. I recommend it 100%

Absolute worst experience I've ever had. I went to brunch with a group of four friends. At the end of the meal we all split the bill evenly. About an hour later one of my friends notified all of us that her credit card had been charged six times (for a total of $240) and the rest of us immediately proceeded to check our bank accounts. Turns out, I was charged 3 times, my boyfriend was charged 2 times, and my two other friends were charged 5 times and 3 times.  The five of us were charged a total of $760 for our $200 meal. We called to resolve the issue and staff member after staff member refused to help us. They offered absolutely no assistance or compensation for the inconvenience. It's been a week and I have still not been refunded. Now I have to go to my bank to report the charges and then off to the police department to report credit card fraud...
If you never had a great dining experience you should stop to one of my favorite place in Soho. Mono's food is incredible delicious and service implacable. Do not waste your time anywhere else.

Food is good, but I have to talk about the bad experience here! The reception who's in charge of arranging seats has very bad attitude. We have reserved one night before, when we arrived, he only set us to a seat next to gate, with most center seats empty. After I requested, he put us to a seat by the yard (right in front of curtain, no view!). I said I wanted to seat in a two persons seat among other people, he said it's reserved for a 4 people party, while it turned out later, not the truth! He laid to us, just not wanted us seat over there among white people! How ridiculous it is, I found all the asians are put at the side. There were at least 4-5 table of asians that during my dining there, all in the border seats. I think it's super racism！！ won't come back again!

I'm surprised by the amount of positive reviews for this place. It's beautiful but that's where it stops. The dinner menu is short and not very exciting. The Dj blasts music so loud that you physically cannot have a conversation. While ordering a meal, the waiter implied that it comes with either one of two sides, only to find out later than we were charged for the side separately. Maybe it doesn't help that you can't hear anything. Come for the pretty pictures, but don't expect a good dining experience.

I'm usually a person that does not care about ambience and just good food. But this place had both! You feel like you are in a glasshouse with pretty lights. Perfect for an afternoon brunch. I had the fish and chips It is not the usual battered fried fish, rather a pan fried fish which had crispy skin and succulent meat, I'd say it was cooked to perfection. The music was good, but a tad loud for day music.
No comment
No comment

The place looked really beautiful, however you should be aware of where the entrance is. My friend and I made an embarrassing mistake of going through curtains because we thought that was the main entrance. You need to go into the hotel and turn to your left in order to get into the restaurant properly, oh yeah and the food was pretty good and the waiters are so so sweet.

NOMO is amazing - thought maybe it was a bit touristy at first because my friend visiting from out of town wanted to go, but I was wrong.. The ambiance is amazing (both inside and out of the restaurant -- totally worth going, so beautiful) and the food is delishhhh. Happened to meet Franklie, and he is INCREDIBLE. He really made my experience there so special - so nice and thoughtful and accommodating. Overall couldn't recommend this place more - not only for its ambiance but also amazing service (Frankie!!) and food and drinks :) so excited for what's to come w this restaurant !!
Amazing interior decoration makes a quick impression. Kale caeser salad was great although portion was small.  Service was strong. Highly recommend this place.

I met my friend here for Brunch. It was my first time but definitely won't be my last. The decor was artsy and beautiful. Our server was Joe, he was really friendly and made a bunch of suggestions on what I should eat since it was my first time there. Unlike a lot of servers in NYC, Joe was really down to earth and didn't make us feel rushed even though he was really busy. He didn't seem to mind telling us what was good. 10 Stars to Joe for his patience with this indecisive bunch! I absolutely recommend going, super cool vibes and great service. Make sure you ask for Joe!
No comment

Limited lunch menu but lovely service. Came here on a whim after my best friend got married for a celebratory lunch. The waitress was so sweet and they took great care of us! Great ambiance and delicious food!

Service was great. I was staying at the hotel and I thought it would be easier to just grab a bite at this location downstairs. I didn't have a reservation and it was a Saturday night, but the hostess easily squeezed me in with little to no wait and no problem whatsoever. Definitely 5 stars for ambiance- gorgeous lights, chandeliers, and classy environment. The burger is one of the best and tastiest on the menu. A bit pricey, but it's reasonable.
Love NOMO Kitchen! One of my go to places. The food is great. Beautiful atmosphere, great service. I highly recommend the brunch... the salmon eggs Benedict will change your life.
No comment
Nice service, great vibe! A very Instagrammable place. But the food is just okay. My husband ordered the lamb loin and it was too raw, maybe undercooked, so he had diarrhea for the next 24 hrs.

Love this restaurant! Had dinner here a few weeks ago, and it was delicious! The staff was super attentive from the moment we arrived, and Frankie was especially helpful with food and drink selections. We really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant and would recommend this to anyone looking for a fun night out with great food and drinks!
This is the kind of place that spells "prix-fixe" "pre-fixe" on their menu, which should tell you plenty.
This is my new favorite brunch spot! The atmosphere and decor are amazing, the food is delish and the mimosas to die! I love this place and recommend to everyone!
Atrocious service, bland food, and incredibly overpriced. Save your taste buds and time.
Margherita flatbread  was cold. Side of fries was small. :/. But everything else was good.

Beautiful place but not much to get excited about beyond that. We had brunch there. The service was not good (delays, omissions, disorganization) and the food was average: very filling and not well presented. Quite basic and rough.
The food was excellent and the service was great.  The flatbread with with a mascarpone spread was delicious and the flat iron steak melted in the plate. Compliments to the chef!
The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing. Drinks are good. The ambiance is beautiful and perfect for brunch. Our server was amazing and really out did himself serving us.
Overall menus are great. However, service is really slow and they do not provide brunch menu during weekday and couldn't find any infomation regarding this limitation.

As people would say...this place is definitely "Instagrammable". Very beautiful and picturesque. The perfect back drop for that caption "brunch so hard mimosa wanna find me." Honestly, that's all there really is to it. The food was ok and really pricey. Brunch for five girls somehow came out to be $280. My friends got the Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon ($21) made with biscuit, hollandaise, and mixed greens; Steak and Eggs ($24) that came with brussel sprouts; Avocado Toast with Farm Egg ($17), and we shared the Smoked Salmon Flatbread ($19). I didn't think the avocado toast was worth the price. The toast was waaaay too thick and crunchy. The eggs benedict was pretty good. My friends liked the biscuit. The smoked salmon flatbread was decent and it had a good amount of salmon on top. Good for sharing for five people. There was a live DJ, which was awesome. Overall, beautiful place and okay food.

This place is amazing!! I was here with a few friends for New Years Eve and had a blast! There were birdcage dancers and body paint models. Staff was very attentive and made sure the night was one to remember, and it definitely was!!! The manager Emily was superb: friendly and professional. Cortnie and Monique definitely were as well. Emily even remembered me when I went back a few days afterwards!  The ambiance is definitely one that needs to be experienced. I love how it may not look like much from the outside but once you enter, it's a different story! Definitely a must visit!!

All the bad reviews are true, unfortunately. It is an absolutely beautiful restaurant, accompanied with terrible terrible service. I legitimately waited 20 minutes to get just my water and made eye contact with all the wait staff and hosts during that time. When my pastry basket came it lacked the additions promised in the menu. Our waitress left halfway through the meal without a word and we had to ask from other staff for our necessities. We also ordered coffee which we had to remind them of towards the end of the meal and received our beverages as we honestly took our last few bites - I guess it was a rather pleasant end to the meal. I don't know if it was discrimination because they could tell my group was from out of town  but I definitely watched other guests receive much more prompt service, there's really not much else to do as you wait 20 minutes for your waitress and water.
No real qualms about this place besides it was pretty busy and douchey. But only leaving this review to encourage you to grab their cocktail menu and enjoy a typo word search.

Great food! However, someone took my LV bag in the lobby of the hotel. The hotel never called me back when they found it even though I left my number there/ called a few times after. I later went back and they found it, but all of my cash was taken out of my bag. Be careful with your belongings there, especially in the lobby.

This is probably one of the most overpriced and over exaggerated places I have ever visited. I normally do not do reviews considering how many restaurants I visit on a daily but this could not be let go. The ambiance and vibe of NoMo Kitchen is very nice but this place is Definitely just for one or two drinks before heading to dinner. I ordered pasta with octupus and my husband ordered the Half Chicken. The half chicken was average, it tasted like any regular chicken. However, the rigatoni and octupus was beyond terrible. The first time I received my plate it was super undercooked. I understand this type of pasta is cooked to be "al dente" but this was nowhere close. The second time around the dish was overcooked. I ended up just eating the Truffle fries which were not too bad. If it wasn't for that thought, I would have been starving. Definitely not a spot to go to for dinner.

Loveddd this place! Visiting NYC with my cousins (we're from SOCAL) and wanted a unique, trendy, yet comfortable place for a nice girls brunch! And that's exactly what we got here :) the environment is sooooo beautiful so artsy and fun and swanky yet still laid back, pretty diverse menu with lots of breakfast and lunch choices. I had the Benedict with ham and it was absolutely delicious, the egg was poached perfectly and I loved the sautéed spinach. Very tasty mimosas as well! Oneeeee little thing, the service could have been just a bit better, our server was a nice guy but didn't engage with us much (I'm a server myself so I notice these small things, and try to make my customers smile as much as I can!) and wasn't 100% attentive when it came to delivering the check and things. Did not pull away from the all around great experience though!!!! If you're in NYC definitely give this place a try!

The only thing that makes this place worth going to is their decor. Their food is and service are not up to standards. Went for brunch with a group, took 45 minutes just to receive our menus. Had to reach out to staff continuously for basic necessities such as forks, napkins,extra plates and water. Someone ordered a drink, and had to ask 3 times. Another order was messed up. The food was also sub standard. Ordered avocado toast which was a stale piece of bread with spread on it. Other members of my party did not enjoy their food either. I really wouldn't recommend this place unless you're going for the drinks and ambiance. They really need to train their staff to do a better job.
Loved eating here for brunch on Sunday. The food is excellent. I ordered the pancakes which were yummy and fluffy and the truffle flatbread which was also excellent. Definitely a repeat.

I will not go here NO MO'. We sat at bar for 15 minutes waiting for service. Bulky bartender was checking his phone and chatting it up with other servers. Don't think he even saw us leave. FO SHO NO MO' NOMO!

Went for brunch on a Sunday, great vibes! The place is beautiful, the DJ was a great addition.  The food is really good and the cocktails not to be missed. Try the fish tacos! If you are in for wine Rose was nice. Last but not list, very friendly service and Krys, the manager, knows how to take care of her patrons!

I was having lunch in your restaurant on March 21, 2016.  I like restaurant's environment and renovation.  But the service and food have a lot of room to be improved.  First the food is average in NYC restaurant, and it is overpriced in this neighborhood you can have a lot of more better choice with the same price tag.  Second, I understand that restaurant charge customers for outside food, so when I order over hundred for lunch just for two people I would expected be kind to waived the service charge for I bringing in the birthday cake for my friend. Well, even if you don't waive it, when you charge me, I will expected some type of service, but I don't see any, except damaged my cake.  I was so disappointed when I see the cake is damaged.  And when we finished the cake, I ask waiter to help me put back the rest of the cake into the box, instead helping me, he is though me back the box and let me DIY (do it yourself) and you charge me the service charge for binging in the cake?  It is very disappointed experience.

Eh..... Romantic setting but that's about where the positives end. Service was slow and inattentive. As far as the food goes, it was average at best. The Tuna tartar was very bland, the kale salad was good, and the mini tacos were Very good. For an entree we had the wagyu steak. It was very "chewy" which is the best way to describe it and it had a bbq/steak sauce that it was cooked in that should have been left off. All the portions were very small. I was not impressed with the food nor the service. The waiter was nice but in the course of a 2 hour dinner came by 2x to refill our drinks. Highly unlikely i will go back.'
Love this place! The decor is beautiful and the food is great! Came here for brunch and got the spaghetti cacio e pepe, fried cauliflower and the pancakes which were all delicious
Loooooove the brunch menu here! Everything is so delicious! I got the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were amazing. My only complaint is how loud the restaurant is during brunch. Very hectic inside

Ambiance and atmosphere was great. The food was delicious. However the service was atrocious. It was fully staffed and there were only 7 customers in the entire restaurant and the waiting staff stayed out of sight in the back. I had to walk up to the back to check my check. Ridiculous.

I have been here in the past for brunch and highly recommend it has a great ambiance and good food.  Most recently went for an dinner and was highly disappointed. They could not offer almost half of the menu (if not more). Both my first and second choice was unavailable. I do not recommend for dinner!

surprisingly good brunch and food. it's definitely on the expensive side for the portions, but the quality is good. i especially like the ambiance and the small patio at the back with the swing chairs (except for the people constantly smoking there).

One of the best meal experiences I've had. Took my girlfriend here on a date, great atmosphere,great music, very chill, very calm. Food is amazing and chefs  are really nice. Chef Phil cane out and made sure we were having a great time and enjoying our food. Loved it!!

The biggest disappointment in this restaurant and hotel is NOMO could make so much more money just by improving customer service. We were guests at the hotel for three nights. We were excited to see the restaurant was packed on the first night. When we came down for drinks and asked for a table where we can have a drink with friends, the hostess was rude and told us all the cannots rather than any cans. We brushed this off as a busy night for her. The bar was not ready for us so we were limited to a short list of options with a rude bartender. This morning, we came down after checking out to grab breakfast. The same hostess was at the stand with a half empty restaurant. We asked to be seated for 2 people and she told us it would be a 10 minute wait. I kind of felt like she thought we were an annoyance to her job. No smile, no acknowledgement we and everyone she is seating actually supports her paycheck. I thought I was at the Ramada Inn asking for Cheetos. The service in the restaurant is terrible. 10 minutes to order, 15 minutes to get coffee, wrong order came out, took 20 minutes to have the table cleared. The experience is so poor compared to the excellent food they served. They need a new front end manager. There are a million places to stay, eat and drink in NYC. NOMO may make it by for a few years on sucker guests but you will miss out on loyal customers. You are missing out on sales! I would say try harder but the team wasn't even trying. Disappointing last experience at the hotel. Won't stay here on next trip.
No comment

I'm sitting in the restaurant and we have been waiting for our check for 25 minutes. I had to get up and ask bartender for condiments. Then also they spilled champagne down this poor girls back and no manager went over!! Terrible Service. Food was good minus the raw burger my friend got. We then had to wait for that. Good music.

I'm an NYC local and had a good friend in town and wanted to take her to a super trendy spot with super good food. We decided on Nomo kitchen, and were anxious to get through the weekend just to brunch on sunday. Walking in, you're wow'd by the aesthetic and expected nothing but the best service to match the environment. We sat down and started looking at the menu and were so excited that 15 mins passed and we realized we had yet to be greeted or offered water. Looking around, you notice employees in every corner talking to each other rather than serving customers. I had to raise my hand and flag someone down just to be acknowledged.... i let it go and hoped my point got across that we needed attention. when our server FINALLY got to our table, she simply said "are you ready to order?" no "hello", no "how are you doing" and no "any questions on the menu?". AGAIN, we let it go, not looking to get angry and ruin our day... we ordered the margarita flatbread and our server responded "it's actually not a flatbread, it's a pizza..... i think" ARE YOU KIDDING ME. we told her either way it didn't matter, we'd still like it. she proceeded to be so confused, looking around as if she'd find the answer at another table? the whole situation was awkward as hell. we ordered a few more dishes and continued to have a good time... our pizza/flatbread came out and we waited for her to bring us plates, that we had to ask for. at this point we were just besides our selves that this service looked acceptable in the fact that she didn't seem flustered or overwhelmed or just did a really good job at hiding it. We finished our food, not surprised at the fact that we had to flag down different servers just to get us refills OF FUCKING WATER. also not surprised that i had to get up out of my seat to track down our server to ask for our check... who then had someone else bring it to our table for her, saw her process our payments and handed it off again to a different server to bring it back. at the end of our brunch, we flagged down a manager to bring all of this to our attention and didn't even offer anything in compensation of our time or experience. I kept count and by the time we left, 8 different staff members touched our table, not because we looked upset but because we had to flag someone down EVERY SINGLE TIME. But i guess you can't have it all right? excellent atmosphere, amazing food and the worst service i have ever experienced. i suggest an entire re-train of every staff member.

Tried a few dishes from NOMO Kitchen the other day as I sat at the hotel bar and they were delicious. Had the Tuna Tartare, Cauliflower, Mini Tacos and Truffle Flat Bread. All dishes were unique, each with their own burst of flavors - but as a person who loves truffle (and expected the truffle flat bread to be my favorite) - was surprisingly blown away by the Cauliflower! It was battered and fried perfectly (not too much tempura and not too crunchy) and the sauce was this aromatic and sensual blend of pistachios and chili paste - giving it a sweet, salty, savory kick (similar to a satay sauce but better). None of the dishes were heavy and just right in regards to starters. The atmosphere of Nomo Kitchen is warm, laid back and friendly. You don't feel like you are in downtown Manhattan with the beautiful chandeliers hanging over your head to give it a touch of romantic class. The bar inside Nomo Kitchen and out in the hotel lobby is comfortable and quaint. Definitely relaxing from the hustle and bustle. My Bartender of the night was Rob and he was amazing. Professional, friendly, knowledgeable and skilled! His drinks were some of the best I've had with the right amount of ingredients to not make any of the drinks overly strong in a particular ingredient. Perfectly balanced. Would definitely return!
Very good food, even though it is a bit expensive. The place is beautiful and staff is very pleasant
Just FYI, bar closes at 10:30 which is incredibly early. Be prepared to have to ask for EVERYTHING and not have anything offered to to you, like a refill on a drink or fresh water.
The food here is delicious and fresh. Quite possibly one of the nicest rooms to eat in all of NYC. Desserts are especially good, probably my favorite part and I am not really a dessert guy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for our engagement anniversary dinner. NARO is a new Korean fine dining restaurant that has been around since October. It's on the rink level of the Rockefeller center and you can get here by stairs/ via an elevator located on 49th st. The staff is eager and knowledgeable, and we incorporated all our server's recommendations and weren't disappointed. We had the standard as well as the vegetarian chef's tatsting menu to get more variety. There's a beverage pairing option as well. The dishes were very innovative and well made. As expected for Korean food, the flavors are really subtle and delicate. Would recommend this place for a date night!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here for lunch. The place was inside rockerfeller that had lots of people but the dining room was calm. They do have tables the outside of the dining room (still indoors rockerfeller) where you can dine and do people-watching but the vibe may not be as peaceful as inside. The service was attentive. All the courses were delicious, even though the rice from the 4th course was not my cup of tea. My favorate was the chicken skewer, the chicken was cooked in many ways and so tender and juicy. The meal was on a lighter side, but I actually left feeling full. I would love to come back to try their dinner menu.
No comment

This week I had lunch and dinner at NARO. What an incredible, impressive little restaurant! Yes, the waitstaff are genuinely sincerely kind & friendly. Yes, the design is cool & warm and plush & minimal all at the same time. And, yes, this very quickly shot up my list of favorite restaurants in NYC... i cannot say enough good things about their amazing food; even though 2 of the lunch tasting menu dishes (lamb & octopus) also appeared on the dinner tasting menu, these dishes were knockouts, and somehow only got even better the second time around, and the remaining additional dishes that came with the larger dinner menu just got better & better & better... I can't wait to come back again and again to enjoy their masterful creativity.
No comment
No comment

Came with my wife for dinner. NARO was highly accommodating for some specific food preferences, and the meal and service were equally excellent. We had a non-alcoholic beverage pairing that featured some very unique teas and kombuchas - highly recommend. Will be back again - excited to try the vegetarian option.

NARO provides an experience like no other restaurant in New York. The thoughtful sequence of dishes, each a delight on its own with subtle wonderful flavors culminating in the miraculous straw desert are just amazing. The staff is caring like you rarely see and provides an unforgettable evening
No comment
Service was impeccable and food beautifully presented. Will return for another special occasion.

What a beautiful, well done experience! I came in to try a few drinks and snacks. Kyle took great care of us, and everything they brought out was delicious. The Lime Leaf Sour was probably my favorite drink, but I now have to try them all. I'll be back soon!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cool relaxed vibe. This would be a good date spot at night time. The burger was fantastic and the cocktail menu is great for a summer day.

Really nice spot for a burger and a negroni. They have mastered the balance between casual vibes but more elevated dishes. We loved the tuna tartare with an oolong egg and the butter greens salad! I would skip the rose pistachio cake since it was a bit dry.
No comment
No comment

THIS PLACE IS A DISGRACE OF A RESTAURANT. I lived in New York for 13 years, and in my time there, Jack The Horse was my favorite restaurant. Then one day, I found out that this place was taking over. When I tried it on their grand opening, it was awful. The other day I went back there to give it another chance and it was just as bad as i remembered. Their trout had bones in it and the french fries were over cooked. Only positive thing was that the employees were kind, but that is it. I made a vow to never go back to that disgrace of a restaurant  and I encourage you too as well. Unless they give me free food. Just kidding i would still never go back there. This place sucks.
No comment

4.5 stars: what a gem of a spot! For drinks, I started off with their martini and never looked back - it was perfect. As for food, the duck croquettes were truly incredible and the celery victor salad was very good too. The mussels were prepared well, in a traditional garlicky broth and served with bread, while the bulgogi dish was quite unique though a little bit less of a hit than the other food we had. Finally, though, we ended with the delicious buttermilk and a taste of the housemade coconut-washed genepy - perfect together! Thanks so much to the team here - can't wait to sit at the bar again and indulge.
We just moved to the neighborhood and had a lovely dinner here. Every plate was fantastic (we're pescatarian, no dairy) and the staff made us feel at home. Will be back very soon
Food is always new and delicious and the service great. Best whiskey menu in the area.
